Very nice, clean and quiet hotel. Location also great, convenience for travelling, located near MRT and tourist attraction places. Staff are also very nice, friendly and helpful. Sure that I will be back again next time.

review_title: Great location and value, let by large number of rooms and limited ability to cope with guest demands.
review_text: Great location with proximity to cafes, restaurants, shopping and bars. Rooms are fresh and clean, and have a great feel. Bathrooms are clean and the rain shower is a fantastic touch. But be warned that crying babies can be heard in the room next door ...Given the size of the hotel, having 3 elevaotrs means you could find yourself waiting for a while if you're heading down at the same time as many other guests in the morning. The breakfast served in Ginette bar is a very generous spread, but again, be warned that the size of the hotel outstrips the demand for breakfast so you could find yourself struggling to find a table, waiting up to 20 minutes for an omelette, and staff who don't understand or sympathize with why your are frustrated that to enjoy your 'included breakfast'

This hotel is in a great location to access anything. They provide you with a mobile phone to be able to book tickets and use Google maps etc which was handy. Rooms are small though and can't comment on food as didn't eat at the hotel. Comfy beds and TV had screen mirroring.

review_title: Great location to explore any part of town!
review_text: The staff is lovely although check in was a little hectic with so many people arriving just before 2pm. (Understandable) Rooms are decent size with super comfy beds, clean and great amenities. The perfect location to MRT subway and able to reach anywhere in the city super quickly. Breakfast was excellent with lots of choices. Also within a 5min walk to Bugis Junction which is a great shopping mall/area and has great eats! Would definitely stay again

Good hotel with good wifi but the room is too small. The food is excellence and the staffs are nice. However, it is supposed to be a city view room, but we can't see the view from our room at 14 floor.

I had stayed at Hotel G last year and have had dinner at Hotel G in Hong Kong. Great concept. Small but very clean and well designed rooms. The location in SG is great as well. I would stay there again.

review_title: Great Venue, Very Clean, Quiet, Bar Staff not so friendly
review_text: Thanks for the stay. Welcome / check in staff, were great, the room cleaning were fantastic as usual. The location is superb. The Hamburger Bar downstairs was not so good, The burger was dry and when I told them so, all I got was an "oh". The bar staff "Ginett", are really average. The size of pour of wine in a glass is laughable. They have no rapport with customers. It is functional, not polite, but the ambiance looks like it should be cozy and friendly. Anyway, the hotel is friendly. I'll stay again, just spend less time at their bar and skip the burgers.

The BF time was terrible, it seem to be shortage of manpower, always shortage of good, as well as the kitchen who cooked egg seem too slow with poor working attitude, the coffee machine position should the located at the other position where should not next to the kitchen for the boy who cooked slow, it made the queue too long and block the coffee queue too. Hence, suggest to fulfill food proper during the peak hrs. Room should slso add the stool or a stand for the luggage offloaded ...

Hotel G is a very nice accomodation for a short trip in Singapore. The rooms are small but very clean and good. Staff is very helpful and it was no problem to check out later. The location is very central and there are a few MRT stations nearby. Breakfast-Buffet was international and tasty.

Overall stay at G Hotel is pleasant. Good job on welcome drink.Regarding first timer direction to hotel's reception / lobby would be confusing. Hope for more directions for taxi or car to go to 2nd floor parking.It was raining and hotel provided the umbrella, another great job. However, the auto free one hour umbrella available was difficult to register and obtain and was in fact quicker to borrow one from the hotel.

Very nice hotel. Good breakfast. Appreciated the style, very charming. Love the design, especially the dream catcher ceiling lamp (unusual and so creative).  Staff friendly. Will definitely go back if I should visit again.

The rooms were well air conditioned and clean, small but that's what you get in Singapore.  The staff were all very helpful and friendly. There is a subway station 2 mins walk away as well as loads of traditional restaurants.  Little India is about 10min walk away.  The bar at the bottom of the hotel was a very trendy spot for cocktails and the burger place next door was brillant and good value.   Thank you for a great experaince!

Excellent location and service, small rooms, breakfast could be better, rooms cleaned up every day, attentive staff, do have mobile phone in the room with data and free local calls, drink vouchers for the hotel bar

Very nice Confortable Essential Good location Clean Organized For singapore very good price From airport about 20 min with the cost of sindollar 18 The entrance a bit strange Overall i suggest you to try

All OK as usual., very small rooms but comfy and clean, all essentials available in the room, great staff. access by car a little bit complicated if you aren't local, and by the street you must pass trough restaurant and then take lift to reception, a little bit odd if the restaurant is packed with people. Western food in the restaurant and round the corner decent indian and chinese singaporean at fair prices.

I can not find any fault with the hotel, the service, the location or the staff. I wish I could have stayed a little longer. I design and buildhouses in Bali, Indonesia and my "thing" is taking attention to space, comfort, function and form.... you guys aced all the points

The room was good, just veryyy small. It had almost all the essentials - safe, bathroom, hygiene kits, hair dryer, WiFi, but it didn’t have a mini fridge. (Literally had no more space for it) I was able to ask for an iron. Good room for someone on a work trip that will spend most of the time away from the hotel. Service was great, very helpful and friendly. The bedsheet had a stain on it and it wasn’t swapped out in any of my 3 nights’s stay.

Hi there Hotel G Singapore Team,It’s my 2nd time around in your Hotel, and I can say you’re the best for me :) room was great as well as the food. Friendliness of the staff at reception. Thank you! :)

Great hotel with very cool decor. Rooms are well designed. Good location , walking distance to little India, Orchard Road and Raffles. A 4 minute walk to Bencoolen MRT station which connects you to a lot of the main spots, China Town, Marina Bay and Botanic Gardens. Would recommend and stay again.

review_title: NICE TRIP @ HOTEL G IN SINGAPORE
review_text: That was a very nice experience in Singapore. Very nice totel also. That would be better if you can provide one more slppers for us, or change them on time. Because I had to wear the same slipper during the 5 nights... Besides, I had no water to drink when I back to my room in one evening. In general, this hotel is cool. I think I am willing to select it next time.

Great place and convenient location. The housekeepers were very helpful. Only downside is there's no mini refrigerator in room and the hair dryer wasn't powerful enough. Wi-fi was super fast and room was clean. They even have a water dispensing machine nearby so it's very convenient to get clean water for my baby.

This hotel ruined the last 5 days of our amazing holiday. The hotel rooms are so small with next to no natural light and after being in the room for less than 30 minutes I started to feel dizzy and nauseous due to claustrophobia. There is absolutely no ventilation so all of our clothes in our suitcase felt damp and the room smelt damp and mouldy, which can not be good for your health. The staff working at the restaurant down stairs at breakfast seems very unfriendly and rude. I would urge anyone who is thinking of booking this hotel for more than one night to read the negative reviews and book elsewhere.

The very convenince centre location, easy to reach anyplace you want to. Near Albert hawker centre where has best fishball noodle, near Kwan Yin temple, Bugis Junction... I love the location. Nice design hotel with good Western restaurant. I did not try breakfast therer, due to various choices for food outside.

The hot dog and tomato soup I had at 25 degrees were super good. Serving staff Baba has been helpful and very friendly. Good job!On the breakfast side, since you have only one coffee/tea making machine in the entire restaurant, the queue was quite long on a few mornings. You might consider getting a second machine or have your serving staff help some tables to get coffee/tea from another location - kitchen perhaps?!

We stayed there for 3 Nights. The Room was very smal, but pretty and clean. The breakfast was offered in the Restaurant and it was really good. We also liked the area around the Hotel, cause threre were some nice little Restaurants and Shops.

The location was great, the hotel was pretty. The room was very small for 2 people, but it was ok. The breakfast was fantastic, and affordable ! Great value for money. What I didn't like is the fact that the room had a humidity odor which was very inconvenient. Otherwise it was clean

I stayed here for 3 days as a break on route to Australia. The rooms are small but clean and the bed very comfortable. They leave you a phone in the room with free data and free international calls which was perfect when I broke my phone. Was perfect to say babe me to the nearest Apple Store. The bar down stairs is wonderful with great food and wine.   Nicholas whom I am assuming is the bar manager is world class. I was a lady travelling alone and he made me feel welcome and comfortable without being overbearing. His professionalism and overall persona is just what you need in a swanky bar.   The location is fantastic to venture to Orchard Road for shopping or to The Gardens by the Bay. Taxis are quick if ordered by reception.   I would definitely recommend staying here so long

Funky, no frills hotel with a wonderful Ginett restaurant at the street level. My only complaint is that AC works like crazy when on (temperature modification on touch screen does not seem to matter), it gets quite cold very fast, and once you turn it off, it gets stuffy quickly. No fun in getting up during the night to turn it on and off.

The room was very very small with very minimal areas to move about. However, this hotel is located very conveniently near to restaurants and public transportation. In general, it was a good stay. Only issue is that the room had a moldy smell every time I entered the room.

Stayed in for a total of 5 nights. Hotel was in a good location. Rooms are always kept clean and service is very good.  Food was also topnotch.Only thing that can be improved was the size of the room but it is not such a big deal.

A really comfortable hotel. I had a very small room but it was excellently appointed and fitted out which made the size of the room immaterial. Great decor, good restaurant and bar with a handy location.Great decor

review_title: Too small, needs a better cleaning
review_text: I enjoyed your breakfast and nice staff, but that's not enough to make me return.  The room was so small that I did not have anywhere to put my clothing: no drawers,no closet.  Also, the shower tile is quiet moldy.  Finally, after the room was cleaned, there was so much hair (not mine) left behind on the bathroom floor

Some of the gym facilities need to be fix asap especially the threadmill machine, 2nd machine from the far right. In order to find out its faulty, u need to run and u will know. Its risky and dangerous for othrr user to use.

Small room but super clean and quite. Centrally located. Highly recommend. Stayed here for 6 nights. Staff was helpful and kind. Food, especially the breakfast spread is lovely. Make sure you include breakfast while booking. Worth it.

Hotel was disappointing in terms of room size. It was narrow and tight. The pictures on internet are not true images. Breakfast buffet was poor and not much selection and all out in different areas of the room.

Im glad Ive just booked one night on this hotel just to try a 3* and also because i found a cheap price (89$sgp) bfast included because was the worst experience in my life.   I saw the pictures online but ive never imagine that the rooms were tiny! Thanks Good ive been by myself because two people in one room doesn’t fit at all.   The room i was located was on the 13th floor and was extremely noisy as well... the AC was noisy and old as well. I went down with my stuff to request for another room because I definitely was not staying on that room, the guy was not smiley at all but at least he was willing to help me and he showed me another room in case i could pay for an upgrade but NO!  The room still too small so they moved me of floor (same category)   BREAKFAST: is as mess, is

The room and services were excellent. However, the entrance was rather confusing. You have to walk pass a restaurant in order to reach the lobby. Unless you are dropped by grab drive. Also, I heard knocking sound middle of the night. This is scary. Otherwise, 5 star I shall rate them.

Hotel G makes it easy ... to check-in, stay, and depart.Very hassle free and simple.Good value! It works great for me on business trips...have stayed there twice and will stay there again!Rooms are simple but very comfy.

This points based on my own experience @Hotel G Singapore Positive :-This hotels nearest MRT Station about 100meters (Reccomend Bencooleen MRT Station)-Nearest of shopping malls (Bugis+,Bugis Junction about 4 blocks from Hotel)-The breakfast its good-The staff very kindly and helpfull-The hotel rooms clean and the linens are good for rest-The smell of area hotels is fresh-Nearest of Toast Box,7Elevenand also i would say the negative-Maybe have improvement in future so the customer can get easily reached the lift because the loby located on second floor ps: in bar area has lift for pwd and lugage but i think its can make easily by croos street stairs and less times-the hotels breakfast its good but i think in future can more improvements maybe more variants items can choose-the

I stayed at this hotel for four days.I was very pleased.Bedding was so comfortable that it could sleep well.The breakfast was small, but it tasted great.At first, there was a lot of dust next to the bed, so it was just that but later it was cleaned.And when I took a shower, I was uncomfortable because of the smell of sewer.Everything was great, and if I go to Singapore later, I will definitely stay at this hotel.

Will surely come back.Great place.Great breakfast.Amazing wine bar, Ginette.Great food, 25degrees.Great location. Very accessible to access all points in the city.Wonderful experience.helpful Front desk.

Great location and comfortable environment. Strategic location from MRT stations (Bugis and Bencoolen). Nearby to Bugis street which is only 5 mins walk away. But room size is comparably small. Otherwise, the stay was pretty comfortable.

The room is not spacious enough.Shower space is too small.The bed is very comfortable.The location is a bit far from the MRT. Beverage redemption time is not ideal. Overall is good. Maybe next time I will book.

review_title: Very Good Hotel at Great Location
review_text: For this trip I booked G because often before we have been frequenting Ginett for a chat in the evening. Besides I like to stay in Bencoolen, as it is perfectly positioned for all what I need professionally and privately. Therefore, booked G this time and was not disappointed. It is a cute hotel. Rooms are not large (Singapore usual), but there is everything one needs. Three most important things: the bed is great and comfortable I could sleep just great, there is the “rain shower” oh I love that, and WiFi is working just perfect everywhere. Besides, I liked the practical working desk. As said, evenings favourite Ginett bar was just “below” the room, and daytime it its just “cool” to sit on one of the tables half indoors half on the street sipping a drink and either working or

Love this Hotel so much, every time went SG also choose to stay here. comfort & convenience. Especially hotel have provide us a smartphone which can support internet & local call, very convenience for traveler like us.

It was a perfect place for a short stay. Aircond was good and love the decoration of the room! But the lobby for pick up point was a little confusing for some drivers. But overall, very good service from the receptionist. Thank you!

allthing is very very good, but i dont know why i slept too bad.after day when i woke up too tired....:(ab the hotel is so good, nice service, nice hotel, nice view, good location, near food court, near pagodaeasy to go everywhere by bus or mrt

Very disappointed in this room.  I mean place is trendy clean in a fantastic location. But very very small. It's probably 2m x 6m. One power point.  It would be comfortable for one person. Double bed is located at end of room against 3walls so if you need to go to bath room you have to go across on top of other person.  Breakfast was nice. Won't be using this room again

review_title: Nice hotel, good breakfast but frozen air conditioning
review_text: My husband and I spent two nights at Hotel G. Our room was very small but well furnished. We enjoyed the abundant breakfast provided, while we literally hated the air conditioning, set everywhere at an unnaturally low temperature, like we had to dress with shorts and bermudas due to the outside temperature, but we chattered all the time before reaching the exit. At least we managed to switch it off inside the room...

The hotel has a lovely interior design, and its location is quite convenient with plenty of eateries around and has quite a reasonable walk to three different MRT stations. I enjoyed my stay and will come back next time.

Very enjoyable Stay. Perfect location, many places walking distance to visit, eat or just  chili. Our room was very tiny but all renovated and with a confortable bed. The service is very good but they don't exceed expectations

Overall was great, only small downside was that the hotel lobby was not located at the entrance. It would be a little tricky to find the hotel lobby if you are unfamiliar with the area. Otherwise, the rest was great!

Small but comfort room , everything you need are provided,well decorated ,like the design of the room,bed are comfortable but pillow are too soft, luckily there four in the room, overall very satisfied,will be back for my staycation.

Have stayed in many hotels in Singapore, this one is the smallest. No place to keep even one bag. It’s functional place with everything inclding a hair dryer but no place to even walk if you keep a suitcase.

I felt that your hotel had good service and hospitality. Hotel location was good, because near from MRT station. It would be usefull fot bushiness and presure,too.However, I wondered about gurantee system when I checked in.

Stayed here for 2 nights on my first visit to Singapore. Location was good, able to walk to tourist attractions and MRT station was nearby.   Room decor was cool and like most Singapore hotels, the room was small but functional. Room was also very clean.  Breakfast was a good selection but if you didn’t get there early enough, some options would run out and not be replenished.  Staff were helpful and friendly.  Would stay there again.

Room looking very nice, the location is near downtown and it is very convenient. But the cleaning and housekeeping were not good. The toilet and cups were dirty, I saw curly short hairs on the bed, water ran slowly in the sink, toilet paper was not new and clean, body lotion was unsealed, floor is not so clean, and the housekeeper went inside my room without my permission while I hang the "no,  thanks" card outside the room. Hope Hotel G can solve these problems.

review_title: Modern decorated hotel in central locations.
review_text: Hotel was in 5 minutes walk from 2 main MRT line that have access to everywhere even to the airport.Hotel was modern decorated and very comfortable bed.Breakfast had many western and Asian options and very tasty.The stuff was also very helpful if we need to ask stuff.I will definitely go back to here if I come back to SG.

review_title: Great stay for a long weekend
review_text: We were in Singapore for 3 days and stayed here. It's clean, trendy and was perfect for our stay. The rooms and bathrooms are tiny, but we expected that so it didn't bother us, plus the design of the room works really well. We didn't spend much time at the hotel, but would definitely stay there again the next time we're in Singapore.

Rooms are small but clean and well designed. Bathroom door not designed to close. So no privacy if you are sharing. Breakfast not great needs to be organised. All it needs is more staff. So that it can be presented well and you are not waiting around as chef's are cooking and restocking

review_title: Personal service and a great hideout for seeing the environment!
review_text: We arrived late, at around 0:00 (late flight). There was still a very friendly receptionist that did a quick and good checkin that was really helpful after our flight. We could still drink and eat something at the 25 degrees bar downstairs. This all contributed to a pleasant first night.The breakfast was lovely and broad. There was a wide choice of English, American and local breakfast. We were always able to eat well before another day of walking through the city. That said: the hotel is very close to the Bencoolen MRT station and makes it possible to get to major areas such as Chinatown, Bayfront area (Gardens by the bay,  Marina bay sands, merlion), Little india/Haji lane and Sentosa easily. Even if you want to hike to Mount Faber/Henderson waves, this is a good

review_title: A trendy hotel in good location
review_text: I stayed in Hotel G as arranged for my business trip, and overall my accommodation experience at this hotel is pleasant. The guest room is well renovated and tidy. Though not very spacious, the room is comfortable to stay, with all necessary stuff provided. The breakfast of the hotel is okay with an adequate variety of food served. Hotel staff is friendly and helpful. Near the hotel, there are convenient stores, cafes with authentic food and drinks, as well as food court. Within around 5 minute walk one can reach the nearest metro station.   However, there are minor things that make this hotel not perfect enough. Before staying in Hotel G I actually wanted to book a twin room but seems there are not, or else very little number of this type of room in this hotel. And after my

I found reception personal to be very obliging but some of the information was outdated. All hotel staff that I encountered ,including the cleaning ladies , had no problem with a happy "hallo ". The only other item needed is guest laundry facilities.

It was a paid business trip stay, and overall quite happy with the stay.However, the breakfast experience is quite awkward as they have a staircase to go up and down to get food, ie: the coffee cup is just enough to contain the coffee, and walking down the staircase means having to make sure it isn't spilled over, so people are walking slowly and being carefull, which means blocking the flow, something that can be solved by just providing a bigger volume mug. There is also always quite a queue for the egg station and for coffee, again, something that can be solved with having more than 1 chef for omellette (or even better, more than 1 pan), and to provide brew coffee downstairs.

Small area in the room but designed to fit all comfort creatures. No complains - comfy, clean & friendly staffs! after the renoavation, it looks fresher and water dispenser in the hall way is a nice touch. :)

The main stand out issue is the size of the rooms, laying in bed I was able to touch both sides of the room (Not stretching either!)So, for the price you pay, I don’t think it is worth it for what you get!

I don't like how the people who works at reception was trying to cheat us  that our room wasn't ready so if we wanted they could upgrade for bigger room because we came earlier and they doing with all guests who came earlier.Anything else was perfect except of the room size, but we didn't have problem with that

Room smelled like an old locker room and had no ventilation. It was a essentially concrete closet tastefully converted into a hotel room. The soaps and the decor were nice, but didn't outweigh the old heavy mold-hazard air.

I absolutely love atmosphere in this hotel such as bar on the ground floor and room very comfort, cosy and clean. Staff is so kind, good service. Location : close with MRT station you can go to another place very easy, a lot of restaurants around the hotel.

Not some kind of mainstream business hotel, but a boutigue hotel with value for money. Well located, nice stylish rooms. Complete breakfast buffet and bar/restaurant for dinner...Worth a try for everyone traveling to Singapore.

review_title: Lovely location. Clean room. Friendly staff
review_text: Friendly and helpful staff, room had free smartphone .Stylish rooms which are very clean and well equipped. The bed and blanket are super comfy. Very good location with lots of sights and great food options in walking distance. The hotel is near MRT . Breakfast was excellent.General cleanliness of the property.Welcome drink on arrival + upgrade to "Great room".   Small room, the slidey bathroom door not fully closing.
travel_type: Trip type: Travelled as a couple

review_title: Pretty good stay - can recommend it.
review_text: Not sure of the price, my friend had paid for me.  Single room, small - which was okay considering it is near to town and expected in Singapore.  However, the window (thus, blinds) is behind the bed so you need to climb over to the other side of the bed to open/close it; the length of the bed took up the length of the room.  Everything was clean, except for a towel which i found a long strand of hair when wiping myself after showering - way too long to be mine.  location is excellent, with multiple mrt stations within walking distance.  The service at reception was fine, and the cleaning staff was polite and friendly.

Stayed at Hotel G for 2 days after a cruise from Tokyo to Singapore. Found Hotel to been a great location for us. Taxi service was less than 5 mins. after called, food within walk distance in all directions including food services at the Hotel. Everyone was friendly and helpful.

I cant have a good rest. Keep have noises came out from outside the window. Service and location are good. If could solve above problem, probably I will stay back for my next trip. But since the sleep quality is important for me, sorry to said that I won't consider your hotel again. Thank you.
travel_type: Trip type: Travelled as a couple

review_text: Everything is excellent. The hotel is near MRT .The room is comfortable with style and beautiful decoration.  We stay there satisfactorily . If we travel to Singapore again , we are willing to book this hotel again.
travel_type: Trip type: Travelled as a couple

review_text:
Yes the hotel is in a popular shopping area.
It was a disappointment from the time of check in till checkout.

I would like to clarify that the staff are very helpful and pleasant. They are only selling and servicing the product.

The rooms are like student accommodation with some facilities of a hotel. Very congested room if you have 2 occupants with suitcases and hand baggage.

The bed is placed in the part of the room where one needs to hop in and out over the other occupant!!

Reception is tiny and crowded at checkin and checkout time.

Breakfast is is the pub used during the day. Food is spread over two levels hence going up and down with your plate is not a pleasant experience.

It's a pleasant business hotel located in the heart of the CBD yet set apart from the bustle of traffic. The only lack is a fridge in the room. And the shower curtain in the bathroom was not very preventive if the bath water going everywhere. K

This hotel was very disappointing to say the least.  On arrival I asked for any tour infomation and was told there wasnt any. Further to that there was no fridge in the room . Was told there was an ice machine on our floor but of course it was broken. Your rooms are so small that you cannot walk around the bed and have to crawl over the other person to get in or out of it.  I have had better experiences  in hotels in third world countries.
travel_type: Trip type: Travelled as a couple

review_text: Poor front desk, totally ignore when my hand was full of thing. Never offer help. The structure of the building was super noisy, early 8am in the morning, the house keeper was making a lot of noisy outside the room with the walkies talkie and very loud open and close door. Upstairs unit of the guest walking I could hear too! The room was too small, the price was pricey for this kind of small room. The bathroom was wet after you take a shower, not a good design. I am very disappointed of this stay!
travel_type: Trip type: Travelled as a couple

review_title: Great quirky hotel with a good location!
review_text: A very good hotel considering Singapore standards. Would have honestly wanted a bigger room for the price you pay for (for $100+ you would expect a bigger room elsewhere!), but considering Singapore hotel standards on size it's not bad. What it lacks in size it makes up for with ambience. The rooms are really cute and quirky which i think younger families/couples would appreciate. Location is real good too -- near the MRT, real quiet, homey and artsy since it's near an art university.

review_title: Great spot if going to a conference at Marina Sands
review_text: Neat clean room with a funky vibe. Proximity to MRT makes it easy to get out and about.Restaurants had tasty food and were reasonably priced. Staff friendly and happy to help. Close to Little India and Chinatown for interesting food options.

review_title: The best value for money ever
review_text: This place is a real find. Excellent location, helpful and pleasant staff, clean.and attractive interiors, comfortable beds made daily- all for a surprosingly moderator place. No.trimmings, OK, but ale the essentials you will want.

We have stayed here several times while attending KAPLAN.  It is one block away and there are good cafes and movie cinemas within an easy walk.  The hotel is trendy so the rooms are a bit on the small side, but they are clean and the bed is comfy.The breakfast is good, but it could benefit from more variation as it is almost exactly the same every day.

The hotel is the best location but good enough to get around conveniently. Staff are friendly and nice. Room are small but neat, tidy and very nicely decorated. A lot of privacy, good breakfast, and  I will be back again.... a little pricey though.

I like the service, decor, cleanliness. Only thing I didn't like as much is how there's no blockage between the shower and the toilet so the water will splash everywhere despite the shower curtain. But even with that, I'd be happy to stay here again. Good atmosphere at their restaurant and bar, sadly i didn't have a chance to try it this time.

review_title: The rooms are simply too small
review_text: Quite with a comfortable bed. However the rooms are extremly small and there is not even a cupboard to store some of the cloth. There could be more power plugs. The restaurants on the 1st floor are quite nice.

Stayed like a dream at this property.  Rooms are a little smaller but still designed in a very comfortable and clever way.  The breakfast was great just a limited selection and the same food everyday.  They have nice specials on a daily basis to eat at the restaurant downstairs.  The team is super friendly and accommodating and the location was superb close to two MRT stations and taxis and bus stops.

Hotel G was in a fantastic location, easy to walk to some tourist sites, the MRT and easy to get a cab called. The staff were helpful and friendly but the ultimate saviour was the “Handy” smart phone which got us around all of Singapore.  Some days we came back at 6 and the rooms weren’t done yet but it wasn’t a major issue.

review_title: Good for short stays but hotel seems understaffed.
review_text: Check-in was quick and efficient. The check-in area is a little small and can get filled up with people, but the staff is efficient and they work quickly to get you sorted out. Room was clean, but was pretty tight in terms of space. We had 2 suitcases and it was difficult having to walk past them. They also seem to be short of hotel staff - we called Housekeeping to ask for more bottles of water and extra towels - our call was picked up and they said they would come by, but we waited an hour and no one did. The phone line also seemed to be busy and we had to call twice before anyone picked up. Bathroom was poorly designed and there was no separation between shower and WC, which meant that after a shower, the entire bathroom floor would be wet. All in all it was a decent enough

My first time stay in G hotel is very impresif. i was stay for 4 nights in this hotel, As a new hotel in town which have good ambience, nice interior, so intagramable. Eventhough room are small (typical hotel in Spore) but as iam single traveller, it's still acceptable. The bed is soooo comfortable.Cons -  2 times during my  stay when  im back from work at 6 Pm , room still not clean up yet. But overall stay this is great hotel, nice service, near to MRT as well.Absolutely will come back again!

The room is quite clean and comfortable ( although a bit too small). Very close to transit system, shopping, restaurants, temples, etc. Special mention to all the staff for their top notch service with a smile. Nur went the extra mile! Thanks Nur!   Sheela and Murali

Nice restaurant below. rooms are small but adequate.  Front desk are friendly.  The lobby is on the second level and has a VERY narrow driveway.  Make sure you book early and this place tends to fill up very easily.

Yes the room is small but how much time do you actually spend there while in Singapore?! Is it too small? No, for me it’s just right! All the space there is has been used. The bed is good and bathroom was clean. Breakfast is spread around the restaurant area. On the mezzanine you can find the eggs (cooked/fried/omelette) and in the bar area there is much more such as bread, juices and Asian cuisine. Have had better breakfast but it’s definitely good. Haven’t had lunch and dinner there so can’t review on that. Wanted to have a beer but the barkeeper told me it would cost me $18 and that it would be much cheaper to go to a Chinese bar next door. Very honest, because $18 for a beer....?!  For Hotel G the location is everything. If you want, everything is in walking distance. Must

review_title: Best Services for a Budget hotel
review_text: I liked the facilities of the hotel and the fact that the hotel manager accepted my special request for reverting the cigarette charge (of 300 SGD). The people managing the property are genuine and likeable. I'd strongly recommend this hotel to anyone who asks me about it.

review_title: Room is small, shower booth is no good
review_text: No idea why the shower booth has no water stop, water flows everywhere, can't even get into washroom after shower. room is tiny, only good for one I guess. well the location is good so can't expect more.

review_title: Nice Service, Clean Rooms and Reasonable Price
review_text: Hotel G Singapore is located near Bugis Junction and not far from Bugis MRT. Their service is very good. The room is clean every day during my business trip. The price is reasonable and I like the decoration of this hotel. By the way, it's better if hotel provide the small refrigerator in room as well.

Excellent breakfast! good location, there are all you need in the room. Good combination of price and servicerooms are small but it is good for short business trip of just couples of days at SingaporeThank you for good service, the stay was good

All of them more than average,Room is clean, Staff arrangement is nice,Also breakfast is nicer in this hotel level.But the bed size is too short for me.If it is nicer, I would like to stay again next time.

We stayed three nights and it was a very bad experience! Dirty Rooms. Very unfriendly stuff. The breakfast was horrible! Nobody wanted to clean up the tables so we didn’t know where to eat. As we asked the arrogant barkeeper he cleaned our table but made us feel really uncomfortable!!!!!!

I had a good experience when to check in to the V hotel lavender. It's so quick and help us a lot.  We were help by two beautiful and friendly V hotel lavender hotel's staff and they are miss Nabilah and Miss Chirley.   Once again,  keep the good servicea for your customer

Located at Bugis,the hotel is value for money, with great service, nice restaurant and cozy bed, though the room is quite small. The toilet is very clean. The check in was very smooth and we will definitely come again.

review_title: Love the room decor, comfy bed
review_text: Check-in took bit of time, reception area provides coffee and green apples. Love the unique room decoration and very comfortable bed. Toiletries provided are of good quality and the hotel location is great !

The hotel is clean, neat and comfortable. The location near to little india, can be reached by walk and near to MRT makes it very convenient to go around Singapore. The services also very fast and very helping.

The place is just 5min walk to Bugis Junction and downstairs you can find a decent bar to enjoy your wine there.The hotel is new with industrial design and comfortable, though it is very small.The bathroom design is not so good as you will get the floor wet after showering

Stylish rooms, perfect for short term stays ( 1-3 days). Fridge is missing in the room. But apart that it was good. Location is also great and the staff is friendly. Wifi worked just fine and the room was quiet. Really nothing to complain.

Excellent and not too noisy location, convenient to metro and shopping. Wish the size of room is a bit bigger , more room for sitting area,  very little space for luggages.  Staff are very helpful and pleasant.

review_title: Great pad for exploring the city
review_text: It’s not complicated, great rooms, great access to public transport and a central location. The hotel has a great character and great care has been taken in every aspect of the design. It was a great place from which to explore Singapore.

Great location with food options and sights in walking distance, friendly and helpful staff, very clean room & bathroom, the room we stayed in was a little on the small side but very cosy, I'd definitely come again.

worst hotel experience for a long time.Booked 3 nights to allow for early check in and late check out.before arrival I sent emails to the hotel to alert them of next day arrival ie Sunday morning 14.10 not Saturday afternoon 15.10. Email from G hotel could find no booking!! I even sent the voucher number!!On arrival was given early check in but was incorrectly told I would have to check out Mon 15.10 by noon. I was sick with bronchitis and did not challenge this error. On Monday 15.10 both my wife and I were very sick. we begged the reception staff to give us a late check out. They did but nly until 4pm. We had to fill in time in Singapore before flying out late that evening. The error was discovered after my wife and I were packed up and were checking out at 4 pm. An apology

The hotel gave us exactly what we needed - central location, very good value for money, good bar (also converts to a decent breakfast buffet area), and clean and comfy rooms.  Design is neat and efficient - rooms are small but well appointed and thought through, perfectly good if you are in Singapore to be and about and not hang out in your hotel.

i love the breakfast ambience. location is superb too near to Mrt and vibrant area of Bugis. room is little bit small but for sleeping i wouldnt mind since whole day you will be outside to explore the city..will come again for sure!

the room was quiet small and there was no wardrobe. When you take a shower, the water goes all over the place in the bathroom. Nice to have: hair strghtner and hair dryier, plus the mobile device great!!!

房間真的很小 沒有冰箱 隔音也不好 廁所沒抽換氣裝置重點是住雙人房 卻只給一個人的備品和飯店主管反應了也沒用 住三天每天都一樣只給一雙紙拖鞋 一支牙刷 有一天甚至到下午4點半回飯店 房間竟然還沒打掃  床單也沒換過 真的糟透了!The room is really small, there is no refrigerator, the toilet is no air refresher.I ordered the double room for 3 nights,but only give me one slipper and one tooth brush every day.It’s no use to react with the hotel manager. One day,even at 4:30 in the afternoon, I went back to the hotel. The room didn’t even clean. The sheets didn’t change. It’s really terrible!

We were so happy to stay at G hotel..we are a family with a toddler..and we are satisfied due to size of a bed which is comfort for three of us..Furthermore, the location is so close to the mall..it is walking distant go to mrt and mall..

Stayed 6 nights in a “good”room class. The room is neat and tidy but small even for 2 people. There is no room to sit apart from a small nook and the bed itself. All multi functional in the room plan but was not a good experience. The  restaurant and bar attached was expensive as the tax was added after the base price of the drink. Very expensive to drink in Singapore. In all reception staff was helpful but get a bigger room if want to have  a bit more space. Cleaning staff very polite. Should include the buffet breakfast in price. Had to pre order before midnight to get cheaper  rate but then iti still attracted taxes.  Not sure what clientele they are after. No pool and no fridges in room.

Was tempted to write a long rant however will keep it simpleFound the experience very deceptive, I don't think I've ever written a bad review for a hotel before but this this was by far the worst value hotel I've ever stayed in.

Hotel G Singapore locates at an ideal place of city. It is neighbored to the Exit A of Bencoolen station.  The area has a good public transport. It's a good choice if you can accept the narrow size of room slightly.

review_title: Great place, but asking for another set of toothbrush seems to be difficult to get
review_text: Great place, nice room. But was only provided with one toothbrush set. Requested for an extra set from reception, and it never arrived even until we checked out. Will probably never visit the hotel again.

The Hotel G is a good value. The rooms are a bit small but certainly pleasant enough. Well located. The buffet breakfast  was more than adequate considering the room price. Staff is friendly and the hotel is well maintained.

The room took great advantage of the limited space. Breakfast was a mix between western and local food. Located in the Bugis shopping district and 15 minutes walk from the convention centre. Would stay again!

review_title: comfortable but small, especially shower room ❤
review_text: the best part of my stay was the shower room, even very small , but was very comfortable！！water so good, shampoo so good！and the lotion also good！！！but the room too small , if got heavy luggage, not suggest this hotel

The hotel is located in the middle of 3 MRT stations which are Rochor, Bencoolen, and Bugis. It is also surrounded by cafe, street food hawkers, department stores, and university campus. So, you can enjoy almost everything in Singapore easily!

The location of hotel g is so good. Nearby bugis mrt station. And the conditon of room is so good. But some things are a little disappointing. There was no refrigerator and no luggage tray. I was satisfied hotel g.

review_title: Room small but ok. Convenient for food and mrt
review_text: The room is clean but small, not many space for bags. The shower area is small, some stains on the shower curtains. Its’ location is good, close to Bugis, Rocher mrt stations. Nearby has many food choices. The bed is fit at the corner of the room, the person who sleeping near the window has to climb over the partner to get out of the bed.

review_title: Hotel with excellent value for money.
review_text: We stayed with multiple people in multiple rooms and all of the rooms were very nice and clean. The whole hotel is quite stylish in design and has a nice bar/restaurant at the ground floor, with also a burger joint in the same building. The hotel is not so far away from the metro and is quite centrally located yet not really in the middle of the activity of the city (really quiet). Would recommend this hotel all people as a hotel with very good value for money!

Hotel G is such a great hotel. The staff are very quick in responding to my needs and they are polite as well. The room is clean and comfy. Ultimately, the buffet breakfast is excellent since it offers variety of food which I like! ❤

Nice service and great location. Also the water dispenser is very convenient for tourists. There is also lots of restaurants and shopping stores nearby. The room is not big, but has anything you need inside, except for refrigerator. Overall, it's an excellent hotel to stay again.:))

Probably well fitted out for most travellers however the rooms are very small and a little claustrophobic for my tastes. More like a capsule room and it would be better if the hotel promoted the rooms more accurately. I stay in the G hotel in Malaysia quite often and I probably wouldn't return to this location

review_title: Smallest room for a 4 star hotel i have ever stayed in around the world. I would not recommend this hotel with such a sm
review_text: This is not a good 4star hotel . The room was the smallest room I have ever been in for 4 stars therefore the room is over priced. I am sorry to say that I will not be able to recommend this overpriced 4star tiny room.

Good - Location is good. 250 meters from MRT Bencoolen (blue line) - Decoration is good. - Type: Great King Room wider than average room in singapore. Sufficient space. - Lots of food around the hotel - Clean and new - Helpful staff - Walking distance to Bugis street - Bar at downstairs makes the atmosphere of hotel so good.  Bad - Wet and Dry area in bathroom separated by curtain. When you take a bath, a bit water splash to the dry area (toilet)

To be honest, it was more than I expected. The room was very functional. The design and layout was made rather spacious for the size and didn't sacrifice most of the necessities, while adding bits of style and fun here and there. The Handy X Phone was quite useful since I was only there for few nights and not wanting to get another sim/roaming, with the GoogleMap & Youtube APP I was entertained for the whole stay. Just wish that it was able to work as a hotspot.   Anyhow, the staff was very friendly & helpful, the place was fancy, the location was very strategic since it was nearby lots of temples & churches, and museums too. The hotel is also situated between 3 train stations, which was extremely convenient for a  lazy folk like me.  Definitely would recommend for chill &

Stayed in small room for one night quick stopover. Extremely well done- had every amenity you’d need. Very comfortable. Love the design of the hotel and the restaurant. Bartender was super nice too. Check in was great but when I came back down i had to wait 10-15 minutes to borrow an umbrella till the people checking in cleared because there was no one else to help me. But overall it was a wonderful stay!

The hotel is in a great spot, is nicely decorated, and has a decent restaurant.  It strives to be young and energetic and mostly succeeds.  For my preferences, would prefer a bit of gravity (could do without the television and music blasting on whenever I entered my room!), but very much appreciated the kindness and attention of the staff and the pleasurable decor.

I had dinner at the wine bar and used breakfast as well, on both occasions service staff was not of the same standard as the rest of the hotel. Reception staff very good.Overall still an nice place to stay.

review_title: Contemporary hotel in a good location
review_text: The hotel was very contemporary and in a good location to get around the city.  The breakfast was first class and the best I have ever had in any hotel.  The staff were more than helpful.  Room was a bit small but we were only there to sleep so that did not matter.  Would recommend to any traveller.

Alot of documentation and the extra amount around $30 i have to pay as Tax which was the fun killer to start with. The environment was good same as the cleanliness but the space of shower was not enough for a tall or healthy person.

review_title: Great space but poor room service
review_text: Stayed in your hotel foe 4 days and 3 nights, they never make up my room throughout my stay despites there's a request has been placed on the door. All they can say was, Im sorry Im late again. Thanks

refreshing interior decor and stylish inhouse bar and cafe. most convenience location, nearby Bugis MRT, nearby shopping centre, nearby cheap foodcourt...definitely my preferred hotel next time i'm here, cheers

Stayed here for 3 nights post cruise, Great location, the room was on the petite side but very well appointed. Staff were very pleasant and helpful. The hotel and room were spotlessly clean, fresh bottled water each day, free WiFi. I thought it was the perfect base for a city break.

I love the service from the staff, especially the sweet lady who helped us checking in, she smiled throughout the time. Room is clean, comfortable and cozy, spacious enough for two. I so love the water dispenser outside the room on each floor for us to "stay hydrated", because I always feel one water bottle isn't enough for two days. The interior design of the room is unique, there's a dream catcher-chandelier above the bed and was dustless. Overall a perfect night-stay in this hotel. Walking duration to MRT Bugis is only 10minutes. The only minus is that the room service forgot to put a body soap in our room so I had to personally ask for it in the lobby. I would definitely come back!

Stayed at Hotel G for 6 days while in Singapore. The hotel is very clean and modern. Rooms were actually a lot bigger than we were expecting but there wasn't much in terms of drawers or closets for storage.   The bed was comfortable and the room came with a cell phone to use around town. The phone service was really slow so we ended up getting a sim card for my personal phone but we kept the hotel phone to get great deals around the city.   The hotel was in a great area (10-15min walk to Little India, a few MRT stations on different lines nearby) and had a great bar/restaurant downstairs.

The hotel is about 5 mins from the nearest MRT and well located otherwise. Some nice restaurants in the area including some local street food. Note, you have to walk through Ginnett restaurant to get the hotel reception on the 1st floor, a bit odd.   One of the big advantages was the hotel mobile (handy) in the room which provided some really good discounts for most excursions.  Rooms are very small, no storage space, tiny bathroom/ shower and double bed against the wall. Seriously, a swinging cat would not survive.   But how much time does one spend in the room!! It worked for us for 4 nights.

Stylish, clean, boutique, but a bit small in size especially the toilet. Only one set of toiletries and slippers.  Overall the experience is good. Good bar , welcome drink.  Would come again with friends.

I was there for a business trip. Will not return:  - Not really nice staff, no flexibility. If you call reception, you probably will have to wait several minutes on the phone for someone to answer. - The rooms are very small. What they call "Queen size bed" is really not queen size. - Room cleaning does not do its job properly. - Air conditioning is hard to set - Several light buttons do not work properly. A light bulb was not working (and no, I have other things to do than call for repair). - The water pressure is very low, so it takes forever to simply wash your hands. And it spills everywhere since the sink is in the middle of the room. - No room service. - Location difficult to find for taxis (up in a building with an entrance that is not obvious).  Overall, very expensive

What i loved about the hotel was how cozy the rooms are and strategically located the hotel was.The staff were mostly friendly and accommodating. One minor pet peeve was the area between the shower and the toilet are of the same level so it tends to flood the toilet area a little bit after a shower even with the shower curtain (not really a huge issue though)However, I would love to stay here again in my next return to Singapore.

Very nice hotel, in good location. Near tubes etc. Rooms clean and tidy. Nice breakfast. Around the hotel are plenty restaurants> Gym good in hotel. Only down side was musc in bar ws very loud but that's a personal thing

I stayed always there , i like the staff very friendly and helpful thanks viktoria . the rooms was great and clean. the position is good too . For the reservation is better take care of the old guests before cancel the reservation ,and check if have other reservation and given other credit card .  Best regards

Perfect location  nice hotel.Rooms lack a bit of storage for clothes especially with 2 people in the room but a minor issue as only there for a few days.Shower get the toilet floor wet if you're not careful.

review_title: Very Nice, Exactly Like the Photos
review_text: Online pics show almost exactly what you get. Very clean hotel with a cool chic vibe, and trendy artwork. Rooms are nice but small, but that seems par for the course in Singapore. Even thought we were two adults in a small room, it didn’t feel like we were sardines, then again we were a couple on holiday so if you don’t want to be in close quarters maybe book two rooms. Price for the room was a little more than I would want to pay for a smaller room but I guess that’s just Singapore. Overall a very good experience,

Everything is good , the breakfast,the room design, the service and the gym,but the shower space is a little small that I usually touch the shower curtain while showering . The location is good that go to MRT is convenient. If I go to Singapore again I will choose hotel G again.

I stayed for one night only while in Singapore on business. The rooms are small and my room was a 'double' but trying to imagine my wife and I in that room with our clothes, getting ready made my head hurt! Regarding clothes, there is no wardrobe as such, just a metal rack on the wall. As I was there one night my two shorts and suite hung OK but there was no room for more (see above wife comment). The shower however was great and although the shower space is OK you do tend to get water on the toilet etc.  The light switches are also in strange hidden places (in my room anyway) with the switch for the light over the sink hidden behind a blind and curtains and then tucked round the corner. The switch labeled 'master' was not a master at all.  There was a desk area but it's small

My room was comfortable & was good to see coffee & tea making in room. Only problem was for taxis to find reception entrance around the back in nside parking station. Plus a few one way streets in the area.

review_title: Not as Described. Don't go HERE
review_text: 2 Star hotel at best.Worst designed hotel. Jail cells are bigger than the room we were given. Tiny windows. Room measured 2 metres X 5 metres. The room we booked was called a  Business King Room. The only business we could achieve was negotiating turns at trying to breathe. Don't go there. Death by claustrophobia was a possibility. Our wake up call came 30 minutes late. Fortunately, we were awake rushing to leave hotel and end our pain.

review_title: Amazing location and cozy place to stay
review_text: I loved Singapore and i loved this hotel. Staff perfect, cleanliness top, great shower amenities, super soft bed, amazing breakfast. Noticed that their restaurants are very popular in the evening too,comfortable to go anywhere by MRT just nearby or Taxi. Would recommend to everyone and definitely come back again.

The room was small but very well organised and clean. The check in and out was very easy and I felt very welcome. Breakfast was very good with broad choice. I would stay in this hotel again and I would recommend it.

Hotel G located at Middle Road is a fine choice for people as many places are close to this area, The hotel rooms are amazingly created & of perfect sizes. My experience was great staying at the hotel for 2 nights.

It's a really good find! Although the rooms were small (like all other Singaporean hotels), the furniture and layout of the room didn't make it feel small. It is really clean, staff are competent, and the breakfast is really good. I love love it!

review_title: Superb base for exploring the city!
review_text: We stayed at hotel G for three nights in september. The accommodation is squeaky clean and modern. Although the rooms are small, they have all the necessary amenities and are very comfortable. Most attractions are easily reached by short walks and taxis can be called at short notice to collect you for further a field trips. Breakfast is available at a small charge at the restaurant downstairs and there is a lot of variety available for all cultures. Highly recommend this hotel which we will stay in again on  our next visit!

review_title: good location but not user friendly
review_text: The location is good, rooms are small but clean and the beds are comfortable. The design however is not user friendly : no night lights so when you get up at nigh you have to move in the dark to the switches. The space for working, for hanging clothes and for storage is limited. The sound proof should improve too.

The reviews on Hotel G were all true. I have experienced them for myself. Excellent location, super nice and friendly staff. Comfy and clean room. Nice food and cool bar at the ground floor. I would really come back here again and again.

Hotel G was very clean and modern. Upon arrival check in was very easy. The room was small, with the bed covering most of the area but all the space was wisely used, leaving no room wasted. The room had everything you'd need in a hotel room - cannot complain. The room was very clean. I think if anyone was taller than 180cm they might have trouble keeping their toes in the end of the bed though!

Hotel was new , clean and trendy. Our room was a touch small as I am 6’ 4” tall but as for one night only it was ok. Didn’t have breakfast as we had an early flight . Great location as walk everywhere and close to mrt

It was a great experience.Although the room is smaller than I expected, but It's really cosy, clean and convenient, the hotel have ice maker machine at the hallway. Location is very convenient near by the public transportation station and with a walkable distance to Bugis. Staff very friendly and helpful. What I don't like about Hotel: + Water from the hand wash faucet quite weak. + I was frozen because of no hot water at 5 a.m +  Unreasonable deposit (  150$ for 3 nights )

Well it looks cool, looks hip and it is located in a strategic location! I think we can summarize the hotel as a Hot Surfer Dude wearing Suits kinda of Hotel. You wont go wrong formally and casually. Good for business & Leisure for those who do not get me! Lol!

Roon is very small where refrigerator cannot be set.  However enough confirtable stay for one or two person.  All other ppoints, no complaints at all. I wold say except room size, 4.5 star hotel, I would say high cost performance hotel and I will back there when I in SGP.

Really Nothing To Complain About My Stay. The Hotel Is Very Clean. The Staff Was Very Helpfully With My Needs. Great Location Walking Distance To The Mall And A Lot Of Restaurants Nearby. The Only Thing I Didn’t Like Is This Shower In The Bathroom Where The Water Comes Out Easily On To The Bathroom Floor. I Would Recommend This Hotel To Everybody!!!

review_title: Great location. Great stay. Limited amenities
review_text: The place is quirky and fun and is extremely conveniently located in Singapore. But there is no pool available and the hotel doesn't have a few other utilities such as bathrobes or twin beds. The entire space is also strictly a non-smoking zone. Even so, the decor is tasteful. The rooms are very well lit and squeaky clean even with the limited space. The breakfast spread is wonderful and it's always great to have two amazing restaurants in-house. Service was friendly and non-intrusive and our stay was pleasant overall.

Hotel is walking distance to Bencoolen MRT. 24 hours local indian restaurant right besides it. Though the room is small and dont have a fridge, the bed and pillow are comfy! The shower is also great but not so roomy for those plus size customer. Metis bathroom amenities smell good! House keeping is superb! Love the interactive TV. It would be great if the work light and ceiling light (with Dreamcatcher) have a separate switch.

review_title: Good location but the too small rooms
review_text: Very good location close to metro stations. We were two people and the room was so small it was difficult to open the two luggages at the same time. Disappointing welcome drink because we expected to try some more than a simply juice.

the ground level public area pub/restaurant is probably the nicest part of the place. and superbly located.
very limited space. the curtains only divide the shower area which let the water leak out to the toilet area. it smelt a bit damp when first arrived. not the greatest first impression.
the corridor looks more like a hostel.... good enough for the price for the location.

room service only made my bed. the cups and ice tank was not replaced with cleaned ones....

review_title: A Good Hotel for Travel Light People
review_text: We enjoyed our stay in this hotel, it's very stylish and clean. :)This hotel is good place for people who has small / hand-carry luggage bags. If you have many pieces of luggage, please look elsewhere as their rooms are pretty small, you won't have much space to walk around after laying your things out on the floor.

experience of having a small blood stain on the blanket upon first day of arrival where i found no wound from me. While others service being excellent. Staff being helpful and friendly. will recommend my friend to stay

review_title: condions good, space   in the rooms is very low,  and staff is not freidly
review_text: reception: even we did not get welcome drink after 9 hour journey, even a water bottle.Room space: very little, bath room space is also not enough, cleaning staff very good, food very good and tastyi'm not happy for the hotel
travel_type: Trip type: Travelled as a couple

review_text: Good location (near the Bencoleen MRT station), very cose to Orcahrd Street and Little India. Amazing breakfast.Bed very comfy, all very clean.The room is small for people travelling with big luggages, but we managed.
travel_type: Trip type: Travelled as a couple

review_text:
Hotel is in a convenient location, 2 blocks from Ben Coolen metro stop. Area has many restaurants and bars nearby.
Check in was simple and quick, however found entry into the hotel confusing as when you enter from the street you end up in the restaurant/bar. As far as I could tell you had to carry your luggage up a flight of stairs within the restaurant to get to the elevator. The lobby is on the second floor.
Had a single room which was quite small but quite efficiently designed. Bathroom consists of toilet and shower. Small basin just outside bathroom. Single bed with TV above it. Room comes with complementary water and instant coffee.
Storage for suitcase is under the bed and there is a safe for valuables.
Breakfast provided in the morning has good selection of dishes. Again a bit confusing as the restaurant has 2 levels and the dishes are spread throughout.

Brilliant, quirky Hotel. Excellent location and value for money. Small but perfectly formed rooms.The staff at breakfast need to cheer up a bit though!Generally a great option and I'd definitely stay here again.
travel_type: Trip type: Travelled as a couple

review_text: Rude staff, small rooms.We had issue with the booking and the reception answer is "it's your problem sir not our" and didn't want to help also if we paid full amount prior our arrival.We had to manage and fix the issue by ourself also making international calls Never again
travel_type: Trip type: Travelled as a couple

review_text: Very good location. Metro stations all very close.Rooms are small, but ok. Breakfast ist very good, bit rather expensive. We couldn‘t get a late check-out & they couldn‘t find our booking.com confirmation, but we got the right room.
travel_type: Trip type: Travelled as a couple

review_text: It was a great stay! My friends and I really enjoyed ourselves in the hotel. The staff was very sweet and understanding. The free mobile device with data was very resourceful and was a huge help. The location is also great because it is close to many train stations. I will recommend this hotel!

Hotel G is located close to the MRT (Bencoolen station), which allows easy access to the rest of the city and airport. Also, there are a lot of lovely restaurants nearby.   As for the hotel itself, breakfast is excellent, although we advise you to come in a bit early as it gets crowded later on in the morning. Choose of food for breakfast excellent.  Room is cosy and has everything you need, bathroom amenities, TV, tea station. The staff are nice and friendly. In all we had a really good stay here.

The house keeping staff was positive and proactive, however the kitchen staff and restaurant staff need improved customer skills and increase in positivity -- a smile can go a long way. A second coffee machine and breakfast and regular supply of cups is essential

切換至中文（繁體）The hotel environment is very clean, but unfortunately the daily room is sorted out until 4 pm, the staff is still using it, so I don't know if the rest is waiting for him to finish...so it let me confused

We had a problem with our booking, we fully paid the nights and the hotel didn't received the booking somehow. When I show to the reception the receipt of payment and the confirmation of the booking they refused to give us the room and ask to contact the booking agency by ourself telling us "it's your problem sir, not our" without any help. We had no local phone and no internet and clarifying the matters cost us 20usd of call. Never again with this rude staff. Small rooms.

Hotel was great love the cozy atmosphere and uniqueness of the cork board and handy phone. Our housekeeping attendant was very nice aswell asking when we would like our room serviced when leaving. However our check in was very average we weren’t explained anything regarding the hotel facilities, restaurants, elevator and hotel ground entrance.

Very good hotel, very small rooms but new, good for staying there just for the night and explore the city. However, one day, I put twice th sign for the cleaning staff to clean the room, and I found it twice under the door without cleaning. Cleaner must passed outside the rooms and putting inside the cleaning sign in order to avoid cleaning. This happened twice in a day. When I informed the reception about it when inreturned at 22:00, they sent asap a cleaner to tide the room and and provide us with soaps, towels etc

review_title: Great location. Reasonably priced considering its Singapore.
review_text: Great location! Near Bencoolen and Bugis mrt; quiet neighbourhoodGood service and accommodating staff Check in/check out is a breeze! Luggage storage was of great helpComfortable bed, all areas are clean and well maintained, loved their toiletries brand, free supply of cold water and ice perfect for the Singapore heat! Nice bar, restaurants at ground floor perfect for a nightcap! Ya Kun and Toast Box are across the street perfect for breakfastThings that may be of concern to other travellers:Lobby and pick up/drop off is on the 2nd floor through one flight of stairs. Managing luggage up/down the stairs was not an issue for us but maybe for those arriving via train/busRoom is small so just enough for a few nights as there’s not much space to take out all your stuffShower area is

Very close to almost all the tourism spots in Singapore.  I was there for a long business trip.. Every bit of service provided made my stay very comfortable.  Hope you keep up the good work !   Wishing you all well

Had a very nice stay, liked the free mobile phone very much! The room was very nice, and I enjoyed the breakfast a lot. Great place, in a very central area, and very good service. Great atmosphere overall.

Perfect location if you want to travel around Singapore and the staff were always available to help and provide recommendations. Hotel was clean and there are water re fill stations on every floor. Rooms had everything you needed but if you were staying for longer than 3 nights it could be a bit small. I stayed for 2 nights and it was perfect!

review_title: Nice hotel, but not muslim- friendly
review_text: No water in toilet areas to wash..so not Muslim -friendly. Have to use toilet paper. The waiting time to get a room was Atrociously long! The hotel booking management seems to be poor. Breakfast was disappointing! Other than these issues, everything else was excellent and value for money.

Bed setup as platform is a bit weird. I prefer standard bed that I can walk around. Overall is good for the price. Excellent location to public transportation. Check in lobby is a bit small and understated.

Great hotel. Friendly staff, rooms are small,  not for the larger traveller. Perfect location. Shout out to Wallace, made the stay fun. Recommend the hotel, enjoyed our time. Comp water, which was an added bonus.

We stayed in the hotel for 2 nights. Rooms are nicely decorated and are modern. However room sizes are super small, there is barely any place for two suitcases and no place to take your cloths so you need to pack wisely to have all the essentials on the top.   Hotel is well located in the city center, close to the subway station, there are shops and restaurants too.   Hotel breakfast is served as a buffet and has a really big variety of foods and all foods are supper tasty, one of the top hotel breakfasts I had.   Staff of the hotel is helpful and nice.

I feel the price paid for this Good King room not value for money.The wash basin was outside the toilet room not convenient. Location to nearest train station not convenient too.I would not want to stay this hotel again.

I found Hotel G to be a very nice base for my time in Singapore. It was centrally located to my activities. The room was not large but was certainly large enough for a single traveler like myself and very nicely appointed. The staff was always very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is great - food styled for Asians, Europeans, Americans - there was something for almost everyone and was always fresh and tasty. And at night in the restaurant the long charcuterie board was a hit with me and my friends. I will certainly go back again.

Stayed for a little over 2 weeks for a business trip and was a brilliant experience, my first time in Singapore so I was not used to small rooms however the service was awesome and the breakfast was amazing!!! Thank you Hotel G

Convenient location, Middle Road is easy to reach and close to the center Super stylish hotel, but rooms are small. Absolutely OK for a business trip though. Small gym, always open Good breakfast, and warm welcome from the staff

wonderful hotel, amazing and tasty breakfast, great location close to MRT stations Rochor, Bencoolen and Bugis, very clean room, not noisy at all, great bar at the entrance, lovely wine and coffee, pancakes were heavenly

Wonderful staff, great location and extensive breakfast.  Rooms were compact but really functional - and loved the idea of giving guests a phone that was 4G enabled to help you get around.  I also loved the convenience of being able to order taxis from reception that came right to the door.

Be prepared for small rooms, but otherwise very good!The only complaint is that the air-conditioner's fan is very slow, so it takes a while for the aircon to cool the room, so you may sleep feeling hot while you wake up feeling cold in the middle of the night because you have set the room aircon too cold..

The room is ridiculously tiny. There is no minibar, the bathroom wasn't cleaned well. The bed wasn't even that comfortable. There's no wardrobe whatsoever.  Now here's what made me write a review: THE SERVICE. Good lord, if you're grumpy AF, do not work in the hospitality industry. The front desk was in a rush. And this Chinese girl at the buffet breakfast basically spat at the guests while we were waiting to be seated. "What room?!" Good morning, sunshine indeed. Do something about your service, Hotel G. You're an embarrassment.

Located in town near to several malls. Near to Bugis street and the MRT. The hotel bed is comfortable. The room is furnished with modern furnishings. The room is small for two persons but it’s fine for a solo traveller. If in Singapore this is a Hotel people should consider.

The room was good and comfy but definitely smaller than what the expedia picture looked like. It did not have a closet and was tiny. toilet inside the shower. Hotel is overall clean and centrally located. close to the MRT and close to bugis street Staff could be a bit friendlier.

review_title: Overall, the hotel was very nice!
review_text: I found some hair and dust in my room after cleaning service :( ... But overall, the hotel was very nice! The staff was nice and proximity was really good. I will stay in Hotel G Singapore if I go to Singapore again!

We spent 2 nights in this hotel. It's located in a good position, not far from the metro. Rooms are very clean, but a little bit smalll. The Dining area is pretty big, on 2 floors. Breakfast is very rich and tasty. It's a good choiche for your stay in Singapore!

I stayed at this Hotel for watching F1 SingaporeGP.(14~17.Sep)Service,Cleanliness,Sleep Quality is Excellent. This Hotel can keep baggage after Check out.  Location is good.Hotel`s Bar and Dinner open until 2:00 am.Any other,Singapore food restraunt open all day.15min: F1 circuit gate Without size of the room, I have no bad point.

We are arrived at 7:00 AM due to changed by aircraft. After breakfast, it is still need to wait a long time for check in. Staffs are very helpful and arrange early check in for us when the room is ready. we can take a break in the morning so that we have a memorable experience in Singapore. Thanks for the staff who help us.

Hotel G offers a great atmosphere and friendly staff.  We were please with the breakfast buffet and also some great dinner options in the first floor restaurant.  We found great places to shop and eat nearby but also a little off the hustle and bustle of the busy areas.

Everything was smooth from the time I checked in and till I checked out. I was surprise with the room bcos it's nicely designed and with unique layouts.Getting food was convenient around the hotel and on our second day getting to Gardens by the bay was just by taking the downtown line which was just abiut 150m away from the Hotel.I would recommend the place to my friends. Service and place is just what you need away from home.Thanks Hotel G!

The best hotel I've ever stayed at! Amazing service and nice and detailed wall borders bring a lot of different environment to my stay. Overall my stay was entertained by the simple design of the room. It is highly recommended for my friends and family!

The stay was convenient and comfortable. The customer service was fine, only one of the receptionist had mistaken the information, whereby the payment was supposed to charge under my company but ask me to pay for it instead. Fortunately, the problem is rectified.

I don't know where the button or sign for cleaning the room. So far everything excellent for me and wife, next time will take my kids to stays. hope you have family rooms or connecting room for us. many thanks
travel_type: Trip type: Travelled as a couple

review_text: We stayed at the hotel for five days. The hotel is in an excellent location close to the metro station. Three minutes walk. The rooms are not large but very functional. The bed is wide and very swollen. Breakfast is good. Do not arrive after 0930 There is hardly any food left. It's a great experience.

Would recommend to have someone at the ground floor (the restaurant)  to give clear instructions on where to check in, as the waiters / waitresses are not so helpful in guiding us to the lobby. Overall, is a good stay with nice arrangement in the room.
travel_type: Trip type: Travelled as a couple

review_text: My second time in this hotel and my stay met my expectations The hotel personnel is very efficient and kind, the room is good and it’s all I need when I travel on business trip. Comfortable bed and good shower. Restaurant and Bar very lively and good selection of wines.

The location of G is convenient, near 3 MRT stations(DT13, 14 and 21), which gives us choices to start and finish our daily schedule.  Although the room is quite small, it is really clean and get everything we need in this trip, and the view through window is really great. We would like to recommend G Hotel to our friends and family.
travel_type: Trip type: Travelled as a couple

review_text: Rooms are compact but comfortable bed (please note I’m only 5ft4 so if your tall it might be different) good service, friendly staff and very clean. Breakfast choices are good and Ginette bar is good for a sharing platter and nice glass of wine

review_title: Clean, comfortable, good location, but I wouldn't stay again
review_text:
There was nothing awful about Hotel G, but nothing amazing about it either.

The location was good - easy to walk to most places (about 10ish mins to Raffles Hotel, 25ish mins to Marina Bay/Gardens by the Bay) and really close to several subway stations.

The service was hit and miss - some people were nicer and more welcoming than others (the woman at breakfast was definitely on the less welcoming end of the scale). But then I came back one afternoon to find a little note with helpful tips on getting to the Grand Prix and a complimentary bottle of red wine. Pretty sure everyone got them, but I thought it was a nice touch.

Breakfast was fine - I didn't have any of the cooked egg options, but people seemed to be enjoying them. There was a good array of Asian and Western dishes, so whatever you wanted, you could probably find.

Gym was pretty good - small, but functional.

The rooms were fine. Bed was really comfortable, but to be honest, I found the 'modern' design of things really annoying. I only think that 'innovative' design should be used when it makes sense, not for the sake of it.

For instance, the light for the bathroom is next to the bed, rather than next to the bathroom.
