The shower was infuriating, as the rain shower head didn't work and so had to use the pull-out shower head, which was fine except it made the curtain blow straight on me, which made it impossible to shower. If I adjusted the shower head to stop the curtain from blowing on me, water went all over the bathroom floor. Also, the shower curtain seemed out of place - it was modern sliding glass everywhere else, why then have a curtain?!

And if you're travelling with someone who you would rather didn't hear your noises in the bathroom, this is not a good hotel for that because the bathroom door is a sliding glass door that doesn't fully seal.

I also couldn't for the life of me figure out how to put the do not disturb sign on - I didn't have a sign to hang on my door and there was a button outside that seemed to illuminate, but I couldn't find any way of illuminating it...nowhere. I searched everywhere. I just had to keep my fingers crossed that when I went to the gym in the morning I wouldn't come back to find housekeeping in my room.

The other kind of annoying thing is that reception is on the second floor, so you have to go through the bar, up a set of stairs, then take an elevator up one floor to check in. So if you can't/don't want to carry your luggage up a flight of stairs, don't bother. There also wasn't any clear signage about accessible entry to the reception, so if that's something you need, you may want to call to check whether it even exists.

The elevators were really slow, so it took a while to get in and out.

This place just didn't do it for me like it seemed to do for other reviewers. As I said, nothing terrible, but I wouldn't stay there again.

Excellent stay! Everything was very good. I would like to express my special thanks to Wallace, who works at the reception. He gave me really good advice how to plan my 3 days in Singapore, what to see, what and where to eat and how to get there. What an asset to the hotel!

review_title: Cute, well-designed rooms in a convenient location
review_text: The rooms are small but so well designed! Space under the bed to slide your open suitcase. A safety box drawer also under the bed. Firm, comfy bed snuggled up againts the window and a good sized workspace and shower. It has everything I need when I'm traveling alone.

review_title: Very good Hotel for short stays. Rooms are well equipped
review_text: Hotel is located in a very good neighborhood. Near two metro stations. Rooms are small but well equipped. Good value por the money payed. The breakfast buffet is really good, pastries, hot dishes, eggs, fruit, yogurt. The buger restaurant in the ground floor is another fine option for casual dinner.

Hotel G was a very clean and nice property in the Bugis area of Singapore. The room was small in size but very efficient in function. The bed was comfortable and had nice quality bedding. The room had a large window to let in good natural lighting. The restaurant on the first floor served a nice breakfast and was a nice bar at night.

Nice clean hotel, good location. I paid equivalent of over £150 per night for the stay which I felt was expensive for what it is.I wasn’t impressed with the attitude of the staff in restaurant at breakfast and I was not explained the options that I had.Nice clean and compact rooms.I was really impressed I was able to watch world title boxing match in the room without pay per view.

review_title: Amazing place to stay in Singapore
review_text: I was arrived around 11pm, the staff nice and very helpful. And I was surprised when they upgrade my room become the largest room in this hotel.Room clean and I love the hotel concept and decoration. I have dream catcher above my bed :)

Walking distance to Bugis shopping area. Good decoration with nice bar downstairs.I requested for room decoration and special shout out to Alexander and his team for fulfilling my request as per communication. Keep up the good work Alex!

Nice hotel, nice location and good breakfast. The surrounding has some nice restauants. The only point which was not that good is the size of the room, which was really very small as well as the toilet, which is a bit dark

Visited Singapore to attend the F1 Grand Prix and partake in some tourism. The hotel was located a few hundred metres from Bencoolen station on the MRT downtown line. This makes it very convenient for travelling around Singapore. Rooms were clean, a little on the small side but suited our needs as we were maximising our time out and about, not in the hotel room.

Exceptional Service. Staff were extremely nice, accommodating and helpful, to the extent of making us uncomfortable. Very clean and neat rooms. Breakfast was possibly if not the best i have ever eaten locally and in overseas (and i travel alot). Hope you keep up the good work!

An ideally located small boutique hotel. Located in the city center of Singapore G Hotel is the best base for your walking routes through the city. Near to MRT stations and in walk able distance to lots of city’s main attractions. The hotel has 3 types of rooms. Good , great and greater. It has to do with the space of the room actually. We spent 2 nights in the great type of room. Small room but totally accommodating and clean. Two restaurants are situated in the ground floor of the hotel, were the breakfast is served as well. Nice breakfast, with reasonable variety but sometimes crowded.  The personel could be more helpful ank kind.  A very good choice for exploring the city!

You get what you pay for, the trouble is the Hotel is not cheap. Reception is small, everyone with bags had nowhere to stand whilst checking in/out. I would start by saying one or max two nights stay is ok. The room was terrible, tiny, the small sink smelt. No wardrobes, the bed is up against the wall, so you bang your head. The bathroom is tiny. Nowhere for your bags to go, so constantly in your way. No opening window. BREAKFAST. the staff coughing over us and the food. They are untrained,they looked so fed up.... The cooks didnt even know how to cook an egg over easy,or an omelette. It looked to us that the fried eggs had been pre cooked. When the cold hard bacon had run out, no more! But you did get terrible boiled sausages instead lol. The queue for the cups (that ran out

Nice hotel with great location, walking diatance fron Bencoolen and Bugis MRT station. Next to shopping mall, bugis street market and hawker. Room quite small with compact bathroom but with nice design.  Good quality bed and bedsheet. Very comfortable. Breakfast just oke, noot too much option buffet menu need improvement at egg station, very low speed. Design very milenials with expose ceiling. The best part? They have water and ice cube dispenser every floor.

Loving this hotel so much! One of my most memorable staycation ever! Really love the design and ambience of Hotel G, lots of instagramable post for a content creator like me, would love to visit this hotel again for a longer stay next time!

A lovely hotel within easy walking distance of at least 3 MRT stations, more if the weather is kinder! The beds are lovely to sleep on. The rooms are snug with a little space for everything. The funky décor of the corridors is a treat. The dual level dining area is based on a French bistro with a great wine selection and menu. Breakfast can be a bit too busy, but maybe that was because it was the F1 weekend and the hotel was full. All in all we would stay here again!

review_title: Pleasant stay but Housekeeping needs improvement
review_text: This has been one of my fav hotels which I often recommend to my overseas friends. Regrettably,  standards have really dropped. I stayed here for 4 nights this time. One 1 night, the bathroom wasn’t cleaned and on my last night, they packed the trash but forgot to bring it out and left it in the room. I came back to it around 10pm, brought it outside my room and placed it near the door. When I came out of my room at around 11am, was really surprised to see the trash bag still there uncleared.This is despite someone coming around in the morning to check if I want my laundry to be picked. This is still a decent hotel with small and cosy room in a pretty good location. But clearly the Housekeeping can be improved.

Room is clean and staff are friendly. Very good services, will stay again for my next trip. Would be great if breakfast menu can be provided and screened in each room TV or handy phone. It will helps to attract people to top up breakfast for their staying.

review_title: There are few outlets in the room
review_text: Now is the era of IT. Laptop computer · smaho · wifi · electronic cigarette · electronic notebook · · ·. There was only one outlet and it was serious.Now is the era of IT. Laptop computer · smaho · wifi · electronic cigarette · electronic notebook · · ·. There was only one outlet and it was serious. The room was compact, comfortable and comfortable. I confirmed that the museum is opening, but it was closed during refurbishment. There was no choice because there was no information on the Internet. If I knew in advance, I regret that I could tour somewhere else.

Clean room, a comfortable and released bed.Location is good, yakun toast and mall is near. Bus station is very close and MRT is not far. Little indian and Bugis muslin area can be reached by walk.Breakfast is excellent, don't miss it.

We stayed for 1 night whilst passing through Singapore, the hotel was great in every way for our purpose. Central to most sights and very near the Bencolen MRTstation, which is immaculate compared to the London Underground system.

review_title: smll room  with High house price
review_text: The room is super small, 1200 RMB is very small, we booked in advance, but the room cost dropped to 800 RMB on the day of check-in, and we are not allowed to check out one day, reservations. The sound insulation is very bad, and the room is partitions.

I like everything about the hotel, location is excellent and very clean. I especially enjoyed the breakfast lots of varieties to chose from. Grab service is very good and rate reasonable. Shopping in the Bugis Streen and Orchard Road was fund and can find what you are looking for.The people are friendly and the staff of the hotel is polite and friendly.

I was upgraded however the room was still small so can imagin the standard room must be very small indeed. However the rooms were clean and well presented and the room cleaning staff did a great job. My only complaint was the restaurant and bar. The food selection was poor and on 2 occasions my first choice was not available. Service was very slow however I put this down to a lack of staff for the size of the restaurant rather than the staff working there, Drinks were expensive and I would suggest a larger choice of wines from other countries as generally i find French wines over rated and over priced compared to other origins

The Hotel is very well located, the rooms as small but quite cozy and very good cost/benefit.They also have an amazing restaurant downstairs with a great wine list and chef prepared food.We loved our stay and definitely will be back!
travel_type: Trip type: Travelled as a couple

review_title: Great Hotel, centrally located, Middle Road
review_text:
I stayed at the hotel for 5 days. The rooms are relatively small, hardly any space for storage. The Breakfast spread was awesome. The Bar has a good collection of wines and has some great evening eats. The Bar s almost full in the evenings. Spent really nice evenings having a nice time with colleagues. The bathrooms have a sliding door and is slight inconvenience as water gets out.
Overall I definitely recommend the stay if you are travelling for work and your office is anywhere around Middle Road.

That's our first Time in this Hotel, it's located in the Heart of Singapore. The Rooms are not very large but you have all what you need. The Rooms have a nice Style, Breakfast will be ok. The Restaurant/Bar which is open to the Street is very nice.

The hotel room is slightly smaller than your average hotel rooms in Singapore however its location is great as its in the heart of the Arts and Musem district. On the ground level of the hotel, there are two restaurant Ginett and 25 Degrees.

I personally tried the burgers from 25 Degrees which is a famed burger concept restaurant from Los Angeles, California. They have their monthly theme burger offers overrall the bun, meat, toppings and sauces compliments one and another.

Its location caters to all types of travellers from sightseeing, shopping to eatries:

Sightseeing

1) Singapore Arts Musem

2) National Musem Of Singapore

3) Fort Canning

4) Peranakan Museum

5) Singapore Philatelic Museum

6) Little India Heritage Trail

7) Kampong Glam Heritage Trail

8) Orchard Road Heritage Trail (T.B.A)

9) Kwan Im Thong Hood Cho Temple

10) Sri Krishnan Temple

Shopping

1) Bugis Street

2) Bugis Junction

3) Suntec City

4) Raffles City Shopping Centre

5) Marina Square Shopping Centre

Eateries

1) Cafes around Haji and Bali lane

The Singapore Arts Musem, National Museum Of Singapore, Peranakan Museum and Singapore Philatelic Museum

review_title: Little itty bitty room but comfortable
review_text: My husband is 6foot 8. Having his head on the headboard, his feet touch the wall at the end. That’s the width of the room. Only there one night so it didn’t matter too much.Breakfast was yummy, good selection

We really liked our stay in the Hotel G Singapore. It's well located in the city center (MRT-Station is 3 minutes away). Our room was comfortable, clean and modern. We were very happy about the smartphone the hotel provided for its guests.

review_title: Very nice Hotel in the center of Singapore
review_text: Very nice hotel in central location everything is nearby and public transport is very close to the hotel. The room we had was very small but we learned this is typical for the G-Hotel. Nevertheless staff is very polite and helpful. The restaurant is not really cheap but the quality of the food is very good. Breakfast is not typicall for a hotel located in Asia but more for a European Hotel, means offers a lot of good things. We really enjoyed our stay in this hotel.

Stayed at the hotel last month. Beautiful rooms furnished to a high standard.
Excellent service from all staff - highly trained, very professional and understand the value of looking after customers.
Amazing breakfast buffet and the building is an incredible feat of architecture.
But it cannot be help that we couldn't enjoy the trip as everywhere in Singapore is too crowded.
travel_type: Trip type: Travelled as a couple

review_text: Lobby & reception on split levels.dinning .meals area on split levels. Breakfast choices very limited. tea coffee in room only 1 .per person in  small cup  no fridge in room .2 bed but very  smay room space

Hotel G is a great location in the Bencoolen area, about 2-10mins away from 4 MRT stations, in walking distance of multiple restaurants, attractions and shops.  The room was fairly small, but comfortable and great for a solo traveller. The toilet and shower is a wetroom and sometimes takes a while to dry. There is complementary toiletries and water that can be topped up. The bed is comfortable and dream catcher light above so cool! The downside is that the AC is pretty loud and you can hear the traffic from outside (even on the 10th floor), so if you sfruggle sleeping this may be an issue.  The hotel also offers a gym (which i didn't manage to use) and x2 restaurants. I only ate at 25 Degrees - which is a burger and beer joint. The food was tasty, but not much. I didn't eat at

review_title: A hidden gem in a great location
review_text: I always stay here. The staff bend over backwards to help you, the price is affordable and the rooms and cleans and well equipped. I highly recommend this place. There are some nice places to eat around, as well as some budget restaurants around the corner under the hotel. Also short walks to the public transportation stations. I’d you’re visiting for F1, it’s only two stops on the subway. Quick and painless.

I came to Singapore  for the Formula 1 race even. I come every year.  This time I decided to stay in the area, away from Orchard because most of the hotels there are fully booked.  I found this hotel is so unique and interesting. The interior is so unique. The corridor is narrow but is designed in colors which is so nice.  The room actually is so small, about 15m square. But even it is small but it was designed in smart lay out, enough for everything, enough for my 2 big suitcases, spaces for putting my things and toiletries. Even they have quite big safety box.   The bathroom is small, but again, it is comfortable and even small, the air is fresh, that means good circulation.  And the other nice thing: the GM compliment... a bottle of wine  I love this hotel

The staff was very friendly, it is in a good location to explore the  city and Bencoolen metro station was very close to the hotel..the badroom is a little dissapointing for a tready hotel like this. you must wash your hands in the sleeping area instead of badroom. It looks a bit cheap. Also there are no light buttons near the bed so you have to go out to turn of the lights when you want to go to sleep which is a bit inconvenient.

Nice hotel , room are very minimalist but nice, breakfast is very good. Personnel is available for every requirement, you can ask the reception.The bar is located at lobby floor and here you can find ant cocktail, the staff is nice and always available

review_title: Relaxing and fun stay at this hip hotel
review_text: Ambience of the hotel was on point. The decor and the overall look was stylish and hip. Breakfast was good also!What was lacking were the room essentials - soap, other toiletries, slippers, etc. The room was good for two and the provided essentials was just for one. Hoping to improve on this.Overall, our stay here was superb! Kudos to the Hotel G team!

Great location, convenient to find food and it is close to the MRT station. The room is provided with an Internet access cellphone which enables us to search for the map and reach our destination smoothly.    It worth the price and we will definitely be back!

review_title: Comfortable and cozy rooms, located in a very central location close to many amenities
review_text: Hotel location is excellent, at the corner of Bencoolen Street and Middle Road. 5 minutes walk away from exit A of Bencoolen MRT station, 8 minutes walk to Bugis MRT and Bugis Junction and located close to Albert Street and Sim Lim Square. 24 hour eateries just beside the hotel. First/ground floor of hotel has the Ginett Wine Bar and 25 deg Burger Bar for those looking for some excellent food and drink options.Rooms were small but cozy, with storage space for luggage cleverly positioned in a cove below the bed. Room I stayed in was tastefully decorated and cleanliness was OK. Sink and showers were quite small, however, will be a squeeze for larger sized guests.Would strongly recommend this hotel for those looking to stay in Central Singapore for a decent price.

The room was not really spacious but well cleaned and comfortable with lovely deco. Its location is good, just 5 min walking to MRT station. Also I was happy with the breakfast at the nice bar space. I appreciate for keeping our luggage after check out.

Noisiest hotel we stayed in on our 5 week trip overseas. Housekeeping staff have 2 way radios turned up at 8 in the morning. Doors keep out zero noise from the hallways. King bed sits in an alcove, so inside person has to climb over the other to get out of bed. Bathroom has glass walls, so turning on the light in the night lights up the whole room. Hand basin is in the main part of the room, not the bathroom, so floors need bath mat to keep the floor dry.Poor design overall. Breakfast is only saving grace, although things that should be hot were often cold. If you arrive any other way than car, have to enter via back alley as hotel has nowhere to stop out front.

More shadows than lights for this design hotel; location and continental breakfast are fine.But the rooms are really narrow and you have problem even to find space to open your luggage. The pictures that you see in same web sites are misleading. Smokers are not welcome and you cannot find any smoking area inside the hotel but only outside. I dont recommend it.

Clean room with nice cozy setting, even though it is small (the shower area is really tiny). Reception area is cramped, and not as directly accessible if not arriving in a car/cab. Breakfast spread is just okay, a mix of western and Chinese food, the cooked dory fish on that day was extremely salty, probably to complement the porridge.

Very cosy and comfortable hotel. Just add different asian meals for more attraction. Do you make arrangements for Singapore Sightseeing for a day or so.Service was excellent.Will recommend to my friends.

Though I was not good at English, your staff were very polite. I is very appreciated. In addition, the design of the room is a little bit different from the other hotel, and it is comfortable and enjoyable for me.

Trip with family went well.   Hassle is the tour pick up that we always have to go downstairs since the van cannot go up the reception area.  Room was not cleaned on time on my last day. A little inconvenience of going up and down during breakfast buffet

This hotel look exactly like the pic shown. I like their design and size of the room is just good enough. Bed was comfy and check-in was easy. Only issue for this hotel is the parking and if you drive, you need to pay Sgd2 per hour.

review_title: G for Great place to stay
review_text: Wonderful varied breakfast, close to shopping and the metro, friendly and helpful staff.  The only downside is the hotel rooms are small, hard to put the luggage and move about the room freely.  The breakfast had different hot food selection everyday which is wonderful. They do end promptly at 10:00am.

The strong points of the hotel are the cleaning, the location and the fact that is is very trendy, very modern.On the other hand, reception is very small and it's full of people at the check-in time. Additionally, the room and bath was very very small

Good location, great breakfast with international kitchen, friendly people and clean hotel. Mobile phone in each room with internet connection was very helpful throughout the day. Clean and nice room but no room for storage which was a bit difficult with our backpacks. All in all a very nice stay.

This Hotel is near 3 MRT Station and there are 2-3 Malls nearby. The hotel bar serves good cocktails and the burger restaurant right next to is delicious and good. The lobby is on the second floor and the personal were friendly and helpful. Would book it anytime again

review_title: Good location and modern decoration. Pleasant stay
review_text: highly recommend the hotels for solo travellers.Good location - close to MRT stations and the national museum of Singapore. Convenient: easy to get food around.Great decorations: nice designsBreakfast buffet was nice.

We had a very small room. Not enough space to open both suitcases at the same time. And we had some trouble managing the air conditioning. But good shower. Nice breakfast. Nice stuff. Near to metro, so everything was good to reach.

One of best value for money hotel in Singapore. Conveniently located near 3 train stations and just a 20 minutes taxi ride from airport. The bar is lively with great wine food and cocktails although closing time of 11.30 Sunday to Thursday is a bit disappointing. Quick bites at 25 degrees burger and snack bar is highly recommended. Low point is staffing as Hotel was fairly full and my room was not cleaned for two days despite leaving the clean room sign for many hours. They did clean the room quickly after a complaint call.Nonetheless will return and still recommended to all.

Location is good (nearby the MRT station), room size is reasonable, nice buffet breakfast. Also the floor provide the ice, hot and cold water machine which is a nice arrangement since our room doesn't have mini bar

The Hotel's marketing is extremely good.  We booked this on what the website stated.. Unfortunately it was a massive disappointment.  i would classify the hotel as an overpriced backpackers.  The check in foyer is in a carpark.  Checking in were were greeted in the foyer (which is tiny) by about 6/7 people with backpacks on the ground sorting out their suitcases!   The room is extremely small - If you are travelling as a couple do not book this hotel.  The bed is not built for you taller persons and you feet will touch the wall.  The room is an over-sized capsule.  Breakfast is mayhem as expected with so many people and not much room.  We ended up foregoing the rest of our stay at Hotel G and checking into another hotel with normal sized rooms at the same price.  The website

The room is amazingly comfortable and clean. It maybe a bit on the small side, but I'm not bothered by that at all.The breakfast is fine and covers the essentials. And they have this big coffee machine and it ain't half bad.Definitely will stay with them again.

Room was incredibly small.  Not really suitable for older and larger size people. Difficulty getting into bed as one of us had to clamber over the other.  When in bed our heads touched one wall and feet the other wall. Believe these rooms are suitable for the younger, smaller people and not bigger European people.  The shuttle bus was only able to drop us off in the back street, so we entered by passing by the recycle bins and had to find out way up to reception, which was very small.

review_title: Not bad, good area, slightly overpriced
review_text: Central location, very close to Bugis market. Hidden hotel entrance/reception area. Good bed, small room, very small shower box and sink, not enough light for proper shaving. No drawers, few hungers only. No fridge un room. Staff - polite and helpful, with no much personal involvement. For arriving from Europe around 9am and check in immediately, I had to pay fully for that night although I was in the plane. Check in in most hotels is available since about 11am, so for 2 hours only I was expecting to be charged some part of the room price, but not full amount, or even not to be charged for couple of ours only. Such details make a difference for business travellers, in this case not particularly in favour of the hotel policy. True, they preferred getting the money and possibly

Staff is friendly and helpful. Room was very clean and stunning. Breakfast was very tasty and rich. Everyday they did cleaned the room. It is very near to all landmark places. Two MRT stations are located withing walking distance. Shopping malls and restaurants located within walking distance.

review_title: A convenient location with very good service
review_text: Friendly staff. The front desk was extremely helpful and always open for assistance even in the busy hours of the day. Secure handling and storage of luggage. Although we waited slightly longer than expected for our room, it was worth it as it was a cozy little space.I loved how the location made it so easy to get around the city without a hassle.

Good Hotel and friendly staff indeed. I only wish the rooms were bigger. Stayed in the good king room for 3 nights. The rooms are clean and the staff are very attentive and courteous. However, as previously mentioned, the rooms are rather small and if you are not happy in cramped places, you might struggle a bit. They do have larger rooms but not by much from what I have seen.

A well-located hotel with thoughtful, modern design flourishes across the rooms and common areas (though strangely: no drawers in the rooms!) Seemed rather busy when I was there, with frustrating crowding at reception and in the breakfast area, but this was a minor quibble.

I would like to introduce this hotel to people that are interested in going to Singapore.The hotel even provide a iPhone on your stay in Singapore!Not many hotel would do that.Once again I would like to introduce this hotel to people that are coming to Singapore for holiday.

I have a great staying experience, it's very nice hotel. The hotel locaition is very great, environment and near the metro station and ya kun breakfast totast. Only one weak point is room space too small.

There is a bar and cafe nearby hotel. They gave us free drink with non alcohol wine. We can walk to the mrt station. By5-7minute. And people also very nice. Especially I like a dream capture in my room. I want to stay again thank you again.

In general its a pleasant stay at your hotel and overall experiences is quite good.  Just some comments below :-1. insufficient staffing during peak breakfast period and thus longer waiting time for small requests like a cup for tea or coffee2. the lighting is a bit too dark in your gym room3. will be great if your hotel get a small  swimming pool

The room looks exactly as shown in the photos. It gave off a slight victorian feel. The bed was amazingly comfortable, the wifi and air conditioner were both working really good. There's no fridge but they have ice machines available on the floor. The only downside was probably that I could sometimes hear from next door or when people walk past the corridor but it wasn't such a big issue. The shower room's a little small but again, no biggy to me. They have a bar/restaurant on the first floor but I didn't get to try it. There's also a 24-hour coffee shop and 7-11 stores around the corner. I think the location's really good.

We were locked out of our room on the day of check out.  Check out being 1pm and apparently card does not let you in the room after 12pm.  Was such an inconvenience for us.  Suggestion to change it to 12.30pm?  I had to push inline to get out cards reinstated so we could pack!We stayed there for 3 nights - I asked the girl at counter whether we have room service, she said no.  Luckily a guy there caught up with me to let me know they do service the rooms.

Everything was perfect, the service, the cleanliness and the quality of the rooms. The breakfast was abundant and high quality. The hotel is near the metro station and 20 minutes by walking to the Marina Bay. Totally recommended.

2 guest stay in that room but Only 1set tooth brush was prepared for guest. I wasn't satisfied with the bathroom because  if bath too long time water will leak to outside. Bed sheet contain blood stain. Price this room was value.

We arrived at hotel G for a stay of 4 nights. Although the room is not to big for someone my height it was still a very nice decorated and clean room. The breakfast that was offered was wide in assortment and quality wise very good.The restaurant that is below the hotel called ginett has good food and nice wines for a good price.We had a pleasant stay and would recommend the hotel for sure

The Hotel is modern, clean and the staff is very friendly. These are very important criteria! the gym is also good. Maybe the air conditioning should be renew or  something, because it is very stuffy. All in all a very good stay. I will come back.

Service is good.But if you can provide twin bed will be better because sometime we have 2 people to share one good.You have pick up some music to automatic play and the song is quite well.But some time there will missing some tower or shampoo.

Perfect location, helpful staff, great rooms! 10/10Love the new bar and restaurant downstairs - definitely an upgrade from BIG hotel the elevators could be a bit quicker, however there's worse things that could happen.

Room is a bit small for the price but everything is provided and all new and tidy. Staff are incredibly friendly and helpful. Free mocktail coupon is nice but cocktail instead would be waaaaay nicer ;P Overall very good experience and I'll consider the same hotel for my next visit.

I really enjoyed my stay. Everything was taken care of very well. The rooms were nice and clean, and the staff were courteous. The food at the restaurant was great as well. I shall definitely recommend this hotel to my colleagues as well.

review_title: Ginnet restaurant = petit Alain Ducasse execution
review_text: I have stayed at the hotel several times. Indeed rooms are small but who spends time in the room while in Singapore? Excellent location and fast 20 min Grab ride to Changi. However, if you are particularly business traveler it has one of the best breakfast offerings in the town Cor the price. This is French crew run restaurant and I encourage you to try particularly mean from the menu. It is simple but sublime and molten chocolate cake is worth the wait. Book as after 7pm till 9pm it is has to get table only bar spot. If you are after European food at professional French execution level this is the place and you will not be paying Top dollar.

Third time staying here. Pros: Easy access About 45 minutes by MTR from airport to Bencoolen station taking downtown line. The room is clean, big and comfortable bed,  breakfast also pretty good. Toiletries with shampoo, conditioner, and body soap.  Cons: very tiny rooms. But the worst is the tiny sink, really tiny. After  you shower the floor will get all wet.  No closet.

good locality, very clean, great for solo traveler!!the front desk needs improvement in their service. wished they have complimentary car space for one day or a few hours.they have great selection of tv channels, i can catch up with the news from around the world (eg. CNN, BBC)

My favourite hotel in Southeast Asia! A very enjoyable 2 night stay here to explore Singapore. I booked the Good Queen Room (12m^2) and it was small, but after all, space is a premium in the city and i was travelling solo. The room was equipped with adequate storage space for my luggage and an in-room safe was provided for valuables.  The décor of the hotel has a hip vibe and is the kind of place I love!  Breakfast is wonderful (however very busy!) with a large range of Asian, Continental and cooked options. The breakfast here rivals the very best 5* hotels i have stayed in on my travels. Super impressive.  Within 30 minutes walk of Merlion Square (believe me, to get a good value hotel in Singapore, this is a short walk), Hotel G is perfectly poised to explore the city. The

The hotel is nice and very modern. The room was very fancy. You can reach almost any location in 30 minutes walking. The cleaness of the bathrom should be improved. The bad was short for the person taller than 186cm.

review_title: Nice hotel but could improve service !
review_text: Beautifully designed. nicely located !!! rooms are small but very comfortable.. but Jacob at the reception was not very welcoming when doing our checked in.. no smile, no eye contact, nothing. he took my deposit, i signed the bill and i was given my room key .... that's it !!! when arriving in the room, the room was clean except the toilet which was not cleaned !!! and we were two in a queen double room but all amenities were for one guest only. We did not felt very welcomed and awaited !!! but fortunately, when going back to the reception to ask to remedy, it was done very quickly.

review_title: Cool place where to stay in Singapore
review_text: Very nice hotel with cozy rooms, perfect for a few days stay in Singapore. Good location with some restaurants around and 2 tube stations very close to the hotel. Rooms are small but clean and functional.

I recently had the pleasure of staying in this hotel whilst working in Singapore.  The staff are super friendly and helpful, I want to give a special mention to Gabriel! He was so helpful and so friendly you just instantly warm to him. I didn't meet one staff member who didn't smile and say hello when walking around the hotel.  As for the rooms, they are very well kept and have regular cleaning done and have such comfortable beds!  Very easy to get around from the hotel as they are able to get a car within 5 mins on average sometimes less.  Also, I decided to extend my stay by a day and walked down at 2 am and they had it sorted that I could stay in the same room within 10 mins.  Would definitely stay here again.

review_title: Crizel will go out of his way to ensure you are Satisfied
review_text: Quite a funky little place with a great bar below. The rooms are quite small but didn’t really bother me. I was greeted by Crizel who was just incredible. I dropped my bags and ran off to a meeting. When I returned he ensured I had everything I needed and even though my bags were misplaced, he was quick to let me get to my room, find them and deliver them to me. It’s little things like this that make you appreciate what’s important and to write this review :) thanks Crizel

review_title: Not for travelers with very high expectations
review_text: I travel quite frequently to these parts of the world especially Singapore. Close friend recommended Hotel G for my next trip and i decided to check this hotel out as it was of very convenient distance to my place of meeting, the convention center at Suntec City. My first impression of the hotel was not impressive. It was not the sort of hotel that i expected, the lobby was small and tucked away somewhere on the 2nd floor and i was pretty confused. The room was pretty cozy,  and had a nice small premium inn sort of feeling, the ones you would find in the UK. The rooms are certainly not for people with too many bags or luggage due to space constraint so i wouldn't recommend someone with tons of bags checking into this hotel. There are no bath tubs or swimming pools so be

Good Breakfast, Clean Room, good location.TV could be bigger, but its quality id good. Staff is friendly and helpful.The water machine on my floor is not working, else it would have been great. Otherwise it has been a good experience.Don't think it is very child friendly

overall good hotel in good location... easy access to most of the city centre areas, courteous staff , good service but mattress are old and needs to be replaced as it made my backache worst... till then probably will not stay here

Clean room with very creative solutions to fitting everything necessary into a small space. Great comfortable bed, great rainfall shower, great airconditioning, mostly clean, and friendly staff. Centrally located very close to Bencoolen Metro station.

Room categories between "Great Room" and "Good Room" and photos not what it seems to be. Photo of Great Room is more spacious with space between bed and wall vs Good Room with no space between bed and wall. Booked a Great Room and found the room to be the same as Good Room with no space between bed and wall. Categories and photos is confusing and do not match.

The room decor is chic and modern. There’s a mobile phone acts as a computer to show you tourist info. Smart tv. But the air con is noisy from time to time when it operates. There’s a bar and restaurant and a gym in the hotel.

Everything was good.But let me kepo abit.There was a cute female receptionist besides Bernice, dont get me wrong,she cute too but the other one ha mik mia? 😉 if can say then say, if cannot say then nvm. Besides that, keep up the good service and standard at hotel G

Terrible service with unhelpful staffWas not getting late check-out. Was not allowed to borrow PC access for urgent case. Several staff members on duty but took forever to get helpI would like my money back

I like this boutique hotel located at bugis very close to subway station and restaurants are near by too. Hotel crew are friendly ( Thanks to all housekeeper to clean up my room, tumb up for you all ) and bed are comfortable. for sure I will be back^^

Have not been back to Singapore in 5 years. Surprised how hotel prices have increased from before and the room sizes decrease. This hotel however is easy on the eyes as well as the budget. It has a restaurant and bar on the ground floor which comes alive at night. The Bugis area is also refreshed and I loved walking around the area which had a nice vibe. MRT is also close by the hotel.

Room size is very tiny. No ventilation in the washroom, no exhaust fan even and just look at the washroom its almost a size of 3x3 feet.  Soo disappointed by the room size. And i booked GOOD KING SIZE ROOM. I am amazed how does even government passed this hotel with this much size room. I am having a stay of 3 nights and i am planning to go away tomorrow. Worthless room. Not at all good. So disappointed.

review_title: Nice idea, less than perfect implementation
review_text: My wife and I enjoyed some aspects of our stay at Hotel G, but there were some serious concerns as well.Positives;- Nice decor / overall design- 25 degrees makes an excellent burger- Breakfast buffet was good- room is nice- good central locationNegatives;- The shower alternated repeatedly between warm and boiling hot, my wife burned herself a few times before we figured out that there was a sound change when the cold water pressure dropped 2-3 seconds before the water became scalding - customer service, when I raised this issue with the front desk, the reaction was, 'oh ok' with no explanation or problem solving done.- poor bathroom design, shower stall has no lip to the rest of the bathroom which quickly becomes soakedOverall, I'd say it was a decent night's stay, not as nice

Countless stay in G Hotel. Mum love G Hotel because shes a vegetarian and easy access to every where as well as meals for her. Arrived at arnd 1am on 22 Aug due to a flight delayed in Hong Kong. Were travelling with old folks and we were worn out by then. Feeling so relief to finally reach the hotel but was treated badly by one of the male staff. There is 3 of us and was told that if we do not mind the tiny room, we are able to squeeze in as they do not have a room for 3. Later then, i was told that I am not allowed to do that!! Been staying here and you told me that I cant do that? Fine, I am renting another hotel which has family room then. What a regret but no choice.

We loved the hotel atmosphere, the rooms are very small but at the same time very cool! The breakfast is also good, with a lot of choices. If we have to go again to Singapore, this hotel would be our choice again.

AC/blowdryer/HDMI/TV all broke down at some point during my stay, cleaning lady walked in my room on a Sunday morning at 10... Staff was very friendly and helpful though. However it was just annoying that all the stuff simply didn't work.

great budget hotel with best location near rochor mrt, bencolen mrt and bugis mrt..comfy bedroom but the room is tiny for standard room but no prob since the hotel close to bugis market and halal food..

Rooms are pretty small but very arty place. Cool for short visits or perfect place backpackers who dont want dingy dirty hotels. Probably gotta come out with more but its worth it. Front office smooth checkout great service esp the super friendly luggage guy Gabriel who helped us with our very heavy bags!  Thank you!!!!

Awesome location, walking distance to malls and food. Hotel has a cool vibe and the 24h gym is great with water supply and towels and fruit. The  room was spacious but the bathroom is a little tight. There was a dripping noise in the day but became quiet enough for s good sleep at night.

We spent 4 days in Singapore. Hotel G was a very good deal for our stay. We choose the deluxe room, just a little bit bigger than the standard and was good enough for 2 people. Only the bathroom result not to much comfortable because the shower doesn’t have a door but just a simple curtain that let the water goes everywhere. Another thing :the sink is really to small for occidental standards. The breakfast is really good and a best way to start the day in a good mood. Very kind and helpful the staff!

review_title: Good place to rest in the middle of the city
review_text: Compact, clean rooms, nice amenities, clean toilet, friendly staff, located in a strategic place (near 3 MRT Station: Bugis, Bencoolen & Rochor), great acces to food vendor, very nice breakfast.I really enjoy the room atmosphere, the dreamcatcher is wonderful.

we booked a queen sized bed, naturally that means two people. there were only toiletries for one person.the first thing we saw when thinking of using the indoor slippers were the nicely labelled bags, but each of them had a price tag. that made us think, are these supposed to be free? are the contents free for use? turns out the bags were for sale, not the contents. very misleading.the washbasin is outside of the toilet (facing the room/hallway). it was the first time seeing it, and i think the design is poor. it's too easy to wet the corridor by accident, and some people prefer to shave/brush their teeth in the washroom, not outside of it.speaking of the bath/toilet, the door is a simple sliding door with no lock or a proper way to secure the door. if you're a couple who

review_title: Simple yet chic hotel in the heart of the city.
review_text: Hotel G is standing in a premium location,  at walking distance of places of interest, shopping malls, souvenirs, eateries and bus or trains. It can boast a very friendly and efficien staff, clean rooms and an awesome breakfast option. The rooms can feel a bit claustrophobic for a long stay but are neat.

I had an unpleasant experience while staying as a guest at your hotel. First of all, the check-in took too long before I was assigned a room. When the room was eventually assigned, I was shocked to see the size of the room (Room 0702). It barely fit my personal belongings. This was a far cry from the four star hotel that I was promised when I booked my reservation with expedia. I was just too exhausted and disappointed with my experience that I decided not to raise any fuss while I was a guest.

Towels smell bad, as though they have not been washed properly after previous use.Reception area cramped and claustrophobic especially at check-out time.Comfortable bed.Poor accessibility from street level.Should cross-check facilities advertised on booking.com since not all is present such as ironing facilities.Nice location.  Quiet room.

My husband and I were given room number 1328. I usually don’t share such details on TA but I would like to warn future guests of Hotel G to stay away from it. The moment we entered the room the smell of mould and dampness hit us quite hard. We thought this is due to the weather conditions in Singapore and my husband and I were too exhausted after a long flight so we just went to bed. Second thing was the size of the room - ridiculously small!!!      The next morning we woke up surprisingly tired, short-breathed and stiff. The AC btw was blowing directly towards our heads. After coming back to the room the next day after a walk in the city my husband noticed an appliance underneath the desk which turned out to be a dehumidifier. That was a clear sign the  room ventilation was not

I found no where to wash my clothes.We two persons lived in the room but only one bed,that is terrible.The hotel provided only one toiletries for us even though we called the receiption many times.The room space is too small ans so is the desk.

review_title: Good Hotel but can be better.
review_text: Overall the stay was good. I found other hotels like Hilton or Mercure much more better. Vegetarian options is very limited for breakfast. Lobby being on 2nd floor, one has to enter through the ground floor bar.

Love my room Love the locationLove the concept HoweverIt is the worse breakfast time I ever experiencedNot about the food Not about  the set upNot about there's only one coffee makerBut 2 very rude and inefficient waitresses.

Location very goods because long time I ever go to singapore not ever stay in this location this surprise more traveler and very goods for facility is full option from other hotel nearly but reception long time for waiting.

review_title: Modern and clean in central location
review_text: The hotel was easy to get to from the airport - 45 mins on the train and very close to Bencoolan station. The room was compact, but still enough room for two large suitcases. The room was clean and was cleaned daily. Check in and out was simple. The bar on site was reasonably priced. Easy to walk to get to most places by train or short taxi ride.

Good location close to Metro and close to Little India, which was an astounding good expeerience.       Rooms are (too) small.Ok service and breakfast.Entrance to the hotel is a little strange.A good solution in Singapore

review_title: Great Hotel at the city center
review_text: G hotel is a nice hotel in the city of singapore close to all important sightseeings.. also has a vey nice wine restaurant and a bistro with nice burgers! We had a dinner at the wine restaurant and the pasta was very nice and the wine also. We had launch at the bistro and the burger were delicious. Furthermore hotel provides a smartphone with 4g connection that is vey helpful in order to be connected to internet outside the hotel!!👍 Furthermore the staff was very helpful!

G hotel has a very good design, and the location is near the downtown line and circle line. The G logo is very large that we can see the logo from very far away. This logo makes us more easy to find the hotel. Also for people who bring lots of things, they have not only stairs but have a lift for them. I would like to stay in the hotel in the future.

My friend and I stayed in Hotel G for 4 days. Though the room was not very big, as long as we can open our luggage together, we think the room size is reasonable. We were mostly impressed by the accessibility of Hotel G! We would concider staying in Hotel G if we go to Singapore again.

Overall service is very good. Although the room is not as big as expected, it is clean and tidy. It's nice to have hot/cold water and ice cubes provided on each floor but I couldn't get ice cubes after 11:00pm. The washing basin is a little bit small and water flow is too slow so it requires quite long time for face washing the teeth brushing especially for women. The location of the hotel is excellent that you in the middle of different MRT lines.

Good service,  thank you very much for helping me about money change (finally i can pay my taxi fare) 😁. Next time please serve more various food for breakfast.  However the pasta was good and orange juice was fresh

Stayed there 2 days for business trip, requested slipper and toiletries since morning, but the staff didnt send. Called twice to reception on this issue, reception said that the colleague was on the way to our room, but till the next day i checked out also dont have.

The room is very small. We had toiletries only for one person althought the room was for two guests. Besides that the room was very clean and the staff was helpful. The location is good. A bit hard for drivers to find the lobby of the hotel cause it's located on the 2nd floor of a parking lot.
travel_type: Trip type: Travelled as a couple

review_text: The room quite small but good set up,, Good smell in hotel, near MRT Bencoolen Station easy to go anywhere, Everthing is very good. Just only the breakfast is not so good for me. I will recommend to other people to stay here.

The place seems hip and groovy but the rooms are small as well as the beds. Lucky it was just me and not my wife too. The room needed another shelf for storage. Location is good as its close to the MRT, Hawker markets bugis markets and shopping.

I felt cheated and stolen because the room they assigned me did not have the features that were indicated in the booking site reservation, even complaining they confirmed that those features did not match the truth.At the check in they take money from our credit card as a guarantee as if the customer are dishonest or thieves, even after we have already paid the entire reservation.I booked a King room with a view over the city and they gave me a room that looked like a small coffin with view to a terrace, I do not like liars. In my country this is not a hotel but a hostal, a good one but a hostal, so I do not recommend to anyone unless you like of being robbed.

After staying with the Hotel G group in USA and HK I’m shocked by the level of service from Singapore without even arriving yet!

I made reservation 3 months ahead of the check-in date, immediately after I contacted the hotel to request a change and this was denied.

I understand the booking wasn’t modifiable, however I’ve never dealt with such a unhelpful reservation dept. Especially as requested the date change immediately after booking, due to a simple mistake.

Disappointed and not looking forward to staying.

What I liked : we get a room even if we were here early (noon) , the room was really top (decoration, bed, convenient), the hotel is in a quiet location, near mrt, near university, very good location What I didn t like : the reception is at 2nd floor so you need to climb little steps with your luggage, no one to help and welcome you  downstairs. It s not normal to have to enter in a bar to climb, then take the elevator to go to the main reception !!
travel_type: Trip type: Travelled as a couple

review_text: This hotel definitely I will come back again. As it was clean and comfortable bed. I didn't took the breakfast so I can't comment on it. The room is small but you really hard to heard other room noise at all. One thing which need to improve is.they help you auto check out at 12pm even you haven't real check out, maybe you need to tell them when you check in if want late check out a little bit late.

Nice, clean and very good location, friendly staff, lots of food stall around, very close to bencollen MRT Station. Bugis Junction is just around the corner, very convinient place to stay. Highly recomended.

I was upgraded to a ‘Great’ room and loved it! The bed was lovely and big and there was loads of space in the room.I loved all the little touches like the robes and slippers and the lovely toiletries. The rainfall shower was amazing.For the price I would like there to be an included breakfast but I think hotels in Singapore generally don’t come cheap.

The room is stylish and cool. I am glad that you have all the necessary items. However, I think that it is better to improve not to dry as watching the mirror because the number of power outlets is small and the cable of the hairdryer is short.

Had a very short stay, only for a transit. I really enjoyed it for the value it offers. The room is smal and compact, but they make it less claustrophobic. Which was good! The staff was friendly and helpful. Just maybe a caution to the taxi drivers, as the drive up was very narrow and tight.

I had the opportunity to visit Singapore again in July and stayed in this hotel. I must say that it was a really nice experience.  PROS:  -The hotel has a minimalist approach to it’s hotel room design. No unnecessary fixtures like most of the modern hotels have, which I like better. -Very nice location. Along Middle St. in the shopping district of Bugis. -Great wifi service. Fast and reliable. -Decent breakfast. Mind you, no pork in any of food in buffet. -Concierge is very helpful especially when we needed to have some bulk printed documents done. They accommodated it without hassle -Has bar and restaurant at the lowest floor. -Has hawker places available 24/7 beside the hotel for cheap eats -Hot and cold showers availability -Easy to go around as public transportations are

Its on the mid level range but you will not regret booking as you will get what you pay for. If you can afford $120 a night, sure, go for it! Bencoolen MRT station is just minutes away so transportation will not be an issue.

Good hotel located in downtown Singapore, close to Bencoolen, Bras Basah and also Dhobi Ghaut metro stations. It's ideal when you want to explore the city. Good breakfast, convenient taxi drop-off at 2nd level just aside the reception (but some taxi drivers pretend they don't know), 3-storey parking with plenty of space if you are coming by car and 2 restaurants into the venue. Many other restaurants are nearby at walking distance. Recommendable.

Cool vibe, lovely bar and cosy room. Book it just to get our mind off work and it sure helped. My partner loved it since she slept the whole way through and only woke up at midnight. This doesn't usually happen :D

review_title: Clean and Well Located Hotel In Singapore
review_text: I have stayed at this hotel before, when it was called BIG hotel. It is now called Hotel G and appears to have had a complete remodel. The current layout is more accommodating to business guests, as the room I am in has a spacious desk to work at (A Great King Room). There was a glitch upon checking in, as the first room that I was assigned seemed extremely small for this particular room category. It was a corner room at the end of a corridor. When I questioned this, I was shown another option in the same room type, and what a difference. Room appears to be about three times larger. Not sure why the hotel would put the two rooms in the same category (1328 and 817) but the manager assured me they were a similar size. Optical illusion maybe?  That aside, the room has everything

Excellent location. Spotless rooms. Terrific breakfast menu, range and quality. Nothing was too much trouble for the reception staff, and the bar staff extremely welcoming and pointed us in the right direction to make the most of our visit. I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

While the rooms in this hotel are not very big, what they lack in space they make up for with comfort and friendly service. The bed is large and comfortable (but it's pushed up against three walls, so you can only climb in from one side, so for couples one of them will be in the hotel equivalent of a window seat), and the bathroom is efficient (though it has one of those translucent glass walls between the shower and the bedroom, letting light in that would disturb someone still trying to sleep while someone else is showering). These minor quirks aside, I would stay here again since it's very conveniently located and the price is right.

The staff here are extremely polite and friendly! They managed to get us in a room early, and let us check out late although they had no obligation to do so. The rooms are quite, small but comfortable. Not ideal for a family, but for couples or individuals you will be perfectly fine. The beds are comfy and the showers have good pressure. There is no fridge in the rooms, and no cots available if your travelling with a baby or toddler so you’d need to bring your own portacot. The buffet breakfast is $13 if you preorder the day before, I’ve had better but you will be filled up. It’s very hard to find anywhere nearby that is open for breakfast that’s cheaper since most places open late. There is disabled access. The location is great, there are museums, restaurants and shops nearby.

Hotel G has an absolutely bizarre layout and entry. The check in process is also not as efficient as it could be. They collect $50 Singapore dollar deposit for every night you stay. So if you stay 5 nights be ready to pay them $250. I don’t like that. The room itself is small but comfy. This should be a 3 Star review but because the staff is nice I will give it 4 Stars. The check in process is flawed for sure!

We went for our honeymoon, no detail from the hotel in that regard. Otherwise the hotel is clean, very well appointed, but in the general treatment very low.I think there are other hotels in the same location that may have better conditions for a similar price

This would be my second time staying at Hotel G. Won’t be the last for sure. The room was good. Just wish the room comes with a mini fridge. Hotel staff was kind and helpful. Checking in and out was a breeze too.

Great hotel, central location, you can walk to all the interesting places, clean quit rooms, nice winebar with delicious food. Breakfast is ok. Staff very friendly and helpfull. I will come back in this hotel when I visit Singapore!

review_title: Average but funky and chic hotel
review_text: Booked a solo stay in the single room. room is small but compact. Love the decor and the funky design of the room with interesting display of key information displayed in a creative manner on the bulletin board. Love the well-utilised work desk. The only downside of this hotel is that there is no fridge in the room. so it is difficult if you want buy and store cold drinks or food.   Breakfast at Ginett Restaurant was filling though choices are rather limited. The bread and pastry section is pretty decent. Ambiance at the restaurant is lovely.

The counter service is commendable but several issues brought the rating down. 1) restaurant for breakfast was too crowded and no proper organisation from the staff. 2) parking is payable. How many people drive to stay there? Can't the hotel compliment the parking charges?

review_title: Very convenient hotel with comfortable rooms (though not without quirks)
review_text: Let's start with the good (and there's a lot): the price is reasonable, the location is excellent (with two metro stations an easy walk away, along with a very good hawker centre, plenty of restaurants, and several interesting neighbourhoods), and the staff are very helpful and friendly. The rooms are clean, too, which is a plus. Of course they are not big--at this price in Singapore you know the rooms will be on the small side--but that's OK, especially since they are well thought out.   The things that annoyed me about the hotel are mostly design-related, and are not unique to this establishment. Perhaps also most people like these things, and I'm an outlier. But the way they put a glass wall between the bathroom area and bed area means that if you wake up earlier than your

Lovely Hotel, Perfect for a quick stay. The room is well maintained, very stylish and clean. The Hotel staffs are very proffesisional, attentive and helpful.  Checking in was very fast.. this means alot for people checking in late at night, tired and hungry😉. Great location as its just a few minutes walk from Bugis Junction etc. Food will not be an issue even late at night. The breakfast buffet on the otherhand is just ok.   We noticed alot of guest would leave there luggages/stuffs for awhile with the concierge for safekeeping after checking out as its very safe. Its a good thing for people who have late flights and would still like to spend some time to stroll around before going to the airport.  Overall we had a very pleasant stay. Would highly recommend to friends and

We  booked two rooms from 21 July to 27 July 2018 and the hotel changes were prepaid.  When we checked in we were charged a deposit of $300.00 and the money was taken from the account on that day.  We checked out around 8:00 pm on 26 July and we were informed that there were no additional charges and the deposit will be refunded to the credit card and it would take about 10 days.  As we haven't  received the refund we made a call to the hotel around 8:00 pm on 9 August 2018 and spoke to a gentleman who advised that the processing of refund to overseas bank takes up to 4 weeks and we were asked to wait for another 2 weeks.  I queried him that they took the money from overseas account straight away but to process the refund would take 4 weeks.  He asked us to wait for another 2

review_title: Unless you live out of a soft bag, don’t bother
review_text: Ok so I accept that hotels are changing to suit the younger wealthier travellers from around the world but I have to say that this is 3 steps too far!   Since when does a hotel room NOT have a wardrobe or drawers or shelves to place or hang clothes? Since when does a hotel NOT have a fridge, it only needs to be a very small one but in the room all the same. Let’s put feathers on a useless ceiling light and make it so in order to close the blinds or curtains you have to climb over the bed! Take a shower? Oh yes you can but the cubicle is one end of a toilet/shower combo unit! A shower with not enough fall on the floor which means water then flows out to soak the shower mat or turn your toilet into a water feature! The shower curtain is also a real pleasure to fight with while

I had a good trip with Hoter G .It was clean and tidy enough. Its location is convenent.The hotel staff showed great hospitality. one suggestion is .it will be better if the bed has both two side to get in/off

The pros were that the breakfast was great! It was very clean. As building and as rooms were designed minimal which we liked. Also, it had a great bar restaurant at the entrance. On the other hand there were a lot of cons! The room was tiny!! Honestly, it was almost 12m2. There was only a tiny window which was not opening, as a result there was no fresh air in the room! Also, there was no fridge in the room. The provided hygiene items were only for one person and not 2, while we had declared we were on our honeymoon. The location is not bad, but not good too... it is located near to sin lim square and indian and arabic area. If i come back, there is not a chance to stay here again!

review_title: Would love to stay here again!
review_text: Location is near bugis shopping area and the train station. Rooms are comfortable and clean. The design of the hotel makes it fun to stay in. There's also a bar/resto on the ground floor. The staff are friendly and helpful too!:)

like sleeping in a caravan !!!!! my feet touched the wall and I am only 157CM  tall !!!!! No kettle to make a cup of tea,, only thermos that you must go to the end of the corridor fill it up with hot water and take back to your room !!! Not exactly what I want to spend my money on , A Caravan Room !!!!!!!

Great location and place. Nice Boutique hotel with accessibility to the train and restaurants. Rooms are a bit small, but new and if you are only on business will work out well. But they may be cramped for some people. They also provide a local phone for you to use during your stay which helped tremendously.

review_title: Stylish and hip hotel in a very good location
review_text: I like this hotel a lot with its hip and stylish interior. It’s kind of like citizen M type of hotel and to be honest, it’s more suitable for couples on leisure trips or alone on business trip as I’m not sure if twin beds are available. It’s not the typical family friend type hotel and you need walking a few steps to get access to the lift, there’s a connecting lift though so not really a problem if u have a pram or wheelchair.The room is not big but its cozy enough to provide everything I need as I don’t need a refrigerator or kettle.  The location is great and my local friends offer the same comment, very easy to get to the city Centre, a few big malls are in walking distance. 8 minutes away from the national museum and 5 minutes to the national design Centre. Surrounded by

Although room is rather small but reasonably comfortable n clean. Good location for shopping, eating n it's only about 10 mins walk to nearest mrt station. Good breakfast choices too. Another good point is free usage of hp.

Great stay and facilities, very friendly and helpful staff! We really enjoyed how close the hotel was to 2 local metro stations, they were only a 5 minutes walk away and very easy to access and use.  Really enjoyed our stay at hotel g!

The place is near Bencoolen MRT, very convenient. The interior is cute, my room was clean and pretty. I like the shower; it works really well. The handsoap smells really good, I like how they manage to package every little thing with simple and cute looks. Sufficient space and circulation for 2 people in 1 room. The staffs are helpful. I’ll come back for sure. :)

We are all praises for Hotel G, except maybe one or two things. Room service didn't clean the room or at least make the beds when we put the sign out, although there was clear indication they came in to open the curtains. We were not too fussed because it was a short stay but would have been nice to come back to a made bed. Also very superficial point but the TV could be lower, just a suggestion. Otherwise, full points! 3 different MRT lines within 10 minute walk was so convenient. Breakfast was excellent!

Hotel is located very near Bencoolen Station and you can walk to Bugis very easy. The room is good and size is okay for me. But I don't know why the air con always switch to low fan in late night. By the way I still like the hotel.

review_title: Clean, New Rooms, Location Near MRT
review_text: Great location, just a few minutes walk from Bencoolen MRT station. Rooms are small but clean.  Ideal for 2 persons only with small baggages.  There is a water dispenser in the hall so this helps as well.  Breakfast is ok for the price SGD 17.  Has a handyphone that you can take with you, no hotspot though so you will have to stick to using the handset.  Great overall experience

I enjoyed my stay so much. The Hotel is located walking distance to Bugis area. The room was excellent and clean. The staff very nice and helpful. Unfortunately haven't got time to enjoy Hotel facilities as I was there for business trip. Will sure be back together with my Family soon.

The room was rather small but very stylish and comfortable room with quality Serta mattress. Bathroom was rather smaller. Found few hairs leftover by previous guest. Housekeeping needs pay more attention.    Handy phone charging took very long time (whole night not even 100%). Hotel located in good location, less than 10mins can reach few MRT stations. IPTV was awesome. Quality amenities and towel. Breakfast can be improved. Elevator was slow. No refrigerator. Love the Coway water dispenser. Overall was a good stay.

I like the hotel's room design. Clean, comfort and you have all the basic amenities. As a business traveller, Iron is very important. Eventhough they do not have it in the room, the house keeping delivered it within 10 minutes after my request.   Only 1 comment: -  Long Q during check out. With small size of lobby, it look messy. It would be good if staff  could advise the guest upon check in on the express check out facilities available. (I see the express check out box in front of the lift)   Overall, it's with good bed, good location, good amenities and good price.

The hotel is beyond my expectation. Location is perfect at Middle Road Bugis, walking distance to major malls, MRT stations, hawker centres, and attractions. Hotel ID is trendy and chic, mostly all basic amenities are included in the room. The in-room cell phone provided to all guests, free local calls and international calls for selected countries, less hassle for guest like me without subscribe roaming.

Located in a beautiful street, Bugis shopping center near MRT, it should be a really good choice for you to stay in Singapore. Unless the room is quite small (as one I stayed), all the things were perfect. I love the way hotel serve ice cube so that I had really really good taste of cooled tea.

The hotel itself is amazing, room is so clean and nice interior. Location is perfect, near bus stops and mrt. Near tourist spots like bugis and haji  lane. Accesible to all kinds of transpo. Lots of restqurants nearby.

Hotel located in good location, less than 10min walk to Bugis. The lobby entrance is slightly confused. From G floor, you have to walk pass a bar restaurant to level 1, take lift to level 2 where reception located. Compliment to Front Office for their service.  Breakfast can be improved. No plate on serving table, has to request.  Room is good for solo travellers & design is unique, modern with classic touch. Well, may consider to return one day.

Absolutely faultless.. warm and obliging staff..we had the Great Room with Balcony..superb.Spacious for 2 with large suitcases and extra bags..King size bed so comfortable.Showerhead was the size of a large dinner plate..we will be back !

The room was not so big but very clear and comfortable. The staff is very kind and helpful and the intercontinental breakfast amazing. Perfect connection with all the city areas by bus and metro. Very suggested!

review_title: Convenient hotel for short biz trip
review_text: stayed here before & love the much wider F&B options now - amazing breakfast though space is a bit limited & if hotel full can be some queues on coffee/ egg station. Rooms are good (i stayed on upper floor), bed very cozy & good shower (though water is leaking to the toilet area, should improve the drainage solution). Overall, great location for biz trip/ short stay in SIN.

This boutique hotel is very chic but the rooms are a bit small. Location is good, close to Bugis Junction where you can find local food and small shops for shopping. The hotel lobby bar is fantastic and has a good vibe.

Bathroom was way too tight.  Room was tight too with no place to relax other than on bed.   No refrigerator, cannot boil water...  Elevator was slow, taking too long to wait.  Breakfast, so so.  Other than the space, room has nice atmosphere.   Overall maybe cost effective, but my impression was a bit too small room for overseas business trip.

My wife and I loved our stay at 'G'. The Staff were so welcoming and very helpful. Highly recommend staying here. Gym was great and good location! The bed was super comfy. The only small down side was there was not much space to put our packs, but if you have suit cases you would be fine!

The hotel locatin is very nice place, and I also enjoyed various breakfast.  Hotel's room also good enough for me, it's clean and functional. The correspondence of the staff is also very good. I wana stay this hotel whenever I make trip to Singapore.

overall the experience was fine. The place was very small but well designed. I found that the Caucasians got rooms on higher level, it could be a coincidence though. The location was good, it was close to two different train stations. restaurants open 24 hours near by.

review_title: Water Machine and Shower Are Broken
review_text: I have stayed for 5 nights on the 8th floor, and during my stay the water machine outside my room is out of order.  Also, the room seems a bit old, I can literally see the wall paper not holding firmly to the wall.  Also, the shower is broken.  I used to be a customer to the BIG Hotel (I stayed there for at least 3 times), and I remember BIG Hotel used to offer free movies stream on demand.  I hope Hotel G would do the same thing.

Despite lower accommodation  fee, everything OK including location. Comparing to a hotel in which my friends stayed, Hotel G was as good as it, even though its fee was about twice.Since the hotel is connected with Chinatown mrt station, it is convenient when raining. However, a guest of Hotel G can reach two mrt stations of Bencoolen and Rocher on foot. Bencoolen is 150m far from the hotel. One problem is the restaurant for breakfast consists of two floors. Therefor guests must walk up and down to serve foods.

I stayed here for one night and was very pleased with the quality of room and services. The rooms are compact (typical for Singapore) but they have made extremely clever use of space to fit in a work space, bathroom, wash basin and bed.   Check in was easy and they include little extras like a welcome drink and a smart phone that you can take out around Singapore with you, with maps, city guides and travel tips, so you don’t have to use your own data. The room was contemporary and clean with a wet room style bathroom and old quality toiletries. The wall mounted TV greeted me on arrival with music and a welcome message, again indicating the cool, modern vibe to this place.   I slept well in the comfortable beds and the room had the usual slippers, hairdryer, safe, phone, hangers,

I stayed 1 night from 14 to 15 July 2018 to celebrate my one-year anniversary. Many thanks to Alex for assisting me to surprise my partner with the room decoration (see picture) and the bouquet of flowers.  The service provided by the hotel staff was fast, lively and cheerful. Special mentions to Sihui and Jacob who checked me in and out of the hotel.  My partner and I had our lunch at 25 Degrees, a Burger Bar at Level 1. The service was okay but the food was brilliant. A must-try for everyone staying with Hotel G! :)  Overall, an affordable hotel that provides great value for couples looking for staycations or anniversary celebrations.

I love Hotel G Singapore and will go back again future , smell very good , very clean especially shampoo and condition lemon is very very good , quiet and sleep well ! Quality good more then price , all receivtion are very nice smile and introduce for Travel in Singapore

What I Love About This Hotel :  1 - Unique Designer Feel 2 - Room Are Consider Good Enough For A Condence City Like Singapore 3 - Great Location, 2 Mins Away From Bencoolen Mrt, 2 Mins Away From Convenient Store & Food Store Around. 4 - There Is A Free Mobile Phone For You To Bring Around As Guides, Pretty Cool! 5 - WIFI is Fast!   What Is Acceptable & Need To Be Improve :  1 - Cleanness Of The Toilet, There Are Still Black Stain Around Corner Of Toilet 2 - Lift Speed Is A Bit Slow Sometimes, Especially During Check Out & Check In Time  What Is Not Acceptable :  The Breakfast Is Havoc, Table Not Cleaned, Food Selection Is Rather Not Enough For The Price We Have Paid. Waiter Seems Tired Of Working, Unknown Reason Why.   Tips & Advice :  1 - Taxi / Pick Up Is At Level 2, A Small

review_title: Great Hotel and Great Location.  Would definitely stay here again.
review_text: Great Hotel with a wonderful modern touch.  Location was fantastic, as it is so close to the MRT and all the buses that can get you all across Singapore.  Breakfast too was exceptional and there were so many varieties of food to choose from.  I would definitely stay at this Hotel again during my next trip to Singapore.

Hotel G is a good base to explore Singapore. There are a lot of facilities nearby and the MRT stop is just a 5 min walk.  The ‘Handy’ provided by Hotel G was great since it helped us a lot on our first proper visit to Singapore. The mobile phone has unlimited data which is great.  On the downside the rooms are fairly small... despite only having two bags... Also, we did not know how to boil water to make a cup of tea - very unclear. At breakfast there is not a lot of choice for vegetarians since practically all the warm meals are meaty. In addition, there was not any bread left after 9 am which was very disappointing.  It is also quite difficult not to flood the bathroom without putting down a towel. This problem could probably be solved.   The beds are extremely comfortable!!

Really unassuming gem close to Bugis Street and a subway station on one of the main lines. Rooms are very compact but have everything you need. Very groovy interiors as well. Pleasantly exceeded expectations.

The service is unexpected, as I got a package delivery came earlier than arranged time & I have yet check-in. And your staff, Wallace Eng, offered to help me charge to my card via verifications and email approval as I am not ready to go over yet. It’s excellent service! And great initiative! The room is nice, cosy. Just that the breakfast buffet has limited choices. Other than that the rest is awesome!

It is a cheap and good hotel. It is close to Suntec and Little India is also within walking distance. The disadvantage is that it is a little bit narrow but the breakfast is good enough to enjoy. What a cooool....

Love the well decorated room and the dreamcatcher chandelier. Although it's a bit tiny, but definitely cozy stay for two!  Hot water dispenser available at the corridor. Breakfast was affordable with a good spread of food.
