We booked 3 rooms for 4 nights at Hotel G. The best part of the hotel is its location. There are multiple MRT and bus stations just few minutes walk away from the hotel. You can reach any of the popular tourist attractions in Singapore within 30 mins by public transport. The hotel is well maintained and new. However, the worse part of the hotel is its compactness. That is the trade-off that you would make for choosing a central location. Even with a room upgrade, the rooms are very small with barely any place to walk, keep your luggage, or store your things. The rooms amenities are excellent and the beds are super comfy. Some of the front desk staff are very friendly and helpful and we even got complimentary wine because it was my wedding. However, there were other staff who

I enjoyed the friendly service and clean environment.  Room is bit small but good enough for short stay.  Location is good but need to take lift from restaurant entrances which is not convenient.  Breakfast is not fancy with various offers but good enough as well.

G Hotel is pretty much near the central area of Singapore where you can visit the museum across the street, the night clubs a few junction away and the shopping district just right around the corner. For tech savvy, Sim Lim Square offers most of the techies which is located just behind the hotel.  Anyways, first of, the reception area is on the 2nd floor, so if you are travelling by vehicle, the carpark entrance is at the back of the building. Everything about this hotel is compact- from the room, to the gym, and even the reception area. Though the ambience is pretty relax and comfy. It does have a cozy-up kinda feel. There isnt much movement you can do in the room coz the space in between fit for just two people at most. The service was pretty fast and the staffs are pretty

Best hotel suited to my needs of a break from part time studies and work together with my bday and 5th anniversary with fiance plus a stone throw away for my night class as well as near town and bugis for shopping and food

Was quite excited about staying here as I read good reviews and photos are nice.  Also since it is near Bugis then its good. When we reached the hotel, we liked the bar and burger restaurant that first greet us. Its cool and surely the ambiance at night is nice -we weren't disappointed. It's bustling at night with lots of locals and expat. The room we have booked is rather small for 2 pax considering we only got 1 luggage bag each, when layed on the floor there isn't much walking space for both of us. I also didn't like the fact being the wash basin outside the bathroom. Also, the bathroom needs deep cleaning though, the shower curtain needs washing.  When we checked in and for 2nights that my booking was made from Agoda, the tv displays the name of previous guest.  Only changed

I stayed in G Hotel after making a booking from the impressive photos and all.  Didnt quite like the entrance how it didn't display much of the direction/signages to the lobby. The room was alright but could hear people outside quite loudly. Room was decored with some dream catcher thing on top of the bed. That was to me unnecessary cus it is inappropriate given that Latin Americans have a huge significance for it and has some extra spiritual meaning to it which should be avoided given that it is a hotel for all different kinds of travellers with different spiritual and religion backgrounds. Room smelled of cigarette smell as well, not strong but not all that impressive. Generally woudn't go back there again. And yea, saw a couple of lashes on my sheets before sleeping on it

review_title: Very small room, comfortable bed - over all good value for money
review_text: I stayed at Hotel G in early July as I had a 1 night layover in Singapore on my way from Europe to Australia. Because I knew I'd only need a place to crash for one night, Hotel G seemed like a good option based on its location, gym facility and reviews on Tripadvisor. I booked the cheapest room they are offering and therefore I knew, the room wouldn't be big. But it was so tiny, I couldn't even open my suitcase - and I was traveling with 2 big suitcases plus a carry-on.... So I struggled a bit and had to shuffle around a lot.  The shower was in the same "box" as the toilet, so for instance toilet paper had to be removed before taking a shower.  That being said, these are the only complaints I have. Hotel G was clean, the staff was friendly, the hotel was accessible 24 hours and

We went with the Greater Room King and it was spacious and clean, though it could use some sunlight. Housekeeping was very efficient and the room was always in tip top shape. Hotel G is centrally located and has the convenience of having a bar and cafe at the hotel. We had dinner and drinks at Ginette. The food was okay, and the bartenders forgot our orders a few times. We didn't do the breakfast buffet (SGD 15), since there were lots of good and cheaper options just outside the hotel.   Overall a good stay, and I would go back!

Good location near Bencoolen, Bugis and Rocher MRT and easy to get to by airport shuttle.   The hotel was clean and comfortable with a minimalist modern feel with adequate facilities for our short stay. Tea and coffee making facilities were available in room, no fridge, however,  hot and cold water  and ice was available from a dispenser situated on each floor.Excellent Wi-fi, in room mobile phone with access to free data for the period of our stay, thought this was a wonderful idea, giving us free access to sightseeing and making reservations.   The hotel bar and restaurant were a hive of activity in the evenings. Breakfast was included in our package and this was adequate for all taste buds.   We found the staff to be helpful and friendly.  Downside -   Breakfast staff found

review_title: Price okay but quality so so
review_text: We got a corner room which the counter said that it has a bigger bed (queen to king size). However, the room design was weird and humid. No ventilation in the bathroom and all the humidity pours out from he bath room to the bedroom. There’s a triangular soft mattress at the corner which was not that clean. Other than that, it was fine.

Well located hotel for the Suntec City conference centre. My room was on the 9th floor, there are 3 lifts to get you up to your floor. I think the room was designed to utilise every centimetre of space in the room design. The room

Excellent location, minutes away from train station. Good clean rooms with practical layout. Fast wifi and friendly staff. Breakfast included has lots of options. Burgis mall and street market close by.

review_title: Hotel G for  a Good stay
review_text: The rooms were clean and staff were friendly. Very convenient location near food stalls and pubs. Check out the wine bar and burger joint in the building. Near MRT stop as well. Rooms are a tad small but, functional..

Location is good Staff are friendly Breakfast is fantastic Room is small but sufficient for short business stay Amenity as shampoo etc. are sufficient If water heater was inside room, it would be much better

Breakfast was a little odd. Great choice and price. Constantly running out of meal plates, and side plates for breads. then when plates did appear, they'd be put in one place, rather than the 3 places where food is served. I was there for 4 mornings, each day was the same with customers being confused and annoyed. Also, at 10am when the buffet was finished, the food was cleared away with incredible speed. It seemed as though staff moved faster at pack down time than any time during service. Even the omelette maker stopped cooking at 10, there were still 3 people waiting for an omelette. They didn't get one. Reception team and housekeeping staff were friendly and happy. I loved my room. The small size and layout were a bit quirky, but was great and clean. Location was excellent

Requested Early CHeck-in but had to wait for more than 4 hours before room was ready. Staff were nice but the whole experience just didn't make me comfortable. Room was as expected. Must respond to emails properly.

review_title: Great hotel in an excellent location
review_text: We stayed here for 4 nights while on a trip to Singapore. The location was ideal and the facilities are second to none. The bar downstairs in the hotel is really cool and great value for money, we even ate there one night and it was delicious. The hotel itself has quite a modern and new feel. We stayed in a ‘good’ room which is very small but ideal as we spent most of the day outside exploring.

review_title: Great little hotel and fantastic value for money
review_text: Efficient in every way, friendly service even under pressure, fantastic breakfast and comfy spotless room.  Cheap for pricy Singapore and location convenient. They printed off my boarding passes and gave tourist advice that was very useful.

Stylish hotel located in Bugis, which is the city center. For Singaporean Standards room was a right size, for European standards room was very small. However, when you do your research, you realize all the rooms are small. For a 4 star hotel, they are lacing pool and room service. ( It’s so weird not to have room service in a hotel 🙈 ) That’s why I’m giving a four-star review. The gym is tiny, and a proper workout cannot be done. Everything else was great. The room was spotless and the staff friendly.

Good location, very clean and cosy apartament with separated bathroom and TV (movie channels available in English). Restaurant services value good and drinks, prices are rather high (in comparision with European ones).

Room is extremely tiny. The bathroom is also very, very tiny. The sink, which is weirdly situated outside the bathroom is also tiny.  More cleaning in the shower could have made the stay more pleasant too.

Good location, friendly staff. Restaurants available downstairs which are good. Range of food for breakfast.  Hotel was quick to email and gave advice on best way to get there from the hotel.   Hot and cold water available in the corridor

nice design and compact and comfortable and very near to sim lim! had a very pleasant stay and compact room.i wanted to buy electronic stuff at Sim Lim and the actual location of the hotel is about 200 meters away from sim lim square.awesome!

Free handphone service helped me to take good sightseeing. That phone helped me to take a reservation of afternoon tea at hotel.  The room is good,but not so large. For my one-day-stay, it is enough to stay.

The room was clean, bed was comfy and the bathroom amenities were great. Wi-fi was fast and easy to access. The only disappointment was no room service. There were 2 great restaurants downstairs from where you could pick up food but unfortunately can't get it delivered :(

Nice food served below the hotel at Ginett. Towels and bed linen were spotlessly clean. Strong shower, lovely toiletries, powerful aircon. Pillows were too soft for my liking though.  Location wise, it’s walking distance to bugis junction, bugis+, rochor mrt station and bencoolen mrt station.  Avoid bringing huge sized luggages as the floor area is really tight, literally. Similar to tiny house arrangement things are all within reach. My 3 yo staying with us with no problem though. Price might be a little high for its size.

Overall we had a pleasant stay during the trip. However the sound proof system is actually quite low as we can still hear people walking along the corridor and noises from room beside. The location is excellent as mrt station is just a 3 mins walking distance. Definitely worth the value.

review_title: Excellent location and comfortable place for business trips
review_text: Excellent place to sleep when on a business trip to Singapore and you don't want to stay in just another boring hotel. I had a room on the 6th floor, with cozy relaxed atmosphere and all the basics you need: good bed and bathroom and a small table to work at. The hotel is just a few minutes from Bencoolen and Bugis MRT stations. Breakfast is good and diverse and if you wish you can make tea yourself in your room. I haven't been to the bar downstairs, but the atmosphere was good. My only comment would be to replace the teas daily :-).

review_title: Very good place and enjoyed the service by the bar,
review_text: The hotel room is small and the fact that there wardrobe is open and makes the room look untidy The air conditioner was not working properly so it was cold in the room   The staff is very friendly and make you feel welcome

Upon arrival we were confused as to where the reception was. Would be great if there could be some sign other than the tiny fonts on the lift buttons.   The room was cozy, well-lighted. I love how the walls were not painted with usual white. But instead that bluish-green was a nice colour combination to the wooden furniture. My partner was so amazed by the dream catcher light, it was really mesmerising the more we laid on the bed staring at it.   The location of the hotel is by far the best I've experienced. It is walking distance from Bugis, Bras Basar, Bencoolen, Cityhall and Dhoby Ghaut MRT station. Could maybe provide a pamphlet of places of interest or places to eat like the newly opened Belle-ville Pancaks at Bugis Junction, or Victor's DimSum at Sunshine Plaza.   I love

I stayed just for 2 days in this cool hotel. The hotel is very modern and good looking! The personal is very nice and helpful in every way. Our room wasnt that big but it was divided up very good and it was especially clean. The next MRT —>

review_title: Nice Room Good Service Good Location
review_text: This room is so nice I really love Style of the hotel but location is a bit away from MRT Bencoolen Exit A (around 4-5 mins by walk) Anyway I still love this hotel. Next time I don't hesitant to stay at the hotel

The staff was very generouse, the room was wonderful and the location is really amazing. I recomend! Good place to stay ar if you are visiting singapore. Thete is a train. Right next to the hotel. Very comftable. You will love it!

Very trendy hotel. The breakfast was good. The location was central and I was able to arrive easily from the airport using the metro. Unfortunately I didn’t make it to the gym, so I can’t comment on that. I’d stay here again.

review_title: Hotel G with a Big Capital letter G for Good to Great?
review_text: Hotel G with a Big Capital letter G for Good to Great? Or, just a plain small "g" for generally small sizes, but with good location and reasonably good breakfast for a hotel centrally located in a hitz shopping and foodies areas in Singapore CBU district. Be Prepared! BE INFORMED!

Excellent breakfasts at 7-10 am which you can use as a lunch: soup, rice, pasta, some chicken or pork meal, different types of eggs, omelet with vegetables and ham, sausages, cheese, bacon, different fresh vegetables and fruits (melons, apples, oranges), yogurts, toast bread, croissants, cookies, cakes, pancakes, waffles, 4 types of milk, juices, coffee machine, different types of tea. I had a small, but good room w/o refrigerator, but at the reception you can always leave anything at their refrigerator. Perfect location.

Hotel G was in a really good location - central and close to many attractions but without having the extra price cost of being on Orchard Road. The room size was perfect for a solo traveller and the gym was a good facility. The rooms were always very clean and the service staff were friendly and helpful.

Wonderful place to stay. Great location and rooms are wonderfully appointed en comfortable. Absolutely love the decor and style of the hotel. Rooms and bathrooms are exceptionally clean. 2 mins walk from the nearest MRT station. Fantastic, can not recommend enough, will definitely be staying there again on future trips.

This Hotel very good location and convenience for take Bugis MRT, Breakfast and lunch very nice. For night you can choose a lot of good wine. Staff very good support. Room very clean but this time they forget for shampoo.

Hotel rooms small, compact but very comfortable. Great location. All staff super friendly and always willing to help. Superb breakfast choice and delicious. Gym ok but needs another total body workout machine. Overall a great cost effective choice to stay for mini break in Singapore. Very good. Thanks t all the staff.

review_title: Nice and Clean and Great Service
review_text: My stay at the hotel was great. Centrally located to everything even by walking and nice and tidy. The staff are ever so friendly and i must single out Shaun - a real nice guy among many good front office staff. One little minus though is that the rooms turn out to be smaller than appears in pictures on the web and were a little squeezy! Everything else, fantastic.

review_title: Best attention to details in town
review_text: Amazing attention to every details, they provide a free phone with all the application, maps and activities details, all products provided in the bathroom are top cosmetic products. Quality of the bed is surprisingly high, i wish i had the same at home! And no odors in the room, which is in many is the case for a lot of 100-200SGD accomodatiin range in Singapore. In terms of cleanliness, it is also spotless. I was rewarded a free breakfast of a value of 18SGD, so extra bucks you pay are definitely worth it! Thumbs up to the G Pullman team.  Also, two restaurants are available in the ground floor, with fairly good food for reasonable price, large smoke salmon salad for 14SGD is a bargain, just have a look.

My partner and I had a few days in Singapore and I couldn't be more happy with the choice of Hotel. The location was fantastic, the staff were charming and very professional. The breakfast was an excellent decision to start our day off and our room was cosy, clean and very well equipped. Including a mobile phone with lots of information about the city at your fingertips. The bar was a great vibe with a classy style. We felt very at home and comfortable at Hotel G. A must stay in my opinion.

The hotel room was very nicely decorated and felt very cozy. Space wise it is on the smaller side. The lack of a mini-fridge and kettle made storing/making beverages a bit more troublesome. Overall decent hotel with friendly and helpful staff.

It is clean, quiet, and good for the room. It's close to the subway station. It's good to go anywhere. Halal to the Pharaoh and leaf the hotel restaurant can eat local food and Malaysia have good by cheap prices.

review_title: Great stay as a solo business traveller
review_text: I stayed at this hotel when it was called Hotel Big two years ago, and had a good experience. An overall good experience this time around as well, the ambiance was nice, the hotel staff were very friendly and the room is as advertised. The Bencoolen MRT station is less than five minutes walk, and I got a deal where breakfast was included so that sweetened the deal.  Every guest is provided a mobile phone for data and calls. - The hotel staff were cordial and helpful, and I liked the touch of receiving an email asking whether I needed anything one day before my stay. However, I did notice that the rooms were not 100% cleaned as I saw hair on the floor and dust. But other than that, the room was cleaned daily and everything was replenished. The only complaints I have are as

It is clean, quiet, and delicious for breakfast. It's close to the subway station. It's good to go anywhere. Halal to the Pharaoh and leaf the hotel restaurant can eat local food and Malaysia have good by cheap prices. And only one block away from the hotel down, swelling seuseu Street is also good for shopping....

review_title: Trendy hotel in shopping district with nice details
review_text: Hotel G had cute and trendy decor. Larger hotel with many floors. I stayed in a single room with a twin bed. It was VERY tiny however as a solo traveler for only one night, it suited my needs. Despite very small size, the details were very nice. Cute finishes in the room, considerate amount of toiletries (they provided shampoo, conditioner, lotion, toothbrush, q tips, face pad etc) - more than i've seen provided by other hotels. Has a cute bar and restaurant.   Easy taxi drop off/pick up. Close to mall and tons of restaurants. MRT entrance nearby as well.  Shower had great water pressure, although it was weird to shower standing right next to the toilet. Despite, water didn't flood the room as you could close it off and the shower area itself was spacious enough that I didn't

Hotel G is a good hotel, very well located . You can almost walk everywhere from the Hotel is you like. Room is small, but comfortable. Good shower, good linens, overall very clean. I booked it with Priceline with an excellent price.

Hotel G is all you want and had everything you need. The room was just right. The bathroom is amazing. Breakfest is included and it is delicious. The location is perfect since MRT is nearby, or you can walk to many points of interest. Truly recommendable,

Interesting choice for city trip!! I really love the location that is near to the MRT station and nightlife points. The breakfast is also good and delicious. Just one comment for improvement, there is no refridgerator available in the room.

review_title: Good choice for couple. Nice place
review_text: I love room decor, good location, and helpful service. After a long travel day, this place is a great choice to recover energy and start exploring new things on next days. I just feel bad about toilet in my room. Toilet water did keep running for minutes. On last day, while it seem be unstoppable, I reported to G Stop. It is quite annoying and made me worried a lot.

thank you and i wish to come back soon!  breakfast choices are good but can still be improved.   great housekeeping team!   convenient. location.   resto service is good but perhaps a smile will always brighten up someone's day. :)

Quiet small room but nice decoration.. receptionist at 2nd floor.. quiet difficult to find receptionist because there is no information at 1st floor about reseptionist location.. every room have smartphones and there is a lot info about explore singapore

We stayed here to compare with another hotel close by which we also stayed in. Also close to the metro and closer to Bugis than the other hotel. Our room was larger but one side was against a wall meaning a clamber over my partner to get out. No pool but a decent buffet breakfast available. Not a bad hotel but we preferred the previous hotel.

Locationof the hotel is very good !!! But the asking price for such a small room is too expensive. There are no place to to store suitcases and his belongings. It's possible to call with the mobil phone of the room. But you can in UK and not in France ??? Why do a difference ????? So i advise this room only for the location.

The location is good, near to MRT station. The room is clean and the deco is great, but room space is a bit small. There are variety choices for breakfast, the food is delicious. I will consider to stay in again.

It's a good location. It's a small room, but if you sleep alone, no problem. The staff is well serviced and the room is in excellent condition. It's good to drink at the bar on the first floor. Thank you.

Overall, the service was good, staff are friendly. We did get a quiet high floor room as requested, which was good.  However, the room was much smaller than we expected, which we were quite disappointed.  Either we didn't read the details carefully or we had a different impression.

review_title: very comfortable and I like the shampoo and conditioner
review_text: Everything is very nice ... convenient location, nice service, like the shampoo and conditioner, sleep quite well on the bed    just always need to wait for the elevator  and sometimes the sensor is very slow.... have to wait 3-5 mins for the power on after inserting the key card

It’s a nice price and location. Basically,I think its quite good hotel . But Room space is too small for me and my girlfriend.Therefore, I’ll consider to stay in hotel G again if I come to Singapore alone next time.

review_title: Good clean room, for one person
review_text: Room was nice for the price (bed ect were of good quality), and location is good, but room might be small for more than one adult. Getting breakfast as part of the room cost is a good deal ($15/day) and the food/coffee is decent. If you are on a budget, there are a lot of cheap food options near by (i.e., for lunch or dinner) that cost much less than the restaurants associated with the hotel.

The room was small, however it was very clean. Friendly and helpfull staff. Great location, close to subway station and shops. The BEST thing was that the hotel offers a mobile phone to the guest with free Internet mobile and free calls to singapore numbers.

Myself and my colleague had pleasant stay in Hotel G. All amenities are good except Room. Room is very conjusted don't have proper place to keep our luggage. Hotel staff are shown good hospitality. The breakfast is good even I am a typical vegetarian, though I can ante to manage the breakfast in  hotel G.

Beautiful rooms, super friendly and useful staff, great roaming phone for travelers - perfect location! Customer service was above and beyond, staff also allowed us to store our bags after check out due to our flight times, it allowed us to have an enjoyable last day.

My best trip in Singapore ever Thanks to the great staff and the fabulous Ginett restaurant.  The taxi drivers do not like the parking access but the open structure of the hotel give you the feeling you are not lock in a conventional hotel  It is a great and vibrant mixing place for people in Singapore, from breakfast to late diner.

Staffs is not friendly, pleasant only room and hotel atmosphere. I stayed here for 2 nights, and asking for cleaning service, but they have no clean. The cleaner only come to knock the door, and when she saw I was sleeping, she quickly gone without saying anything.

The hotel has the Perfect location, beautiful rooms, but wish they were bigger (though it can be ignored) Amazing Staff, very helpful, friendly and dynamic!  Each detail is given so much thought, you really enjoy it!

Service is very excellent and friendly. room is very cozy and cleanliness is perfect. value is very attractive. Location is not bad to take on bus and MRT/Taxi. Sleep quality is needed to improve sometimes I can hear some noise from next/corridor.

Hotel G has an excellent balance of providing a more informal hotel stay that retains its functionality for the business traveler. This makes it an excellent choice in Singapore. The team at Hotel G are friendly and always helpful. The restaurant/bar area is very good and I found the gym provided enough equipment for a good workout in a stylish area. Rooms are comfortable and WiFi service is always excellent. Location is also good - a short walk to the MTR (Bencoolen), major shopping plazas at Bugis and many restaurants and coffee places. It's accessible, without being right in the tourist strips.  I've stayed several times now - this time was for 4 nights - and definitely recommend it as a well-priced option for a hotel of this standard.  Thank you to the G-team for an

Location is quite close to subway - easily accessible to china town and Manila Bay Area. A bit of a hassle to go to gardens by the bay - prob would be new better to take a taxi or grab (same as uber). Room is quite nice and clean. My only complaint is the size. We paid extra to upgrade to a king sized bed but the room is quite small.  We only brought on a carry on sized luggage plus a back pack and if u leave the luggage open you’re tripping over it a few times on ur way to the bathroom.  They give you a free smart phone with unlimited data to nagivage around the city which is quite convenient. Internet is slow but we were still able to use google map .

review_title: Good location, good service and comfortable room
review_text: Not far from mrt and bus station. Have a lot of restaurants around the hotel(muslim/steak/chinese restaurants near the hotel open till 4am.) Although the room is small but well decorated and clean. But I feel the blanket and mattress are a little bit damp and they makes me feel uncomfortable.

The hotel have unique lobby in 2nd floor. The room good, not too small but not too big, it's just enough for couple. The staff is helpful. The hotel is also near with 2 MRT station Bencoolen and Bras Basah, only view minutes in walking distant. If you like taste the Wine and French dine, there Ginett resto on ground floor or want find something cheaper 24 hours food there neighbor India street food near Hotel. And hotel give you Handy phone you can use for internet and free call to some country. It's great hotel and recommended.

I stayed here for a day just to explore new hotels in Singapore. But after having stayed here I no longer feel adventurous. Let me go back to my regular such as Ibis.  The hotel has an awkward construction due to lack of space. Reception on the 2nd floor which is not intuitive. But the rooms are the tiniest I have seen. No space even for a chair. You have to work on your laptop sitting on the bed. The bathrooms were tiny. No partition between shower and commode so the floor is wet once you use the shower. I took a standard room.  There was a coupon for a welcome drink but that did not allow you to choose. A standard ginger apple soda.  The breakfast was great though. But you will have to climb up and down for various items.

Very good hotel for tourist and business man. Its location is very near to Bugis station and it is very convenient to go for riding MRT. Especially, Wine bar is very good and kind service. Recommend who visit in Singapore

The staff was really friendly from the moment we checked in to the moment we left. It's about a 3min walk to Bencoolen MRT Station which made it a really convenient spot if you want to move around Singapore. But the best part for us was the little mobile device that came with our room as it had Google Maps and 4G internet which made moving around super duper easy! I can't find any fault with the place whatsoever.

Located in the center of where the sites are.   Boutique hotel with an artistic flair. Breakfast is excellent with a mix of local fruits. Minimalist but comfortable room. Knowledgeable and friendly staff.

Tiny room can barely move around. I think you can get better rooms for the price. Toilet and shower in the same room, I had never seen this before. Some hotel staff are friendly others not at all (especially the guy wearing glasses at the reception!!).  Otherwise good location and good breakfast.

While I arrived very early before office check-in time, I was told all rooms were full so I'd have to wait until someone checked out and the cleaning staff arrived (3 hours later). After I expressed concern (I was exhausted and needed to sleep), the front desk agent took another look at the system and said a suite was available. Why did I have to show concern before being offered a room? But I'd have to pay for it -- not just one but two nights. I was so tired I agreed. Why would I have to stay two nights? I felt like I was taken advantage of. I get the hotel is a business but it wasn't service-oriented. Beyond this, the rooms (both suites and standards) have an awkward layout. Standard rooms are quite small for even one person with a small suitcase.

Excellent service and location. Handy phone provided by the hotel room was very helpful. Room was small but clean (stayed at a queen and king room). Overall it was an excellent stay in Hotel G. Highly recommended.

Near to the Bencoolen sta. Down Town Line.  Room are not big but easy to use.  It is the worst point that lifts are too small and slow.  Front area is too small, once a group will come, difficult to contact.  Breakfast is tasty.  At night, you should enjoy wine bar or burger shop at the ground floor.

I booked into G Hotel for a night. The room is well designed and small, but very useful. Not sure if you can stay two people more than couple days.. The room was clean and functional. My room was definitely a room for a single traveller  Singapore is not large city. The location is good to walk many places, but with taxi far place, where is the airport,  is around $30. Short distances maximum $10.  I enjoyed my short stay.  By the way, you don't have to  TIP anyone  in Singapore :)

Stayed here last week for 3 days 2 nights.  Rooms were small as expected, but smaller than nearby Mercure and Ibis Bencoolen.  Location is convenient, 5 minutes walk to the Bencoolen MRT or 10 minutes to Bugis.  Check in process was very slow, and the lobby felt very cramped as it was located on the upper level off the street.  Gym was adequate but limited free weights.  The bathroom was glass partitions so if you are staying with someone else make sure you are relatively close and comfortable with each other.  Overall a very average stay with so many other options in Singapore.

I booked into G Hotel for two nights.  I was really surprised how small the room was.  With my luggage open, I could not open the room door.  The door itself was really hard to close due to the tight latches, so the night reverberated with doors slamming shut as other guests were having pretty much the same issue.  The room was clean and functional.  This was definitely a room for a single traveller who perhaps should have only cabin luggage - not a bag for a shopping fiesta...  The location wasn't too bad, two MRT stations (Yellow and Blue lines) within walking distance, but they weren't on the main Red Line, so you'd have to change stations.

Great location, staff are friendly, rooms are very small and hardly any space and no fridge in room. Breakfast is excellent and No pool. Your partner has to climb on top of you to get in and out of the bed.

review_title: I think the room is neat and tidy, the design is very good, the location is very good, and the transportation is conven
review_text: The entrance to the accommodation is accessed from the restaurant. It would be better if there is a separate entrance to the hotel; the waiter at the entrance to the first floor can reinforce the quality of the staff and will not actively assist the guests who ask questions.

Loved the decor and even though my single room was small it was perfect and felt very cosy.  Staff were very helpful . Breakfast had range of western and eastern. Very helpful via email before i arrived

Cozy and Valuable  .. A lot of Mall and food around there Recommended for couple because the room is a bit small not match for a family  Staff are so nice and helpful, In the lobby area  is a smell good i like it  ( :  Not much for breakfast but good

Hotel was limited space even lobby or room size or parking.  But have perfect Bed, was excellent sleeping and more comfortable.    Breakfast was great and good quality but lack of staff service sometime plenty of guest in the morning.

Highly assessable hotel, only a 5 minute walk from Bencoolen station. Nearby there are restaurants opening till late night. Staff are kind and helpful. Room is clean and tidy. Welcome drinks are offered at the restaurant on ground floor. There is a handy mobile which can be used for surfing the net and dialling overseas (local calls and to Hong Kong for free). Highly recommended!

Stay here, bencoolen mrt is close walking distance highly recommended. Also, the hawker place nearby save us from breakfast if you like a more western brrakfast, aka bacon, stay in the hotel it was delicious

Good hotel, super tiny room (0803) but very convenient location.the breakfast buffet is very good. Front desk staff very average, at checkin the guy, didn't greet and not smiling at all. but I dealt with him at checkout too and still pretty serious guy. because the room is so so tiny, I won't be coming back, but for some people it won't be an issue.

Nice to stay at this hotel.. easy to go every where ..thanks G Hotel .. near Bancoolen MRT and Bugis Area to buy many souvenir... but next time better to provide live TV program speciallly FIFA world Cup... because I can find in this TV hotel chanel... but so far all service it  Good

I was there in Singapore for a week and I had stayed in this hotel. It was very nice and comfortable. I loved it yeah. And we had a great time in the hotel. I must say this is the best hotel in the world. Thanks

I was worried that it would be too small, but it was large enough for me. I didn't do anything but sleep though. Clean, good location, decent interior. It doesn't have a refrigerator but there is a free ice dispenser in the hallway and a ice bucket for use.

Hotel is good. Room is clean and comfortable. Varieties of food to choose from, outside and inside the hotel. Staff is friendly and helpful. The staff that checked me in saw my wrist was wrapped up, she asked if I was comfortable filling up the information needed. I told I was alright. I like that she was attentive to my condition and make sure I was okay to continue. Besides that, the hotel is also walking distance to Albert food court, Bugis street, Bugis Junction and etc. Only dislike was the shower area was quite small. Other than that, I have no complain.

review_title: Good location, friendly staffs and very hip decorations
review_text: Good location, friendly staffs and very hip decorations - is just the room is very small :) easy check in and check out .. location close to the MRT station Bencolen, walking distance to bugis, nice shopping area and nice restaurants

The room was very small (you had to climb over your bags if you wanted to reach the bed) and the bathroom had no privacy (door was 1 centimeter open at all times). And the bathroom only had glass walls.  Breakfast was supposed to be included, and both in-room information and reception said that brunch was served at 11 AM on Sunday (no other time communicated). But when we went down for breakfast we were declined and had to pay 45 dollars per person. We also had to pay a 100 dollars additional fee upon arrival in addition to the room charge (deposit).

As the review title says, grgre location with easy access to a Mrt Station nearby. Facilities are minimal but its clean and just nice for short trips. If you're staying more than 3 days however, i'd recommend either getting a bugger room or another hotel as the room sizes are really small.

Rooms very clean but too small. Bed super quality. Breakfast was great but at certain times too crowded in the breakfast lounge. Waiting times at the lifts is sometimes a problem. Excellent location to visit Singapore.

Stayed here for the second time. Even though the rooms are smaller than your average hotel rooms but they make up by maximizing the use of space and clever design to make it comfy. If you’re not claustrophobic then this hotel is good enough for you.   Located near bugis junction where you can find good food easily (they have good burgers downstairs!) it’s also a strategic location where you can walk to two MRT stations within 10 minutes! So traveling to and from the hotel is a breeze.

Looking for somewhere centrally located, we found HG on a well-known hotel booking website. We decided to give it a try and were happily very pleased. Our room was clean and tastefully decorated, with all necessary amenities. As many other reviewers have pointed out, rooms are not big at all, but that is not really a problem if you are going to be out and about (as we were) for most of the day. HG has an arrangement with the restaurant on the ground floor for breakfast. We tried the buffet one morning at 13 Singapore Dollars per head, a reasonable price for what was provided.  All the staff, check-in and chambermaids, were very polite and friendly. We paid about HK$800 for four nights - very good value, in our view.  Nearby, in Bencoolen Street and Middle Road, there are many

I stayed for two nights with my husband. The room was very small but cozy, convenient and sleep well. I think it's reasonable to stay here in Singapore with this price. Also the location was a quite good to move to everywhere.

Was pretty good all up. No bar fridge was a let down though. Also didn't appreciate having to walk through a quasi nightclub each time I wanted to leave. Apart from those things I can't complain, rooms were nice and staff were very pleasant.

We had an enjoyable 2 night stay at Hotel G on our way to Bali. We booked 2 x Great King Rooms. 4 of us travelling. Yes, the room was a bit on the small side, but we found it quite cosy and comfortable enough for 2. The decor is tasteful, bed comfy and shower/toilet clean. What more do you need really. Staff were friendly and attentive. Restaurant down stairs was nice (bit pricey though).. we ate mostly at the burger place next door. Great burgers and happy hours. Convenience store just down the road for takeaway beers and nibbles, Starbucks and various eateries not far away. Close to all the main attractions. We'd stay there again.

Room is small, smelly, cleaning is bad( they knocked door at 8am wake us up to clean!). It doesn’t have a pool, around $200 dollar per day it is too expensive for this place, service is bad basically better to book Hotel 81 than this which is only 2 start! Disgusting!  Since it was business trip everything was sponsored by company but they charged from my personal cart didn’t even inform me!!! And they clam it is obvious. Like you need to inform us first about every detail of your policy. I am super angry Because the refund will take 1 month and I would be in Singapore! I need to explain problems why they didn’t charge company cart but mine!?  I got so many problems and stress everyday pf my stay!  I am really tolerant person but this was really unprofessional!

Very small rooms with quirky decor. No wardrobe, only a small rack with some hangers. Small sink outside the bathroom.  Hot water and ice from dispenser in the corridor.  Very clean and new room and bathroom and comfortable bed.  Good location, close proximity to Bugis Junction, Marina area, Sim Lim Square, National Library etc. Many eateries nearby including an in-house bar/restaurant.

Came here yesterday with my girlfriend and we were treated with no welcome or warmth at all!!!! Definitely on our first vacation we will remember this hotel as a nightmare.!!!   As soon we walked in to check in we could see miserable faces of front desk..... not Hi or anything! Next one- our room!!! Stink of mould and damp! Really disgusting smell.

I was staying in Room 1607. It was my second stay with Hotel G, small but comfort. Just a small complaint due to safety concern - There are sparks coming out from the hair dryer when tried to switch the strength of the wind. Although the spark didn't last long, it is enough to worry a electric shock. Had mentioned to receptionist, hope had sent technician or anyone to have a look.

Corner of the rooms, edges of the mattress is extremely dusty.  Bathroom water flows to the main area during shower, could have a better gradient to avoid water flowing to WC area. Service at the reception is competent but missing the friendliness.

I arrived in the morning at 6AM and asked for early check in. Hotel G was able give me a room by 11:00AM so my wait wasn't that long. Comfortable rooms, convenient location and room was clean. I was only here for 1 night and it had everything I needed. The only thing was there was no remote in my room so I couldn't control the TV but they sent a guy to give me my remote relatively quickly after I told them.

The hotel has modern and good quality interior, but the room was claustrophobicly small, only as wide as the bed is long. So you can only enter the bed from one side, not even the end. Clean room. Comfortable shower. Staff was ok, but not super eager to help out. We asked for two single instead of double duvet, but they said they only have one per room.

Well done. keep up the good work. I would consider staying at G Hotel again in my following trip to Singapore. I would recommend G Hotel to my friends and associates for their next trip to beautiful Singapore

A good stay in Singapore where you can easily get to Bencoleen MRT(about 5minutes). The room and facility were really nice; clean, and not too small. The stuffs warmly welcomed me for the stay. It's less than an hour away from Changi Airport for MRT(~2-4 dollars), and only 20 mins for taking a Grab car(~22 dollars).

The reception staff is very nice and polite, thumbs up to Wallace, he was very nice. Hotel is well situated, well equipped and the price is right. The rooms are very cozy but it is exactly as described. The free smartphone comes handy as well :)

I stayed for almost 3 days and i think this place is not good for business trip...I arrived late and i was so hungry and tired and unfortunately no room service available like food and etc  and at the same time poor business facilities.  Rooms are too small can't sleep properly, no cabinet to put your things,,my experience was really bad..i will not go back again.

Very tidy excellent room, and thanks for the handy handphone that help us so much for not get lost in singapore. but i am not really comfortable in when we are entering the hotel in first floor, we need to pass the bar to reach the escalator. Location of the hotel is excellent, because if we use mrt, we just need to walk maybe 5minutes from bencoolen mrt to reach the hotel.

I stayed 2nights.Room was very clean and comfortable.But bathroom's partition was too low.So I had to make partition to towel.And I wanted to use refrigerator.If you can't preparation in each room,I  want you to put at least one on the floorm,

review_title: Small room but feel like home
review_text: I stayed 5 nights here and got a corner room (Room #910). Room is small but got everything needed. I slept very well thanks to the quietness and good soundproof. It feels more like my home room rather than a hotel room. Hotel location is great - only 5 mins from the nearest MRT station by walks. Staff are all very friendly. Breakfast is good with long offering time (7am-10am in weekdays).  It was also my first time using Handy Mobile (free) - it was a very good experience. Thanks so much for the great host.

It was quite pleasant to stay in Hotel G Singapore. The service was awesome, the room was fashionably designed and the breakfast was excellent. Strongly recommended for anyone who is traveling or will travel to Singapore.

review_title: Decent place, but very small room
review_text: Pro: The hotel was nice and clean, and the location was very good (close to metro station, restaurants, etc.). Breakfast was very nice.   Contra: The room was so small I could hardly open my suitcase. The shower stood right over the toilet, which made it a bit uncomfortable. Cleaning staff was quite loud early in the morning (you could hear them yell in the hallway).

You are a rare perl in Singapore for quality/cost rate.  We decided to spend the first night of our honeymoon at Hotel G and it was a very good choice. See you in one month when we will fly back to Italy.

review_title: Ideal retreat for fun and relaxation after a day of exploration.
review_text: Designed with trendy and graphic elements that reflect the cosmopolitan rhythms and dynamism of the Lion City, Hotel G, formerly known as BIG Hotel, is the ideal retreat for fun and relaxation after a day of exploration.  All rooms are equipped with a 32-inch IPTV system with screen mirroring options filled with lots of channels that you can choose from, ranging from news to lifestyles and movies. Guests can also download a press reader application on their own devices for access to over 6,000 newspapers and magazines, translated in 60 languages.  Read more on darrenbloggie.com

This is like camping in the city.  Location is great but the rooms are tiny, no room to walk around the bed or have anywhere to sit.  Perhaps the room would be better for a single traveller.  Breakfast is good but ends at 10am and the staff are in a hurry for you to leave.

Nice hotel, nice surroundings, good value for money. The ground floor is actually a fancy pub, but it doesn't annoy during the night. Rooms are really small, with no space for your staff, especially if you have big luggage. However the space is very well organized, the room is clean and with nice and new furniture. Main drawbacks: not efficient separation between shower and WC: when you take the shower, the water drains.

review_title: Fashionable and easy access to the city
review_text: It is a very comfortable and fashionable hotel except that the toilet gets wet when showering.  The main town can be accessed in about 10 minutes on foot. The room is small but fashionable and clean. Basic amenities such as hair dryer, toothbrush and cotton swab are available. It is regrettable that the toilet will be flooded when you take a shower.

review_title: A must stay if you can
review_text: I was blown away by Hotel G. For such a mid-range price you get a top notch hotel. The rooms are beautifully appointed, bed super comfy, location excellent and service above expectations. I will always try and stay here in the future when I come to Singapore - you would be mad not to as well.

We are currently staying at Hotel G and while first impressions (our airport transfer dropped us in the bottle filled back alley) were less than impressive our views changed. The guy checking us in was both friendly and efficient. While the rooms are very small they are clean, modern and cleverly designed, we have ample room to store our 2 large suitcases. The bed is comfortable and though the bathroom is tiny the shower has great water pressure from the rain head and the basin being on the outside of the room hasn't bothered us at all.  Unlike a previous reviewer we find the breakfast to be excellent with great variety and quality, everything you could want. The location is fantastic, walking distance to many shops, a market, restaurants and the metro. We went to the Marina Bay

Long story short - needed luggage stored in an AC room due to medication, repeated this request several (5+ times) to make it clear. Come back and my luggage has been stored outside in the heat. Pretty much sums up quality of service. Pity as despite the smaller rooms, could be considered a good value hotel given location.

Stayed there recently in 2 rooms on the 8th floor. Not the largest rooms but well laid out and clever use of space meant you weren't tripping up over your bags, also very clean. We had burgers at 25degrees one night and all agreed they were great, they were massive too. Breakfast was ok, not spectacular but a decent selection of hot and cold. Main plus for the hotel is location. 15 minute walk to orchard road, 10 minutes to bugis mall, 15 to the suntec mall and under 10 to 2 met (tube) stations so very easy to get about.

Hotel G is simple hotel with high comfort for guest. Especially for fast stay in Singapore. For services is will be better if there are limit time for linen change, for example, is maximum 2 days must be change, requested or not. except

Hotel in good location.  We had stayed 3 nights. You can reach anywhere with subway. Rooms were very clean but small. Staff were friendly. They keep our luggage after chekout until our flight. Wifi was good. Bed was comfy. What we didnt like the sink beside the bed except all was good.

Very clean and comfortable. Bed was super comfortable and there were many amenities in the room (good quality tea, coffee, kettle, coffee machine, etc). Only thing they should keep and eye on is the humidity in the bathroom, since there isn't much ventilation it gets humid easily. Still 100% recommendable!!

review_title: Chic but small and no free parking
review_text: Room is small and no free parking eventhough they want their own parking in the building. Wall in the room was peeling. Can hear noise from upstairs, from the side and outside. No hairdryer in the room and very basis amenities provided.

I really enjoyed my stay at hotel G. Great location and nice, modern rooms. Although the rooms are relatively small, the use of space is very good, e.g. my very large suitcase fitted underneath the bed so it wasn't in the way. The breakfast was great, I looked forward to it every day. The only thing I didn't like so much was the fact that the aircon had to be on when I wasn't in my room. I could only turn it off/lower it when I was inside and my card was in the slot. This is not very environmentally friendly and I was always freezing when I entered the room.

The hotel was wonderful. The service was also great. We didn't have breakfast here as there are loads of other options nearby so we can't comment on it. One night we went to the restaurant below the hotel which was OK but don't get the veggie burger!   The location was great, the local mrt stops are bencoolen and bugis. Both are less than a ten minute walk away. Very close to bugis junction for cheap shopping and markets!  The room was really nice but its important to note that there is not a lot of storage space (not uncommon in Singapore) and the bed is against the wall.  Finally, this hotel provided a phone which allowed free calls to the UK, Singapore and other countries as well as near  unlimited data. This was such a wonderful feature! If only all hotels did this..   We

review_title: Extraordinary hotel with the best breakfast I have ever eaten
review_text: We had a short one night stay at Hotel G, and the only thing we would like to change about it, was the fact it was only one night. The hotel is well located - very close to the MRT station and (a bit long, but approachable) walking distance to the Chinatown and The Bay. The rooms were spacy, clean, air conditioned and well prepared. We had the access to the drinking water and basic personal-care amenities. Everything that we expected was there. The design of the lobby restaurant, lobby itself and the rooms is excellent (according to my wife who is an interior designer). They serve amazing coffe in the restaurant and the breakfast was the best breakfast I have ever eaten in my life - honestly! It is not the cheapest hotel - buy you can be sure, it is worth the price and the money

Space in room is very limited. No refrigerator and no water boiler. You need to get your hot water at a water station outside your room. It is not convenient for myself because I had a baby to feed, each time you need to leave your baby alone in the room or bring the baby with you and holding her while pressing the hot water button and unlock button together. It is not good.

Hotel G is close to MRT, Shopping Malls, 20 minute taxi ride from the airport, staff were helpful, room was clean and tidy. The train at MRT was the best way to get around Singapore to see the sights and didn't cost that much.

Room was nice and cosy for two and the bed was pretty comfortable. A pleasant aroma greeted us upon exiting the lift and I was intrigued by the decor in the hotel. Had a good sleep and one night was not enough! Would definitely return again if I have the chance to :)

review_title: Room is a clean and nice . Food need improvement
review_text: Room is a bit small but  is very clean n nice .  The first night dinner I spend at the restaurant . But the taste of the food I relly can’t accept . We order a lobster soup , pasta , and a salmon . Salmon is still ok , but pasta and the soup really taste so heavy and weird . We just leave the food a side , bill and leave to take dinner at another place .

The design of the hotel is so sleek that my husband and I love the layout in the room. Absolutely love the dreamcatcher that was only customized made I would love to purchase it. Overall out one night stay was awesome!

Basically very good. Very new hotel, something very unique. Very small rooms, just perfect for 1 or 2 persons. Breakfast is very acceptable, not that big and not that small. I would recommend this hotel to others

Good clean rooms. Great vibe. Small Boutique hotel rather than big chain. Great bar/restaurant. Quick wifi. Could do with a bit more shelf space by the sink, but otherwise just perfect. It is right in the middle of a vibrant area next to china town. Great if you are single or a couple. All i needed for my 10 day business trip here.

We booked and payed some weeks in advance and got a pretty discount and breakfast included - which was very tastfull and rich. Location is near center with bus and metro station around the corner. We had a bigger room which really payed out, because the standard rooms are rather tiny.  We would go there again anytime!

Excellent value. Room was comfortable, breakfast was decent, and gym was always available. The location of the hotel was also close to my office. I would have enjoyed it more if the room had more space though.

Great hotel, rooms have been criticised for being on the small side but very functionnel. Rooms very well soundproofed too. It would have been good to have more storage space or at least a few more hangers. Lovely breakfast with a great choice of local and western choices. Would definitely stay here again next time I'm in Singapore!

We stayed here for 2 nights the rooms are small and very contemporary and have everything you need for a couple of nights, the breakfast was very good and also the food in the restaurant. only slight moan is that you couldn't open the windows.

small rooms but comfy bed. it would be great if you have bidet and more movie channels or adedicated channel for offline movies..also maybe a glass container for water since you have a dispenser available.

I stayed here when it was Big Hotel and like the location The renovated restaurant and burger bar are great. The location is very convenient . Nearby to Sim Lim tower and great food shopping at Bugis. Ill be back

It was good. Near from temple, market, foodcourt, mall, etc. All available (drink water hot/cold, ice cube, free phone call, nice bed, nice room, good service, everything is good - excelent ! RECOMMENDED :)

The room was very clean but very small.   The Vanity is extremely small.  And after taking a shower, the shower water comes out to the toilet area floor....they should have put the glass door for avoiding it.

review_title: Modern, stylish, clean and great value
review_text: The hotel is conveniently located and the decoration is modern and stylish. It's a great value given that the hotel is still in great shape and quite new. Hotel staff were very helpful and friendly when I asked for clippers to trim a thread out of my dress. There's Handy phone in the room so quite convenient for tourists.

Near to 2 MRT station, Downtown line with 200m walk only. Nice local food near the hotel. The best is walking distance to Orchard Road. Car Park available for SGD15 per day. However, the hotel lobby is located at carpark level 2.

review_title: Very Small room with strange drop off lobby
review_text: For the same amount of money you can have lots of better selection. The room itself is very tiny. This by far the smallest room i have ever stayed. Room decoration looks modern and have an industrial theme to it. The lavatory was located outside the bathroom and it was way smaller than the average size. 500 meter away from MRT station and bus stop. All in all it was not worth the price. If they can go down to 50-70SGD, then it should be more worthed.

review_title: Excellent stay within minutes of walks to Bugis and Dhoby Ghaut
review_text: Love how the hotel is presented with a theme. Room is quite spacious and bed is plushy. I love the communal area for work and chat area at ground floor.   Tip: If you have a heavy and big sized luggage, you may want to drop off at the carpark cum reception as there is a flight of stairs to head up to the lift lobby. Reception is at level 2.

Was there for a business trip. Room was good, provides what is needed, bed, good shower, complementary drinks and wifi. The bar downstairs offers some nice atmosphere, however price is a bit above average. Only downside was that breakfast started at 7AM, which was too late for me

Front office staff are very friendly and helpful, we forget to ask for room cleanup and call the front office around 9pm, they still manage to send staff to clean our room. The location is great, near MRT and popular shopping mall.

I prefer this location. Reasonable price for the quality of breakfast. There is nothing gorgeous about this hotel. Just enough for business use. I will recommend this hotel to my colleagues who have chances to come to Singapore.

review_title: Good hotel but the room was tiny
review_text: The location is good in a central area. There are several MRT stations within a few hundred metres.  The hotel has been completely renovated not that long ago and it shows. Everything is clean and there are several nice details.  The two restaurants of the hotel occupy the ground floor and you have to take stairs through one of them to get to the elevators (and eventually the reception, which is on the second floor).  The room was disturbingly tiny, even smaller than what I've come across in Japan. The small bathroom sink didn't fit in the bathroom so it was in the room itself. I'm 177 cm tall and my toes touched the opposite wall when lying in the bed. There was no minibar in the room, probably because every possible part of the room was already used for something else.

Arrived Friday and was pleasantly surprised to be allocated 2 adjoining rooms with a private common entrance, since our booking was for 1 family room for 3 adults. Room facilities are standard with daily replenishment of toiletries and refreshments, free Wi-Fi and even an android phone for local use. Ice from the ice machine and hot/cold water dispenser at every floor is green and appreciated though it was frustrating as the hot water took some time to reach boiling temperature. Our deal didn't come with free breakfast but was available at S$15 pax. Location is convenient for shopping, near to Orchard etc. and food, with a western restaurant and pub on the ground and a 24hr mamak at the corner and eateries all nearby. Lacking a swimming pool but has a gym. Parking is S$15 a

review_title: Quaint Room with Funny Lobby Location
review_text: First thing your taxi "uncle" will tell you is that the location of the lobby is funny (It's on the 1st floor in the parking area) but the lobby is nice and have plenty of seating space. Room is small but comes with all the necessary items of a traveller - including various toiletries so you just need to bring your clothes. Bed is comfy, pillows are comfy, internet connection is good. Walking distance to yummy food too so don't need the hotel breakfast for you to try local food! Would come back!

Me and my Girlfriend were travelling to Australia and stayed 3 nights in Singapore.  The hotel was perfect for this time. Its very central (around a 20 min. Walk from the Bay with a look at the Marina bay sands hotel) in addition many shopping malls are very close.  The room we got was very small but totally enough for getting a shower and resting the night. The bed was very confortable and big!  The room was clean!  The breakfast offered a great selection, so everyone should find something. We had luck that we got 3 nights for the price of two, including breakfast. I think otherwise it would be a little bit too expensive for students to stay. But thats no critics.  The personell was very friendly and the check in/out was fast and easy!  Concluding, we are totally happy that we

Excellent staff 《in particular Alexander ) breakfast ( amazing) bar staff ( exceptional) room ( fantastic ) really first class hotel in the city centre, close to all of Singapore's best attractions including Skypark!

It was a very  good selection. Excellent balance quality-price. Kindly staff and very clean and new. Well located near to Bencoolen MRT station, Chinatown, Little India and Marina bay. Greater king room is comfortable for a couple and sone days in Singapur.

The hotel design is nice and modern but rooms are very small and bathroom is not for 4 star hotel. Staff in the restaurant (Burguer) are not friendly. I stayed in the hotel 4 weeks ago and still waiting to receive the deposit refund. I wouldn’t recommend the hotel.

review_title: Quiet rooms with a modern vibe
review_text: stayed for 6 days on a quiet corner room on the 13th floor, with a convenient water station (hot & cold water, and ice) easily accessible on the same floor.  The hotel location is near multiple MRT stations wherever you plan to go in the city (Bencoolen and Bugis being the stations I have been to most of the time).  The modern look around the floors, and reception add a youthful vibe!  Value for money, will surely book this hotel again on my next stay.

Hotel G is located at city. It is a great location. Just ard 3-5mins walking distant from Bencoolen MRT. Its bed is comfortable to sleep. Everything is provided in room. Room decoration is warm like our own room making me have family feel. Just surprise the room is small however understand that it is center, city just within walking distance, furthermore, it is Singapore. It is gold with each inch of land! lol

I was Singapore for business for 5 days and I choose here because of the location and low cost campaign. This is typical low budget hotel and so room is very small room but it’s good enough for just staying central Singapore. Staff is friendly, service is good and flexible. I’ll choose here again.

This was a cool hotel with a very nice lounge/cafe on the ground level that sort of belonged to the hotel. My room was maybe a bit too small for my taste but it was different and therefore still ok. I can highly recommend this hotel

review_title: Upon check in staff friendly well serive
review_text: Room was good. Size of room quite small but overall is good. Location is very easy access to anyway. Good for short stay and without kids traveling. Facility not really match for traveler with kids and senior citizen.

Easy check in and great hospitality! The view from the highest floor was great and I would stay here again when I come back to Singapore. The bed was so comfy and the complimentary products were decent sizes to use during my stay.

Good restaurant and bar, I had a delicious steak and good choice of red wines. Beds very comfortable. Surprised how small room was but was more than adequate in the end as well designed. No bar fridge . Internet very good .

Tastefully decorated.  Goodt that the water is free and placed in handy location. Gym is big enough for proper workout. However, the shower space, there is a curtain used. With this modern hotel, i dont think curtain in shower is a good material choice. If you change that it will raise up overall look of the room to another level!

The Hotel was good, but our room was very small. The guy at the reception was very kind but his english was very unclear. He talked way too fast and we had to ask for nearly every word again. In general the hotel was in a very central spot and the staff way very keen to help us.

The room is not big but have everything you need. They have a great bar at first floor that you don’t need to worry what’s for drink at night. I am so fascinated by their breakfast, every customer has to try.

Hotel is very clean and staff are courteous and friendly. Breakfast is excellent but didn’t try the restaurant for dinner. It is in a great location and we found it surprisingly quiet. We are going back in 7 weeks and looking forward to it.

Perfect hotel for the downtown explorer. Everything was great and even got a free upgrade when stay for the 1st time. Only want to get the seperation in bathroom between wet and dry area. Besides that the hotel is fantastic for value

I love this hotel but this time the room was smaller and I pay more;( But a good point the gentleman who was there recognized me!! Hope next time to have a bigger room and maybe more. It was a short but good stay in hotel G!☺️ Thanks

It was very  great experienced for us to stay in a 4star hotel, very accomadating staff..very convenient location, it was really great pleasure for me and my colleagues.  We hope to comeback soon.  Thank you.

This is third time  I stay in this hotel, near the MRT station, room is quite small this is normal when you stay in Singapore,the only thing need to improve is facilities, the rest for me almost perfect.

The hotel is quite clean and nice. There are many restaurants around there. You can get unlimited water and ice cube from the hotel. The room may be too small for person who need a lot of area for their stuff. The staffs is nice and helpful.

1 Can walk to MRT Bencoolen station within 5 minutes and easy access to Changi Airport 2 There are bus stations nearby the hotel and can access China town, Orchard in 10 minutes 3 Clean room and facilities 4 Nice decoration and concept hotel 5 There is no proper common area

the overall experience is good, Hotel G with good location that it is close to Rochor and Bugis MRT station with lots of food and convenience stores nearby.  the room is clean and cosy but the bathroom design can be better.

cost-effectiveness is very good. With a bar in the basement,perfect to meet new friends. MRT is a 5 minute walk away and bus stations are around the intersection. Perfect hotel for a 1 or 2 week stay.

Nice, trendy hotel with good location. Stayed in The Great Room, unique design with interesting decorations. However, the room had a certain stale smell to it not sure if it was because the place was fairly newly renovated but the hotel lobby also had a musty scent. Perhaps, the hotel can look into improving it's ventilation or adding certain ambience aroma features to improve overall air quality.

We stayed here for 2 nights in June for a family trip. Check-in and Check-out is very easy. The room was clean and had ample facilities. It would've been better if we had a small fridge but it wasn't a great hardship. There is a small 7/11 shop across the road and behind the bus shelter. There is a very convenient ATM machine outside of the hotel.  The hotel has 2 restaurants which are good but the beverages are quite expensive. The location is great and the nearest MRT station is Bencoolen. There's no ticket office there so if you purchase a 2 day Tourist Pass please bear this in mind when trying to get your deposit back on the card. Nearest MRT station with a ticket office is Bugis. Take the MRT to Bugis, get your deposit back and walk back to hotel (about 10 to 15 mins walk).

I recommend this place, Clean, neat rooms. Super friendly staff. Close to Bugis street market, Buddha Temple and Hindu Temple, Simmlen square. Very central place. Lovely Bar and resturant at the Hotel.

review_title: Great stay in a good location
review_text: The place is extremely centralised and it was easy to get around and the hotel room had all the necessary amenities.  The only thing is that it’s a small hotel, and the concierge is limited in manpower. When checking in during peak hour? Just be patient.

The Hotel is simple and nice. It is located at junction with a small shopping mall around 5 min walking. There are few restaurants downstairs and it take around 5-10min walking to fast food shops. The hotel itself is clean and modern. Comfortable bed and good water pressure. The room a bit tight without wardrobe (walking wardrobe available). The staff are superb, very polite, supporting and professional. I would recommend this hotel for young couple / single or business trip.

It was a pleasant place to stay during my latest trip to Singapore. Hotel G offers your usual fanfare of hotel amenities with a chic and modern revamp. As I entered the hotel, I was greeted and assisted by a door man who helped me operate the floor lift going to the main lift. As I arrived on the 2nd floor I was promptly greeted by the staff. Check-in was almost hassle free apart from the security deposit which was not advertised. I was also given an upgrade from a Queen sized bed to a King sized which was a great surprise.  Security was not an issue since one would need a key card to enter the guest's floor and rooms and the key card issued to each guest can only be used on their specific room on their specific floor.   The room is quite neat and the space was spacious with

review_title: quite good, will stay here next time
review_text: Good: location is good, 10mins to mrt and bugis junction; room is clean; every floor have water dispenser machine  bad: sound resistance is not good, can hear sound from the corridor clearly, waked up by the vacuum cleaner everyday; sound from water pipe was quite disturb when other room having a bath; one floor to the reception if you are walk through the front door

The room with simple decoration but nice and memorable.   Angelina Tan, Wallace Eng & Alexander Ghan staff of hotel Suggested and did exactly what I want for the birthday decoration.   Well planning for check in, drop baggage and the cake.

Nice small rooms. Not too expensive. Great staff downstairs at reception and the wine bar. A small refrigerator in The room would be nice. I took the 'Mystery Room" off booking.com and was disappointed with a standard single for the same price as a queen! No upgrade at all.

Hotel location is good for MRT and buses.  Greater king room’s space is ok.  Bed is good.  Coffee maker is good.  Free water and ice. Breakfast is good. Room facilities are good.  Friendly services from staffs.

When my in-laws visited Singapore, I booked Hotel-G for them due the location which is near to Bugis station and Kwan Yin Temple. I check the room and not that big. But the rooms has everything you need. My in-laws love the buffet breakfast but the refill took quite a while. Hotel-G provide smart phone for every room that can call back to Thailand for free. I think is a good thought but the data speed is rather slow. It's FOC...so can't complaint much. The room has a unique design and most importantly...clean.

Hotel G is in a great location, with close proximity to Orchard Road, Singapore Museums and Galleries and Marina Bay. While chic in design, the hotel rooms are exceptionally small... closer to a hostel style. Recommend staying for 2-3 nights.

excellent breakfast, very nice stuff, but broken water dispenser on the level and two high humidity in the building, free internet was OK, no storage possibility for clothes at good room king, two bottles of water every day

Facilities were quite nice, super small and tight rooms. Bed was from one wall to the other.  Shower floads a bit out into the main room - so had to always put a towel down as a barrier. Fairly well located - easy walk or a short taxi ride down to Marina Bay.

I have been staying there for 4 nights, and the hotel is amazing, well located in the heart of Singapore, you will be greeting by a smiling team, the room are not too big but what the point to stay in Singapore in the big room hotel when the most exciting thing is to visit. The best thing is this hotel is the restaurant open all day with a magic team, always here for you. The food is great and during my stay they have been creating a wine dinner which i have been participating. Serious good restaurant with a serious manager. Thank you for all I will be back very soon.

Great location!!! cozy and comfy room.  Staff attending was friendly. Very near to mrt station, just 5 mins walking. Room a bit small, but still remain cozy and comfy. A bit noisy but overall stay was great!!!

Good position. Stylish modern hotel for young people, nice bar but the room is really small and the floor is always wet due to umidity and for that reason, it was really hard to move. No space for big luggage

Good location, close to Bugis with dining options at the ground floor and close to the hotel.  It is quite lively downstairs with a tasty burger joint that has tasty food and is busy.  Staff are very efficient, attentive and friendly.

review_title: Nice comfy hotel - but no cabinets
review_text: Stayed there for 4 nights on a business trip. The hotel feels cozy, reasonably priced, staff service is good, and it's close to Bugis shopping area. My only concern is that there are no cabinets to put your extra clothes or laundry into. If you are there for a short business trip like 1 or 2 days, it's fine. But if you are staying longer - better to have your clothes laundered or bring laundry bags/plastic bags to put your dirty clothes or find some better option.

I am surprise that the hotel charges for the car park fees which are waived for most other hotels in Singapore (or other countries).  The room is cheap and tidy but it is small.  You need to get hot water from the corridor (you cannot boil your own water in the room).

review_title: Felt like home! Would definitely book this hotel again!
review_text: Delicious breakfast and they where superhappy and helpful to arrange something for my boyfriends birthday! Got balloons and birthdaycake as a surprise in the hotelroom at arrival =D Also the beds were comfy and everything was superclean!

This is very hotel in Singapore with nice room, comfortable facilities and very kind staffs. The breakfast is very well also. It is very near popular places such as Bugis Junction, Bugis Plus, Little India, Sim Lim Square. It takes 5 minutes to go to MRT Station Bugis and Bencoolen

We only stayed for one night but the hotel is exactly as it says on the tin  It's clean, tidy, modern and centrally located. The staff were extremely friendly and were happy to answer any of our queries.   It's a cheaper option for a hotel stay in Singapore, so the room size is small (typical of Singapore)   Wouldn't mind staying again

review_title: If you want to feel a city vibe
review_text: The hotel is very nice. I like the design of the rooms and amenities. The restaurant downstairs is so stylish. The location is great, it was nice to walk around. Also there are a lot of good places to eat and drink around.

Good location, breakfast buffet good, room services and reception staff helpful.   But no refrigerator in room, and room size is quite small.  Ice and hot water provided by self service machine nearby lift.

I took the queen bedroom with a city view. If you actually came for business trip, i think this is fair place to live, comfortable with a small room, good enough for 1 person to sleep in. They also offer a 24 hour halal restaurant downstairs.

Overall is good. Location is OK, walking distance to MRT Bencoolen (200-300 meter away) Just that the room is too small, not much space. Suggest to have glass door in the shower room instead of shower curtain.

review_title: ventilation is bad in the room.
review_text: The room ventilation is bad due to the window cannot open, and i didn't see any ventilation fan or it doesn't work well. If someone went to the toilet and do 'big business' then basically the whole room smell. Secondly suggest front desk officer should speak good english with clear message, experience 1 of the front desk staff try to speak with funny accent and is very hard to get what he mean.FYI i'm Australian grade so he might try to speak like 1 but he can't even speak it loud , suggest he could just speak normally take me more then 3 to 4 time to understand what is he trying to tell me. ( morning shift staff). Other then that everything is fine, like the design and location. Just my 2 cents word.
