Room is v small despite is a king room. Most problematic is bathroom inside no counter top wash basin. Breakfast is not bad. Location is good though.  Courteous staffs. Still recommended for short stay. Worse thing is NO FREE PARKING!

During  staying Sigapore , I went often Indian Town and  Chinese Arabic, there are quite close , I think the location is pretty good.    Every reception staff are kindly.  The room is a little bit small but enough for us.

Even after an upgrade, our room was only as wide as the bed is long! There is nowhere for luggage & I had to climb over my husband & step into my open case to get to the bathroom. Second case was half stashed in small indent under bed next to the room safe! No wardrobe & minimal bench space triples as tea-making, dresser & desk! Room is cute & funky looking, fitting all expected ammenities into a Hobbit Hole!!

Had a great experience at Hotel G. The place was beautiful and cozy! Our room was also equipped with all the amenities we would need (such as greattttt toiletries which smelt amazing).   Would definitely return to Hotel G!

Read some comments complaining about the room size and was prepared for it. Stayed 2 nights in Good Queen Room at 13th floor with small backpacks for 2 persons. I like the design and the room space is acceptable for me and should be OK too for close frens/couples/family/solo traveller (except those prefer more space to walk in room or bring a lot of large luggages). The room provides all I need (except a mini fridge & iron). Bencoolen MRT station is <200m walk from hotel. But the bed is a bit too soft.

Nice, simple and clean. Near by MRT station. Is about 45-50minutes to the airprt by train. Change station. By taxi us around 25minutes and cost 17-20 sing Singaporean dollars ($13-16 USD). Check in and out was smooth. Nice bar and burger shop at ground level (street level) Breakfast. Average. No much cheese types.

review_title: Great place close to the Business District in Singapore
review_text: - Excellent and modern rooms - fair size for Singapore. - Good breakfast with a lot of variety. They even accomodated vegetarian preference for breakfast items on request. - Clean - Quick checkin and checkout

Good location and breakfast but tiny rooms and stressed staff. Plenty of good eateries and shops nearby. Well connected to the rest of the city. Breakfast buffet is simply amazing and good value. But the rooms are super tiny and not ideally arranged. Staff seemed tense and curt.

Fantastic hotel in the heart of the city. If you’re coming from airport Bencoolen mrt station is literally a stone’s throw away.  Bugis, chinatown and Little india are very close.  Hotel has 2 trendy restaurants in the ground floor.  We were at room 501 , that’s the 5th of the probable ? 16 floors they have. Slightly disappointed with the size of the room but i’d say the room was cleverly designed.  Massive showerhead, very comfortable bed, free cold and hot drinking water on every floor, okish view from the room ( would’ve loved upper floors ), very helpful staff made our stay very comfortable.  I don’t mind staying at the hotel again but i dont’t mind exploring other options in Singapore for prices we paid.

review_title: Sad want-to-be copy of a SoHo House or Ace Hotel
review_text: OK, how little did the owner spend in the renovation of this hotel? Terribly executed design, going for industrial chic, comes off as bad copy with abundant use of imitation (plastic laminated woods, wall paper with cement look, plastic bricks)...and, horrible ¨dream catcher¨ light fixtures, ugly curtains, and nasty little shower with a shower curtain (gross!). No place to open the suitcase, child size desk...and, the gym is a complete waste -- no mats for stretching, a machine that was broken, and freezing jet of air. Although the hotel price is cheap, so is the decor. I hated the hotel.

I’m very disappointed at the room cleaning. I saw many dirt all over the room. I chose not to change the linen, but I didn’t expect tissues still on the bed after they did the bed. No tissue in the tissue box after cleaning...

review_title: Clean great location but rooms are a little small
review_text: Had a great stay. Location is great with easy access to great cafes and authentic food. Rooms are really nice but compact. You can literally sit on the toilet and have a shower but didnt detract from the overall experience.

Execellent design, good friendly staff , reasonable price very clean n bright room , very comfort bedding very nice design outside and inside nice bar and also get a welcome drink from the hotel taxi service very quick location very good mtr very close aswel

It was wonderful to stay at Hotel G and just the rest we needed after a long journey. I would recommend Hotel G to anyone traveling to Singapore! I loved the rooms, hospitality and atmosphere. Hopefully see you again!

Hotel G Singapore  Singapore  nice but small  582566351  nice location very small rooms tight space clean no dressers not much room for suitcases  i dont have much more to add... these words are just to add up to 200 minimum characters

review_title: A perfect stay for holiday nor business
review_text: In the center of downtown and easy to reach from bus station and MRT station exit A. It is located very near with national museum of singapore just take a quick walk. Beside, we can also have a meal in the hotel or outside to get more various cuisine

Best designed and clean hotel in the middle of the city. Awesome staff and superb quality tolletries. Already extended my stay here and Would definitely recommend to friends and family. Even though size of the room is small, doesn't feel that way at all.stayed 10 days and loved each and every day. The 25 degrees burger place is awesome as well

review_title: Hip and trendy city center hotel
review_text: Hip and trendy city center hotel near bugi and bencoolen MRT.  Cool that they offer free local mobil with google maps, free local calls and free calls to certain countries as korea. Reception staff is friendly and helpful. Rooms are really cosy as in Tokyo. Anyhow clean, with desk, fresh water bottles every day and rainfall shower. Breakfast yes or no? Some words to help your with decision. A lot of eggs products as scrambelled, sunny side up,... toast, joghurt, cheese, fresh fruits, o and apple juice,... asian dishes as fried rice, kimchi rice, sweet sour chicken,.... Enjoy your stay in this vibrant hotel and town. Tip: Thursday is oysternight (each peace 1 SS, 2018)

Rooms were small but really nice and trendy. Love that the hotel is very central allowing us to easily go shopping or eat. Everything was perfect expect the elevators are quite slow. Will recommend this hotel

I have stayed at this hotel twice. Once before it was re-branded as Hotel G.  This hotel is great for people who doesn't need a lot of space.   Although small, everything else about it is great: Central Location, easy to get to, clean rooms and great helpful staff.   I will definitely use this hotel again as home base whenever I travel to Singapore.

I booked the premium Queen room as Booking.com popped up to be the recommendation for 2 perons staying. The room we had was rather small, but at least cosy.  The aircon was not working for the first two days, after complaining lots- they decided to change the room for us, to another Premium Queen Room but the new room seems alot bigger.  It was rather like a 3stars hotel than 4 but the staffs and services was fine, friendly and approachable.  Recommend you to book this hotel for staycation not Vacation

Very tiny room.  Bed is next to wall in corner, my husband basically wakes me up in order to get out of bed.  Terrible layout.  Bathroom wall is glass enclosure and when lights are turn on in bathroom, the entire room is also lit, waking me up.  Bathroom is a glass door, and next to bed, no privacy and hard to close door.  Sink is outside of bathroom next to bed.  No refrigerator  No sitting lounge other than small busy reception lobby.  My husband had to sit in the gym to read to give me more time to sleep No hot kettle in room but hot water outside on floor

Room is clean and bed is comfy. We have not tried the bar but it’s always packed. Hopefully will have time to try when we return the next round. There’s also a lot of cafes near by.  It’s near to 3 mrt stations, which is very convenient. Even though grab sometimes has issues picking up from lobby because of the obscure entrance and there is no place to stop at the hotel entrance.

Hotel very well located close to MRT, Little India etc. Staff very friendly and helpfull, Excellent breakfast. Rooms are VERY small and soleless - no room for anything, bed touching walls on three sides!

There are lots of transportation nearby. You can be with some walk to Bencoolen, Bugis, Dhoby Ghaut station. And also bus stops are there. Of course, 7-11 is in accross he road. The hotel building and room afe very fashionable.

The last time I stayed here, it was under a different management operating under the name Big Hotel.  The size of the rooms are the same but it's decos HV change into modern, cozy n chic. If you are just passing through spore over the weekend and looking into reasonably cheap, clean and conveniently located boutique hotels then I recommend G Hotel. Everything are within less than 5 mins walk away. Will definitely be back. 😍

Stayed at the hotel for four night, the location is definitely great, very convenient with bus and metro, the breakfast was delicious and there are lots of markets and bars around it so no worry getting bored at night.

Stayed at the hotel for 3 nights.  I cant say one bad thing about it.  It is above the restaurant and bar in a nice busy area.  The staff are fantastic and cant do enough for you. The hotel is clean and modern. We would definately stay in future.

Good and convenient location.Very nice and cosy hotel. Small room size but still suitable for couple or single traveller. Surrounding have alot of local food and shopping mall. Friendly staff.  Ps: hotel lobby at 2nd floor. U can access the lift via the restaurant

We had a wonderful family staycation  at this hotel which is strategically located between Bugis Junction & Orchard Road. Though the room is small, the space is optimized and the decor is very nice and cozy.

I booked this hotel as a reasonably budget/cheap option for Singapore and it definitely exceeded my expectations! This is a really modern and clean hotel. The basic rooms are compact but cosy and comfortable. The breakfast was well worth the price, staff were very helpful... overall, highly recommend!

Room much smaller than expected. Breakfast was a total waste of space food was cold even when one of the first  persons in the dining room at 7.00 am. No variety and the traveling up and down steps did not at all add to the experience (breakfast displayed on 2 levels with 10 or so steps between them Coffee was some of the worst I had ever experienced (made by machine)

Awesome and friendly staff, smooth check-in and out experience, Clean and nice fragrance hotel with chic design , cozy greater room with an small upgrade fees.  Improvement  The water dispenser was out of service for my floor.

Everything was great when i visit G hotel. the hotel personnel cound not have been more solicitous. Friendly, attentive service from a hotel employee. but, i'm little bit sad about the bathroom because of crawlspace.

review_title: A lovely boutique Hotel in central Singapore
review_text: You should advise that the rooms / bed are not easy to access or move around in for people with any physical disability or joint problem. Staff were very helpful with assisting our needs. Rom was too small for International travel luggage needs. Great central location for walking and train services.

review_title: Good location if you don't mind the small room size
review_text: Room is way too small.  It is fine for one person but seriously, I cannot imagine staying here with two person and big luggages as you will not even find space to put your luggages.  Not a place that I will be back for more visit.  Also, disappointed that the so call two hours early check in as offered by booking.com was only available subject to availability.  That is as good as saying is a marketing gimmick  and not an exclusive offer as most hotel will offer early check in and late check out subject to availability.

Firstly, I would personally liked to thank Mr Ahmad and the management team for their warmth welcome. Due to surgery, I have contacted the hotel to postpone my trip. After few rounds of negotiations, the management have expressed generosity and allowed me to change the travel dates. Not only that, the hotel also listened to the guest's remarks, and gave us the highest floor. I really appreciate the kind gestures.   Here are my personal review of the hotel:   Room: +free trendy phone (with internet access) +comfortable king bed  +interactive tv (more channels now, including hbo, sports, movie channels) +fast wifi +big room +free ice and drinking water at walkway +4 pillows +bed cushion  Hotel lobby +manager stationed at the lobby to welcome and help guest with their check-in and

review_title: Decent property but not value for money
review_text: Very close to Downtown line MRT Station. Limited / No veg options in breakfast. The room space was too less ,but the service was satisfactory.Chairs can be better. Not suitable if you want to work for lonng hours with your laptops

Light of bathroom was not functional and socket over hot when I charged iPhone. Light of bathroom turned on and turn off when I sleeping.It is very weird.Hotel MUST check this room for safety concern.

Tried to stay at this hotel with my colleague, the room is small, bathroom is also small. The overall design is nice & thoughtful, the basic equipment is provided: hairdryer, safe deposit box, kettle. The room doesn’t have cupboard, they make use of the space really well. I just don’t really like the yellow light & the dream catcher ornament..

very small room, it said 16 m2 with the king size bed, but room is small, no closet, no space for laugage. I booked from Booking.com and would like to upgrade to the queen size bed.  On booking, the difference is very tiny, but the hotel does not allow me to upgrade with booking difference, does not allow me to cancel. We will not choose the hotel with the inflexible way.  By the way, after the cleaning, we found the floor of the room is still not clean.  The advantage is the location

Nice location with good bar and restaurant. Walking distance to Bugis Junction. A lot eatery place with local, Asian and western dishes. Room was nice and complete with free phone for call and internet.

review_title: Nice place - but were were not given the rooms we booked
review_text: Whilst this report is based on our negative experience, the hotel in general was lovely. Our problem was that the photo pictured in our booking and confirmation (and according to details on the booking) was not the room we received (4 guests, 2 rooms). There was only room for navigating around the bed. We were told our luggage needed to be kept in the lobby or outside our door! ARE YOU KIDDING ME? We're staying here 5 days! We were then made to PAY EXTRA PER DAY, PER ROOM to get the room we originally booked simply so we could keep our luggage with us! Other guests were at the lobby complaining too about the very same thing. We realised they were given their upgrade for free because they were much more vocal. Clearly we were taken for a ride!

Everything is awesome!! But the best was each room was provided with 1 cellphone that we can use to call each other in singapore for free and can be used for GPS Navigation. The Location is very close to Bencoolen & Bugis MRT Station.

Overall, it is good. The Bed was great, comfortable, and spacious. Food was great. Mr. Luke was accommodating during our check out. Some staff during our check in and stay was like confusing. Location is great, for taxi, bus, and MRT going to Changi airport, Marina Bay Sands, Vivo CIty to Sentosa. The downside was just not so spacious for the price we paid but it is tolerable.

review_title: Ok hotel with very small rooms
review_text: It is located near downtown and near subway so convenient.   Rooms are very small ans enrerance to the lobby is bit awakard   goes near the restaurant but overall good value for the money..i would recommend

The Hotel managed to suprise positively. The room was very smartly built and therefore convenient. The breakfast offered something for every one. We slept very well, and the only minor issue to mentiin was that the air-conditioning had to be carefully adjusted before going to sleep. Once we found a good setting, nothing disturbed our sleep.
travel_type: Trip type: Travelled as a couple

review_text: Upon our check in, there's no welcoming faces or gestures from the receptionist. Overall we enjoy our stay at Hotel G. We booked for Good Queen Room and they just upgraded our room to a slightly bigger room. The location of the hotel is strategic and easy to get around the city with public transport. A few bus stop is just around the corner.
travel_type: Trip type: Travelled as a couple

review_text: The hotel offered everything you need for visiting Singapore city. There are hotels a little closer to the city cente, but I found none in this price range. Very nice were the drinking water stations on every floor and the mobile with free internet you could take with you for free while exploring the city. Breakfast was great and offered a variety of

Hotel and rooms have a great look, feel and vibe. I stayed in the great king room on the 15th floor and it is tight but manageable with 2 people. Rooms are clean, quiet, A/C works great and the bed was very comfortable. It's in an excellent location for all your tourist needs and there is free ice and water on the floor. There is a very nice restaurant/bar downstairs and a burger bar. The only negatives is that the water pressure is a bit low and the water temperature can fluctuate. Other than that it's a great place to stay and would definitely stay here again.

review_title: Fifth time and I´ll come again
review_text: As usual the stay was very good. I stayed for three nights. The checkIn and out is quick and the staff is very friendly. Missing a sleeping fuction on the remote control. Rooms are small but designed well.

review_title: Big hotel facilities, small hotel friendliness!
review_text: I am a frequent budget-conscious business traveller to Singapore and I recently tried out Hotel G. I really loved the 'big hotel facilities, small hotel friendliness' of the place. The rooms were narrow but very well-designed to make the most of every square centimetre of space. A built-in wardrobe had been sacrificed for more floor and desk space. A cool feature was the spotlit niche under the platform bed for stashing your suitcase. I took advantage of a brilliant corporate promotion that 'forced me' to be sociable as it included a complimentary glass of wine daily, as well as two pieces of free laundry. Smart marketing, because I ended up eating at the hotel with my son five nights out of my 13-night stay. The lovely bartenders Habil and Fi at Ginett (the hotel bar and French/rotisserie restaurant on Level 1) should be singled out for special mention. They recognised my son and I without fail, warmly welcomed us and made me feel 'at home' even when I was drinking and dining alone. The food is fabulous. My son, a carnivore, almost licked his steak plate (he had the ribeye with mash and pepper sauce). I loved the root vegetables and the great-value bar bites. The Beetroot Tartare and the various generous single portions of fresh cheese were delicious. Another brownie point was scored when my request for complimentary late check-out was accommodated (hotel policy was flexed on the basis of the length of my stay – a personal touch that I greatly appreciated). Hotel G gets an A!

I stayed for one night only. They were very friendly. And room was really clean (small, but is cool), breakfast was good, too. there's near by station, shopping center, toast box ...important thing is best price!
travel_type: Trip type: Travelled as a couple

review_text: Room was clean, bed was comfortable, great location, close to subway. Staff was flexible and willing to help. We were able to check in early to drop off our luggage, and get comfortable prior to our plan ahead.
travel_type: Trip type: Travelled as a couple

review_text: I recently stayed for a quick business trip to singapore and enjoyed my stay at Hotel G very clean and freindly staff with a great little bar and resuarant down stairs and a great central location for meeting people

Good value for money but room lacked the space necessary for an extended stay. There was no hanging or storage space for clothes so lived out of suitcase, nowhere to sit other than a chair at a desk which was too small to work from so that just left the bed which was too short for my 6 feet 3 inches....
Oh, and the fried eggs for breakfast, though immaculately prepared were cold by the time they reached the plate. That said, there was a magnificent selection for breakfast, something to suit all nationalities!

Small but well-planned rooms, high ceiling, good/gentle air condition. Comfortable beds! No wardrobes or closets at all, very few hangers. Cleaning service very friendly and efficient, but there were hairs (not mine) on the bathroom floor beside the toilet from my arrival until I departed. Overall clean feeling apart from that.   Breakfast buffet nice, although very few gluten-free options and somewhat stressful staff (telling you sternly that breakfast soon closes when there is still 15 minutes left).   Nice but pricy hotel bar/restaurant. Plays summer-style funky house music (think Hed Kandi from 15 years ago), saxophones and flutes, in the bar area nonstop.  Efficient and friendly staff in checkin-checkout lobby. Extremely slow elevators.  Will stay there again, but will go

Room was descent & sufficient for two people with good breakfast as well. I was expecting a wardrobe to keep all our belongings, without that it was little difficult to manage. Appreciate if we can have smaller wardrobe to keep our clothes.

Great Location & Great Service.   Room was a bit small.  But for a Business trip it  was appropriate.  It would be best that the 200 character minimum is avoided in a feedback as it makes more difficult to give a feedback.

comfortable room,  small but very clean n suit for short stay.  the staffs very helpfull. Good location. Dont have a change to taste the food maybe they have to give a free breakfast once........... lol. I will recomm to others

Breakfast started at 7 o’clock, but we had to wait 20 minutes till everything prepared. Service at breakfast was not good, there was no waitress to take our used plates etc. Room was small, no place for your luggage or for your clothes. Reception is on second floor and not easy to find from street.

The hotel is more expensive Bacause the room is very very small and is expensive for this service We don't have swimming pool and the parking is not free.  I not recommendation this hotel because I was visit more hotels and the price is ok but this is expensive acordint to the quality and service

the room quite small, clean,good place near transports and shopping mall. the place 's very nice. give free drink in Ginatt and i love to eat Burger in 25 degree also. The staff  is friendly. Aircon & shower were satisfactory.

I truly did not expect much from the pictures online, and some of the reviews are a bit harsh, but it was inexpensive.  The Hotel G exceeded far and away all expectations.  Yes - rooms are small. Unless you want to pay more money in Singapore that is the reality. For two of us it was perfect. The room is tastefully decorated and honestly really cool(pictures don’t do it justice). Space is used very well, there’s lots of nooks to place your stuff. The bed is so comfortable, shower is really nice, and it’s CLEAN!!  One of the coolest things was they give you a phone as part of the room - with some tinkering we turned it into a pocket wifi and it was SO helpful on our adventures in Singapore!  The restaurant attached is delicious and the bar is super reasonable.  Location is great.

review_title: The check-in process is too much complicated
review_text: The room is small but neat,clean and tidy. We feel comfortable and had a good sleep.  Things the poor thing is the shower-facilities, the bathrooms is too small and the water flow is too slow. Not really enjoin.

review_title: All you need and a bit more
review_text: Being on a business trip I do not want to stay in the usual business hotels and chains but experience something differently - as in private life. The Hotel G Singapore offers all what you need and expect if you are on business but still in a different way.

The bed was quite comfortable. The facility had a cool concept of providing hot and cool water which was available  24 hours. Location was very convenient and was surrounded by nice and interesting places. However , some facilities that they had  provided like a phone (which was part of the Business King Room Plan) which you could use for making international calls. The sad part was that the phone sucked and it was not reachable too. The reception desk was limited and cold in their response to our queries.Payment was charged to my credit card before I checked in.

Hotel G is decently located and around good amentities, food spots, and transport. Service is attententive and considerate l. Rooms meet necessities and easily meet all expectations and more. Overall 5/7

Great location Good staff & prompt service Room is too small The associated restaurant is rather expensive Deposit taken at check-in time could take more than 2 weeks to be returned (found out afterwards)

Stayed for a week at this hotel in a queen room just a step above the most basic.  My room was more spacious than I thought.  It was clean, quiet and laid out well.  I paid approx. $88 USD per night w/o breakfast which I think for Singapore was a great deal.  The hotel has a great location.  Truthfully, you could walk to every part of the city if you wanted to.  From the airport I took the MRT to Expo, then from Expo to Bencoolen and it was about a 3 minute walk.  One thing I do wish they had would be a computer for those staying in the hotel to use.  I'm not up on checking emails on phones, etc. so I had to go to Little India to use a computer which really was something that could be remedied by installing a little desk with computer somewhere.  They were very accommodating in

This is our first time visit but very memorable. Small room but unique. Got a surprise goose for our wed anniv which is very nice. Water dispenser on each floor is very good. Hotel also can gave late check out till 2pm which is really appreciated since our flight is at nite. Thank you Hotel G !

It located just few minutes walk from Bugis Station of MRT. Easily access by all means of transport system. Shopping mall nearby, restaurants, Bugis Street market, shops surrounding you.  Reception desk located at the 2nd floor, it's filled with smiling faces staff, they are nice and helpful. A restaurant & bar at the ground floor provide convenience to all guests with quick meals & snacks.

it's a really amazing place,i will definitely go there for my second trip to Singapore. Stuffs there always take customer's need for first,and really patient to solve our problems,a wonderful experience i would say.  :)

Lobby as at level 2 in a carpark, taxi has difficulty finding entrance for drop off. Bell hop service would be a plus point. Wash basin is so tiny I don’t know how I can use it without getting the area wet.  A handy phone in the room for free usage. Thumbs up!

I stayed in this hotel for one night. The staff and facilities were great. The atmosphere of the restaurant is calming and relaxing. Perfect location for Singapore and moving around the neighbourhood quickly. I will be staying back here again.

Disappointed, room clean, shower hot, searching for positives in our 5 day stay, Room safe locked on arrival, nil instructions asked at reception twice to have opened, to hard basket.... not done... the king bed had walls on three sides and had to climb over each other to get into bed so older guests no. The motel wants a young crowd. The motel reception told us on three occasions breakfast on till 10:30am but all packed up just before 10am. Checked again with reception guess what they said it should be available.  Noise insulation between rooms not up to standard, room above had rabbits.... snoring from next door.... Of course we had prepaid to get a good deal but what is advertised is not what you get......will return to Singapore not hotel G..... and I will ensure not on our

Although the room is a little small in size, it was comfy and pleasant.  Bed was super soft and the staff / cleaners are so friendly.  It was a bit troublesome to go out to take water and ice but luckily my room was close to the dispensers. Overall, I enjoyed my stay .

I used to stay at the Big hotel, and this is my first time after it has changed to Hotel G. The rooms are very good and clean. Internet is fast. The bed and duvet and the pillows are very soft. I have a few suggestions:  1. The air freshener in each floor is very strong, I think you should reduce this. 2. The bathroom grouting in my shower needs to be regrouted as you can see some black marks on it already. It is room 1420

We had a 1 night stopover and selected Hotel G for the price and location. Absolutely brilliant. Clean rooms with pristine white sheets and big clean towels. Check in staff were a little disinterested, but overall it was great. Service lift from the street for baggage and reception is next to the car park , so the taxi picks you up straight from the door. Really friendly checkout staff and a great cheapest bar downstairs. We were expecting matchbox size rooms, but they are more than big enough. Give this place a go. You will be happy.

Bed was extremely comfortable but the room is a bit small. There are cool and chilling bar and relaxing restaurant at lvl 1, but can get a bit noisy and crowded at late night. Hotel also provide guests with welcome drinks.

Room was clean and cosy. Hotel's vibe is very cool and art-like, the service here is good as well. The bathroom in the room i was staying at is clean and easy to us. It's near shops and restaurants too.Overall would love to stay here again.

review_title: Modern, stylish hotel in ideal location
review_text: This modern and funky hotel is in an ideal location for exploring Singapore, with three MRT stations within walking distance serving different lines (Bencoolen, Bugis and Doby Ghaut). As other reviews have noted rooms are a little on the small side (there is little storage space and we had to juggle our two large cases, but it was doable) but are very well kept and comfortable. Free 3G handy phone, water and ice bucket and USB charger slots were very useful. Two downstairs restaurants are both great and there is a bar that is popular with hotel guests and locals alike.

The location is superb ! In the heart of everything ! Specially local foods in walking distance ! Bunch of choices for different veriaties of foods and local thingy that everybody will love ! The hotel was so clean and tidy . Housekeeping was perfect !

Loving the look and feel of the hotel, great housekeeping, toilet is a little small but still manageable. Everything was clean, the bed was very comfortable. Would definitely recommend my family and friends to stay in this hotel in the future. The receptionists were very friendly, understanding and helpful.

We stayed 2 nights here, yes the room is not big but we just go to the room to sleep and shower by the way the shower was really good! Room very clean, breakfast good, excellent location!  Would return and highly recommend!

I stayed at G for one night in May. Location is excellent, close to Bugis area, closest MRT station is a few minutes walk away. My room was compact, but very clean and in good condition. The interior design is modern and fresh. Staff were friendly. Breakfast was nice, better than average hotel fare (13 SGD). Drinks were good in the downstairs restaurant. Other than that (and breakfast) I didn't try it. Overall I enjoyed my stay and would recommend it!

Good clean room for a short stay, albeit small. Comfortable bed. We appreciated being able to organize early check in and late departure to coincide with flights. Good location close to shops restaurants and transport.

review_title: To small and no window, but clean and phone for free
review_text: The room was very clean, a phone for free call and internet was good,  but the room was to small and have no window to open. If I shower the room was wet. The hotel was good for 2 days to visit India town and orchard road.

Clean with a simplistic design. Value for money! My girlfriend and I had a fantastic time over at Hotel G. Comfortable, well-thought out layout. We love the fact that there is music playing to welcome us whenever we enter the room. Would stay again!

Good location, very central, clean room and friendly helpful staff. However room was smaller than expected. Had to call for a taxi at 4am in the morning and staff was very helpful about it. Less than 5-minute walk to Bencoolen MRT station which was excellent.

Lets go with the Good things:  - Location is excellent with 3 different MRT Lines within walking distance. That's the main reason I picked this hotel. - Rooms are clean and well organised with funky deco, rather small but at the price I won't complain.  And then: - The guy who handled my check in was indifferent and sarcastic, I really wish I never need to meet him again. Such poor attitude. - It's hard to believe the hotel is 4 star, there is barely anything. - Breakfast room had flies. On the first morning, tried to only take fried eggs fresh from the counter, fried rice in the closed pot, and pastries that were covered with a cloth but no avail: I was stricken with food poisoning after a few hours for the rest of the day and the half and and had to spend the day with diarrhea

review_title: Love their "handy"! A very warm arrangement to every tourist!
review_text: It is sometimes quite an issue to find good food and the way in a foreign country. To use the country's network, it could be quite puzzling at mobile plans and data services. Yet, this hotel solved all these problems for their customers! This hotel has arranged "handy" - a cellphone - for customers to bring out of the hotel during their stay, which allows customers to dial free local calls and access to the internet freely on street. It helps us a lot when we need to find a place on Google Map or find good food on the internet. This arrangement did surprise me and my companion! Rooms are small, yet clean and tidy with cosy deco. It was good enough for a short stay for different types of travellers. Customer service was very good and staff were very helpful and nice. The check-in

Less than 10mins walk to mrt station. A lof of eating place nearby. Room a bit small but is clean. I have the queen room. the bed is huge thus occupied 2/3 of the roomm space. I have 1 cargo luggage and 1 cabin luggage and i barely have space to walk. The staff are helpful. Overall is great for short stay

Stayed here couple times, it’s called BIG hotel before, nothing has changed much except for the name. There’s a cool bar downstairs, and all the furniture is customised. Great location but pretty smalllllll room. Other than that, it’s pretty good.

Great location, walkable to subway, bus, restaurants, coffeeshops, Bugis street.... Small room but very cozy and comfy bed. Quiet and neat. Friendly and helpful staff, they offer a handy phone with 3G to use, very thoughtful and useful for your trip. Big restroom, don't have fridge in my room but they have hot water machine and ice is at the hallway. Nice bar and restaurant, great cappuccino btw.

review_title: Surprisingly Quaint Hotel in a Metropolis
review_text: Was impressed how the staff assisted in an early checkin request, even they stated 2pm is standard checkin time. They provided options for solutions, which is very appreciated knowing we had a very tiring long travel since a day before. Breakfast was very nice too and the best is the handy phone, its a help around the city and purchased cheaper tour tickets too. The only room for improvement is at least for team to be more friendly, i know its a city hotel, but smiling more and looking more approachable would be surely helpful rather than being robotic around work. Highly appreciate HK team..those ladies are very engaging and caring as well. Please always check expiry of your yogurt items as well, i appreciate that it was fixed quickly by your chef this morning, just a gentle

I appreciate the concept and the room is cleverly thought through, and the bed is very comfortable and the shower is very good, with quality amenities. However, I felt really claustrophobic. Also, I was put in a bad mood on arrival. Of course, check in is a chore -- especially after a tiring flight. And as a budget traveler, i would have expected a bit more thoughtfulness on the part of the check in person. I asked which was the best way to get to Orchard Road, and he said that walking to the MRT was long, and that the Taxi ride would be about $5. So I opted for the taxi. Which cost $12 -- and proved embarrassing as I didn't have enough Singapore cash. As it turns out, the MRT is a short and relatively pleasant walk away. As well, there was a glitch in the electronic system in

Staff are really nice, location is close to every tourist spots, room is nice and clean for me, it wasn't small at all. If 2 people are staying in great king room then you might feel its small.  overall Im satisfied!! I would definately come back

This is my 2nd time return to stay at this hotel due to location. Bed is comfortable, room is very small, location is very convenient except the main lobby which is located at the 2nd floor and if you have huge and heavy luggage, it will not be very convenient for you to pull all the way down from the bars & restaurant stairs, few minutes walk to MRT and malls. Over all, awesome and great stay!

Hotel G is perfectly locaded for a citytrip. you can walk to most of the sightseeing points. it's a really nice and stylish hotel. I just have one thing, that i don't like. it was the aircondition, which blow at the bed. so we had to switch it off during ther night.

This was the first time I stayed at Hotel G.  Great location and style - clean rooms and well appointed.  Yes - the rooms are smaller than some but this is like many hotels in Asian cities.  Easy to walk to many areas and many buses/subway stops around.  Good cafes and restaurants nearby and on same subway line as Changi Airport.  Can walk to southern end of Orchard  Road - Little India and Arab Street also very close.  Handy Phone was great for exploring Singapore.

The location is very near mrt and eateries place, you can access the Bencoolen mrt station, Bugis mrt station and bras Basah mrt station within walking distance. However, the waiting time for lift is too long, we will need to queue or wait for 5-10 mins during afternoon and night time.

Small Hotel, small rooms but really nice. It’s second once for me in Hotel G and I’ll book again as soon as possible I come back in Singapore. Excellent Service. Personnel is very kind and professional. Strategically located into Singapore

Overall service was good, rooms were trendy and modern. I could complain about the lift and the system it follows, but we opted for stairs not to be lazy instead.  Perfect location, love the hawkers downstairs for affordable lunch and dinner, also 25 degrees is great restaurant.  Only issue would be the cleaners and their ability to clean the small rooms which they are. Overlooking dirty glasses, not cleaning the floors, sometimes no water bottle refills, etc.

review_title: Elevator is too late and inconvenient, but the others are very excellent
review_text: Good point ・near the station ・hotel and around place is fashionable and cool ・restful atmosphere around hotel  ・better price Bad point ・facilities（Elevator is too late） ・Washroom（water pressure is little weak）

Booked a room because of the 40% discount and was generally pleased with the entire stay. The rooms are tastefully and thoughtfully furnished, which made the whole experience very personable and unique. Only thing I'd suggest is to perhaps include more tv channels, but apart from that, I'd definitely come back for another stay!

We really enjoyed our two days stay there. Great serivce, cool atmosphere and comfy room. Quite close to mrt stations. Theneighbourhood is also quite nice. Close by bugis junction, haji lane and another touristy place.

review_title: As cosy as it can get
review_text: I find myself returning to Hotel G everytime I need a place to stay near the city. Cosy and accessible. There is a wine bar just downstairs and a burger bar to satisfy my hunger pangs at night. Concierge was very helpful as well!

We thoroughly enjoyed staying at this hotel. The staff are very friendly & helpful. We were surprised how small the room is, but in saying that once you got used to it, was vey comfortable & so clean. The restaurant on level 1 is a fabulous place to eat.

review_title: Affordable accommodation at a convenient location
review_text: Pros: - Conveniently located near Bugis - Stylish interior  - Adequately equipped with necessities (e.g. toothbrush, shampoo, slippers, hair dryer) - Clean room with a few cable TV channels - Water(hot/cold) and ice dispenser at every level - Comfortable  - Complimentary welcome drink   Cons: - Rather poor noise cancellation. My room was near the lift and I was awoken by noises by guests  - No free parking. $15 parking coupon available for purchase (valid for 24 hours from time your vehicle enters carpark) - Rather small room. Will be too congested for more than 2 persons - Showering area and the toiletbowl area segregated only by shower curtains. Might wet the entire toilet when bathing

I arrived at 6 am very jet lagged . Was told my room would not be available until 2 pm . I enquired if any other rooms were available . Yes they were but it would cost another $80 per night for an upgraded room . This came across as a well rehearsed money grab to entice travellers to get immediate access to a room . Many guests were complaining their rooms were tiny and not good value for money . One lift was broken the whole time. Which overloaded the other two remaining lifts which were verrrry slow in arriving at any time of the day or night

工作人員的態度都很好，服務很周到，地點便利，樓下就有餐酒吧也有24小時的大排檔，對面大樓有亞坤吐司也有7-11，非常方便，到武吉士地鐵站大概7-8分鐘，沿途會有傳統市場、武吉士商場，對面還有武吉士mall，要購物或吃東西都相當方便，周邊又有蘇丹回教堂跟哈芝巷這些景點，真的是很不錯的入住地點。I think it's a gooo experience to live here，next time I'll still choose HOTEL G

It was great time for staying hotel g singapore. Hotel room is very clean and comfortable. There are yakun kaya toast and toast box near hotel, so i could eat breakfast easily. The location is good because of 3 mrt station near hotel.

Loved my little room at Hotel G. I arrived very late at night and fell asleep in a comfortable bed; awoke the next morning, went to the gym and sampled a little bit of the breakfast offered downstairs.  I appreciated that the hotel was walking distance to everywhere I needed to get to and the staff were sweet.  Thank you.

review_title: The staff is very friendly. Floor corridor have water dispenser is very convenient.
review_text: The staff is very friendly. Floor corridor have water dispenser is very convenient. Location nearby MRT Bencoolen station and Bugis station, Bugis+ shopping mall, Masjid Sultan, Waterloo Guanyin temple. Room is very clean and comfortable.

Good ambience, good bed & clean. Thanks for the room upgrade for us. Its unexpected. Our comment for the use of the lift, the lift must be operated well because only 2 out of 3 works. So we have to wait if we want to go up or down

Hotel G is a perfect place if you want to stay in singapore. The room is not big but the price is acceptable and the environment is pretty good. The only thing is the cleaner didn't knock the door when he came to clean the room while I was sleepig in the morning at 10 a.m. You should remind your staffs about this.

We do enjoyed the stay in Hotel G. The room is decorated in trendy and warmly design. The restaurant & bar at the first floor is so stylish, recommend to hangout The location is so convenient, close to department store, bus stop and MRT.  Great place to stay :)

I booked a kings room and was told that upgraded was given however the bed doesn’t seemed like a king size bed. Stay was pleasant nevertheless. i was impressed with the gym room for the cleanliness and cosy.

The hotel is at a great location, clean rooms and comfy beds. The rooms are not too big but big enough to not feel claustrophobic. The rooms come with a phone that you can take out, super useful for internet outside the hotel and getting around. Unfortunately our phone did not charge properly and the hotel was not able to replace it before we went out. I lift was broken for the 4 nights we were there so you could end up waiting 10 mins for a lift to come to get you. Thee were just one off problems we had but our stay overall was good and I would recommend staying here.

central location. near MRT.  well lit and nicely designed room.  strong water pressure.  full amenities available. includes very useful Handy smartphone which offers very tempting discounts for major tours and attractions.  ample choices for breakfast. everything was delicious. very helpful and courteous staff. will come back for sure!

review_title: Great accessibility options but overall an okay experience
review_text: Positives:  1. Hotel had a vibrant environment. 2. Great accessibility options for persons with disabilities and also liked all the safety messages etc on fire hazards. 3. Good breakfast option. 4. They provide iron and table on request. 5. Rooms are equipped with everything you need. 6. Great place to socialize and hang out as the hotel has a restaurant downstairs. 7. Convenient location with great eateries around the hotel.  Negatives:  1. Really small and dark rooms. A nightmare for claustrophobic people. 2.Lift extremely slow. A few of my colleagues also got stuck in the lift for 15 minutes. Hotel extended their check out time and gave them a free airport transfer service but my colleagues used the stairs instead after the incident. 3. Rooms feel damp. You can't open any

review_title: Good hotel for quick business trip
review_text: I was in Singapore for a 3-day conference. Room was a bit small but everything else was fine. The Ginnet restaurant was very good. Internet and room services were also very good. The location was quite central and easy walking distance to most places.

Its so vitage and classic in style. Just the Street Level kinda pack with Restaurant that at the ground level. Too bad that its don have in room service to be order for my guest that stay in. Overall is quite acceptable.

room overall is good only 1 issue, no air circulation inside room. i have put air cond fan speed to HH, it seen like no huge different compare with L or H.  suggest put table fan or exhaust fan or window able to open.   thanks

Nice shower, comfort bed, compact room with good lightning. There is a SG SIM   card handphone provided, free of charge. There are many restaurants and cafe just around the corner. MRT station also in walking distance. Some tourist attraction such as Singapore Museum is also nearby. Perfect honeymoon holiday.

Hotel rooms were smaller than expected after making the booking so more defined room images would be nice. Overall the stay was pleasant enough. Bar downstairs is cool and the food was pretty good. Breakfast was nice. Elevators were slow.

For an acceptable overnight stay , it was meeting the minimum requirements. The service, cleanliness alue and location outbeat other in this category but sleep quality room is below my expectation for a 1st timer.

Very nice and professionnal staff. the room was cleaned every day. the situation of the hotel it is very good: 10min by foot to clark's quay. And the bar/restaurant of the hotel is very causal I recommend it

Room is clean and comfort with a nice smelling scent. Bernice is fast in checking us in and wears a really friendly smile!   Location is excellent to visit bugis area.   Suitable for either business or leisure traveller.

Good value for the money. Rooms are small but efficient for our needs for the one night. Breakfast was good with lots of options. Cabs were cheap to use to get around also from the hotel and to the Gardens by the Bay.

A budget hotel in a good location but with minimal expectation.  A few suggestions for hotel for improvement:  1. Staff at front office is a bit tired and feel their emotion 2.  Cannot accept that hotel refilled a used tissue roll to a guest.  The replaced tissue roll is only half roll 3. Blanket quality can be better   The rest is ok

Room was small but acceptable considering the price and location. Reception area was also very small and crowded during check in and check out. Staff was very efficient and friendly.  A reasonable choice for a busy traveler who does not plan to spend much time in the hotel.

Have restaurant nearby, 7-11, 5mins walk from mtr Bugis, staff given wonderful service, friendly and activity ask if u need to clean room or any help ,room is quiet, I didn’t heard any noise out of the room. u can check in at 2pm, exactly to match our arrival time. Might visit again.

I am a repeat customer. Nice rooms. Friendly Staff. Interestingly a lot of hoteliers from the Hotel EXPO are staying here and the hotel is overbooked. I also like the area. Lots of good local restaurants and shops around and about. Keep up the good work!!

review_title: Loving my stay in Hotel G
review_text: - Very good customer service and friendly staff - Room is very nicely cozy, comfy and well decorated. Absolutely love it! - Pretty good location as it's very near to Bencoolen MRT station and not too far from Bugis +, Bugis Junction and Bugis MRT station. - Love the fact that we can get free drinking water supply (hot and cold) as well as ice cubes just outside the room

This is far from the 4-star hotel. Mini hotel by size of rooms in a skyscraper over more than 20 floors. The mini room has everything that has a normal room (double bed occupies the width of the room). I missed the fridge. It was not possible to regulate the air conditioner. Settings did not work. At night, I was faint at an outside temperature of 25 to 32 degrees Celsius. The staff is friendly. The room is for experts who want such a room at a price that is for  a normal room around the world. In Singapore, I was not 12 years and everything changed with megalomaniac construction, which looks like is overlooked opportunity for a normal hotel stay. Underground Bugis 10 minutes, Bencoolen 7 minutes is not that close. The hotel has no instructions for access to underground or

This is an excellent modern hotel in a very convenient location - many attractions are within walking distance, and the Bencoolen MRT station is less than 200 metres away on the recently extended Downtown Line (which now goes out as far as Expo, one station from Changi Airport - the train fare from Bencoolen to Changi was a mere $2.50). My room was narrow and quite small, and couples might find the space less than they would like, but the bed was large and comfortable and the towels suitably thick (one of my tests for a good hotel). The breakfast is reasonably priced, especially if you can prebook the night before to get a discount (I paid $13, more like $15 actually once they add the service charge and GST; breakfast at a local Toastbox for example is even cheaper - and prices

review_title: Very good experience of my stay in Hotel G
review_text: Our plane arrived in Singapore at early morning. The staff informed us immediately when our room is available at 10 a.m. We spent all 3 nights at Hotel G during our trip, the service, quality and staff of Hotel G are all excellent. We did have a very nice experience while staying there:)

Great location with caring staffs, ground floor bistro and lounge bar also recommended!! Just couples of minutes away from Bencoolen subway station and several bus stations near the hotel, makes you much easier to go anywhere in Singapore

This is an interesting hotel in a good location. The rooms are small but reasonably well organized. Front desk staff are helpful and friendly. Buffet breakfast has lots of variety at a good price. Would stay here again.

Stayed with this hotel for 5 Days.  So impressed.  The rooms are so clean.  Rooms are quite small but designed to be comfortable.  They offer handyphone you can use for free and bring with you while you are out of the hotel.  Their staff are so courteous.  I would highly recommend this hotel.

1. Nice location, near bencoolen and bugis mrt. 2. Nice staff, responsive and friendly, proficient in both chinese and english 3. Clean and tidy room 4. Room for improvement : staff transferring trolley of stuff should set the lift for their own use, there was occasion that life door open, but big trolley inside and we can not enter

Stayed 2 nights at this hotel. I booked the smallest room(Queen Room) but was told been upgrade when checking in.  The room was neat and tidy. We asked for a quiet room so my mother and I slept well at night. All three elevators operate during my stay, great location and friendly staff. Would stay here again next time.

review_title: Great hotel at a great location
review_text: We stayed at Hotel G for one night. They were super accommodating to keep our luggage before our check in time since we arrived early morning in Singapore. We even left our luggage to be collected later after our check out since we had few extra hours to kill before our flight out of Singapore. The hotel is nice and clean, the stuff is great. They have a killer restaurant at the first floor. The location of the hotel cannot be better - there are tons of places to eat nearby and it's within 10 minutes walking distance from Bugis street and Albert Center. Overall we had a great experience. You may find the rooms a tad on the smaller side but they were sufficiently big with nice bed and bathroom.

review_title: Comfortable Room with Lovely Room Interior
review_text: I love how smooth the check in process is and how the room is so clean with a very comfortable bed. Lovely prompt service when we need an iron with the board. Housekeeping service was excellent as well.

I think this hotel is very comfortable, next time there is a chance to stay and recommend it to friends. The breakfast is delicious. The overall atmosphere is great. The service is very good. The traffic is also very convenient.

The space is so small that when you use the shower, the water flows into the room. Had to use towels and put them on the floor to avoid having the entire area wet.  I find it appalling that there is not even a boiler and that you have to walk to the dispenser to get some hot water.  One morning, there was no hot water to shower, and when asked about it, the staff tells me to turn the selector towards the red color. Thank you very much! I never knew that!!!!!!!!!

Stayed here for one week on business. Great central location, well equipped rooms and friendly staff. Will definitely stay here again and highly recommend the hotel to anyone traveling for business or leisure.

The room was small but functional, the bed next to the wall on one side did pose some difficulties. It was good value for the money though. Interesting coffee making facilities which were not explained. The hot water/ice station is on each floor and a Thermo jug is provided in the room. The restaurant/bar is really good and well worth a visit.  Great location.  The reception is on the first floor and is accessible via the street front restaurant or the cabs go  into the car park and drop you at the front entrance.

- Good facilities e.g. mobile with free internet access and free overseas call (though the purpose is to encourage you to book for transportation, admission ticket etc. through the hotel), free cooling water and ice making machine at each floor. - Locate at quiet area which perfect for those who seek peaceful area but not so far from Boocalen MRT station - Hotel staff were very nice and helpful

A very nice hotel with an amazing design in the center of the city. Several metro stations are within walking distance, as well as grocery shops and small restaurants. Several USB sockets in the room, which is very convenient. Loved staying there.

A beautiful, central and elegant hotel in Singapore. So close to the subway that takes you pretty much everywhere in the city. Our room was a little bit too small for two people with two big luggages, but was always clean and equipped with everything you need. The restaurants are sooooo good and the breakfast (15 dollars) was worthy every penny. So going back the next time in Singapore!

The location is just 5 mins away from MRT station, easily accessible to nearby shopping areas and airport. The room is small but clean and stylish. The bed is comfortable. You can get drinkable hot/cold water and ice from the machine on every floor. The hotel restaurant got nice food too!

review_title: A good memory at Bencoolen St.
review_text: - Very impressive for accommodation and dining. - but so tight and cramp elevators - friendly staffs  - a bit less of choice for breakfast - longer hairdryer power cord would be better. - night light mode in the room would be nicer.

The rooms were small but the space was utilized wisely. There’s no fridge in the room but they do have an ice and water dispenser with hot/cold water. We loved the interiors; there’s a dream catcher in every room. Location is excellent. Walking distance to plaza singapura and other orchard shopping centers.

Great hotel close to a number of food stalls at around Bugis. Easy access with the metro or buses. The room interior is very nice, and I had a great view to the city. Everything is clean, staff is super friendly.  Things to improve: long waits for the elevator, access via the bar is not the most convenient.

review_title: Excellent little experience at your cosy hotel
review_text: Amazing hotel with kind staff. Very caring and when I had any issue they responded to my concern as soon as possible specially the manager. They make feel comfortable at the hotel. They also upgraded my room with no extra charge.

The room is small but cute and very clean and comfortable. Perfect for what we want and very centrally located. Highly recommended! We also liked the restaurant Ginette that was within the hotel property.

A very lovely Boutique Hotel, ice and hot water for tea and coffee in the Hallway, but very easy to operate the machine, the Bed linen was  lovely, the Hotel staff were excellent, it was very clean and a Great Location for the Night Markets and only a 30 minute walk to the Water Front and Marina Sands Hotel complex, take a 40 minute River Tour for $25 Dollars each well worth it

This hotel is convenient to Singapore transit system. Roughly about 5 mins away and situated close to eateries around. Staff is great and welcoming. Wife and I had a room where it is quiet and hardly heard any noises. Will consider this hotel again if we return to Singapore.

The place is quite close to the MRT as well as some bus stations, by walk I can reached to the Bugis shopping mall and market. Good restaurants around also. The room is clean but one day they forgot to give me the new toothbrush ... but overall speaking it is a very good place and I recommend it.

I was enough of this hotel services of business. I wanted the closet in the room. The temperature of the air Conditioner in my room was set at 23 degrees as standard and I felt a bit cold. It was hotel which was suitable for price.

Stayed 3 nights in a tiny but beautiful and clean room.  Stylish hotel, well organized, very friendly staff and a superb restaurant made it a great experience in a perfect location to explore Singapore sights and shopping.

Plus = chic design, good location, good service, strong water pressure, clean, affordable Minus = AC blows directly to our bed. Bathroom light penetrates the glass wall, it may disturb light sleeper (like me) if somebody uses the bathroom at night. No fridge

Walk 10 minutes to Bugis mrt. Tired if you go and back to Hotel G everyday trip There are restaurants, supermarket , 7eleven and YavKung nearby.  Hotel room is clean and tidy. Noise acceptable. But room size is small upon the price.

Everything was really great- the staff, the room, even how the magically the hallway smelled. There was a slight odor in my room possibly from too many showers in the past. Otherwise it was lovely and I have no complaints!

review_title: Artist Abundance and All that you need
review_text: Although the room sizes can vary from a very small/cozy room to crash in. It's cool Decore, central location, clean and perfect bed/linen/pillows. Pits this against any overpriced palace. Unless you came to Singapore to stay in your room, I give this place top marks

-accessible location via MRT (Downtown Line-blue) and bus stops;within Bugis area _3 min walk to convenience store like 7-11; 5-7 min to shopping mall-Bugis Junction/Bugis+ _ clean room, including hallway as it smells better )probably because it is a non smoking floor/hoetel?) -confused as to why my toiletries(shampoo, conditioner, bodywash) are being changed everyday when I have used it once. there's a foil cover in the contained and I have to open them everytime -be advised that the lobby is at the 2nd floor!  some taxi drivers do not know this and is not aware on how to access the parking entrance of the building _taxi service has additional fees as well; should have been part of their information -if you are walking and going to the hotel, you have to pass through their

review_title: Great pick to discover and enjoy Singapore
review_text: The hotel is a great pick to discover and enjoy Singapore. Its location is very central and close to MRT stations (especially Bencoolen). Accommodation is stylish and comfortable. Reception staff is helpful and very friendly. Book the hotel's amazing breakfast - it's probably the best choice in the block and closer neighborhood. However, it is only served until 10am - which can be early if you're not an early bird every day...

15mins walk to Bugis Mrt but there are many buses in this area. Near to Albert Hawker Food Center, go to the 3rd floor for local dried goods! Nice toiletries. Staff could improve their service standard - not too friendly. Good budget choice.

review_title: poor accommodations with HIGH class prices
review_text: The hotel check-in is through a back alley access to a parkade or hoist you bags through a restaurant and up one floor, the rooms are dismally small even by Singapore standards, the hotel charged 5$ for a broken crap hotel glass, the staff obviously assume you were born with the hotel layout and services - like get your hot water for coffee / tea at a vending machine down the hall, the 2 complimentary drinks totaled 4 oz of ice and 4 oz of watered down fruit juice. The hotel rooms are reasonably clean and are quiet - as not much is going on around the hotel. The 25 degree restaurant tries to passes off a McDonald's oversaturated quarter-pounder with fries for a 13 sgd$ hamburger and 3$ beer as a 2 for 20$ afternoon bargain. The hotel is also not particularly close to a mrt stop

I loved the room. It was so cozy and comfortable. The location is also very convenient as food stalls and the mrt station were very nearby. Overall I enjoy my experience and will definitely come to stay at this place again!!

Cosy room with great location. Bus stop is just opposite the street. MRT is about 5mins away. Close to many famous attractions in Singapore like little India, Orchard street and chinatown.The room was clean and the staff were quite nice. My partner and I were impressed by the service. Would recommend the hotel!

Great place to explore the city. MRT stations nearby and also a walking distance to main sites. Small but convinient rooms , nice design,  very comfortable bed , clean. The bar downstairs looks like pretty busy spot.

Very nice hotel in a very good location easy walking distance to many places, they did mess up my booking and it took some time to sort this however everything else was fantastic. Rooms are a little small but if just staying for a few days then it’s fine, overall a great hotel for a good price

Good location, Very good service, pleasant staff, excellent breakfast choice! Expensive bar. Clean rooms, good access for cars and taxis. Good selection of products in the room. The rooms are small but that is normal in Singapore.

The location is great closed to the Bencoolen station where I can reach other places with no time. The staff are very helpful since checking in (which I did the very late check in due to the flight) until checking out as well as the service to store the luggages until my late flight.  The room is that spacious due to the room type I chose but the hotel is amazingly provide all the amenities needed similar to large hotels.

Gorgeous hotel with very professional service. Rooms are compact but very well designed, modern and extremely clean. Daily cleaning when the room is returned to immaculate condition.  The hotel also provides a

The room is really small so that I cannot fully open my luggage. But I feel great is the hotel has water dispenser that it is benefit for me. The best is including handy for me that I need it for calling and use internet searching where I want to go that it is free for living.

Near MRT Bencoolen and shuttle bus, the room small just for a couple or and only with 1 child but overall the room very clear, the lobby hotel 2nd floor a litlle confused looking for it but the hotel with unique interior and cozy

The positive is the hotel is in a great area, the negative is the size of the room. No wardrobe/closet to hang your clothes. The room is well equipped but I really would not want to stay here again due to the size of the room. Also I left a beard trimmer and a book in the room and there was no attempt by the management to ask me if I would want them sent on to my home address.

We had a great stay of 3 nights. Location was excellent where it was an easy access to all public transport area. Room deco was super nice and was clean. Staff was friendly. Had a wonderful stay and definitely will return

The location is easy to find and close to downtown area. Beautifully decorated rooms. However the room had little mouldy smell and floors were sandy. Overall a good boutique hotel.  There is no ground floor lobby but most taxi drivers know where to go.

Stayed for 5 nights. Loved the hotel. Staff were really friendly. The room was small, but it was just me so I didn't mind. The location is great as well as it's really central. The restaurant downstairs called Ginett is awesome for dinner or drinks.

I had a great time staying with Hotel G. Love the location and the wine bar Ginett downstairs. The room could be more spacious though, given the value of the money. But overall, it was a very pleasant stay.

Nice clean hotel in a convinent area,close to Bugis MRT.Double bad comfortable,no closet.Room is small but very clean.Good breakfast.Very helpfull front desk,answers all my questions.I will stay again

room is small.  do not get a room near the housekeeper's room as the room is not quite sound proof. The housekeeper may need to prepare for his housekeeping and will make noise that you may still be sleeping.  Light switch is inconvenient located as you must climb off the bed in order to reach the switch whether you want to turn it on or off.  Reception is inconveniently located on 2nd floor.  Unless you reach there by car, you will have to climb one floor to take the elevator to reach the reception.  The shower stall does not have shower door but only curtain, therefore, you may get the bathroom floor quite wet if you are not careful.  The hot water is not running consistently.  For whatever reason, the water temperature may rise to very hot for about a fraction of second and

review_title: Great hotel in the heart of Singapore
review_text: I spent 2 nights in Hotel G in April 2018. Hotel has good location at Middle Road and is on walking distance of many places worrh visiting. The room was tiny, but space was well degined and very clean. Breakfast was excellent

review_title: The first and the second night the room had bad smell.
review_text: I arrived at the hotel on April 7th, 1-2am. The front desk staff said they upgraded my room. When I arrived at the room, I saw that the room type was smaller than I had booked, but there was a large balcony (I had not used the balcony as no view), in addition, the room was full of bad smell, like a damp odor. At that moment, I was too tired to change the room and I thought the situation would improve after one night air-con on.   Second day, I left the hotel in the early morning and back to hotel at night. The room still had a bad smell so I asked the front desk staff to change another room for me, however all of  rooms were full.   Third day, I got the change successfully in the morning. The room type was as same as I had reserved on website, the room area is larger, no bad

Fantastic location, near to good food and walking distance to some of the best attractions. The people working at the hotel is fantastic, helpful and kind.   Looking forward to be here again if I decide to visit Singapore again

Everything is good just a bit far from the subway. Room wifi machine cannot charging. Does not affect the trip.  But it should be checked before providing it to guests. I am satisfied with this check-in.

review_title: Good choice to stay in Singapore
review_text: I had a very good staying experience in Singapore. Convenient location, friendly staff, nice room and delicious breakfast. The room is clean and comfortable. Highly recommend to travelers visiting Singapore.

reasonable price , great location, breakfast is good, service is also awesome, definitely staying there again next time when I visit Singapore. The room is a bit smaller than expected,  but it's ok. Didn't have the chance to try the restaurant, hopefully next time

with the reception in the car park this is small and dark but not as small as the rooms,i could nearly touch both walls with my arms outstreched and no acess around the bed as it is wall to wall.the bathroom is so small the sink is outside.the hot water for drinks is outside the room in the corridor.the best thing is the breakfast which is taken downstairs in the bar

The location is very convenient and the hotel has a sense of design. The only minor drawback is that when I first entered the room there was a bit of a damp smell, but when the air conditioning was on, it was a little better.

Rooms were comfortable and cosy, room service friendly. Perfect location walking distance to many sights and accessible to many MRT stations. Handy provided for guests was very useful. Good value for money!

Had a seemless check in although arrived early morning flight, they safely stored our luggage. The room is small but well appointed, with 2 complimentary bottles of water and coffee and tea packages.  The linens where very nice and the room very clean and crisp. The hotel is in a very convient location to explore singapore.They have elevators, and a restaurant within the hotel, and bar as well. Staff very friendly and helpful. A special mention of Alexander who spent time showing us on a map how to manuver about the city.. Good wifi as well.

02/04/18 - 04/04/18  Great location! It’s very central to the MRT district line which is in walking distance (I used the Bugis station for the most part). This was convenient for my quick exploration trip of Singapore!   The hotel is very chic and on trend with modern features. The rooms aren’t especially spacious but they are organised well and it was enough for a 2 night stay. There are nice touches with messages in the room on notice boards and the toiletries smelt great. It was a comfortable stay overall. Staff were also very pleasant and helpful.   There is a bar and restaurants on the ground floor which often have offers on. We also received a complimentary drink on arrival which was a nice touch.   If like me you did a short stop over in Singapore and wanted to see as

we loved staying here..close to the shopping center and just a min walk going to mrt,and the hotel is so nice and clean..were so happy to choose the G hotel to stay while were here in singapore..and the people here is too easy to talk if we need something..

Really small room. No fridge in room. Comfy bed. Limited TV channels are available. Lucky that it allow mirror display from android phone. Reception staff are ok. Overall good service. Will wish to stay here again

review_title: nice location, clean room, good service, but poor elevator waiting time
review_text: the location, place, room, everything is excellent. the housekeeping is also very meticulous in changing the sheets and towels (smells really nice and clean). however, the only downside the glasses are a bit dirty. also the downside is there's no elevator for staffs only. the housekeeping can take the elevator during check out hours and around 6pm. taking the elevator is a bit difficult and sometimes have to wait for 10-15minutes if it's crowded (i'm not joking). other than that i'll definitely come back!

Trendy looking place whose rooms actually look like the pics profived taken my the hotel. It almost looks new! Clean rooms and space. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Location is close to mrt, local and western eateries. If you like walking, it's only about a 20min walk to marina bay area. Can store your luggage with them after checkout. They also have an area you can refill your water bottles which is handy (cleaners also restock the free water bottles in your room). Room is decent for 2 people however with luggage, may feel a little tight. Would recommend this place!

review_title: love it ... and definitely will be staying here again and again in the future.
review_text: love it so much. this is my third time staying here and definitely will be coming back. the location is just rite to go to the main places such as Orchard road (walkable distance) bugis Junction, Bugis Plus, Haji Lane, Serangoon road. So there is nothing much to say but only to recommend this place. What are you waiting for? click book now!

The hotel was very conveniently situated near MRT stations and McDonalds. The room was small but clean and fitted with everything necessary. We were on the top floor but the lift was available quickly on most occasions. Staff need to make the open lift from floor 2 to the exit known to customers as we carried our suitcases up stairs when we first arrived and only on leaving were we shown where the open lift was to leave the hotel on the ground floor.

review_title: rooms as small as broom cupboards
review_text: The width of the room is equal to the length of the bed. Not suitable for travellers even if you  had no luggage. Our heavy suitcases had to be placed on the bed to open them. Very  claustrophobic not close to any tourist attractions wouldn't recommend this accommodation at all.

Close to bars and restaurants and the hotel bar is great. The rooms could be bigger. We had one of the bigger ones but still had a hard to fit bags for two persons. Complimentary parking is 15SGD per day.

All staff at Hotel G are so helpful.  We liked the fun atmosphere at the hotel and the location is good close by to the MRT which is a wonderful and cheap way to access all areas.   Breakfast at the hotel was very varied and the smartphone provided in the room was very useful.

The room was clean and it had the necessary things ( toothpaste toothbrush shower gel and towels ) Unfortunately the room was the smallest that I have ever seen and it had a lot of humidity. Also had mold in the bathroom.

A trendy hotel with slightly smaller rooms but didn't feel to cramped though. Quite conveniently located. Helpful staff but remember not to arrive too early before check-in. The  hotel looked like it was genuinely busy with travellers. Would consider staying there again.

Great Hotel, young vibrant atmosphere great bar in house, the rooms are small but comfortable quite funky with very nice toiletries included, we were given a welcome drink voucher (non alcoholic) on arrival. The only thing that I didn’t like was the music in the room on the TV, it was very explicit language and the songs all included the “F” word which wasn’t very pleasant, but all round a great location and a place to stay, close to two MRT stations, will happily stay again!

Value for the price you pay. Staff attitude and service is excellent. Location is 5 star - Bugis mall, Bencoolen MRT, Bras Basah MRT are all less than 10 mins walk. Added bonus of museums to explore (also within walking distance!).

review_title: Small room but good for me
review_text: We recently stayed at Hotel G for 2 nights. It was a really nice hotel! We arrived early so unfortunatly our room wasnt ready, however Bernice took our bags so we could go out and look around until the room was ready. When we got to our room it was fine. Yes the rooms are small but you know that before you arrive so its no problem.  The room was clean and tidy so good for me! Room at the hotel also come with an IPod with a city guide you can take out so you dont get lost, which is a nice touch! My only real gripe with the hotel is the lift system. There are only 3 lifts, which run very slowly so when it is busy the wait for a lift can be a while. I have read reviews on here where people complain about the small rooms however for what you pay I dont see how! The hotel is clean,

No wardrobe, no chair, desk attached to the end of bed. Poor sound proof you could hear the sounds from near rooms and corridor.Very small window, the bath sink located in the main room outside the bathroom.Ifnot very carefull water from bath wpuld.run into theain room.

review_title: A smart hotel located within easy reach of MRT station and markets
review_text: Located more or less in the middle of Bugis,  the hotel provides neat and clean rooms. The handy telephone set placed in all rooms is a great help especially for tourists as, the 4G connectivity it provides aids you to access google maps and general info about the city when on the move.

We knew that the rooms were too small but the real size was even smaller. Singapore was our transit station, so we carried a lot of luggage with us and there was no space for them. But what it was really disappointing was the mold that was everywhere. Such a pity, because I believe they could have done something about it. The breakfast was just ok. The good thing is that it is very close to the MRT station.

review_title: An excellent home base in Singapore
