review_text: Recommended to us by our close friends, we were very impressed by Hotel G from it accommodations to the restaurants below and the proximity to everything that brought us to Singapore in the first place.  We would highly recommend Hotel G to friends and family and would definitely consider on our return trip to be determined.

review_title: Over priced with awful customer service standards
review_text: The overall stay here at Hotel G has been crap. To begin with I wouldn’t exactly call this a cheap hotel yet it has such a $40 hostel vibe to it. Staff seem to have a problem with me but are absolutley fine with my partner maybe it’s because I’m a woman and he’s a man? But I’m my opinion we are all equal and at ginett when staff members say “sir how’s your dinner” and complete ignore me that’s when I know sexism is real.... you did have 1 manager Hendra who was absolutley fab though and if it wasn’t for him showing us a different room we would’ve checked out the next day for sure. The fact that your lifts are for staff and customers is just so unhygienic. The amount of times we were in a lift and cleaning staff would bring their trolleys full of rubbish into a confined space

the room is super small but clean. I payed for the room higher than the room my family booked but I got the smaller room. And it is hard to find lobby in the 2nd floor. First i came, I hardly find the lobby.

Good location, not far from city center. Modern hotel but very small room, feels like a cruise cabin. There is no space for bags and you can’t walk around the bed. As a goodwill they offered a drink in the hotel bar but only for one person 🤨

Hotel easy to find in Bugis district on Middle Road. We had the King size room for the extra space. Room was light and airy with a comfortable bed, essential! The platform bed took a little getting used to but not an issue. Staff were friendly and very helpful. Nearest MRT station Rochor which is a 5 minute walk. Very pleased and will be using Hotel G again.

Friendly Staff and Good Food & Beverage. The rooms are clean and modern looking. I would like to stay here the next time I come and visit Singapore. They use technology to make my trip more comfortable.

review_title: Perfect place for a weekend trip
review_text: The hotel is located in a great location with all the sights/attractions being easily reachable either by foot or MRT. The rooms are just as in the pictures - modern, nicley decorated and, most important, super clean. They are not very big but if you are planning on exploring the city rather than staying in your room the whole day then I think this is a great place to stay. You also get a mobile phone with data which you can take outside and also book discounted tickets to popular sights and attractions through it. I would definitely stay again!

review_title: Great location but too small rooms
review_text: Centrally located hotel and staff were friendly.However the rooms too small and congested.Even the great king room was too small.There was no closet ,no place to keep luggage and in the name of a window there was a very small one foot wide window..:(There was no room service which again was a negative point. The restaurant and bar were quite bustling though.Overall not a place I would recommend.

Stayed at Hotel G when we stopped over in Singapore on our way back to the UK for New Zealand. Friendly staff, great central location, clean & comfortable room, and a lovely breakfast too. I'd definitely stay here again!

We extended our layover in Singapore to explore the city a bit before our flight into Bali. We took a taxi from the airport which cost us about 35 Singapore dollars. The hotel lobby is on the upper floor so the driver dropped us off in front of the resturant which we walked through to the elevators and on to the lobby. We loved the location of the hotel as it was very central and close to Bugis the MRT and other shops and resturants. The hotel is a cute boutique style, with a fairly quaint size room to match. However with our 1 day stay we didn't have any issues with the size. The king size bed was very comfortable and the the rain shower was great as well. The best surprise was that they have a smart phone as part of the room that you can take when you explore the city with

Hotel location is ok, but service at the reception was slow - because they haven't received the confirmation from Booking, they asked me to send booking confirmation via mail, and translate myself the mail in plain english (confirmation number was apparently not enough... first time I saw that in an Hotel)

review_title: Quirky - may be too quirky for some
review_text: Hotels in Singapore range from expensive backpacker hostels to expensive 5* resorts, they are all expensive so best shut your eyes to the price.  Hotel G is low to mid range and the room are small and quirky. The bed was tucked into an alcove but was comfy, the bathroom "door" did not seal as it closed against a pillar, the washbasin was in the room, there was a window between bed and shower with a blind, no fridge.  Pluses, clean and new.  So the room was not brilliant, but you can live in it. If you want a standard hotel room book something else.  Facilities are limited but there is a great restaurant and bar downstairs with a really good breakfast, cheap wine and French charcuterie and cheeses. This is a popular place so close your eyes to the price and enjoy.  Location is

Reception is on 1st Floor  - if travelling with a lot of luggage, advice you to get a taxi to Hotel - will drop you off on the 1st floor. Location excellent with 5 min walk to MRT rail system.  Housekeeping were very good (room clean) and cheerful.  Hot and Cold Water and Ice available in Hall on each floor. Room small - double bed but only one side accessible! Asked for a little bigger room and reception were able to offer a little bigger room which was fine. Breakfast very good. Check when pricing that there are 10% and 7% charges added to booking.com headline price - but it is noted on your booking by booking.com. Overall if the price was right again - I would book again. Suggestion to management to supply and Information Sheet about the water and ice in hall and that

review_title: Very good choice for solo traveler.
review_text: Just added a little bit budget you’ll get a private, clean and comfortable room in a good location in Singapore. The staff here is friendly and very pleased to help me solve my unexpected situation. Thank you!

review_title: Okay hotel, wouldn't really come back
review_text: The hotel is pretty neat and well maintained, and at a great location. 5 minute walk from MRT station. But rooms are EXTREMELY small. I almost felt claustrophobic inside it. A single occupancy room was like 60 sq ft, so extremely tiny. No room to move at all. Desk is a joke, since it sits right on the bed so not really a desk you can work on. Coffee machine means a simple water container, not a coffee machine.

Hotel G is a good place to stay and interior design is very funky which fits very well especially for us, millenials. :) Staff are accommodating and approachable. They are always smiling which appeals to me the most.

The G Hotel is located in the heart of Singapore with easy access to everything. Its nicely designed and finished, with decent rooms for the price. The bar is very lively and happening (though its not cheap). Staff are helpful. My only gripes are that the air con in the room was directly blowing over the bed so it got rather uncomfortable.

If you don't plan to stay long in your hotel room, the rooms are small but clean.  Modern decor and furnishings are sparse, but functional.  Interesting that the hotel includes a mobile phone in each room for guest to use.

Small room but well design. Facilities are very good. Hot and cold water every level. Breakfast is OK . Staffs are very nice. I spend 2 nights there and I can go around city very easily. You can walk form hotel to National Museum, MINT museum of toy.

Hotel is new. Location good, near bugis market and national library. Area is around the fine arts school. Room small. Room wd queen bed is good for 1 person w/ 2 luggage. If you are 2 persons better to get room w/ king bed. Bathroom small. Shower curtain is the partition from shower area to toilet. No refrigerator. With toiletries, slippers, hair dryer and safe deposit box. Free water and ice from dispenser found in each floor. There is a burger restaurant called 25 degrees at the lobby which is highly recommended. Wifi in hotel is fast and reliable.

As described, it is 16 squaremeters small. But it is surprisingly very comfortable. We don’t feel claustrophobic. Thanks to the great design, great space usage, and cool interior. Clean. Nice lighting. Comfortable bed. Great location. Would recommend and would come back. :)

Had a wonderful weekend at Hotel G for my boyfriend's birthday - the staff were quick to accommodate to our queries and the service was great. The location is also convenient - there's lots of good food around the area!

The rooms in this hotel are exactly as advertised - small, but they are very comfy, decorated in a quirky way and well equipped.  We stayed in the small 'Good' room, where storage space was limited, with no drawers and only a couple of hangers on a wall, but for 3 nights it was okay living from our suitcases (which just about fitted under the bed).  We had a room on the 16th floor which had great views over the city and could even see the Marina Bay Sands Hotel.  The hotel is in a better location that we expected, it takes around 25-30 minutes to walk to Marina Bay or Clarke Quay; Kampong Glam and Little India are about 10-15 minutes away.  The nearest MRT station is Bencoolen, which is 3 minutes away - if you arrive by MRT from the airport it is more convenient to get off at

We loved the location and above all the breakfast was the best hotel breakfast we experienced in our travels. Even though the room is small for european hotel standards, the room arangement and clever design makes it bigger than it realy is. Definitely to recommend for short stay in Singapore.

Room is small. Barely enough walking space. Not encouraged to bring 2 suitcases especially big ones. Toiletries may or may not be provided. No iron, no kettle. Hot water dispenser is outside, not convenient especially when you need to make hot drinks at night and your room is furthest away. Room lights cannot be turned off.

Great location, clean, soft bed,good service, love the toiletries and easy access for food and shopping. However, room is too small. Not ideal for family especially with young children and elderly parents

Good place to stay but not lots of spare floor space.Reception is on the 2nd floor past the bar area. The handy phone would have been a plus if docking charger is working.  Receptionist said they will change it but looks like they didnt check. They just charged the phone and placed it back in our room.

review_title: Nice hotel with a great bar but the reception can be much better
review_text: Even the taxi driver who drove me there complain about the hotel entrance. It is located up the narrow drive way to car park, with very little space to stop. There is no front door staff to assist with your luggage. Once inside i felt cramp as the low ceiling , a sofa in the centre in this small  reception doesn't give me a good impression especially during peak check-out & check-in hours.The room is modern and nice but compact. Good for single person.Shower area is small with shower curtain.Pretty good location with Bencoolen MRT just a short walk away across the road. My fav is the bar/restaurant, good service & nice ambience.  Had my lunch, happy hours drink & breakfast for both days i stayed there. had the cheese platter, which came with a good portion of cold cuts. Oh yes

review_title: Quirky Hotel - Great for a couple of nights
review_text: This hotel is great for anyone that’s is there on a stopover wanting to explore the City whilst looking for a cute and affordable place.  We are out all day exploring the City but want to come back to something nice.  Lots of reviews say the small standard rooms are tiny, so we booked the great king room and it was perfect.  The hotel is really quirky, the rooms fine for just a couple of nights, clean and exactly what you need.  Downstairs is a vibrant bar (can’t hear anything from the rooms, don’t worry)  The bar had a great cocktail and wine list, all very well priced. The cuisine is french, so are the wines.   Breakfast buffet was great with homemade muffins and all in all great food with a big variety.

I loved this hotel especially the room i stayed in. It was nice and modern. Good enough for a solo traveller. I also loved the breakfast from Ginette! The restaurant decor was beautiful! On the website it stated that it is close by to Bugis or Dhoby Ghaut MRT stations. It is true but Bencoolen MRT station is much closer, about 150m away compared to Bugis which was 670m. Otherwise all is good and i would definitely stay here again if i come back to Singapore.

We stayed here over the Christmas break, great location, helpful staff. Really clean rooms. Amazing restaurant and bar on the ground floor. However the King size room as well as the bathroom size is really small, so if you have a lot of luggage it might get really difficult inside the room. Also they do not have any in room dining.

Stayed here in January. This hotel is in a great location, close to Bugis. We ate in the 25 degree burger bar, food was excellent and reasonably priced. Rooms were very clean and modern, but the best thing about this hotel was the wonderful staff, especially Victoria , who went out of her way to make sure my iPad was returned to me in U.K. after leaving it in hotel room. We would definitely return to this beautiful friendly hotel.

review_title: Good place to stay, central location
review_text: Stayed for two nights recently in this smart and modern city centre hotel. The rooms where small but very modern and clean and met all our needs. Very central location, good price and no complaints. Would definitely stay again if in Singapore fore a few days. Recommended.

review_title: Regular king bedroom is terribly small
review_text: The room we had at had ,195++ is very small. When we asked a better they said it would be chargeable. Then we said we would want to stay for one night instead of two, they said they would not refund us the second night. It was an unpleasant experience.

Fantastic hotel, great location and helpful and friendly staff. The rooms are very modern and clean and offer great facilities such as the in room mini tablet which can be used to search activities and book tickets. Would definitely reccomend this hotel.

Although the room is not big, but comfortable and location with walking distance to bencoolen station. Their breakfast is superb. Downstairs hv bar which is quite happening during night but won't affect room upstairs. The only cons is don't hv swimming pool.

Very small room, no even closet. I came for 4 days and no place to put the suitcases.  I've got a room without any place to sit but the bed. No Chair to sit and work with my laptop. terrible. I will not book this hotel ever.

Everything was fine, just that the toilet is abit small. They provide variety food for the breakfast. The room is clean, the view is good. The receptionist service was excellent. They are being friendly and helpful.

Me and my husband celebrated our anniversary in Hotel G and surprisingly we loved it! The room was super nice, quite spacious, clean and it’s affordable. Will definitely come back for other occasions. :)

Located in not-so-touristy part of downtown Singapore, short walk to Bugis and Orchard, close to MRT and bus station, (aside from the room is smaller than I thought it would be) hotel G offers the best value for money in SG. If you happen to like Chinese food, there are a lot of Chinese restaurants around! Definitely will be back!

Recently stayed at this hotel. Loved the room, big enough just for the weekend as we were doing a lot during the days. Really great shower, with toiletries that were a good quality. Very comfortable bed, & very clean room! Staff were great & very attentive. Only one negative, do NOT bother having breakfast downstairs. The buffet is not worth it. Terrible choice of food & awful service, so don’t pay for it!

Great room, nice decoration in the hotel room, great customer service. I have stayed here more than a couple of times and so far it is not bad. Location is not too bad. I liked that there is a mrt nearby

Very limited space in the room. We have no space to open our luggage. But we’d got free upgrade bed size from queen to king size bed. The bed was super comfy. Exhaust fan not working, washroom was wet all the time. Good location, only 5mins walking distance to reach shopping mall or mrt.

Rooms are small but it is okay for 1 or 2 person to stay with comfort. Location is good, few minutes walk to Bugis Junction and MRT station. Shampoo & Body wash is nice! But my room didn't have a comb :(

Very clean hotel and appropriate for a business traveler. Could do with a little extra closet space but other than that everything was up to par. Extremely impressed with the free Handy Phone that is provided free of charge! Very convenient for use of general searches, google maps, and local/international calling (11 APAC countries)...all free!! Location was also very CBD-centered and convenient to explore the city by foot. AC in the room is nice and cool + the bedding was very comfortable.

review_title: Clean, comfortable bed and convenient location.
review_text: We stayed in a greater room, bed is big enough but the floor space was quite small, however room was very clean and bed was comfortable we enjoyed our stay here. A mini fridge would be nice to have in the room. Very conveniently located it was easy to get around.

We really love their bed even though the room is small. Location and service are nice too. Overall experience is very good and we are strongly recommend to stay when you have to visit Singapore. GINETT bar which be at level 1 of the Hotel is really cozy and nice.

Hotel G is a good choice for staying, WiFi is good, Staff is also very cooperative... Just one issue that i need to highlight... Muslim shower should be attach to toilet. its a essential..  or there should be some rooms design for it, i know its a common problem visiting a non-muslim country, but must have this option.

We had a nice stay. Got free upgrade to kings room. Room was fine, bathroom could be a little more taken care of. Location is great. Overall good value for the money paid. We would definately come back.

Good hotel. Neat and tidy. Staff always friendly and welcoming. Room was quite small but didn’t really bother us as we didn’t spend much time in the room.  Didn’t notice any noise or anything during our stay.  Location is close to most things and close to mrt. Would definitely stay again

enjoyed the former BIG hotel. pleased to see the improvement for G hotel. fantastic cafe and restaurant. only thing is the entrance from the restaurant is confusing. couple of taxis also refused to drop us at the lobby due to narrow path.

Amazing hotel, spoke perfect English at reception and was very quick to check us in. Our room was perfect. Ultra modern with a chic style look! Very close to cruise terminal and airport! We got this room as part of a package so not too sure on the rates but having used our travel agent before this has been the best hotel we’ve been allocated!

Very good value, centrally located hotel. The rooms are quite small but if your spending a lot of time in your hotel room in Singapore your doing it wrong anyway. Reception is located in a strange spot but its quite easy to access and the staff were very nice and helpful. Allowed us to store our luggage for free for a whole day on checkout because our plane didnt leave till the evening.

If you look for a good inexpensive hotel in Singapore, then this is it.  The room is simple but well-designed, and you’ll get everything you need from a hotel.  The location is good, close to subway stations and many good places for breakfast.  However the room has thin walls so you can hear your neighbours if you don’t have your TV on. The reception was friendly and effective, but the guy at the bar was not so happy when people come there only for first drink.

Good for a visit where you don't have to stay in the room. service is not grate and the staff is very cold and not very responsive at times. Self service concept is good  but need to be backed up with availability services or cutlery etc. on time.

review_title: One of the best hotels I have ever been to
review_text: Room was very cute and cosy. I really liked how the room is decorated. Service was good. And overall, room was very quiet and comfortable. Breakfast was fine. I would like to come to Hotel G again if I need to come back to Singapore later.

The room was the size of the bed. In order to close the window curtains i needed to jump over the bed. The bathroom was also real tiny.  The plug points were damaged and i was not able to connect my charger. Got the flat pin adapter from the reception.

review_title: Very small room without basic needs like cupboards
review_text: It's a very small room without having a cup-board. You cannot get into the other side of the bed in the room. For overseas travellers, I strongly suggest to not take this hotel. Staffs are not open-minded.

My partner and I stayed at Hotel G for two nights in February, arriving from KL. We booked a 'King' room which comprised of a large super comfortable (!) bed, desk, chair, a small wash room and a sink. There was also a kettle in the room to provide tea and coffee making facilities, two bottles of water and a 'Handy' phone with 3G internet to help us with directions while strolling around Singapore. The room was compact but provided adequate space for us and our belongings. We didn't spend an awful lot of time in the room so found it a great value for money.  The hotel is well situated within a few minutes walk away from Bugis and Dhoby Ghaut MRT stations. Downtown and Marina Bay are easily accessible via MRT and Orchard Road is also walkable (15 + minutes). We didn't eat in the

review_title: Nice stilish hotel in a perfect position
review_text: Nice stilish hotel in a perfect position , tasty breakfast and very nice bar and restaurant, the gym is wonderful vintage look and the workers very kind and prepared. Ice machine , hot and cold water every stair

-  Extremely small rooms--1 square meter of standing room only -  Excellent location--not quite close to town but easily walkable to multiple MRT stations and short distance to restaurants (burger place downstairs is a little slow on service but food is great) -  Staff are OK (pleasant enough but a little illogical and rigid about repetition of already-completed paperwork)

Hotel G Singapore has a good service with full amenities, great location to everywhere in the city. A bed is very comfortable and every floors are provided both of the drinking water & ice dispensers - very nice!

Very good and nice hotel with good spot near train plus places to eat. Hotel very good spot. Room clean and nice design, but slightly abit small buy still good and nice bed.  Really enjoy stay for me and family. Check in by friendly staff Airi and he is very helpful. Even check out with him and help to plan how to get to next country,very nice staff. I and family really recommend hotel to all

review_title: 'Designer' hotel with wash basin in the room and not in the toilet/shower room!
review_text: Very small room and the wash basin was inside the room and not in the toilet/shower room! For two people the room is very small with hardly any room for luggage. Although the hotel seemed to be either new or newly refurbished, why have the wash basin in the room??? The wash basin was also the smallest I have seen so far on my travels. Hot water for the tea/coffee is available outside the room. The 'electric' kettle is just kettle to bring the hot water from the outside to your room.

I have to say that we (me and my friend) were appreciated with the hotel. First of all, the location is very good. Few walk from Bugis MRT station. Secondly, the staffs were great and helpful. Finally, the room was clean, new, and facilities were perfect.

It's very nice that the hotel upgrade my room as my birthday gift. Though the room is not big, it's enough for two of us to stay comfortably for 4 nights. The hotel is considerate to give us a phone with cellular data and able to call overseas. It located at a nice place which near MRT station and the center of the city.

review_title: room and bed too small ß´
review_text: The room was too small for two persons! We could hardly move ourself in the room or open our baggage. Some of the service people at the ginett bar were unfriendly but the pastry breakfast was good. We booked early check in, but the room was not ready when we arrived.

Really nice hotel for our 4 night stay in Singapore. The location is really comfortable to visit all the main places in Singapore. A great breakfast was served every day and the staff was really nice and helpful . We loved staying in this hotel!

The G Hotel is a nice and clean hotel, very nice located in Singapur. Rooms are small but with all what you need. Buffet breakfast is nice with Asian  food and western food. Location is excellent for both who has time to visit Singapur and his main attractions or who is in town for business. Good value for money

review_title: AMAZING HOTEL | SERVICE + STAY GETS A 10
review_text: We stayed there for a few days and the service is amazing. They are nice, helpful and it’s really clean. The rooms are clean, housekeeping comes every day and the rooms are modern. Breakfast is the best part because it’s freaking delicious with waffles and stuff.

review_title: Cool hotel with great rooms and location
review_text: Friendly staff, great decor, good value, and convenient location. Overall, it's a great place to stay in Singapore. Everything from check in to check out was smooth and efficient. Rooms were well designed and comfortable.

Overall,hotel G is a really good hotel during our stay in Singapore. The reception is really nice and helpful. The only thing I might complain a bit is the bathroom. Because the design of bathroom(the floor is quite shallow) would make me worry that all the floor might be wet when we were taking shower. Otherwise, everything is prefect

very good location and very friendly staff of hotel. good facilities! The handy phone is a outstanding services privided by the hotel, it helped us receive any services such as calling taxi, google map navigation, and I will strong recommend the hotel to my friends.

Definitely one of the best hotels in Asia! Eco, amazing nature, rooms with beautiful views, friendly staff and perfect international food (Japanese, Chinese, European, Kosher...). We prefer premier room 👍🏻

My partner & I stayed here for 3 nights in January 2018. The hotel provides toiletries and free bottles of water each day and also a smartphone to help you get around the city. The staff are super helpful and friendly. The room is a little on the small side for two people but very comfortable & quiet so we had a good night's sleep every night. The price and location makes up for the room size anyway, as there is so much to do you spend very little time in it! Close to MRT, Bugis Junction shopping & the national museum. Also only a short walk to some good and cheap food options. The only negative for me was that there was no bar fridge in the room.

Lovely hotel in convenience location, anyway, the style is same as one Hotel in Paris, not sure if it's the same owner? the staff is friendly and helpful, breakfast is good, just only the bath curtain which must be cleaned more.

Super cute boutique hotel located a block from the MRT with plenty of dining around it? Sign me up!  We booked this hotel for a three night stay at the beginning of our Singapore trip in February. From all the research I had done, I knew most hotel rooms in Singapore were small. This was true here, but I will say they used the size well! We booked a great king room that had plenty of space for myself (5'8") and my boyfriend (6'6") to move around without getting into each other's way. The bathroom was a bit oddly set up with the sink outside, but the shower stall was large enough and the whole floor didn't get wet like I suspected it would.  The bed was super comfortable, even more comfortable than my bed at the Marina Bay Sands, where I stayed the week after! Plush duvet, soft

Good location, convenient with eateries nearby. MRT stations also very accessible. Room is cozy and nicely decorated. Good for solo, couples or business travelers. Staff were friendly and approachable.

We enjoyed every aspect of this hotel, from the great staff, the comfortable bed, the delicious breakfast and the super-covenient location! We will definitely come back the next time we will be in Singapore!

My wife and me had a wonderful stay. Your rooms are clean. The location is very convenient. We were there for a wedding near by. So had to stay for the night. I have stay before and chose this hotel again.   Will recommend and be coming very soon .

Location is convenient with very clean room. Bathroom and toilet are superb. Bed is comfy which we had good nights sleep after a long day out. Room will be perfect if it comes with a mini bar. Overall, it was a wonderful stay and will return again😊

review_title: Small 13m2 King room, Parking $15, Breakfast $15, Gym great
review_text: Cut the room very small. Make the room very long rectangular rather than squarish that makes looks smaller. Hotel knows how to fully utilize the space. Safebox under bed. Hair dryer hang at the sides. Few clothes hanger at the wall. Sliding doors.  Room +nice ambience +interactive tv +4m ceiling +fast wifi +comfortable bed +chair to sit +free ice and drinking water at walkway +4 pillows +bed cushion +mobile phone with data usage +fast wifi -no fridge -not much tv channels. Only hbo. No cinemax. No animal planet. No cctv.  -no remote control for aircon  Hotel lobby +many people +reception staff looks very young like teenagers intern.  +3 lift fast +many lightings in the room +creative design of q n a inside room +2 charging points. One usb port . -no free parking. $2 per hr. Max

This review was written in Japanese. As you can see, it was a wonderful hotel. I was able to use it with confidence in rich and well traveling alone. It was my first trip to Singapore, but thanking you for having the best time. I want to use it again. Thank you very much.

Good hotel location, relatively near to city center, easily accessible by Rochor & Bugos MRT stations, proximity to Parco Bugis Junction and Kwan Imm Temple at Middle Road. There is cool bar & restaurant at ground floor.

A small room, best for couple with short trip holiday. Good amenities and full of complimentary water (on dispenser). Quick check in&out process. Classy room ambience, will be back for short holiday..

A very unique and modern hotel at a convenient location close to shops, food options, and MRT stations.  The room and the shower was small, but I knew it when I booked the room. There were no fridge or kettle in the room but you can get drinking water and hot water from dispenser at the corridor.   The hotel provided good amenities, complementary bottled water and a mobile phone to use during our stay, which was convenient.  The buffet breakfast quality was excellent, but when we went to breakfast 10 minutes after its starting time, no hot food was ready. We had an early start that day and paid extra money for breakfast, so we were disappointed that our options was limited.  Other than the limited options for breakfast, we had a very pleasant stay with Hotel G.

review_title: A little expensive but worth considering
review_text: Hotel G is strategically located with easy access to most of the touristic places in Singapore like Bugis Street, Chinatown, Little India, Mustafa Market and Marina Bay Area. There are MRT and SMRT stations within easy walking distance from the hotel to get around Singapore.  Check in was quick, but surprisingly for a hotel of this price level there was no porter service available to move the luggages around and till the rooms. So it's quite a struggle if you are carrying more than one bag. The rooms at the first instance might seem tight and out of extra space, but it has been cleverly designed and the lack of free space shouldn't really be an issue for organized folks. The rooms are very neat and comfortable and the METIS bathroom amenities seem like premium stuff. There was

This hotel was in a very nice area with a lot of options for food and shopping around. It is easy to get to Little India or Chinatown by walking. The room I had was small but very clean, well-organised and comfortable. I had a very good stay.

Great Location, in a local part of SG. Hotel rooms are very small, and need renovating - no fridge, no iron, basin in main room, TV channels very basic. Breakfast average buffet style, coffee no good.

The hotel is modern and sits into a perfect location to explore the city, next to a central MRT station and at a walking distance from Arab Street, Bugis and Little India. There is a very good bar at the entrance of the hotel. The room looks like a modern hostel room, but despite its size, is clean and has coffee, complementary water, safe and a good shower.

review_title: Terrific stay but missed my breakfast eggs
review_text: My entire experience with Hotel G Singapore has been great (5 night stay), except that on one of the days, they did not have scrambled eggs for breakfast for an entire hour (the only choice was to wait in line). Eggs should be among the first things you put out on the breakfast buffet table at 7am sharp (or whenever breakfast starts). Some people don't have time to wait in line - they need to eat and go. Business trips man! Other than that, great stay. p.s. Please don't fire the chef, I still love him/her.

Modern, clean, and nicely decorated room. The rooms are on the smaller side but thanks to some cleaver design choices they feel larger than they are. The location is convenient and the staff friendly and helpful. Overall I'm very happy with my stay.

Studio G is a small, cozy mid-budget hotel with excellent service and great location. There are lots to see and do within walking distance! Definitely worth a stay for a day or 2. Good for business visits as well.

We stayed at this hotel for 1 night.  When we arrived the reception offered a free room upgrade.  The room comes with a unique design with standard facility and amenity.  The restaurant at the ground floor is great.  The location of the hotel is also good, it is just 5 minutes walk to the subway.  Overall, we like this hotel and will definitely recommend to our friends.  Surely we will come back!

We had lived in Singapore between 6-10 Feb 2018. All 7 Persons love to stay in your good hotel with your warm welcome and service mind. For next time we will advise our friend to visit your good hotel.

Plenty of food to eat around the area and Bencoolen MRT is about 200m away. Lots of Shopping around too. Staff were polite and helpful. One could leave luggage after checkout and they would call a taxi for you if needed.  Cons-  Hotel G does not have a lobby & entrance is through a bar. To get to the Reception area, one must climb a few stairs before reaching the lift to get to the 2nd floor where the Reception is located. Will be difficult if carrying heavy luggage.

It's such an unconventional hotel, I had never been to such a place before in my life.  Wow what a concept! Full points for interior and overall feel.   what's amazing about this place: a. Location b. Buffet breakfast c. Free mobile phone during your stay d. Contemporary rooms, never seen before e. Lovely host, great service over all   Recommendation: a. Book king size bed room only b. Early checkin is hard to get c. Concept bathrooms so don't get shocked by the small size

review_title: Clean room in a great location
review_text: Really enjoyed staying here - if I were hard-pressed to come up with a negative, it would be that the elevators took forever. But that aside, the room was clean and pleasant and well-decorated (not too small at all) and the location was very convenient.

Hotel is at good location with shopping centres nearby and Metro just one street away. Room is small but very clean. Entrance somewhat difficult to find if you dont know where it is. Staff very friendly and helpful.

Yes, the room was really tiny(I've booked the cheapest one for two people), no room to walk around But it was very clean and new, high ceiling and loved smart and modern interior. I was staying with my mom and it was comfortable and cozy. Location is great as well. 8 min walk to Art museum, little india is about 15min away but you could take the bus. There are few MRT stations near by. The restaurant on the 1st floor was hip, alwaysI  full of people! That doesn't mean it was noisy, I slept very well.  loved 24/7 gym as well!  Thanks, G Singapore!!!

Nice, creative and tastefully decorated interior. Rooms are little small though, but despite all this, the quality of the bed is pretty good. Very near to eateries and places of interests. Great for short business trips.

I enjoyed my 2 nights at HotelG :) the room and bed were very comfortable and I truly felt like home. The size of the room is fine for me as I don’t need a lot of space. They have a very nice gym that opens 24hrs. Good location easy to find street restaurants and short walk to MRT

review_title: Loved roomdecoration. Hated the nose 24/7 in the room of something on the outside wall
review_text: This was our 3rd time in your property. The 1128 room had horrible noise. I had to sleep with earplugs. Not sure if I will stay with you again At Check in Front desk staff was extremely friendly for Singapur standard. Not so much when complained about noise.

the hotel is very nice.    work space cove is nice.  lotion is great lots to do.   service is very good    the only negative is  on like the shower and toilet in the same room.  overall rating is good because of the combination of good to great features.

It’s very difficult to reach at hotel lobby. Most of the driver does not know how to reach to Lobby drop off. The front road does not have taxi stop. During my stay one elevator was not functioning at all. Other two was busy. The rooms are so so small. The hotel does not have any room service. Which is terrible. Won’t stay here again.

fast forward for our trip, and new as the future trend, and smart for an economical management, but the bed size need more circling space, and the first floor lift machine need the guide otherwise will miss easily, please check and improve

Very helpful Reception people,  everywhere very clean,  need all 3 lifts working, even then barely enough, (one out of service for a time), room small but adequate, nowhere for clothes, shower v. good, bed comfortable for me, breakfast only ok, eggs, beans and plate cold, tea not readily available, best cookies ever.

review_title: Good value interesting hotel; compact room complete with dream catcher
review_text: I had a good four night stay at Hotel G. I was travelling for work but paying my own way so this was a good choice - well located and well appointed, but didn’t break the bank. The hotel is new and has been built with a design-conscious market in mind. The room had a nice aesthetic - complete with dream catcher! It was comfortable but compact - particularly the desk, which was in a nook facing the wall. That was OK because there was a large table located in the bar/entry which had power points for laptops. The gym was also compact but good and staff were helpful. Uber drivers were continually surprised by the hotel’s second floor reception/pick up point accessed via the side lane carpark entry, but the app recognised that so they worked it out.

room was small but cozy if you're travelling alone/with another person. bed was comfortable. certain parts of the room were a little bit dusty and there was a weird smell to the bathroom curtains but other than that it was a comfortable stay.  the staffs were friendly and the hotel location was great, 5 mins walk from Bencoolen MRT

We had a great stay at this hotel located near food courts and MRT Stations(Bugis and Bencoolen). Check in and check out were hassle free. Hot and cold water are provided, there is a refilling station each floor. Nice breakfast selection, pastries were yum! Will definitely stay here again when we go back to SG.

Close to a lot of tourist place just by walking. Really small room but neat and comfy bed. The bathroom curtain was not so cleaned but the rest was okay. Staff was nice and helpful with information of tourist places.
travel_type: Trip type: Travelled as a couple

review_text: Comfy although its small. Location is great, very near to bugis junction shopping mall. Ginnet bar and restaurant below the hotel serves great food and wine, and good price too. There is also a 24 hours mamak stall right beside the hotel.
travel_type: Trip type: Travelled as a couple

review_text: The location is good, breakfast is a plus but the room was rather small for a double bed. Everytime either you or your spouse had to jump over to go to the toilet. The air conditioning goes directtly to the bed and you!
travel_type: Trip type: Travelled as a couple

review_title: Very good рotel for the short stay.
review_text: Very small room, toilet in 1 meter of the bed behind the glass wall, it's pretty inconvenient. But very nice interior, a lot of useful things, even personal smartphone. Good and tasty breakfast, excellent check-in.
travel_type: Trip type: Travelled as a couple

review_title: Great hotel, gym should have more weights
review_text: Everything worked perfecrly. The checkin and checkout was quick, breakfast had lots of variety and the room was cleaned every day.The only problem was that the gym was lacking equipments for strength training. Could be fixed quite easily.

Room was a bit compact/small for a queen room, but interior was good. Service was good, food was great! Bathroom was okay except for the door. It seems always ajar. No refill of toilteries though. But all was great!

Check in was smooth and faultless. The room was a bit small but that is my fault as I didn't read the size dimensions on the website. If you are a tall person, you might find the bed a bit small and difficult to move around. My husband and I are under 170cm so it was ok. There wasn't much room for luggage so be prepared if you are carrying big luggage- we only had carry on and put everything in an alcove under the bed and hung up clothes on the rails.

Only criticism is ventilation. Whenever we entered the room it smelt a bit mouldy and that is probably cos there was no where for the steam and moisture from the shower to go. The shower was small with a curtain so be prepared for it to touch you if you are a bigger person.

Other than that it was centrally located and only a short walk way to Belcoonen MRT and Bujis Junction. There is a Ya Kun Kaya Toast shop just across the street for Kaya Toast and Tea
travel_type: Trip type: Travelled as a couple

review_text:
Stayed for a week. Tiny room&bed (my husband who's 190cm barely fit between two walls), bathroom door is practically non-existent (might be awkward at times).
Nowhere to put clothes, etc. Can't open the window - so, no fresh air.
But the service was good, very responsive staff, clean rooms, water and ice available 24/7, location is good although nothing within 15 min walk.
Breakfast was good.
Overall - good for a short stay for a family without kids.

Location: Within walking distance from Bencoolen MRT and in close proximity to Bugis.

Room: Bed was very comfy.

Amenities: Complete toiletries. Best thing was the Handy phone which was a great help during our stay.
travel_type: Trip type: Travelled as a couple

review_title: Small Room but nice and friendly
review_text: I was a little shocked to see the small size of the room.  But I had just come off a cruise so I was accustomed to small quarters.  Aside from that, the front desk was very friendly and helpful in finding places to explore and calling for a taxi when needed.  I thought the location was excellent to get around to many of the things to do. MRT was within walking distance if you want to go to the Graden on the Bay. Bugis Street is very close. Overall, I liked  Hotel G.
travel_type: Trip type: Travelled as a couple

review_title: 5 star hotel without the price tag
review_text: Fantastic new modern hotel, would 100% recommend to a friend. Location is good walking distance to most major attractions including Raffles hotel , marina bay, Singapore Flyer etc. Breakfast buffet is huge and great selection also

We stayed here for a week in 2 rooms. Some days house keeping forgot to replace our amenities.  A quick call to the reception would fix that.  The bathroom was not ideal as the shower has nothing to stop the water leaking out into the rest of the bathroom and even the bathroom door is inadequate.  The view from one of our rooms was nice. The beds were comfortable. The room itself was small but fine. The water machine on each level is a nice touch, however we were not informed by staff of this, I can thank past reviewers on here for it being brought to my attention.  One night during our stay after a long day spent in Sentosa with my elderly parents we returned to the hotel to find that the elevator was not working. We stayed on the 12th floor. We were offered complimentary

review_title: Comfortable stay in the heart of the city.
review_text: Overall I enjoyed the stay at your hotel. I quite like the room concept, compact with minimum facilities, enough space to put my things. The water server at the floor was a big plus for me.  I like the house keeping lady at my floor, who was always cheerful greeting me. One staff at the reception was quite attentive although the reception area was generally packed with guests queuing for check-in/out and other inquiries, he even notified me when my taxi arrived. T he location was perfect for me, easy access to major areas (to CBD area, Little India, orchard area). Near to local eating places (Albert Centre, bean curd place, traditional bakery etc.) Minor times to point out: - The lifts were so slow especially in the morning time (around 9am). Sometimes they skipped our floor

I stayed few times at Hotel G past year and I have to say I was never desapointed. Romms are always clean, the service is efficient. Love the location as I can walk to my office on Orchard Rd (10min). Also The Breakfast is really good.highly recommend.

review_title: Great Location, Friendly and attentive staff, all you need is there
review_text: Excellent and satisfying stay, clean and very nice accommodation , room size too small for 4 rating properties, great fine dining at 35 degree restaurant on the lower level. Waking distance to Burgese

Over All condition is good, location nearby MRT, many resto available nearby, good bed and pillow. Except that after I reach L1, I have to carry my luggage to the ground floor. It is not logical in design.

review_title: Entrance to the Hotel check in lobby
review_text: I arrived at around 11pm after my company annual dinner, trying hard to locate the hotel main entrance or lobby to check in, to my surprise, i can't find it, I only saw a bunch of people having outside a bar with bear on hand, singing and dance around at the five foot way, i have no choice but walk in to the restaurant at the corner area to ask for the actual location of G Hotel entrance and Lobby, finally, i have to get past a bunch of foreigner with heavy alcohol on hand, and walk up to L1 of the hotel, follow by waiting for the slow moving lift to the second floor for my check in process. I do hope that G Hotel can make improvement on this as the main entrance to the hotel was totally block and person like me thought that it was a Pub or Night Club instead of hotel.

Hotel G provides the guests with a special experience with every detail! It’s  rooms are clean and organized, service is great and location is very good next to the bencoleen station on downtown line. Its restaurants are really good as well so you don’t have to wonder where to eat every night.

Near mrt..easy find food transportation and the reception really helpful. .gave me good room and big..good for my family  the area of students . Thank you hotel G .sure will come back again with stay at hotel G

review_title: Small rooms but good value for an expensive city
review_text: The room is small but functional. There is no where to put your suit case (other than in a space under the bed). It would be nice if they put a pull down shelf for luggage. Good location and good service. The bathroom is lovely. The light switch is by the wall and not near the bed.

We stayed for 5 nights, a good location, very close to two MRT stations(one of which goes direct line to airport) Special effort on check in to give us a nice room as here for a birthday treat, rooms very clean and modern with a good shower, only downside is lack of hanging/storage for clothes. There is a rack and a few nice coat hangers but more would be helpful. Ate at the burger bar and had a meal in the restaurant both very good. Staff all very friendly and went out of their way to make us welcome, also price for this room was good value for Singapore, would love to go back!

Pros: 1. Location of the hotel is not overcrowded with people. 2. Nearest MRT station (Bencoolen) is about 3 mins walk. 3. Hotel smells nice. 4. Friendly and helpful staff. 5. Water dispenser at each floor with settings of hot, iced, and room temperature. 6. Room was a little compact, but fortunately clean, tidy and cosy. Chic layout. 7. Handy mobile phone free to be used during the stay. Unlimited calls and internet usage. 8. Well equipped gym with free access of water bottles and small towels.  Cons: 1. Stayed in a Queen Room and it was small and compact. But it didn't matter to us as space was not really our consideration factor at that time. 2. One of the hotel lift was out of service during our stay, causing a long wait before the lift arrived. 3. No wardrobe to store

It was a very nice stay. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The only negative point : no tea for breakfast. I had to ask to the waiters every morning to have a tea bag which was definitely not good (not everybody like coffee)

Overall is very good with value of money. The hotel located in the middle of city. The lobby design was nice. The restaurant at the ground floor Ginett was really nice. They room was clean properly everyday and friendly staff.

Overall are good but TV program are limits. Although not stay in hotel for day but still prefer to watch a movie before go to bed just like previous. please consider of movie time after 6pm lighting control NA this time

review_title: Simple hotel located in the more artsy area of SG
review_text: Clean, fuss-free hotel – good burgers and wine downstairs, but if you're not into those, there's a 24-hour mamak next to it that gets pretty crowded at night. The location is convenient for museums, good for buses and public transport too.

Overall: very good hotel The receptionist was nice, warmly and very kind. The room is clean and tidy. One point that i like the most is the pillows, instead of thick pillow, you are using 2 thin pillows. It gave me more comfortable sleep. Thank you!

I'm pleased that hotel G is a clean hotel, and I like the simplistic design. I'm also thankful that hotel G upgraded my husband and I to a King room after knowing that we just got married the day before.  Wished the breakfast set has more variety.   Also, the room radio should be able to play without switching on the screen.  The hotel is at a great location, centralised area. Moreover, there are motorbike lots and it's great as my husband and I travel on a motorbike.  Hope to visit again. Thank you, Hotel G!

The excellently planned Hotel G has compact but functional rooms that come equipped with an Android mobile phone called Handy, which you can use throughout your stay. This is invaluable for checking maps and ordering taxis whilst out and about in Singapore.   Add to this a superb breakfast, the most stylised hotel gym I’ve ever seen, a trendy bar and burger joint all on site make Hotel G a highly recommended location for a short stay in Singapore.

We had three nights at Hotel G and really enjoyed our stay.  The room was small but excellently planned. Great use of space and clever design throughout made it not feel too cramped. It’s new and well maintained and very clean. Free water and ice dispenser on every floor. And each room comes with a Android phone called ‘Handy’ with internet access which you can take with you around Singapore. This was invaluable for checking maps, restaurants, attractions and ordering taxis. We didn’t need to buy a local sim.  Hotel G is in a great location for short taxis or walk to main attractions.  There was a cool bar and restaurant downstairs and a late opening burger bar. Both are expensive (London prices) but good quality and nice vibe. Breakfast was excellent, good choice of local and

The staff were helpful  Good location close to several MRT stations The free phone provided was great idea The wifi was good The room was bit small  The overall experience was excellent  Would definitely recommend this hotel

The hotel had a great vibe, comfortable bed, friendly staff!   One suggestion is to put a mirror closer to the plug for the hair dryer, as ons cannot see yourself when drying or styling hair and when trying to reach the mirror, the plug pulls out of the wall. Not very practical at all!

review_title: Instafriendly yes! Overratet yes that too...
review_text: Super cool friendly ambience at the Ginett restaurant. Great staff at Ginnet who made my stay pleasant. The design and amenites are nice, yes. but rooms way too small and facilities incl. service from the reception are not worth the money. The breakfast are good if your are into muffins, cookies and more cake. It would have been nice with some more heathly choices especially for plantbased consumers.

As there is only a curtain for the shower space, the water was pour out to toilet side when the shower was getting too strong.  Prefer to have more body shower gel supplied.  Though there are 3 lifts, it took time to wait for lift to go up and down.

review_title: Cute hotel for a short stay in Singapore
review_text: I stayed for 2 nights with my sister for a short trip. The main reason we chose this hotel is because they lend you a 'Handy' phone to carry around during your stay. The room is small, but very clean and cozy nonetheless. I'd say my room is more suitable for a solo traveler. Guest with large luggage will probably have difficulties opening and storing their luggage due to the limited space in the room. The shower and toilet area is only separated by a shower curtain so you can easily flooded the whole area if you're not careful. There is no fridge nor a kettle in the room, however we do have access to ice machine and water dispenser in each floor. Location is great, with 3 MRT stations in walking distance, plenty of food stalls, including a bar and burger joint downstairs.

Place is cute and trendy. Location was great. Only thing we found faulty is the air quality in the rooms. There was no air circulation and you could tell it was humid inside the room. My husband and I ended up getting colds due to the bad air quality.

Everything at Hotel G looks beautiful however it is definitely a case of style over substance! The rooms are a strange layout (bed is wedged down at the end - you can't get to both sides without climbing over) and the first room I stayed in had a tiny slit of a window. Luckily for me the staff we excellent and were able to move me to a different room with a bigger window for the rest of my stay. Bathroom had nearly all frosted glass walls so make sure you are comfortable with the person you are sharing a room with! Some hangers were provided on designer looking pegs on the wall but no wardrobe or drawers in either room I was in. Hairdryer and slippers were a nice touch and beautifully decorated with a comfy bed. Breakfast was fairly average although there was a good selection of

review_title: Wonderful hotel, right in the middle of everything!
review_text: I really enjoyed staying at the Hotel G, their breakfast was superb! Pancakes, bacon, eggs, cakes, and even eastern food - they had it all! The gym was good too, not the biggest gym by far but there was more than enough there to get my blood pumping! Hotel staff was super friendly and helpful, and the room was excellent value for money.

Good hotel, nice people. The only weak point is due to no space for lugagge and clothes at apartment.  Breakfast included and very good location, near to Orchard rd, Clark Quay and many options for public transportation.

Only one I know some hotel give to costumer mobile phone. It’s very helpful to short trip in Singapore. Also the facility  room make me enjoy & support to all activities works, read, watching movie, etc

Helpful receptionist at check-in showed us the free map and marked places to visit and the MET stations on map. We had a drink in the bar once and ate in the restaurant next door in the first night; both good. The hotel was centrally located and great for getting to the sights. The provision of ice and hot water on each corridor worked really well. Towels changed daily and beds comfortable. We could even check our return flight was on time on the tv. Didn't use the free mobile provided but seems to be a good service too. Was given a packed breakfast as had to check out at 6. Great hotel. Would use again.

Hotel is conveniently located near Bugis mrt station (which connect to changi airport). In addition from convenience, malls and food center are also nearby, thus easing any traveller's life searching for food.

Been staying in this hotel for business trip since 2016 and apart from the maintenance or renovation, everything is great. The check-in procedure is swift and room cleanliness is always great. The room might be small for someone but for me they have everything I need for a great night sleep.

As a first timer in Singapore, I admit I was kinda nervous what I was getting into, but Hotel G was pretty comfy for me going by myself. The room was cleaned carefully when I was out, located conveniently near several subway stations and a 7-11, plus the taxi pick-up really helped me out when I needed to get to the airport by 5am. Good price overall for a good location and experience. Would recommend for first time travelers to Singapore!

Great location, great price, great service.  We stayed for 2 nights, and the place was reasonably clean for the price that we paid.   Although the place is a bit small  but it's definitely cosy and much better than other budget hotels that we've been to.

review_title: Small and compact - good for business travellers. Great location.
review_text: I stayed in this hotel 2 years ago when it was still called BIG hotel. I came back this time as I was on budget (business travel) as i was it was within budger, great location and i know it would keep the same good standard of cleanliness and convenience. I recommend this hotel to any single travellers who need a good night of sleep and space to work off their laptop!

Rooms had everything you needed but the only thing I would say is that no kettle for tea or coffee & hot water outside the room was just warm so you couldn't use this to make tea or coffee. Location was very good.

Stayed there as overnight for a stopover in SG, mostly for the price (this was the best value of the SG hotels I looked at for this time of year) and ease of transport to and from Airport via Bencoolen and Expo MRT. Rooms are clean and tidy but small/tiny although well laid out to utilize the limited space. Reception is on the second floor and to access the lift area you do need to go up a set of stairs. Recommend for short stay and traveling light.

Rooms are very small, but really, you just sleep there.   Hotel is close to four subway stations: Bugis, Bencoolen, Bras Basah and Doby Ghaut.  Also walking distance to Kampong Glam.   Bar is hipper than average ... though a beer is one third the price around the corner at a street stall.

I would like to reccommend the twenties-young couples to feel cozy. Standard room is very narrow, so recommend higher graded room instead. The restaurant located on the 1st floor is satisfactory to enjoy the breakfast under refined mood.

The first trip to Singapore, chose the hotel G, some of the original fear, afraid of the room is too small; except for poor sound insulation, the other is very good.Very good location, fashion sense with retro! The room is small but very comfortable, easy to get there!

The hotel located near MRT Bencoolen station, just 5-7 mins walk from station to hotel, there are many restaurants nearby and many choice for breakfast. The room is small but comfortable, bright and clean. The only thing not that good is toilet small and easy to make the floor wet, as the shower area only separate by a plastic curtain. Staff are nice and it’s a good hotel overall.

Amazing service , located in superb location! Highly recommend! You can either walk to Bugis, Bencoolen or Bras Brasah station so easily. The hotel is very trendy and clean. It's quite small but enough for one or two people.

review_title: Room the size of a shoe box
review_text: The smallest room I have stayed in Singapore and the smallest even compared to other Asian and European countries. The width of the room just fits the bed, can't walk around other side of bed. The wash basin not in bathroom, small shower, no bathtub, no wardrobe to hang clothes, room only for one suitcase. Too expensive for the size, not worth it. Would not recommend it.

Good, clean, neat, small, easy to find using MRT, Many young people get together on the first floor, seems very attractive  to young people, I like the free cell phone  including Internet, that is awesome.

The room was small but clean and functional. The price seems reasonable for the excellent location. The only point I did not like is the entrance of the hotel. To find the reception, you have to find your way through the bar and take stairs with your luggage to the first floor. Reception is on second floor. About the decoration and the quite strong room deodorant one could discuss.

review_title: Good option for Bugis area but large & impersonal
review_text: Nothing wrong with this hotel, but it's really quite large and impersonal, and I felt like I'd made a mistake when I booked it since I like places with character (that's my mistake and my problem, not the hotel's fault) - I almost get the impression some of the positive reviews I read were written by people who have never been in a hotel before, so do not have a benchmark. Rooms are small but nice, clean. Probably at the higher end of the "good value" range, i.e. I felt cost was a bit high. Downstairs bar is fairly popular, but would benefit from being better managed, and with some personality. The hotel is trying to be funky/edgy, perhaps trying a bit TOO hard - advertising posters feature (different) models all with tatts, you get the idea. The breakfast buffet (S$20++) was

Good location! The room was great.. very nice and good ambiance! Smells really good in the hallway.. very nice hotel! They always clean our room. I will surely stay this hotel again next time.. Recommended! 👍👍👍

Really clever and modern hotel in a great location. The free mobile phones they provide are really helpful and a great addition. The hotel was really clean and used small spaces in an innovative way. Would recommend.

When we arrived they upgraded our room which was very nice. The room was very clean. Bed was comfortable. The mobile phone with internet connection was nice suprise. Maybe luggage stand and little fridge in the room would be nice. We loved the decoration of the room and the hotel. It's nice and trendy. The breakfast was excellent! The location was good: maybe 200m to mrt and walking distance from the Little India. Highly recommended!

review_title: Good location, clean room and comfortable bed
review_text: Overall Hotel G is nice. Just hope to receive more friendly & smiley service next time. I rarely saw the staff smile. Room is clean but quite small, location is good. Maybe you could put some guide for tourists in the room, and please let guests know about the Handy phone in advance (i bought sim cards for all of us before arriving at the hotel, quite a waste of money). Thanks

This is my 2nd times staying with and I do really enjoyed the artworks and the interesting architecture. This hotel is a destination in itself - the diverse styles and collections in the lobby were visually stimulating and natural textures and subdued lighting in the hotel is very restful.

review_title: It was such a nice day with Hotel G
review_text: The staff who help me to check in was very kind and professional. She is always smiling and well know how to make customer’s feeling better. She is very well trained:) And the cell phone service for free was convenient.

review_title: Hotel G,,,First impression hotel in Singapore
review_text: -Near MRT Bencoolen station -Reasonable price for cleanliness room and freindly service  -Exellent for decoration at reception area and bar zone on ground floor -Hip bar for relaxing time -Electrical power plug in room can serve for all devices, not need adaptor -Should provide hair dryer in room

review_title: Great place, nice restaurant and environment
review_text: Room is neat and nice, HSKP did a great job of keeping the place tidy.  ice and water machine on hotel floor is great! Easy to have a drink on level 1 and chill out. It will be even better if there is a pool. Convenient location and food places around the corner ~

Good location and friendly staff. The atmosphere throughout the Hotel itself and the 2 restaurants is great - modern and super friendly. We especially liked the design of the rooms, they could be a bit bigger, though.

The room is quite pretty,  but the water easily splash out in the bathroom. Counter service is good.  We love the two bar and burger restaurants at the ground floor specially.  They are comfortable and relaxable. We had enjoyed meal there.

Walking distance to malls, restaurants and MRT. Reception at level 2. Nice hotel concept and deco, every floor had ice and water machine, breakfast is nice but can improve in service. Pillow cover slightly torn. TV is good, there is rain shower head in the bathroom.

review_title: Was a good choice for us!
review_text: Value for money but it's a little inconvenient for people with bigger luggage as we've to pass through the bar & up the steps to the lifts.  Unique concept though & our room is ideal for just the 2 of us. Love the idea of providing a smart phone for hotel guests to use, really thoughtful.  Overall, we enjoyed our experience & will definitely consider coming back next time we're in SG again.

review_title: Very well located, nice and clean!
review_text: The hotel was very well located, i could walk to many attractions at the city. The room is small but well cleaned everyday and comfortable. The only thing i wouldn't have done is the breakfast. It was quite expensive for what it is..

review_title: Good hotel with a good bar.
review_text: Hotel in a good location in the colonial part of Singapore. 10 to 15 minute walk from little india. 30 min walk from Clark quay and china town. Room was very quiet but compact unable to get to window without climbing over bed.

Provide good service,The hotel is clean and tidy.There is hot water in each floor to make tea convenient.But hot water is sometimes not high enough.Green tea needs hot water over 95 degrees Celsius.Breakfast was good enough Not that many choices,but the quality is great.

The room is nice, clean and comfortable.  Location is perfect. The restaurant and bar are fantastic. No place else you should go for food and drink.  I like the restaurant and bar at night. It is a great place to socialize with friends.

Have stayed there now eight time in the last 6 months. It’s a nice place.  I’m used to it. The breakfast service staff have a lot to do and maybe there can be some improvements to make the flow a bit better.

Very Good service so far. I most like the welcoming guest name on the TV show. And the welcoming drink ready to redeem on the bar at Level 1. I  wish to get free complimentary room for future. Thanks q Hotel G

The room is small but cosy. And very nicely furnished with industrial vibes. Bed and pillows were just nice (not too fluffy and not too hard). The whole place was very clean, Central location; in the middle of Bras Basah and Bugis MRT.

Great place, attentive and friendly staff. price a little bit pricey but overall great experience. Although we hope with the price we pay, w able to get breakfast maybe. The Bed is awesome, including the pillow. and the amenities (soap etc) are good and have a slick design.

The location is good where a lot of shopping areas nearby, including Bugis street. The room is simple and neat. The only setback is difficult for the grab or taxi to pick up or drop customer since there is no designated place to stop or wait.

Entrance to the hotel was unique and the bar was very lovely. Greeted by service staff with great smiles and even the cleaning lady at the 13th floor. Well designed room and more spacious than expected. Cleanliness was TOP-notch.

Nice experience, great service, different style hotel hospitality, near bus stop, near mrt station, nice location, nice welcome, very great staff, artsy room, great bed, so we will looking for another experience with you again

The staff were very supportive. The room was funky and neatly appointed- the in house mobile phone was great idea and very useful. Whilst the breakfast was functional, it was adequate. Nevertheless, 25 degree burgers were delicious. Overall, highly recommended and I’ll be back.

My first and last for staying there. 4 star?. I don't think so. This is my first time that I do not fell to get back to the hotel as the room is really not comfortable at all and I have been staying in several 4 star hotel and this is the worst one. Sorry for my comment but I really feel that way.

I'd say Hotel G offers all my necessities. Clean room, good soundproofing, comfortable bed & good room lighting. Despite the small room size, I find the room very efficiently planned.  To be honest, as I have stayed in this hotel when it was still the BIG hotel, I kind of have to say that I liked the previous one better. I think the addition of this hanging decor accent above the bed, is a bit out of place and distracting. It feels rather "off" when you lay down on the bed and see this decor hanging right above your head.  And last but not least, it's sad to see the common living room in the ground floor is no longer there, replaced by a public bare & restaurant.

It was a wonderful stay at Hotel G. The room was clean with cool interior design. The room came with a smartphone that allowed me to make unlimited calls locally and to my home country, which I think is nice.  The hotel is 5-10 min walks from metro station and there is a nice hawker centre nearby.

review_title: Super small room and bad lighting
review_text: Room size is terrible. Lighting not enough. Weird pick up point.Never stay here again. Table waiting staff for breakfast were so rude. Pillow too flat. Bed to small. The only better part is Olivia is very helpful. Lucky you have her. Not Recommend!

Last stay was my 3rd time. The place look much nicer and the services has never fail to impress me. Love the room. Small but very cosy. Wouldn't mind book the room again. And also would recommend to other people.

Very friendly and efficient staff. Our broken Nespresso machine was promptly replaced. Our checkout was quick and simple. On the downside, the water pressure wasn’t great and the hot water wasn’t that hot at peak times.

Overall is good except that the parking arrangement was not convenient to the guest. If you parked for 2 nights, you'll need to drive out and in again in order to enjoy the daily rate of $15/day. If not an hour rate of $2/hour will be charged.

the location is very good, close to bencoolen mrt, clean and staff is good!! around there got many good food and cheap and can walk go many tourist attraction. i really like this hotel and will back for sure.

This hotel had a very nice feel to it and was located in a very central location. The timing of our stay however, coincided with the elevators breaking down. This was unfortunate as I would have given the hotel a 5-star rating if not for that.   Other than that, the hotel has got a really good restaurant below in the form of Ginett's where they serve $8 wines and an amazing cheese board - can't beat the price in a city like Singapore. It's also got a weird little right-hand side traffic in the dropoff/pickup area which is unusual for Singapore.

We love the hotel and the environment, clean room, well supplied amenities, the comfortable bed and the bar at the  ground floor.  The downside is a very small room and bathroom. If you travel alone, that is fine. But if you travel as a couple, that is the hassle begins.

Convenient location. Rooms on the small side but spotlessly clean. Convenient location. Closest MRT station is Bencoolen.Couple of chic food outlets on ground floor of hotel. Walking distance to public transport  that connects to all ver the island. Xtra feature of an Android mobile phone for room guests  - calls can be made , locally and internationally for free ( except mobiles overseas). Overall, a pleasant stay.

The entry to the hotel G. is via a wine bar, which I initially thought was a little unconventional.  The room was extremely clean, the bed was the most comfortable I can remember sleeping on any where...& I am a Gold member of the hotel booking site I use. Point being, I have a lot of comparables:) The room was not what would one would call spacious but very well appointed with absolutely everything one would need for a very comfortable stay. I would definitely plan to stay here again if in Singapore. This was one of three we stayed @ and again the most comfortable beds ever.

The room is really cosy and i think its value for money for the location.  Walkable distance to bugis and its perfect for staycation :)   The only flaw is shower room is too small.  We enjoyed our stay at Hotel G! Will definitely be our top choice if we are on staycation!

Love the rooms, love the reception staff, but the restaurant staff are another matter. Every evening meal I have here, the staff seem to have some person problem and attitude, really puts me off eating here, Food is average European. so I would look elsewhere for food, breakfast is OK, but never go down for the start of service as they are never ready. Last day I had to make do with toast and coffee as kitchen staff were not ready, so no cooked breakfast of bacon and eggs, As I had an appointment, I didn't have luxury to keep waiting, so gave up after 20 mins.  On plus side excellent rooms for the money and good location, so always plenty of other eating options to choose, so I do recommend you stay here, just don't bother eating here.

review_title: hip hotel in a very good location
review_text: combination of very friendly and not so friendly staff. great location. hip interiors. rooms a bit small but still comfy. most guests were european/americans. near bugis and other dining options. love the toiletries.  only problem was when we needed a big car (13 seater van), we had to wait along the street instead of pickup point on the 2nd floor because of low clearance in the building's entrance.

I was expecting a small room and that is what I got. The bed was comfortable and very generous in size but there was no space to get around it as it was jammed in against 3 walls. having said that, there was some room underneath the bed to store your suit case, a desk, some where to hang clothes, a handy mobile phone provided with data and local call capacity, the hand basin was in the actual bedroom area (which was fine) and the shower was separated from the toilet (in many Singapore hotels, the shower is simply a shower head connected to a hose over the toilet). The staff were friendly, decent wine bar and burger place at ground level. Access to reception is confusing at first but overall it is reasonable value at around $140 SGD per night. Location is excellent and there is a

review_title: Excellent location but corridor smell is slightly disturbing.
review_text: The hotel is excellently surrounded by a huge variety of quality local and international cuisine, and the two restaurants on ground level served tasty fare. There are also nearby public transport nodes and a few large malls that offer shopping facilities. The room was a little small but designed with a warm touch, with a dream catcher over you when you rest. However, there was a weird smell in the 8th floor corridor, which could be sewage leak or an overpowering cleaning agent. It would also be good to have a fridge. The staff was efficient but could project more warmth. The gym was tastefully designed but a bit too dark to work out in comfort. Boxing bag was a thrill! Thoughtful to provide water and apples. Also hopefully the hotel can provide complimentary in the future.

Great stay, the service and room are excellent. The restaurant serves great food with lovely ambience as well. Will be back again and highly recommended! Thanks for the lovely experience, we really enjoyed our stay :)

review_title: More attention to cleaning needed and more hanging space!!
review_text: Stayed for 2 nights in a greater room.  Found the room really big which was great as some of the rooms are really small.  Room is very modern and had a seperate shower and toilet.  The shower room had no hooks inside to hang a towel on and you could only hand this on the outside of the shower door so there was no privacy at all.    There is a serious lack of storage in the room as there are no drawers and only 4 coat hangers which were on an open shelf.  This meant we had ot live out of our suitcase.  As there is no iron in the room it was hard to hang out clothes to drop the creases!    The bed is on a raised platform and a few times I hit my let getting in and out of the bed.  The bed however is very comfortable.  There is no mirror above the seated desk areas so impossible to

The location is superb, within walking distance from the Bencoolen mrt Exit A.  Room size is manageable when it is just for sleeping and shower.  The room is equipped with the basic amenities including hair dryer, toiletries, towels, soft & comfy pillows.  Not to mention it also provide water dispenser at every level which provides hot and cold water, great idea!  Breakfast is great ranged from western to chinese.  Love it!  The reception is also pretty cool with car turn up from the parking lots.  All in all, I would be back for this hotel again for its value and location!
