First, it is a very new hotel and its amenities is surprisingly of a high standard. Its toiletries give me an impression that the shower gel, with its good packaging and sense, is from Bodyshop.   The bed and pillows are good for a good rest and sleep.  The restaurants and bar, 25 Degrees and Ginette were an added bonus. Food quality and presentation is excellent. Ambience is really up market!   The room is of chic design with many tv programme to choose from. Hot water available for shower.   There are many eateries around the hotel hence tourists will find this hotel a top choice with a decent Budget.  Looking the reception, this hotel is very popular with both tourists and locals.   Only 1 down side, carpark is not complimentary and it costs $15. Still better if you don’t

Perfect for a stopover in SG. Close to lots of MRT stops and food options. Finding the hotel is a bit odd at night as you have to walk through a bar and up stairs. Room was very clean and well equipped. Would stay again.

The whole boutique experience was fulfilled at hotel g. the decor was unique from lobby to the corridors and the rooms. the staff were friendly and patient with questions. room felt secure and was clean! easy access to mineral water, hot water and ice along the corridors from the dispensers. rooms are quiet due to the long corridor entry. perfect for a working weekend.

review_title: Not a 4 star hotel by any means
review_text: The room was too small, had to climb over parter to get in/out of bed. Staff were attentive and polite but it wasn't a 4 star experience as we were hoping for. They also kept sending me emails after staying to review them. I would rate this as a 3 star hotel.

review_title: Great place that is worth a visit!
review_text: The ground level of this hotel is slightly different as it's mostly covered by the restaurant / bar. Take the stairs near the bar, and the lift near by to the reception at level 2 I believe.   There's a small elevator from the bar to the lift lobby that is helpful for those with bulky luggages.   Levels with hotel rooms are only accessible with the room keycard, which is a plus point for added security.   Room wasn't hard to find, and there are water and ice dispensers along the corridor (to fill up the ice bucket provide in the room).   The room was relatively spacious, clean, and pleasant smelling.  The dream catcher- chandelier thing above the bed makes it really artsy.  The cork board had helpful and safety tips/ongoing promos (for the restaurant) instead of the usual files

The room was small but very cute and organized!  We dined at the restaurant and breakfast and both were amazing. People were friendly and attentive. I will definitely come back again when I visit Singapore :)

review_title: Don’t book ‘mystery room’ or the smallest room unless you are below 4.5ft!
review_text: Great hotel, great friendly staff in good location but terrible terrible rooms. I booked a ‘mystery room’ and got a room on the 14th floor. They all look the same on the map as think it’s their standard room. The image makes it look like space at the end of the bed but there is no space and bed not full length. I am 6ft 1 and my feet were on the wall! Terrible night sleep and room so so small I could hardly have room to sort my case .  Hotel is great but book a larger room if your going as small rooms are bad value. I am booked in their again in 2 days time but considering cancelling if I can’t get larger Room.

It's a great hotel with excellent food in the Ginette restaurant and the famous burger. Also tons of nice local food around. It's within walking distance to the MRT and safe neighbourhood. Hotel decoration is stylish and the room has sufficient space and amenities.

Everything was excellent! The room was clean and beautifully decorated. The staff were all amazing. The check-in and check-out process were smooth, and they even offered me a complimentary upgrade to Great Room King.

Stayed here for 3 nights with my partner. We had a great time, yes the rooms are a little on the small side but that didn’t bother us at all as we were hardly in it. They are very clean and amenities replenished every day which was nice.  Staff are lovely and very helpful and the breakfast was amazing. A great variety of different food on offer. The two restaurants attached to the hotel are very good. We are at 25 degrees after a long day out as we didn’t have the energy to go to downtown but the burgers were great and a reasonable price too.

the position of the hotel is very good, lots of food around and bus stations. The hotel staffs are friendly,kind and helpful. There is handphone that provide by hotel that can be use to call anywhere.The room quality is very good. price is very cheap. it is very worthy to stay at here

Room’s square is quite small. We need more space. Taking hot water is  complicated. I think each room have a mini refrigerator and a small water boiler will be better. Nevertheless, the locations is suitable for walk. In brief, Hotel G is clean and comfortable with us.

review_title: New Year holidays in Hotel G Singapore
review_text: Hotel G Singapore is located in the center of the city in a walking distance of several MRT stations. So it was comfortable to go from the airport to the hotel. There is an elevator for heavy luggage so one can skip ten stairs to go to the first floor. We stored one luggage on reception before 2pm on arrival day and after 12am on departure day so it was easy to walk the streets on the first and last day when the aircraft arrives early morning and departs at night. Such luggage storage was for free.  The access to the floor and to the room was by magnetic card. There was cold and hot water in the corridor near our room. We used that water many times. The room is quite small but has everything we need: a huge bed for two persons, customizable air conditioner, 3 kinds of towels for

A very good hotel. The  rooms (shower, toilet & room) are a bit small, but well equipped. The service from staff was impressive. Check in and check out was very good. In fact the staff were kind enough to keep my luggage in safe keeping whilst we when out shopping after checking out. Meals were excellent.

review_title: Great location and excellent value for money
review_text: Really enjoyed our stay at Hotel G have even recommended it to a friend. Improvement would be to have room service from the bar downstairs. The location was great for exploring Singapore and the Breakfast was really good, especially the scrambled eggs!

the staff are very friendly and helpful. the hotel generally very good. The location is really central. There are many good restaurants and many places of interest nearby. breakfast was very good. cleanliness was not bad either.

Eventhough room size is quite small, most of facilities are comfortable. Full replacement for all amenity is required for everyday. Room manager did not change some amenities in my second night. Other things are fine to me.

review_title: very clean and new but unexpectedly small hotel room!!!!!!
review_text: the rooms are too small!! and the power of water coming from the sink is too low!!! the sink should be attached to the toilet inside of being places oddly in the room!! the sound from the corridor can be heard from the room

my room was not that big however, since i stay with my baby so it was just ok.  Location is good and service was good too.  The gym was facilitied as well.  The overall for this ok is acceptable, just my room size was different from my plan

review_title: Overall Fine BUT Deposit Charged on Card
review_text: Deposit was charged on my card which shouldn't be charged at the first place. No sign of refund after checked out for 2 days. Room would be perfect if has a small fridge, good location and very clean room.

It's very nice hotel and clean in the middle of the city and very good price. All staff are very welcome. There are restaurant and bar open 24 hrs and it's near tourist spot, very conveniences and comfy.

Room to small.hope the room can be a bit biggest......to tiny.....the hot water not so hot,The sign make it clear and bigger for the 1 floor  luggage  Lift......a lot of customer didn't know and they have to carry all the way to the  stair...

review_title: Great place to stay for a short stint....i love singapore....
review_text: I enjoyed staying at Hotel G, Singapore....Thought the room was small and compact, its clean and it has everything i need. i barely stayed in the only to sleep the night and take a shower. So, size of the room didn't bother me. Its located in the central and easy get around. Hotel G is a budget hotel.        Two MRT stations are between the hotel. Lots of places to eat and hang around in the hotel area. So, i recommend any one stay at this hotel and enjoy the singapore at ease. I love singapore.......

Good - Room is clean and comfortable - Nice environment - Breakfast plenty of choices - Hotel location within walking distance to Beecoolen MRT station  Bad - Room no freezer - slow lift (need to wait)

The room is very small even I have already book the king room. And as the hotel guest we have to pay for carpark which the carpark is on site not acceptable as least when we check in the reception should tell us not only upon check out

Hotel rooms are compact but clean and do the job. The Handy phones they offer guest makes it easy to navigate around with free wifi and phone calls. There is a great bar on the ground floor which seems very popular with to locals too and has a trendy vibe.

The Hotel G is within walking distance of the Metro and a nice mall.  There is a restaurant attached and there are other places to eat nearby.  My room was very small but adequate for a one night stay,  but those planning to stay longer might find the small room size and lack of storage a problem.The price was reasonable and the staff was friendly and helpful.

the room has very artistic design and practical arrangements for a small room.  Staff was friendly but I was almost charged for breakfast which I did not have.  Uber driver complained of narrow driveway to the lobby level, there was also an Uber driver who refused to bring me to the lobby at level 2 even though i have luggages despite me assuring him that he would not be charged for entering the carpark.

review_title: Handy Phone + Cozy Nook = Happy Travellers
review_text: The hotel’s strategically placed! It was so easy to navigate from Changi Airport to Middle Rd (Bencoolen) via the MRT. It was only SGD 5 for two! The minute we arrived, the hotel was only 5 mins or less (that huge G signage helped a lot!). The entrance though was a lil confusing for us - the lobby’s located at Lvl 2.  It’s close to some of the good places in Sg too, e.g Bugis & Orchard. The room is impressively clean, cozy & just quiet enough for you to enjoy the place. There are two bars right underneath - Ginett Bar & Twenty Five Degrees - a little pricey but the vibe is amazing (perfect if you’re huge on interior decors). There are 3 close 7-eleven around the hotel too!

review_title: Good for couples, not suitable for families
review_text: Still need to pay for carpark fees for locals who drive. Best is to compare the hotel rates plus carpark fees before making decision to stay in the hotel for locals. Hotel room does not have wardrobe & luggage rack, its very inconvenient to put the luggage on the floor cause the passage is narrow.

Everything was perfect! Honestly speaking, we didn't expect much from the hotel. But every aspect of the hotel exceeded our expectations! The lobby was beautifully furnished and the staff at the front desk were polite and welcoming. After checking in, we were offered a complimentary welcome cocktail  at Ginette, the bar located below the lobby. The atmosphere at Ginette was great! The corridor to our room was aesthetically pleasingly and our room was spick and span. There was even a welcome message addressed to me on the TV screen. The whole experience made me feel welcomed and I would definitely love to book another stay at Hotel G. Thank you, Hotel G!

to enter this hotel you find the lobby on floor one, either through a car park or through a restaurant.  The decor is very quirky and nice.  However the shock of the room sizes was not nice.  No matter how pleasant staff are or how clean rooms are, this hotel is really only suitable for solo travellers.  I have never stayed in such a small room.  Think of a posh caravan and you get the idea of the size.  You cannot walk around the bed as it touches the walls on three sides, there is no luggage rack, no wardrobe, no drawers as there is just no room.  It reminded me of my sons room in his university halls of residence - except he had a wardrobe.  It is a shame as this could be a really nice hotel but they have just tried to cram too many rooms in to the space.  It does say they

I booked this Hotel G and stayed for 3 nights in April 2017. The hotel was located in the city center and very close to MRT, food centers, and tourist attractions like Bugis street. The hotel staffs were nice and supportive. Hotel's rooms were relatively small, but the bed was clean and room atm was cosy. I would book again straight away.

Although we could speak English only a little, all the employees of the hotel were kind and helpful. Access to sightseeing spot is also good, I am very satisfied. I would like to use it again if I have the opportunity. Thank you very much.

Good location, clean rooms, nice stuff, shopping centers near, the room is very small but practically arranged. alot of bus stations around the hotel for most of the points of interest. bar and restaurant open till late.

Check in was smooth, and pleasant. Bella was very friendly and she explained to me everything in detailed about my room and the hotel facilities. This is my second time in Hotel G, i love how cosy the room is, for me to have some time on my own or a few friends with me. Very good location, as it is in the town area. Convenient to go anywhere from here or down to get some food. Overall, everything was just excellent.

Located in a very nice area with plenty to do and close to the MRT bugis stop. the bed was incredibly comfortable, the staff was exquisite, the food and drinks at the bar downstairs were great, and the breakfast was delicious. overall i would definitely stay here again, especially for the reasonable price. i did not get a chance to check out the pool/gym but i look forward to hopefully staying here again when i make it back to singapore!

Check in and everything was fine, housekeeper didn't speak any English. When we asked him about the faulty ice machine he just replied it is broken. We left the room at 10am, put up a sign to clean up room, when we got back at 2pm still wasn't done. Shower was poorly designed. The whole bathroom would get wet after every shower. No fridge in the room. For the price and rating you would expect that.

very great location, and service was good. The room was a little bit small but quite clean. Holter G is very close to Orchard Road, Chinatown, Little India and some nice restaurants. The welcome drinks were sweet.

Jump over mi friend to reach the bathroom at night is not nice. It is the firts time in our two month trip that we found incomplete toilet accessories like bidet or similar. Even we have to wait extrictly to 2.00 PM to check in, but the bathroom was not properly clean. The breakfast option was expensive. Nice staff.

Location of hotel is very convenient, with restaurants nearby and within walking distance to shopping malls.  Rooms was well decorated and furnished, although it’s a bit small. Overall, it was a good stay.

Stay here a couple time for holiday. Staffs are very attentive. Every time the rooms has been great with very comfortable beds and pillows. Will be back again if we return to Singapore, without doubt.

We had a nice stay for 5 nights over NYE. Staff is very friendly and helpful, rooms are modern and clean. The location is very central and within easy walking distance of multiple MRTs as well as little india.

Hotel is new. The hotel lobby is at level 2. Front desk staff attitude not very friendly. Hotel Carpark is chargeable for Hotel Guest, so it’s not advisable for Locals to drive there and park over night. The room is really small. There is no wardrobe in the room, no place for u to unpack your luggage bag. The toilet sink is located in the room instead. The toilet bowl cum shower is around 3ft x 5ft/6ft. Location wise for local food is not bad.  Distance to MRT station is far, u have to take a cab. Overall not worth paying for a small hotel room with chargeable car park fee. Not advisable for local.

Service at this place was outstanding, great location smack center on Middle Road, walking distance or an MRT ride to everywhere. The food was good to G18 dollar breakfast at Ginett was money well spent and the 25 degree burgers are nice and juicy.

Beautiful hotel in the centre of Singapore, and nice restaurant! In Bugis, near mrt train and Little India. Staff was very kind... And wonderful breakfast.  I think one of the best choice in Singapore! Very cheap hotel compared to other places in the city! Everything so good.

Rooms are small but spotlessly clean and ideal for a city mini break Hotel is modern with a trendy "warehouse" look Good linen and all toiletries supplied Staff very friendly /helpful Walking distance to most major attractions One lift out of service so a wait at busy times Reception is on first floor and not obvious from street as entrance is through wine bar and up staircase

We didn't have any problem during our stay. The bed and pillows were very good. We love the HBO in HD(!). We love how compact it is but have everything you need in a hotel. We forego some SG activities just to stay in more :)   Please take note that the hotel has no ref and wardrobe. Both are non-issue for us. We usually just use ref for cooling water and it is already provided, so.. As for wardrobe, they provide a bar and hangers for hanging clothes. We brought our own hangers which I recommend if you will be staying for a long period.  The sink, which is usually inside a bathroom, is outside. I thought it would be a problem due to noise water splashing, etc. But it's kinda hidden from the bed. It's really not an issue for us. I actually like the design because I love to wash

I like this hotel very much. great location, you can go anyway from here. very closed to MRT.  but the space is a little bit small.  the bed is very very very comfortable. the room is really stylish.  have to try breakfast. really delicious. like this hotel very much. I will choose here again when I visit Singapore.

Good service, receptionists were very polite. The location of the hotel is within walking distance from bugis+. The rooms are cozy and well maintained, credits to the house keepers. Overall, the hotel has excellent service, well maintained rooms and surrounded by places to go
travel_type: Trip type: Travelled as a couple

review_title: Funky, good breakfast but teeny tiny rooms!
review_text: Nice and funky but very small rooms. Our feet stuck over the end of the bed and the bathroom facilities are a little awkward. We paid $200 for a tiny room! Slow elevators too. Breakfast choices were delish, with proper coffee from a machine. Good for a short stay, not long!
travel_type: Trip type: Travelled as a couple

review_text: We were using good king room size, but still the room is small. However for 2 adult with 2 cabin size it is still manageable. the room decoration is nice, amenities is good. everyday we get 2 bottles of mineral water, but the hotel also provide a water station if we need more drink. that's a very helpful things. the elevator took a bit time, but not really a matter for us. to Bugis MRT a bit distance, but for young couple like me it's fine, only 10 to 15 walking slowly, but for my mother it's pretty far according to her. In conclusion, we still enjoy our stay at hotel G. keep up the good work.

Comfortable stay though small. the room and gym are modern and chic. Specially mention counter staff, Aishilin who was helpful and served with passion and smiles. The lift too long to reach and complimentary or welcome mocktail was bland. Centrally located in city and easily accessible to public transport, train stations, museums and many eateries.

I love their interior design for the hotel reception, ginette bar and my room! It's so cozy too. However, there's no mini fridge which is the only negatives that i could think of. And take note that their basin is not in the toilet. haha.
travel_type: Trip type: Travelled as a couple

review_text: Good location close to the metro station, nice restaurant and good breakfast. Rooms are very nice and modern but very small, perfect for a short term stay. Staff amazing and friendly they help you in every situation. Thank you
travel_type: Trip type: Travelled as a couple

review_text:
Location is good. Very near to MRT, Shopping Mall. Drop off area is confuse for those who doesn’t know the place well. Big Car can’t go up until drop off area. Rooms are really very very small and not met for our expectations. Price is high but rooms are small which compared to other. One of the elevator is under maintenance. Long Q for taking the Lift. Staffs are excellent. Very helpful. We forgot our hand phone in the room after checkout. But we noticed after a few hours. Contacted to hotel and asked for searching the hand phone. Finally Staff found it and returned to us. Really thanks and appreciate for your help.
From
Family Group
Myanmar

#good location(nearby bus stop、MRT station)
#good staff(Bella)
#good interior design
##bad bartender(when we go to the hotel g bar and went to order something to eat with our welcome cocktail, but bartender not very welcome us ,first of all no arranged table for us ,second the bartender(ASIAN guy with gold hair) just wanna brush us off ,impertinent gave us orange juice)

ps. Besides the BARTENDER ,HOTEL G is very good place to stay!!

Everything was fine except the lift, average waiting time for a lift is 5 minutes.. Friendly and helpful front desk. Good location, walking distance to 3 MRT lines and plenty of food choices nearby. Small room without fridge.
travel_type: Trip type: Travelled as a couple

review_text: i am stay singapore and need more connection internet anf G Hotel give it. but for option breskfast should be variant due i am indonesian, rice is primary food but overall its okay. enjoyed in singapore. thanks

Tidy hotel with reasonable prices in a great location. The only issue with the hotel is that the rooms are very small and there isn't enough storage space for clothes, toiletaries, etc. As westerners we found bed in our room to be pretty short and or feet were hanging off the bed even though we are not tall by western standards. The room has all basic amenities including WiFi, safe, hair dryer and complementary bottles of water were a nice touch. Good enough for 2 night stay. Hotel staff are friendly and helpful.

Overall it was great. Only set back it's the elevator. Taking a lot of time to go up and down. Would be better if it will be maintain for the better. Will definitely be back to this hotel in the future. Highly recommended.

The rooms were small but were nicely decorated. There were NO kettles in the room as advertised. There were decanters that you needed to fill down the hall from your room with hot water.  The elevator situation needs lots of improvement: there were 2 small lifts in service that were often completely dominated by staff with carts of dirty laundry or cleaning carts etc. the staff would always try to fit you in but these 2 small lifts were servicing 16 floors. You could easily wait a very long time. Staff was friendly and helpful and the location is great

New, creative and inspiring! Love the woody decor and cabin-like feel. Very cosy and comfortable and at the same time convenient facilities that are both modern and high-tech. The rooms are unique in their design allowing well-planned space design for occupants to move around in freely in such a space confined environment.

Very clean. Close and handy to all must see locations. Loved the rain shower. Comfy bed. Ate the burger which was yummy. Too long a wait for the lifts though. Apart from that, I would definately stay again.

staff were excellent. rooms are very functional and well decorated. Bath/ body products are excellent. breakfast was awesome. thank you Hotel G Singapore. Enjoyed strolling around the area. Bugis area, Nanyang Arts and Dedign school and short walk to Singapore National museum. Nearby MRT stops are convinient. Very close to Little India and a stroll to Suntec City mall.

Friendly staff. Very stylish. Most of the time it was quiet thought i could hear someone walking past my door at night. Conveniently located near the MRT station and bus stops. Raffles City is in walking distance. Not a wide selection for breakfast but enough for me.

I am really impressed with hotel G due to good services, quiet to sleep and 4G phone - it is really helpful. I will recommend this hotel to my friends who want to find a good hotel to live in Singapore.

Very tiny rooms. Bed is set in the middle of 3 walls so we had to sleep in a weird position so we didn't have to climb over each other. No fridge or kettle, wash basin is not in the bathroom but in the already very crowded room. Getting 2 people's luggage bags in would be a very big struggle. Also the lift is the world's slowest life so plan to leave at least 5-10 mins earlier than you normally would.

Good staycation option with many things to do and eat in Bugis, City Hall. Only small downside is that the carpark costs $15 per exit (which limited our dining options as we couldn’t go in and out). Otherwise their Good room is perfect for solo/couples.

rooms are very small (best for traveller with light luggage due no storage option in room), but nicely decorated and very functional designed. Aircondition working very well, rooms quiet (stayed in 11th floor). Great location and very friendly staff. Perfect for a 2-3 day stopover in Singapore.

review_title: Good hotel for a solo traveler.
review_text: As a solo traveller I didn’t mind the small room space, comfortable bed and cleanliness matters.The hotel is just 5min walk to bencoolen MRT and walking distance to many interesting places. You can bring the free handy phone to navigate.

review_title: No refrigerator and no kettle inside the room
review_text: Everything was fine, but no refrigerator and no kettle made me difficult to keep fruit/drink and to get hot drink. Although had dispenser outside the room, but still not practical in and out from the room.

review_title: Good value hotel if travelling alone
review_text: Hotel G Singapore represents good value compared to similar class hotels in Singapore. Location is awesome in between at least 3 MRT stations (Rochor, Bencoolen, Bras Basah, etc.) and very close to Bugis Junction. However, as hinted on the title, rooms are dorm size tiny, I stayed at their Good King Room. Bathroom is small and sink is outside of the bathroom. They provided very decent amenities (Metis) and the rooms are very clean. A phone with unlimeted data and local calls in addition to some intl calls is provided which is awesome. All in all, if you're travelling alone, this is a great hotel with good value and location.

No worries about getting delicious food 24/7, the bar at the hotel serves up a good vibe for drinks and buffet breakfast was quite yummy too. Cozy decor in room, with lovely rain shower and amenities.

Good facilities in room and not far from MRT Station. Room is too small but still can be rested. Number of elevator is too less then take more time for waiting in going up and going down. Location is quiet for sleeping.

I strongly recommend this hotel for couple. Room is clean, although the power sockets are a bit loose. Friendly and helpful staff. Location is in the center of Bugis area with verities of different type of foods.

During my trip in Singapore since 12/25~12/27，I love and recommend hotel G. It provides free welcome drink、clean room、convenience taxi call and kind service. Although the room is small, the atmosphere is very tranquil~

It takes me more than 30mins for check in with too many unnecessary signing on too many papers. The first impression of this hotel - is this a love hotel? The entrance is inside a pub which is very hard to be found. Not really very kid friendly. The shower area design is very easy to have water overflow to the toilet area.

the room size is small however with the good planning of layout makes the room accessible in all manner. Room is clean and all necessary amenities provided and its within city range and accessible by MRT

The location is walkable to few MRT stations , Albert court food court and food stall surrounding Bencoolen and Middle Road. The room consider very small and narrow. Housekeeper and Front staff are friendly. Definitely will stay again.

review_title: Good hotel, Cozy and very clean
review_text: Very nice hotel, Very good location, The Bencoolen MRT is very near and you can easily walk to bugis and orchard road for shopping. Apart from that, the hotel is very clean. The only issue i have is the lift, i had to wait for a long time for the lift, but then this is not a deal breaker. Then again, if you are planning to stay here, i suggest you do, because of the price point, location and newly refurbished rooms.

The room was really small with little space to put our belongings. Nonetheless, it was rather cosy. There was no curb between the toilet and the room itself so it actually flooded our room quite a bit when I took a shower and had to ask for more floor mats to clean up the mess.

Enjoyed the stay, celebrating xmas with my LO and husband! Hotel gave free upgrade to great room when seeing us staying with LO. Hope that parking can be free in future! Looking forward to next stay with hitel G again!

review_title: Close to MRT and many foods stalls around
review_text: Easy to find and close to MRT stations (downtown line - Bencoolen and Green line - Bugis station).  Hotel environment is good and Staffs are very welcoming and friendly..although the room size is compact but overall experience is nice

Stayed here 2 nights, love love love this hotel so much. The hotel design, deco, location, conveniences, friendly staff, clean room, provide all necessities including a handy phone to bring out for navigation  and making local calls and etc etc.   One of the best hotel in SG with such reasonable price. But is not a child friendly hotel. Highly recommended hotel for small family/couple due to space constraints.   Will come back and stay here again soon.

This hotel was a huge disappointment.  The rooms are extremely small, there is no closet or drawers, and it is impossible to put two pieces of luggage on the floor.  Two people can’t move in the room simultaneously, one much be in a bed. There is no a normal bathroom, but a shower separated by a curtain, and a tiny plastic sink in the room. The whole facility is very outdated and in a bad shape. It reminds us a cheap hostel for students 30 yours ago. For the price they charge, it must be much, much better facility.

Nice gesture to have the guest mobile phone which was very convenient to tourists like us, to have accessibility to internet and local calls when out in the city. Will come and stay again when travel to Singapore .

I got to know the staff very well during the time that I stayed at the Hotel G. First I stayed from November 17-21st, and then again December 10-17th. Both times, I was highly impressed by the professionalism of the staff. I have a very restrictive diet, where I needed to keep some things in the fridge, and they let me use the fridge that they have next to the staff at the front desk. This was a game changer for me, because if they didnt do this, then I would have chosen a different hotel.  Although I believe there should be fridges in every room, because going down and up every time I needed something was an inconvenience (so I highly recommend they look into this).  However, the staff was incredible and very accomodating for me. I also had trouble sleeping in one of the small

Had never stayed in Hotel G prior to this and am glad I picked it this time round! Great location - very close to shops and public transport. Loved the theme of the deco and the 24/7 gym. Would def come back :)

Clean. Modern. Comfortable. The room was clean. The bed was comfortable. The overhead shower was amazing. Good for business travellers and families. Will be coming again very soon. The ambience is just lovely!

What I really liked was that the hotel was really clean and had this pleasant smell all around, from the reception to the hallways and the rooms. The rooms may be considered small but the space is used really well. And the decorations all around are amazing too!

This is a very nice cosy hotel with a trendy interior. Very clean and house keeping is attentive to all needs in the room. Excellent location to all the eateries close to Bugis. Will definitely be back! Thank you

The lobby is on the second floor of the parking so that’s unusual for me. It’s a very cozy and simple hotel. Clean and has everything you need for a night’s stay. The mattress was too soft for me and my partner but I think that’s subjective. Will stay again if the price is right.

The washroom is the worst - when you shower, the toilet gets wet. That is beyond frustrating. The elevators are constantly in use by the staff all day. 2/3 of the elevators are working. The power went out one night because the hairdryer tripped a fuse. The AC stopped working as a result. The rooms with a queen beds are way too small for a couple.  The location is great.

It was a trip with just me and my little boy. The room was small and cozy, we slept well as the bed was nice and the area was not noisy (5th floor). Will consider staying again if it is a solo or couple trip. Not a family trip however.

The hotel is nice clean With everything you need in a room , but the lack of space is a big discomfort. Room service/cleaning is everyday, new towels ,the best thing at this hotel is that they provide you a mobile tel with local no and free internet that you can take it in the city.

i only stayed for one night and for only a few hours because of my tight schedule. But overall, it was an excellent stay. The staff, specially at the 2nd floor (receiving area?) are very accommodating, kudos to them.  Thanks for the excellent service.

Its was alright, but sometimes i could hear banging from next door early the morning when they checked out. Everything was provided so service is good. The hair dryer is not strong enough. There was no way we could boil water in the room as we couldnt find a way to.

The photo is different then we tot the room will be. They gave me SQUARE room. But i want the rectangle room. Why we need it, cause the room is very cool we want to take photoshoot. But i got is square. To small.

The rooms are very small but seemingly typical for this price range in Singapore. The room was clean and well kept by housekeeping. Reception staff were helpful when asked questions about how to get somewhere and with ordering taxis. The location is great in the heart of the main part of the city.

I was very pleased with the helpfull staf that helps me accomodate my staycation, and turns out HotelG is much more better than the previous one (Big Hotel), looove the new concept and decoration. Breakfast was good. Will definitely come again.

review_title: Great location, great service and superb restaurant
review_text: Have stayed on several occasions for business in 2017. Rooms are on the small side but well equipped. Restaurant Ginett is great - be aware that it is very popular so reservations is a good idea. Breakfast buffet limited but the a la carte options are super (available only for. 8 am though). The staff at check-in is great.  Great value for a low-frills stay in Central Singapore.

I enjoyed staying at this hotel. Close to mrt and shopping centre. Room is clean and good vibes. The only thing bothering me is that lift’s too slow. Nevertheless, I’ll re- book this hotel again and again.

I had a lovely stay at the hotel. Great atmosphere, people working there and nice practical rooms. Only the elevators didn't work properly, which was noticable. One was out of order and inside the others you couldn't see on which floor it stopped when you were inside.

I went to Singapore early this week for holiday with my family. We were stay in G hotel. It was surprise us, because the hotel so unique, interior & ambiance very cozy, staff were welcoming, friendly and helpful. Hotel also provide us mobile phone for each room that can call 11 selected country for free! and mobile phone can bring it while you travel in Singapore.

The location is very good easy to access everywhere in singapore. The lift to the room a bit slow because one of the lift was down.  Beside that overall very good. Water dispenser just at the corner so I can refill my water there.

I booked a Hotel G and stayed for 2 nights in Dec 2017. The hotel was located in the city center and very close to MRT, food centers, and tourist attractions like Bugis street. The hotel staffs were nice and supportive. Hotel's rooms were relatively small, but the bed was clean and room atm was cosy.

Room compact and chic. Very clean. In a good central position. Breakfast very good and staff excellent. Always ready to help you with a smile. Did not enjoy having to climb over the bed to open/shut curtains as the room is narrow only approx 7ft wide. Also not enough storage for clothes. Perhaps a couple of shelves underneath the desk would be a good idea, as I had to leave everything in my suitcase. Room was Ideal size for 1 person, but then again you do not spend many hours in your room during the day as you are out most of the time exploring the city.

I do love my experience while staying at hotel G. Even though the room is small but it's fine to my liking. The interior is nice, so artsy. 2 things for room of improvement : 1. the waiting time for taking the lifts is quite long, only 2 out of 3 lifts were working during my stay. 2. I put a sign not to do a cleaning to my room before I went out, but when I came back the sign was not hanging outside and my room has been cleaned up. I am quite confused, luckily nothing was missing from my personal belongings.

review_title: Generally is clean and good room
review_text: Good service and hotel is brightness/clean.  The elevator sometimes wait for a long time especially when check out time.....(about 11AM...)  The breakfast for fruits we think the watermelon is wired sour....

Hotel G was a great experience, my partner and I enjoyed our stay very much. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful for first time Singapore visitors. The room was petite but very well thought out and didn’t feel cramped in any way. The decor was unique and felt more personal than a regular hotel. The bed was super comfortable and the room was very clean and fresh. Would definitely recommend and look forward to staying again next time we are In Singapore.

We only got positive impressions of the hotel :)  the hotel in centrally located and a bus stop / MRT is just around the corner. The drive to the Marina Bay took us 15min, which is really fast. We recommend the breakfast, which was pretty tasty for that low price :)

Comfortable room, nice deco and breakfast is alright. Some renovation was going on which makes little noise and heard within room. Overall : good. Walking distance to mrt and buses. Easy access where map board is just in front of hotel.

Very clean, tidy, functional and everything I needed for a very comfortable stay. Only drawback was the room was small but I've heard that its very expensive to stay in Singapore so this is a cost effective option to stay so centrally while experinecing a nice hotel.

Stayed here for a single night. Cosy little place, love the dreamy decor of the room. Overall, room is clean and has all the amenities you'll need. Great location, within walking distance to train stations. Definitely will come back here again!

Good environment, excellent front desk. The handy app with phone came very helpful and handy. Very environmental friendly with regards to change of bedsheet and towels.  Will be best if the lift is more effective

Great stay. Had a great king room. Knew before hand that the rooms were on the small size, so no disappointment. Room had everything that we required. Staff were all pleasant and helpful. Good breakfast. Only down side was the elevators. They were very slow and one was out of order. Thankfully we were on the 5th floor so could use the stairs.

Room was small but equipped with everything you need. Space was tight if you have two big suitcases laying out.  The A/C blows right at the bed so it was a little chilly at night. Loved the hipster decor.

Stayed for 1 night in single room.  Good clean hotel in good location. Small but clean room with good fixtures and breakfast facilities.  Can walk to Bugis junction station.  Very helpful staff. I would stay again if travelling for short stopover.

Water leakage leading to lifts malfunction.  Phone call from service desk at night which is affecting sleep quality. Breakfast is expensive. Door could not fence the noise from the corridor. Laundry is super expensive.

Stayed one night for Staycation. Check in staff might have a blue day, he dun look very happy at welcoming us. Loved the Check out staff with her great smile though.Overall hotel is good and comfy. Had a great rest.

Great location - Just a 3-5 mins walk away from Bencoolen MRT station Clean Room - Overall room cleanliness was great with basic amenities provided. Trendy hotel - Nice decoration around at the lobby area and in the room. Friendly Staff - All the staffs were friendly, smiling and helpful Small Lobby - Check in was crowded with people Poor Lifts - Only 1/3 lifts were functioning. Next day was 2/3. Slow to get up and down

every thing was great only one thing with g hotel in singapore if arrive on foot you have to go through the bar and up some steps to the lift, i sat and watched some people struggle and staff not help. i helped two ladies apart from that no complaints at all really enjoyed my stay, my friend is coming in january and is going to book tony long

The hotel provide a phone with free international call (some countries) and free data. You can take it with you when you go out to explore the city, this saving you to use the prepaid SIM. However, I only found out this when I back to hotel after a whole day out. It would be helpful if we been told when we do check in .

Very convenient location - close to MRTs and shopping. However, the facilities are very basic. Lifts are very slow and need to wait for long time. Breakfast at the restaurant was not fully ready even 10mins after 7am.

G hotel was a lovely surprise, not only for the extremely friendly staff from the very check in time to the check out but also because of its cleanliness and location. the hotel has a very trendy bar and restaurant but it is not cheap.  Singapore is not cheap though. Pros: trendy decor and atmosphere, cleanliness, friendly staff, in room facilities, location, quality of the restaurant and breakfast (breakfast had wonderful options including healthy items, hot dishes, omelette station, etc.  Just missed a bit more variety of fruit). cons: strange place for the reception area (don't be put off by this), size of bedrooms, generally small but compact and very practical, again don't be put off by this either except if you really want a big room. Don't expect great views from the

The room is cosy for two person to stay. Location is great. Nearby got mrt station around 5-10min walk. Good food nearby! However, there is no fridge provided in the room. But overall is great for me!

I was quite ‘troublesome’ on the Day 1 but the staffs are friendly and remain very patient with me. The room has got a nicely designed study area where I can work on my ideas comfortably. Great for staycation or solo who needs a totally personal space to work on ideas.

Excellent property. Top quality for location and cleanliness. Rooms are small with no storage space for clothes so you literally have to live off your suitcase as there is no storage cabinets etc. Lifts take forever lucky I was on the top floor. Other than that it's superb, and very clean

Comfy beds, clean hotels, nice gym, nice touch with guest iphone for stay duration. Lovely helpful staff! We enjoyed our stay & the local area has a great chinese food market - there's also a huge local mall for eats n drinks

Clean and cozy room. Small but nice. Staff are welcoming and friendly. Good location. Nearby to Bras Bash and Bencoolen MRT station which is around 5 - 7 minutes walking distance. Halal Indian food just outside the hotel and also opposite the hotel got halal Malay food.

the room we had was rather small. not much place to put suitcases. but nevertheless we loved the interior, the atmosphere in the restaurant downstairs and the fabulous breakfast with eastern and western options ! I would book again straight away !

Stayed in Hotel G for 3 nights from 12th Dec to 14th Dec 2017. While the building itself didn't impress me at first but appearances can be deceptive and first impressions are overrated. It was such a comfortable stay. Room was quite small but had everything one could need and didn't feel cramped. The washbasin was outside of the bathroom which was awkward.  Location was so central. Everything was walking distance. But what made the hotel really worth the great ranking is the staff. They were some of the nicest, friendliest and most helpful I've come across. I had a toothache one night and called the reception at 3 AM asking them for something to eat before I could take my meds. The receptionist went to a convenience store and got me a juice and some yogurt. Best of all, he

review_title: Great HQ for a business trip
review_text: The venue has a really good location to discover Singapore when travelling for business. It is close to two metro stations, near Little India and not far from Marina Bay and the muslim quarter. Service is excellent and breakfast ok. The only con are rooms: pretty small.

- nice and cozy room - super clean (especially, the maid is so nice to you) - easy to travel around! its near 3 mrt station - feel safe to stay there alone   - there's a restaurant downstairs, pretty good one - so many food options near by

The location was great where you can find good local food. Love the theme of the room. Very rustic and and a touch of hippie feel to it. The staffs especially Olivia, was very friendly and helpful. Will definitely come again for a short staycation.

Great service, a very clean hotel with nice location (right next to Bencoolen station). Downstairs’ restaurant/bar affordable and trendy, a nice place to hang out after a long day. The room was great and modern! Had a very nice stay!

The hotel is very nice and clean. The staff are very friendly. The location is great, near metro stations and bus stops. The mobile phone provided in the room is very handy, with free internet connection and can be used for calls. I will recommend this hotel to my friends if they need to stay in Singapore.

Overall our stay was good. The housekeeping was well done The service was good The lifts could be faster The location was very good The main entrance to the lobby from the cafeteria was a bit awkward since it was always crowded During the evenings The ceilings in the lobby and cafeteria could do with a bit of tlc The rooms were very small but you get what you pay for.

I was in a single room,l was pleasantly surprised with how the space in this room was used. Equipped with a comfortable bed, shower/toilet, TV, air-conditioning and importantly a handy phone that could be used outside of the hotel to make phone calls and for internet and maps. Enjoyed my stay. Centrally located and a short walk to an MRT station. Also a bar and a restaurant in the building, with friendly staff and great food.

The only negative comments I have to make are:  1.The bed in Room 620 is right against the wall which makes it hard for the second person to get in and out of bed  2.  I was in the shower when housekeeping knocked on the door, and my sister told the lady, I will need 30 mins to get ready and after that she could come in.  I left the card on the bed asking for the linen to be changed and I left the towels on the floor.   We returned at 10,30pm to find housekeeping DID NOT come in and do the bed, neither did she provide fresh towels.  The coffee and tea wasn't topped up either.   I rang reception and got fresh towels delivered, nevertheless it was a bit disappointing to note the room wasnt made up as requested - hence my option to select "avergae" for the Service and Sleep quality

Short walk from Bencoolen station. Staffs were very friendly and helpful. There is water dispenser near the lift. The room was very clean. I wish they didn't require deposit during check in but everything else was great.

Hotel G is located right smack in the middle of Bugis, which makes heading to Little India, Dhoby Ghaut, and exploring the central area of Singapore really easy. The Good Room was cosy and good enough for a couple with one luggage each, although packing at the same time might be difficult. Really enjoyed our stay here.   1 of the lift was not in operation during our stay and even with 2 working lifts, it takes some time for the lift to get to you. If you're lucky, you might be able to squeeze in.   There is no fridge in the room which makes grocery shopping a little difficult.

I have spend comfortable stay in Singapore. It was wonderful cost performance. The room was clean and staff at check-in & check-out also respond quickly. When I go to Singapore , I want to stay again. Thank you!

Hotel G is just 200M away from the Bencoolen MRT station of Downtown line. I stayed in a room at the end of the corridor. It's cozy and quiet.  The room provides basic things- clean towels, hairdryer, news and movie channels.  Cold/hot water and ice is available in the corridor.  I wouldn't ask for more.  I would recommend this hotel to solo traveler and couples.

Location is good, near to restaurants, food stalls, Bugis Junction & Haji Lane. Comfortable, quiet and hygiene stay. Staffs are friendly and helpful. Overall a positive experience. I will recommend to my friends.

review_title: Stay at Hotel G, meeting expectations
review_text: With the help of Tripadvisor review, booked Hotel G in Bugis area in Singapore for two nights for my business trip. It is nice, clean with great location. Easy access to key tourist points. MRT Bugis/Rochar stations are at walking distance. A lot of restaurants options in near locations. Thought rooms are small but enough space a couple stay, it is equipped with all necessary item what a person may need. In fact, extended my stay for another 3-night based on value proposition. Book it for your next time, it will not disappoint you.

It is a nice place, the elevators didn't work but the administration tried to work doing something. It was quite annoying. Anyway I stay there a lot and I like so probably I'll try again in another visit.

There were ton of ladies hair with the iron that i asked from housekeeping. When I called to the front desk, he only said ok, ok and ok. He did not event apologize and check with housekeeping about this. These are unacceptable.  How can you operate the hotel without cleanliness.

The staff were very friendly and helpful. The decor in the corridors were surprisingly pleasing and the rooms and simple, clean and just nice for a good night's sleep. Locations is great. Just off selegie road, you treats such as the famous bean curd await you.

review_title: Small room with great location, worth the price!
review_text: The room is small, as expected, but worth the price, considering the great location this hotel. I stayed 6 nights here and have planned to wash my clothes in my room. However, it's difficult to do it without a tub (the basin is leaking so it cannot be filled with water). The launch service was expensive. I should have bought new clothes instead.  The breakfast was great, with both continental and oriental food. I especially loved the omelette!

If you wish to travel to Singapore during the peak month of December, be prepared to pay a premium price during this pre-Christmas season. The hotel location was superb as it was along the new Downtown MRT line, which has a direct connection from Changi Airport, after a brief change at the Expo station to Bencoolen station is just under 5 minutes walk away.  This boutique hotel has a unique lobby location at the 2nd floor of the building, where cabs need to drive up a ramp to access a direct drop off at the reception. If you come by foot, you will use the indoor passenger lift to bring your luggage from the ground floor to the 1st level where you will go into another lift.  Wifi is free, and they also subscribe to the Handy Mobile Phone service, which is prevalent around the

The staff was really friendly and helpful,the room was cozy enough,and the fact that we are given a handy phone for free calls and internet was a real plus ! The location was perfect too just a 3 minute walk to bencoolen MRT station .

Not satisfy in general. Although location is good  the room are very small with very little facilities even no place for luggage, no refrigerator, not enough space for bath and wash room, no kettle in the room. No value for money as price is not so cheap.

Pros were good design, good beds and quiet rooms. Everything was simple and modern with a mobile for local use and internet. Great location as well with 24 hour food and massage within 2 blocks. Cons were lack of room service, lack of regard for environmental issues, and late laundry service. They could use more tv channels.

fantastic hotel and a great location with great amenities.  Helpful staff overall highly recommended . Just opposite there is a great food court , and not forgetting the inhouse restaurant and bar serves some amazings drinks and food

review_title: Clean and good value for money! Very nice downstairs bar!
review_text: Good and clean hotel. Nice location not too far from Orchard Road. Good value for money. Very nice bar downstairs with good food and amazing atmosphere! Small rooms but this is normal for Singapore. Can be a little noisy.

Rooms are compact despite high prices. The handy in the room was a bonus and quite helpful specially for those who like to roam around the city on their own. Could use a proper divider for the restroom. But overall good experience.

good hotel, nicely decorated , good for young couples. Room are on the smaller side but I knew it. complementary bottle of water, slippers and good shower products. good adjestable AC. but no mini fridge. not in the center-center but well located for the subways. great breakfast place in front of the hotel (if you want something local and no burgers) . Their bar is also good for a drink !  Also, all taxis knew where the hotel was, so easy!

review_title: Worst stay in Singapore to date
review_text: Worse than student accommodation you have to be nimble enough to climb over bed to close curtains also to climb over partner to get out of bed . There are no drawers or storage and walls need repainting and there is grime in bathroom

The hotel is located in the middle of Singapore's many attractions. It takes just a few minutes to walk to Bugis, Little India and Chijmes. The handy phone was also useful with its reliable data signal.

review_title: Loved my stay at Hotel G
review_text: Gorgeous Art Deco Hotel with amazing service from front desk. Right in the heart of Bugis with a few shopping malls around and about a 5-10 min walk to Rochor and Bencoolen MRT which are fairly easy lines to transfer onto the other MRT lines.  The rooms are on the small side but the space was used really well and decorated in such a way that it was pleasant to come home to. Bed was comfy, however if you’re on the tall side, you might not have enough leg room. Decently priced hotel for a few days stay. Best of all, you get a free phone to take with you when you go out with data and calls :D

These rooms are very small. Bed is not comfortable and its very small. Difficult to sleep well for two people. Very small bathroom. Other services like cleaning and support are good. I will not go there again.

I can genuinely feel the welcoming attitude of your staff, well done. The bed is really comfortable and this makes my business trip easier. The variety of food in breakfast can be something that can be improved, like dishes of Japanese and Chinese cuisine. Also feels quite hot in the upper ground floor restaurant area, probably too crowded.

I stayed at the G for 2 nights for a conference so I only returned to my room to shower and sleep so it was great for that purpose. Pros - a bed, tv, air conditioning, small sink, hairdryer, bathroom, toiletries, safe, desk, and rack to hang a small number of clothes were packed neatly into the space and was pretty much all I needed. I also needed an ironing board and refrigeration storage. The staff were very responsive with helping out with these services and the room was also very clean.

Rooms are too small. Room doesn't even have a fridge. Overpriced for such a small room. Breakfast was decent. Location is great. Bed was very comfortable. Decor is good. Only complaint is the room size.

The location for uber/grab to come and pick us up is really bad as they do not know where is the pick up point which needs to be entered through the carpark. It is also very inconvienient to not have a water boiler in the room available for the people who needs it. Also,When i called at around 10am in the morning, i was told that i am able to check in at 1230 but when i reach there at that timing, they told me my room was not ready and i can only check in at 2.. it was an unpleasant encounter as i made the trip there early for check in but it wasnt ready.  Overall, its a good experience but it could be better

The room was small as expected, but we didn't mind so much as we weren't planning to spend long in the room. There was no room to have our suitcases out and walk around, despite getting the next room size up. The bed and decor was nice. The walls had markings on them and seemed dirty. The sink is in the entrance way, not in the bathroom. Inconvenient. The shower and toilet are in a tiny area of the room together, and the small shower head was broken so we used the overhead one. The shower curtain stuck to me every time I showered which wasn't pleasant. It felt like a camp shower - you want to get in and get out as quickly as possible.   Having said that, the decor was nice and where you have breakfast is beautiful. The breakfast wasn't very good, which we were disappointed about

Taps & shower are not working properly in Rest rooms. Shower is leaking and it was not working.  Rooms are small rooms. Breakfast wasn't great. A/C wan't working properly. Price was high and quality of the rom is not that much worth

review_title: Great place in the middle of singapore with affordable price
review_text: The receptionist is great, u get a handy phone to use in singapore for free, the room is clean, the bath room is ok. 1 minus experience i get is the hair drier is broken. Free flow water an ice in the hall. U can refill ur bottle and take to ur roome

Fancy location, Nice design, good bar and restaurant Friendly service, very good breakfast, Well-located good access to metro, small rooms but well-done and cosy sometimes some traffic jam when using the elevators It´s definitely my first choice for my next trip to Singapore

My staffs like the hotel as it is cosy and the toiletries provided are of good quality. We will recommend for our overseas staffs to visit Singapore for work, to stay at G Hotel. But the room rate is quite pricy.

I had stayed in the hotel 5 nights for attending Singapore marathon. Hotel location is around 5-10 min walk to Orchard Road starting point, this is good for me. Also hotel rate is reasonable for its location. Hotel room have reasonable adequate space and clean. Room facilities are keeping in good condition, good wifi too. Room rate could include breakfast but i didn’t choose. Since there are so many BF choices just around the hotel in 5 min walk. For a solo traveler prefer a reasonable price hotel to stay , this hotel is perfectly suited my requirements.

I checked in for a day. It was a pleasant stay but perhaps it's a refurbished building, the walls between the rooms are thin and you can hear conversations next door. Other than that, everything is pleasant, the staffs are very courteous and welcoming.

The best thing about this hotel is their location! You can go anywhere easily. The room is clean and the service also good. This is my first time staying at this hotel and overall it has been a good experience. Definitely I will recommend this hotel to families and friends. Keep up the good work!

I stayed here for 9 nights and I didn't have any issues at all! The staff were so friendly and helpful. The room was a great size. The location was one thing that I loved, it was a 5 min walk away from Bugis and a 15 min walk away from Orchard Road. I would definitely stay here again and I would recommend anyone going to Singapore to stay here too. Overall, it was good value for money!

Staff friendly and helpful.  The rooms were nicely designed and efficient.  Room came with a smart phone that allows to get information easily.  Hotel is connected to a wine bar and also is closely located to cheaper restaurants that have Chinese and Indian food.

review_title: Tiny cabin-sized rooms like a hostel, not a hotel
review_text: I stayed here for one night, after arriving in Singapore a day early. The room was incredibly small, with an awkward room layout. If it had been advertised as a Yotel, cabin, or a capsule-style room I would have known what to expect and would have been less critical. I was expecting it to be a normal, standard hotel, which it wasn't. The front desk staff were also very stand-offish, possibly because they get a lot of complaints so they want to avoid customers. I couldn't wait to wake up the next morning and check out of there.

One of the receptionists was very rude. After I checked out and asking if I can leave my luggage while having the meeting at the restaurant downstair, she ignored and just walked passing by since we were no longer guests. Also I left my T-shirt in the my room called after checked out and they didn’t even take a minute to look at it. The pictures on the website look a lot nicer than actuall one!

This is my first stay at this hotel. Around late night, I asked for the iron and iron board. Less than 15 minutes, I got it from housekeeping. While I was doing the ironing, I found that there were tons of lady hair with iron line. After that I called the front desk and told him about the issue. He only said ok, ok and ok. There was no apology from him, no questions and no any calls after that. Both staff’s manner and cleanliness are unacceptable. Very disappointed.

The single room is a little bit small。but the hotel is very clean and the bed is very comfortable. The geographical position is very important.If the hotel has a free parking, it will be better, or you can reduce the cost.

Poorly designed rooms.  Bed accessible from only one side. ie 3 sides were walls!  Very little space for suitcases and virtually no hanging space. Only one chair. Miserly with coffee etc. only 2 sachets of coffee and sugar. Difficult access as reception is on first floor with only a wheelchair type of lift to reach it.

Very nice ambient. Great location, easy to navigate around. There's a bar downstairs which is great for chilling. Wasn't noisy at all at night. Room is very clean and unique. Worth the money. Will definitely be back again!❤

A fun, hip hotel, but the rooms are tiny and there is no closet space, only a hook to hang two articles of clothing. Also the bed was very uncomfortable. But the staff were friendly and helpful and the area has a lot of shopping and close access to the train line, which is surprisingly clean for a metro and easy to use.

The hotel receptionist showed "the look" when my friend, who was not very good with English tried to converse with her in Chinese. The carpark was expensively charged (not sure if this is common practice for hotels in Sg). Other than that, we loved the place. The room was nicely designed. Had 2 nights good sleep.

review_title: Still small but it doesn't matter
review_text: The hotel has quite small rooms but honestly, if you are out all day, does it matter? Having said that, you can live there quite happily, the beds are large and comfortable and the bathroom adequate. This is a modern hotel and the reception is small but friendly and very helpful. The restaurant is excellent - a lovely breakfast spread around the area and very lively at night. A good central location for the Flyer and the Gardens by the Bay. I would happily stay again because everything that you need is there and at a good price. Not for you if you want a large room but then you will have to pay for it elsewhere. I love the decoration and the well stocked bar.

We were a group of 7 from Kuala Lumpur and booked 3 rooms for 2 nights in Singapore. We love the tastefully decorated and very functional room layout, convenient location and easy access to halal 24hour sidewalk food joint. Front service staff were also very genuinely helpful

Husband and I stayed here for 2 nights. Was a smooth journey from start to finish. Checkin was fast and easy, staff were polite, friendly and very welcoming. Got a free phone to use during our stay which included data and calls within singapore and to the UK which was a huge bonus. Room was quirky which we loved. Only problem I would say is there is no barrier between the shower and the toilet so water floods everywhere. Loved breakfast. Amazing atmosphere. Stay here

Clean and functional with a good bar and restaurant on the ground floor. Excellent location.  Staff very helpful. Good breakfast which sets you up for the day. Within walking distance of Littke Indua, Bugis Street, China town and the Bay Area.

I heard that this hotel is near dhoby ghout or bugis but it's very~ near by Bencoolen station. 3 mins of walking ! So it was very easy to go to mrt station. !
And also, the room design is so modern and very neat !!!
i really enjoyed staying there and if i will go to singapore again, i want to choose G-hotel again .. hehe Thank you !

GoodThe location of the hotel is first class,first-class service ,first-class health room,built-inbath room,not out of the carpet,easy to fall,the sound slightly worse, bedside lamp is not bright enough.

Very cosy room with all required basic amenities like tooth brush hair dryer safety vault shower gel.. staff is very friendly.. loved the gym.. the decoration and style for a hotel
Cleanliness is amazing

Take advantage of the FREE smartphone whilst you stay at Hotel G. It allows you internet and calls within Singapore. This is a first for me.

Very comfortable beds, and the restaurant attached serves some great Burgers.

Booked a room for 3 days in beginning December 2017. The hotel located strategically in middle road, which is nearby Bugis junction. If you want to pray at Kwan Im temple in Bugis, then this hotel is perfect place. You just need to walk around 5 mins and you will get there. The building is modern and moderate size. First floor are restaurant and bar. The restaurant called Ginett wine and bar are both restaurant and bar. This place is hype and crowded in the night with youngster. Great place to hang out. Another restaurant is 25 degrees which is the place that you can have a decent burger. Despite of the hotel restaurant itself, it is only 5 mins to go to Albert food centre ( well known hawker center in Bugis, and also you could walk to the Bugis Junction. So food is not a problem. And also shopping.
The room itself, we booked what they called mystery room. Basically the interior designed to look alike detective room, which is kind of cool. we have single bed room for two person. while it is not that spacious but it is adequate and even can fit for 3 persons. They provide standard amenities such as coffee and tea set, 2 bottles of mineral water provided by Dr Who Singapore. The good things that the room has window and facing the street. And it has a smart tv, which can mirroring your android smartphone. So you could watch youtube or Netflix using this and thanks God that wifi is speedy here.
The bathroom is small. The shower separated by curtain with the toilet. There is no bidet and there is no wash basin. The wash basin is outside of the bathroom. They use Metis product from Australia for the soap and shampoo. And also good to mentioned that they provide a hairdryer.
The hotel has a gym, which is decorated nicely. It is located on the 3 rd floor. While it is not that big, but the toopl is adequate. I even has boxing bag. Also it is opened 24 hours by using your room card.
The lobby and the taxi stop located on the 2nd floor. It is small lobby but well decorated. The staff also attentive. You can hire taxi from them
Overall I must say that was a pleasant stay experience. Worth to back to this hotel again

review_title: Nice boutique hotel with everything you need
review_text: Clean and nice boutique hotel with everything u need. Nicely renovated, though room is a bit small but bearable as I just need a place to sleep. Shower place needs improvement, as water may easily overflow....
travel_type: Trip type: Travelled as a couple

review_title: Great Value but consider your breakfast options if you are in a rush.....
review_text: Singapore is a very expensive city, so low price that Hotel G offers is actually what you would expect from a budget hotel.  Considering this fact, the Hotel G delivers quite a bit of bang for the buck.  Yes, the rooms are small.  It will be quite close if there are two in the room.  You'll crawl over your sleeping partner every morning.  But, this is fine.  A larger room at a similar style of hotel will cost you considerably more.  My major concern had to do with the breakfast.  First of all, the breakfast offering was quite nice.  Without a doubt.  But, the space was incredibly unorganized and it seemed like the staffing could improve.  I'm not one to complain, but some mornings it was basically impossible to get a cup of coffee because the staff did not reset the coffee machine, or there were no cups, or some sort of easily remedied error.  It seemed as though the staff was not lacking in quantity, but rather in motivation and/or direction.  It was somewhat disappointing, because the was obviously considerable effort put into setting up a nice breakfast spread.  Where I would have normally given a five, I will give a four.
travel_type: Trip type: Travelled as a couple

review_text:
just checked in ... looks great so far. Small rooms, I got a free upgrade to King, even then. No mini bar, small work space but okay. Good location.

Nice modern touch, lots of wood and contemporary design. nice and quiet, squeaky clean room.

Room décor wet rooms  needs freshen and  up-dating, and its not to  4 stair standard. Plus I was given a free complement drink voucher on my first day, but their was a catch, when ordered my drink the barman  said its only for soft drink and not even for the beer, beer coasted me 18 Singapore dollars, please make it clear at the time of checking , what's included in the price.  This hotel is for the younger generation. Good luck

review_title: Great stay but there was some hiccups
review_text:
Overall a great stay, the hotel rooms were decorated tastefully and the beds were very comfy!

But here are a few hiccups:

First night - realised that the air-conditioning was malfunctioned and called the reception, problem was resolved 5 minutes later and we were switched rooms immediately. The next room was a little dusty and the floor was a little sticky, but it was 1.30am in the morning and we didn't make a fuss about it. It got cleaned the next morning.

There was some water leaking on the corridor to the new room. Initially thought it was due to rain but it didn't stop after 3 nights there.

I parked my car there and double checked on the parking rates - I got told that as long as I don't move my car, I will be charged a flat rate of $15/day. And so I left it there until I checked out of the hotel - Which I got told that I'm supposed to move the car on a daily basis so that I can reset and get the flat rate; Very confusing statements altogether. I wasn't told that I could pay the parking fees via credit card with the hotel, because I had then reloaded my CashCard on purpose to pay for it. Thankfully the reception on duty manage to still give the flat rate despite me not moving the car daily.

Only stayed the 1 night wish it had been more now. Everything was just great, check in easy, room compact but that’s fine it’s just to sleep in. Bar welcoming and my favourite thing the Handy phone which you can use out and about on both data and calls. This was really useful as I had to call Home about something’s. Would recommend to stay here to family and friends if visiting Singapore.

We stayed here for 4 nights. Hotel is lovely and clean, 20 min walk to the city. Shops and bars very close by. We thought the room was very small, but we expired the city all day and only used to room to get washed and sleep really. Would recommend it for people who explore all day.

review_title: Great budget hotel in an awesome location
review_text: The hotel was very clean and tidy and the staff were just delightful.  There are 2 MRT stations close by for easy access to airport and other city locations.  Bed was a little hard, but not uncomfortably so.  Breakfast was plentiful with lots of variety to cater for different nationalities.

Stayed here for 3 nights whilst travelling around Asia on hols. The pictures didn't really do it justice. Location wise it's pretty great only being about a 10 minute walk from Orchard Road and about 20mins from Clarke Quay. The hotel is less than a year old and fits into the boutique category. We stayed in a great king room which was above (in terms of size) the good king room and good Queen room respectively. Our only minor gripe would be the size of the room but the space was managed extremely well and was clean, comfortable and modern. How the room could have been any smaller I'm not sure but for people like us who were making the most of the city and only really using the room for sleep it was ideal. A nice touch was the use of a mobile phone which could be used locally and

Hotel G is very convenient as it located walking distance to Bugis and some attractions. They even provide mobile phone with data & phone calls FOC! Which is very convenient to bring along when going around! The staffs are friendly and the room is clean. Strongly recommended and will definitely come back for stay again!

Nice enough hotel, front desk staff was very friendly and helpful but we found the room quite small and difficult for the second person to get into bed because you couldn't even walk around it and had to crawl over the other person or on tiny wooden edge.  Found the breakfast overpriced and not a great selection.  Location was pretty nice.  Comfortable bed, good temperature control in the room and easy in and out.  Industrial concrete around the elevators was odd too - not very nice looking.

Small Room (unlike pictures) Lack of closet (my clothes stayed inside my bag across the 5 days) Lack of handspray or bidet (inconvenient) Unable to order from restaurant to room (must come down by myself) Uncomfortable bed and pillow Washbasin in the middle of the corridor and tooooo small

I really like this hotel.this hotel located is near from Bugis + and Bugis MRT.and the receptionist was very kind to me.i think i Will comeback again to stay in this hotel if I'm visit SG.Terima kasih

Hotel G has great service online and offline. Classy and cozy, Hotel G ticks off a lot of boxes for the traveller that is looking for convenience, classy, cozy and value for money. Great effort of putting in Handy in your rooms for tourist to fully utilise.

A comfortable stay in a centrally located hotel with very helpful and courteous staff. The central location made it easy and convenient for commuting around Singapore. Rooms were small, but I already knew that before booking. Overall a great stay in Singapore for a small vacation.

The room was mostly practical though I would appreciate a bidet by the toilet bowl. The bed was great and comfy. The room size was just nice for solo traveler on a business trip. Quite a distance to walk (7-15min) and enjoy a hearty, halal food on Arab street and to catch the MRT to get to other parts of Spore. All in all, it was a pleasant experience for me!

Clean comfortable room, very nice. I picked room as advertised breakfast included. Booking.com said total cost two nights $251. When I check in I am told not $251 add fee it will be $298. Also another $18. a day for breakfast. It really left me feeling like I was tricked. Better to be up front honest when you say total cost two nights show truthful total cost. Sorry but you asked. Thank you  P.S. I had a great burger downstairs.😊

review_title: Excellent Stay , quirky hotel, very helpful staff.
review_text: We arrived later than anticipated, staff very helpful providing details for eating options locally, including 25 degrees,  next door the burger was amazing and reasonably priced. We had tours booked and staff confirmed arrangements, and proactively called local agents to check times etc. Sadly our onward journey to Bali was cancelled due to volcano, the staff helped us extend our stay with lowest cost options, printed paperwork, contacted airlines and taxis nothing was too much trouble. The handy phone in the room was very useful , at no charge we called locally and international to sort out travel arrangements. We ate in the GINETT restaurant at the hotel , the food was excellent, breakfast options to suit all. Rooms are comfortable, you can't walk round the bed. Make sure you

review_title: Stylish hotel in the middle of town
review_text: Absolutely had a great stay at Hotel G. Excellent location with great food options within walking distance. Thank you for the room upgrade and great service standards! Only thing lacking was a bathtub and a pool but otherwise it was great value for money :)

Weekend trip was easy with a hotel in a central location, located near two subway stops. The restaurant located in the hotel and the restaurant next door were great places to eat too.  Rooms were on the small side but fit my needs perfectly.

very nice stay, room clean but too cold and would have been useful to have more space for clothing. breakfast perfect and very confortable the restaurant below. good transport services, polite personeel and

My Hotel G room was small (the mattress was too short and my feet were almost touching the opposite wall) but had a very interesting layout, maximizing use of space.
