The sink was in the hallway, just outside the bathroom. The bed was comfortable (other than being too short for a tall person). The room door barely attenuated hallway noise; I could hear conversations outside, and I'd suggest replacing such cheap doors with solid wood doors. The neighborhood is very nice, with affordable eateries on Bencoolen. The Bugis MRT station is a good ten minute walk. Overall the hotel offers good value for the money.

The hotel provides a good service but the room condition is not good. Our television is not working properly and we could not turn it off. Even someone already fixed it but it still broken. Please do something!!! For the overall is every nice hotel.

Overall everything is excellent except for the size of the room, not spacious enough with no mini bar and boiler. My wife love the hair dryer compare to any hotel she stayed before. Good location, especially the building next to the hotel have a lot of vegetarian restaurants.

Hotel is nearest to three MRT stations. As a solo traveller the room is good enough however there's only a small wiggle room if you open your luggage. Basic amenities is supplied except maybe for the disposable shaver that is missing (some hotels provide this). Smartphone can be used outside and have call and internet connection available.

Room small, but clean & tidy Suggestion is to improve signage to tell car drivers how to get to the back entrance to pick up or drop off guests. And improve signage at the Middle Street entrance, to tell people that that is also the hotel entrance, plus how to get to reception

Location is good and convenient. Room is clean and cozy. Staff is friendly and helpful. I especially love the seem catcher in the room as it's meant to catch all my bad dreams and give me a good rest. It's very thoughtful of you guys.

Superb location, great restaurants and food downstairs, rooms are a bit small and would be hard to fit 2 in a good room. Go for the great room instead if you're traveling with another person. Otherwise great service. Clean. Wifi is great and i like how you can refill water just in front of the rooms

I stayed here before when it was called Hotel Big so I was interested to see what had changed since being rebranded Hotel G and I'm pleased to report that although it was very good before there was an improvement in every department and we all had a very pleasant stay. Would definitely recommend the hotel and will stay again on my return to Singapore.

Good location of the hotel near to metro station. Walking distance to orchard road. Excellent breakfast - stuff was helpful and smiley all the time. Small rooms, very small bathroom. No place to put your luggage in the room which was quite uncomfortable. Overall is good hotel.

Comfortable stay, good Food, great ambience of the bar, not too far from Orchard Road. The staff are accommodating ang warm. Will be back to this hotel in future trips to Singapore. Will also recommend to Friends.

A very nice good looking Hotel.  The room was a little bit to small for two people in my opinion.  They were clean and modern. In the room was a Smartphone.  The bar is great.  I would choose it again.  Good service.

This is a decent hotel. There are some cool interior design concepts used to make it nice.   However there are some basic lacunae to be seen as a business hotel or as a 4 star hotel.   There are food eateries outside. This place is not necessarily a family hotel.   Hotel G Bugis * Looks like a stylish room and more welcoming. However it has a very small bathroom with the sink in the room itself and not in the bath. * No cupboard. * Wooden finish flooring. * Took a bit of time to checkin. Not sure why. There are 3 people at checkin counter.  * The front lobby for checkout and check in is crowded in the morning. On almost all days. * Lift provisioning is not enough. I have seen and waited as it was full more than a few times. This is not a big deal, but just mentioned for your

review_title: A more-than-pleasant and surprise find that's worth every penny.
review_text: The hospitality of the staff were excellent. Despite me arriving early and not being able to check-in at 2p.m., the service of the staff won me over. I had no complaints of the place! Cleanliness of the room was tip-top. I would highly recommend Hotel G to any locals for a staycay, and to foreigners a hotel they should definitely stay at.

Different, but a lovely hotel with small rooms though everything one needs. Clean, good linen, well thought out and situated close to Metro rail. Restaurant food excellent and great staff. Leaving was a bit slow, not because of the front office who by the way are very efficient but because the lifts were so very slow! I would definitely return.....

Had a pleasant 3d2n stay at Hotel G. Rooms were slightly on the smaller side, but the great king room had ample space for us to move around. We adored the design of the room - simple and gorgeous. The only thing was that we would have preferred if there was a fridge/ mini kettle in the room, although the water dispenser was just next to our room. If our rooms were further in, it will be such a hassle to keep going in and out to get water. But overall, we had a fun family staycay at Hotel G!

Great hotel to explore the city. Perfekt location, close to metro station. Small rooms, but well equipped. That was the first time that i have a smartphone with free internet and calls in hotel avaliable.

hotel is very modern, warehouse desgin  it is very clean easy access, taxi service  good location  good wifi and portable phone  restaurant downstair (genti and 25) are very good  room is very small, very little storage space  would not recommend for families

Had a wonderful stay, staff are very friendly and helpful, rooms are small but have everything you need, very clean and close to some great bars and restaurants. Ideal for short stays. Highly recommend.

The location, the staff and the whole building was amazing, also the gym was great! The room was tiny but it’s very comfortable to be in the center. The hotel located near to orchard road(the main road with shops and malls), you can find also a lot of mrt(subway)stations!

I felt very welcomed by the staff members. Breakfast is delicious with a large choice. The restaurant Ginett and 25 degress provide their guests with high qualty wines, cheeses and french dishes.  Congrats to the chef ! The rillettes were extra tasty.  The gym is good. The hotel is lacking a swimming pool which I didn't mind for my business trip.

review_title: Modern Hotel with a golden touch of Retro.
review_text: Great hotel with an amazing staff and people to help and serve you better. From the people down at the resturant Ginett to the room service. Small room but amazing  decor. Great location near 2 MRT stops just 5 mins away. A 7eleven near by too. Overall a great spot for couples.

Very stylish hotel with super location in the city. The room was clean and we enjoyed free waters every day, gym was equipted very well. We enjoyed the excellent breakfast. The toilet could be more seperated from the room and we missed the wardrobe in the room. Nevertheless I would reccomed this hotel for stay in Singapore

Great location, close to 2 MRT stations and walking distance to shopping areas. Great bar and restaurant on the 1F, good for friend gathering or have a drink by yourself. Clean and nice décor.  Nice staff.

Arrived early (0530), room not available. Upsold me on a room available @ 1000. Left property for Mass (many close options for Catholic Mass), returned to discover they sold the room they offered me previously, and wanted to upsell me even further. I said no, and waited for my original room to become available. Tiny lobby, no free lobby WiFi. Accessed my room WiFi and worked for 3 hrs before they allowed me into room. Breakfast was heavy on breads and noodles, omelet station weak due to weak English skills of chef. Room super small, toilet and shower separated by a curtain. No bathtub or closet. Bed comfortable, A/C worked well, room quiet. Fair value for price.

Nice Hotel, centrally located in the middle of Singapore, the staff are very helpful as well, it has its own restaurant which is great for us new to Singapore. American style burger bar, albeit a little expensive.

Unsuitable for business as no place to have a meeting and Had to go to another hotel.Arrived with heavy bag.Nobody to help carry to room. Reception full of people and bags. Very uncomfortable.  More suitable for young people passing through. Felt very strange in this place and hoped we would not have had a fire. One female staff member very helpful to this 77year old

Probably one of the best hotels I have ever stayed it. The staff were great and friendly and the rooms were fantastic and comfortable. I love the modern aesthetics of the internal decorations but there was a rustic feel to restaurants below. Will definitely stay here again for my next visit in Singapore. Highly recommended.

The location is excellent ; the hôtel is next to everything and the subway is really near.  The bed is really comfy and they even borrow you a cellphone with unlimited data which is really useful, moreover there is free water in every corridor of every floor.  I highly recommand this hotel, beautiful room.

review_title: 4th Stay, still equally refreshing and exciting
review_text: Hotel G's room design are very modern and "hipster" in some way. Gives me a very nice and satisfying feeling when I stay there. A very popular staycation choice for me. Will definitely stay there again.

review_title: nice concept hotel in the middle of singapore
review_text: the only thing that was missing was hot drinking water in the room. It seems that I have to get it outside the room or call for it. Otherwise had a very nice stay. the hotel had a boutique like concept but fell a little bit short I think.

Although the room is compact, the many well thought out design and arrangemnt made the room comfortable enough for a good sleep. It would be better if the bath lotion provided is a bigger size for Singapore is hot and you need to shower a few times a day. For a short stay with limited luggage, this place is a very good choice.

1. I felt good about the kindness of the check-in desk. 2. Some employees, however, did not know the checkout time properly and did not seem to have the will to let them know. 3. The location of the lobby was uncomfortable. 4. The outlet was poorly grounded and did not fit properly. 5. Location is good.

very comfortable, i love their bed and pillow alot. walking distance to bugis street and MRT station. sounds cancellation can be improved. lots of restaurants around, no need to worry about getting food.

Nice design of the hotel and room. Great decoration. Great location. Good services from the staff Easy to access. Unfortunately my room is next to store room or service rooms. It was quite noisy sometime, seems like sound insulation is not that good.

review_title: Good location and hotel is clean!
review_text: The location of the hotel is super good! It’s near Orchard, Bugis, Bencoolen MRT and some famous food in Singapore. However the aircon is so cool that the air directly point to the bed and for someone who has cold allergy, I sneezed all the time and made me can’t sleep well. Maybe the air from aircon can be moved since the AC is central. Besides there’s an inconsistancy for daily room make up. Overall the stay in Hotel G is good! The receptionist is kind too. Even they can help me to arrange a little surprise in the room.  Thanks for having us!

convenient, near my office, centralize, near by night life.  Only 1 thing, that I don't like is that  the Toilet - it does not come with a water spray, or it is also call the Bidset, for washing you front & back, after used....  (plse look into this matter)

review_title: Nice boutique hotel, good for solo travelers or couples
review_text: Its a nice boutique hotel with industry chic deco. Located some in Bugis, its a 10-15min walk to the nearest MRT stations and a short drive to Chinatown and the central business district. The rooms are tastefully decorated and fairly clean, and the bed is comfortable. What I like about this hotel is the great dining establishments at the ground floor. Ginett restaurant and wine bar as well as the 25 Degrees burger concept from LA. Also close by is an awesome cafe called Artichoke which offers an exceptional dining experience. Otherwise, there are many food courts nearby for those who wants to venture into eating local food amongst the locals.  The only downside is that the room is small and there's barely enough storage space for two average size luggage. Its OK for solo

Air-con auto off after take off the room card causing the room very stuffy after come back. This shouldn't happen to a 4 stars hotel.  No leg room in front bed, not convenient for 2 especially need to wake up in the mid night for toilet.

I was travelling on my own so booked a single room. I did not expect the room to be so tiny. If I had been travelling with a normal sized suitcase, it would not have fit in the room.The length of the room was the length of the single bed. The lights were positioned at the far end of the bed So if I needed to turn on/off the lights from my bed I had to get up to do so.  The lobby is also very small. So when it was time to check out it was packed with guests trying to settle their bills.When I was checking out I had to wait 20 minutes to finally get into a lift that was not full. I would not stay there again.

from check in to check out it was an excellent experience.  The only thing it can be improved is the breakfast set up,  going up and down for juice was a little bit challenging, the food at the breakfast was excellent.

nice and clean room  near by train station about 5 min walk room a bit small but layout is compact there is a phone with sim card so no need to buy one some staff are difficult to understand when speak english

Lobby location a problem. Should have some form of indicator at roadside to call for taxi to lobby. And the kerbs need to be fixed. Remove sharp corners and reduce the kerbs which are protruding too much. My friend's car rim was badly scratched. Last minor issue, my room entrance light could not be turned off, but since my trip was short two nights I did not request room change. Affected my sleep though. Regards.

You have excellent breakfasts, fresh rooms, your staff is responsive. We will come back.  MRT in few minutes help us to get in from airport without issues. We have used phone to navigate in the city, it is nice idea to provide it

Room is very clean, fresh. And All staff is kind, location also is very good. So If i travel the Singapore again later, I hope that reserve again. Thank you helping to have good travel.  ah, I have a question. When will the deposit be refunded? I use credit card, the deposit is not refunded yet. please check, and reply

My friend blogged about her stay in a Residence G in Hong Kong and suggested that I stay here. Decided to book here for a short trip back to Singapore since it was a long weekend back home.   Room size wasn’t so bad, I was traveling alone so it was just right for me. What I didn’t like was the bathroom, there was no partition between the toilet and the shower. The only thing that was separating the two was a shower curtain — this was a problem while showering. It sticks to your legs probably because of the exhaust/ventiallation.   Bed wasn’t so bad either just wished they had a better duvet. Had to ask for extra blanket because it was too thin. Also, the walls of the room were probably not thick enough, there were some banging sounds coming from the next door and from the room

review_title: A great hotel for a busy back-to-back visit to Singapore!
review_text: I recently stayed at Hotel G, when on a business trip to Singapore.  I really enjoyed the room – very straight-forward design, with all you need. The HouseKeeping team did a great job looking after me and keeping everything very clean and the Front Desk team was really lovely to deal with upon check-in and check-out.  Hotel G Singapore is quite famous for its restaurant/bar, Ginett on the Ground Floor – it’s definitely the best value-for-money French location in Singapore. The place is open to the street level; it is buzzing; it is fun and service is good. I had a few great nights there during my stay.  And as a jogger, I quite liked the location – the hotel is only about 1km away from a nice loop you can run all around the Marina Bay. I was out every morning before breakfast

I am a booker and recently due some miscommunication on the reservation I did with Booking.com and requested for an early one day check out HOtel G was attentive and is very flexible to my request eventhough it was stated non-refundable.  Superb and excellent for their management.   Will definitely book direct with them in future for my staff.

Location is perfect. The style and decoration make the hotel unique. The room is very cozy and the amenities are perfect to enjoy the trip. Last but not least, the upgrade to a room with a balcony with city view was marvelous!

This is not cheap hotel in the centre of city. No swimming pool. No lobby in the ground floor.  When your neighbours are laughing you can hear them easily. Good tea set. No bath, only a shower withiut a door.

It was my first time in this hotel, and I found out an optimal relation price/quality for Singapore standards. The room is not so big, but is clean, comfortable and with all the amenities needed. The location is quite good.

Fantastic, quirky hotel rooms and brilliant hotel bar - lots of atmosphere and a good mix of hotel guests and locals. Location is good, albeit a taxi ride from the marina etc. Overall a great trip and very friendly staff.

If your looking for a hotel in a central location close to public transport and only 10mins from the Bay then Hotel G is the place to stay. With a restaurant below which has buffet breakfast everyday that catered to all needs from your traditional Asian meals and western meals. The rooms are neat clean and functional with large bathroom facilities. I would definitely recommend this place.

review_title: A Few nights stay in November
review_text: The value for money is very good, the restaurants on bottom floor have reasonable prices and tasty food, the hotel breakfast is definitely worth it! On the other hand the rooms are small with no storage space what so ever. Another minus is the hotel lack pool, besides that it's all good

nice and comfort hotel. with a great and helpful staffs. the location is quite good, near to bencollen MRT station and Bugis District. nice and modern room. the bed is quite big for two people. it feels like im in brooklyn

review_title: Great location, lovely rooms, comfortable bed.
review_text: Great, great great... apart from room was just a bit larger than the average ikea wardrobe, resulting in someone having to climb over someone else to get to the bathroom.  Annoying details like the hairdryer didn’t quite extend enough so you could use the mirror at the same time. Breakfast.... everything kept running out... so you’d get an egg(they ran out of eggs one morning!) Then you’d have to wait for bread....the staff would bring 2 French sticks, so you always felt that you didn’t want to take anything like you would like....! This happened to.... fruit, sliced bread, yoghurt, bread pudding.... very annoying! Get there as it opens or just after, otherwise your going to be disappointed.

Small rooms, but well designed and appointed. Excellent location with ample public transport available nearby. Quiet despite location, and friendly service. However due to size of rooms - pricing needs to be attractive. One major issue was small lobby meant check in and check out was very chaotic

I think Hotel G is quite newly opened. I found an artistic smart hotel here. Facilities is good and complete. Very comfort room for sure. Great location. They have a Restaurant and bar, Ginnet, which is good for breakfast, brunch, and also for night lounge. Besides, they also have 25 Degrees Burger, good choice for lunch time. Place is so tasting.

Excellent for this price point. Could be better if there were bath robes in the room. Also, perhaps could explore an arrangment with the restaurant at the ground level to provide some room service options.

Set within easy reach of all sites. Food quarter and bars within easy walking distance. Excellent service,though bar can get very busy resulting in delay of serving. Rooms small but very clean and staff friendly. Would stay again.

review_title: Clean, Silent, Highly cost effective hotel
review_text: All is good, except: 1. The lobby in second floor and not so easy for us to call a taxi. Not everyone knows the Lobby's location; 2. The switch of main lamp in bedroom didn't work, I don't like to sleep with so bright condition, and I just hope you can repair it (Room1120).

We have been to Ginnet @ G Hotel many times and love the place. For this trip, we decided to stay at G. We were REALLY very surprised with the size of the room. It had to be one of the smallest room we've stayed in, the sink was outside of the bathroom, the bed was against the window (but with a useful ledge) and to get hot water, we had to go to a dispenser outside the room. We had quite a laugh. Overall design is very modern and nice...we loved the colours and design despite how small the room was. We were not informed of the hotel guest parking charges (SGD15 for 24hrs) so on the first day, we paid SGD35 for less than 12 hours of parking! Great for business travellers but not so much holiday-goers.

review_title: Small but comfortable. New hotel so the facilities are new and clean.
review_text: Nice location for food, MRT and shopping! Very close to Bugis. Counter staff are very nice and professional! Every floor has Drinking fountains for ice water, hot water and even ice cubes. It's very convenient!

The location is good since it only takes 5 minuets to MRT. There is a welcome drink for each guest but we don’t have the time to enjoy it. Also, hotel provide a smartphone in each room which can help me with the map when we go outside.However the room is very small.

Amazing hotel with great amenities (comfortable room and hot/cold water dispensers on the floor) and great walking distance to Bugis and MRT. Also a good walk to Little India, Chinatown. Highly recommend this hotel as it was at the perfect location in Singapore.

the staff is friendly and very helpful. the room is stylish, clean with good amenities enough for staying in short period. but in my opinion the room should provide fridge and shower booth for keeping the bathroom floor dry

Good hotel! Ver y clean, near from the train station, you can walk to the atractions and have an excelent breakfast. At night the bar is very cool. The only problem is the wifi because is not included.

review_title: Great Hotel with Not So Great Size
review_text: Had 2 Good rooms and 1 Greater room with my family. While the greater room had just enough room, the good rooms were very small and did not have a twin option. If the room was any smaller, I would've called it a chicken cage instead of a room. But in fairness, the staffs, cleanliness and design/concept were excellent.

Nice and clean environment, but the rooms are very smalls. Good breakfast, but the breakfasting area is diffused.Reaching the reception is not so easy, via the car park. And the shower not properly separated from the toilet.

This has been our second time at hotel g and it has been great again. Friendly & positive staff, great rooms and excellent location close to Bugis. Extras like the complimentary mobile phone are a great bonus. We will be back soon.

Amazing stay in Hotel G, simple modern quite place。 Only the room wasn't ready when I arrived, I had to wait just a bit, no big deal for me anyway.   Lovely place, close to many interesting places. I think I will go there again !

review_title: Breakfast and the Ginett Bar were the best
review_text: French continental style breakfast , and the awesome location right at the heart of Singapore touristic districts. The service manager and the counter staff were brilliant . So far no complaints. Cheers to G Hotel

Located near Bugis shopping district and Little India with a 10 min walk to the MRT station. The room was average size but had limited facilities. I found the hot water is outside the room for tea but this wan't explained to me upon check in. Room was a little worn.

Hotel G is hip and trendy hotel in the mid-sized category. Though the rooms are small, the layout is fantastic that it will make you realize you do have everything you need in that small space. Check-in was a breeze, it did not even take a minute! Facilities are adequate, rooms are very clean, floors were quiet, and water stations were very useful. Bed was very comfortable, and the shower was good. Although I had a bit of a problem because the shower shared the same floor with the rest of the bathroom, which meant water would flood out into the main bathroom. Otherwise, it was OK. Breakfast was excellent! They had the best croissants I have tasted outside of France! Surely they must have used french butter! Seriously, the croissants were so good! Breakfast spread spanned two

Well. basicaly, the room is good but the stuff from the reception is not that nice and location is good but a little bit far from TUBE station, you have to walk like more then 10min arrive the tube station.

It's a cool place, with cool people, nice staff, not stuffy like other places. And most of all, there is a tradition quality in it. I like the Bible inside the safe,  reminds me of the real ways hotels used to be and makes me feel safe.

Everything was ok,near the MRT station but need to change the line if we would like to go to Orchard, however it is walk able to Doughby Gaut station.  The minus only, the floor is a bit dirty (dust) but still ok. We love stay in this hotel and they have the HANDY Phone! Definitely will be back to this hotel

The hotel is in a very good place, near to metro station and the center of singapore. The room is very small and the cleanliness was not very accurate(there was mold in the shower curtain and after few days there was a little dirt on the floor)

I have been there April 2016. the location is great, so close to metro station and so many restaurants BUT rooms are the real shoe box room! very very small! you can not move inside room!!! An awful restaurant with very very weak buffet! You can not find any cheese and almost anything for breakfast! I can never recommend this hotel unfortunately!

I had never been to Hotel G before but i do like this area of Singapore very much. Its easy to get everywhere and there is already lots to do & see by just walking out the front door... But you might not get too far after digging in to what some of what Ginette has to offer. Ginette is an excellent french inspired restaurant with incredible food and an incredible wine list. It made for a wonderful primer before hopping on the MRT to go clubbing or to marina bay sands casino for some fun. Loved Hotel G, will definitely stay again.

review_title: Good Location, good price details missing
review_text: Dear Hotel G Team, my colleague and myself were very satisfied about the stay in Hotel G. However there is always room to improve. The showerhead in 1413 is defective. A small minibar would`ve been great too. Unfortunately there is no Pool area which would have made it perfect for business travelers. Another point is the small gym without a single window.

review_title: Pleasant stay at Hotel G Singapore
review_text: The room is quite tiny in size, but the overall ambience is really great. I love the room decoration, and all facilities seemed to work well. The hotel provides mobile phone for the guests - it made my life much easier to travel around Singapore. And there is water and ice cubes dispenser available near our room. To me, it's the little thing that is really thoughtful! Overall, I had a very pleasant stay at Hotel G Singapore, and will surely recommend this hotel to my friends and relatives.

Very happy with the services & facilities provided with the price that I paid. Wide range of channels provided and also there is a 24 hours gym available to accommodate to my busy schedule. It's located only 5mins walk from the MRT station as well it's very convenient.

Nice hotel set in the arts district of Singapore. Close to markets, shopping and numerous restaurants, the location is very good. The hotel has a very modern feel, somewhat sterile. The only problems I experienced were with the slow and uncooperative elevator which required your room key card to operate when going up. Nice addition to have hot and cold water machine on each floor. Overall, nice hotel but a bit pricey.

We recently stayed at the hotel as part of a multi city tour. The hotel has some clear pro's, and only a few cons:   Pros:  - Great location - Situated round the corner from a great Street food stall - Breakfast: less is more delivered brilliantly  - Professional touches around the hotel evident (a lot of very neat touches like gift bags and promo video makes you feel your in a really high standard place) and restaurant on bottom floor   Cons:  - Small rooms  - Toilet door doesn't actually close fully, we found that really weird (it's a slide door that doesn't slide all the way :/) - Air con due to the room being small, can become very hard to manage: you're either very hot or very cold - Slightly overpriced for room size   Overall though, the hotel delivers a solid standard,

Very good stay in Hotel G Singapore. Extremally small but comfortable rooms with an amazing bed. Location perfect for visiting the whole city - close to metro stations and city center. Strongly recommend!

I liked everything, the room was great for a short stay, location awesome, public transport just a few minutes away, good breakfast, a very nice bar for some drinks! Wish I could stay a few more days!

review_title: Great Chic, Boutique Hotel in good central location
review_text: Booked a Premium King on Booking, and when we checked in we were advised that we would need a better room based on our luggage, and age I think (late 50's), to a room with more space. Didn't argue as the young lady at reception genuinely seemed concerned about our comfort, and offered to show us rooms. Believing her concern we went with her recommendation, changed room type, and added breakfast at the discounted rate for our 4 days.  Went to our room on 15th floor, and was relieved, and laughed at wondering how much smaller our 1st room could have been over this one. Ok, not big, but did have a King bed on a raised pedestal placed sideways, so that who ever slept on right side had to climb over bed to get to their side. No big deal, and again worth a laugh.  The room was

The rooms are small by European standards, but very functional, with comfortable beds, great showers and all of the other expected amenities. Food in the hotel is excellent and the bar area has a great atmosphere at night, with well chosen wines at great prices. We will definitely stay here again on our next visit to Singapore.

Nice hotel with great location and heldful staff. The breakfast is delicious and the restaurant also serves lunch, dinner and cocktails. Overall it was a great pleasant stay and it is easy to get around with nearby train stations.

Was greeted by short hair lady with a big smile. Smooth check in and check out. Love the room very cozy! Would recommend friends to staycay here but take note for big size people the toilet is abit small hehee

Stylish Hotel, friendly and helpfulll staff. When I unpacked my suitcase, my suit was all crinkeld, they organised an iron for me at 10.30 pm! Nice bar at the ground floor. See you next time when I am in Singapore

review_title: Good value in a good location
review_text: It is my third time at this hotel and I will go back again. It is well located and good value for money. My only gripe would be the shower water changing temperature on its own! What I appreciate most is that the room is quiet and the beds and pillows are good quality so you get a good sleep.

We loved our quaint room, albeit small. We were touring a lot so we hardly spent much time inside anyways. Great location to everything. Walking distance to a lot of places and everything is super close, malls, MRT, markets, 7 Eleven etc. The hotel also had a burger joint and a nice restaurant downstairs and to the side there's a small hawker style food joint. Great experience!

Within walking distance of  Burgis street market with food court and bargain shops. Full of atmosphere and great value food. Hotel comfortable but have to climb over bed cannot walk all the way round. no bath just shower

The people were very friendly and helpful, the hotel gives you a smart phone to use during your trip which made everything more convenient and stress free. It was close to several MRT stations and shopping centers. Centrally located to all kinds of nightlife and major attractions. Something to note is the room was quite small but that is nothing to deter you from staying here, after all you won't be in your room too much on vacation! The bed was verrrrry comfortable too- some of the best sleep I've gotten in Asia! Most definitely recommend this place and we will be staying here every time we visit Singapore! ❤️🇸🇬

Check in /out counter will taken quit long time to wait. Understood sometimes have a lot customer doing check in/out at the same time. If this part got improvement than will be more perfect. Overall is good.

Love my stay in Hotel G. Comfortable bed and clean room even the space is limited.  Great location and very convenient to go shops nearby. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Smooth check-in and check out.

**Surprising hotel; **unique with comfy bed & pillows **kind staff msB & her partner **free use of handyphone to carry out!! **efficient hotel. nice hallway *Will definite stay again & recommend this place

The location of the hotel is very good and easy to reach aother parts of the city by metro. teher are mant  nearby attractions and eateries. The room was small but clean and comfortable. Good breakfast but limited selections. Nice to stay here for a short time to see Singapore.

Overall Hotel G was great - a mixup at checkin left me with a wrong room number & wrong key which was frustrating, and then the individual wifi wasn’t working & nobody told me the complimentary password ... once that was smoothed out the rest of the stay was enjoyable.

Nice and cozy boutique hotel.Great warm welcome and make our anniversary trip perfect with a special welcome drink. Friendly staff and prompt service. Love their decoration in room. Location near some shopping mall and convenience. They have a nice bar & restaurant on the first floor.

the bed is very comfortable and room is very clean, even the space is very limited but the room configuration makes the room look spacious. perhaps for tv channel, could add more program such as sports channel

This is the 3rd time i have been stayed this 2017 so far while visits to Singapore.  Very convenient as it’s just talk me couple of minutes to Bugis area. Comfy room, bed though it’s abit compact in size of the room.  Staffs are friendly.

Clean room.  Modern and funky.  Functional but very small (bed length was width of room) and compact.  Had everything I needed - nice shower, ice machine and hot water on every level which was good too.  Comfy bed.

review_title: Great location, friendly staff, Good stay
review_text: -Very nice attentive staff, friendly and welcoming. -Comfy bed, -Great location -Variety of the breakfast is a bit limited. -Default Aircon was too cold for me at 23 degree/level = high -Bathroom gets all wet after a shower, and after entering the bathroom at night it gets slippery and have to be very cautious.

Great location. Convenient to travel around to nearby attractions and eateries. Staffs were helpful and the room was clean and comfortable. Although the room was not as spacious as I thought would be, overall stay was good.

the room concept is awesome but there isn't any refrigerator, so maybe they could install one, the service of the frontline staff was friendly and pleasant. Even though the lobby is a bit squeeze, but nevertheless the experience of staycation was a memorable.

review_title: Clean, Cozy, Comfortable and Convenience Location
review_text: Have been staying in this hotel for many times, very comfortable room condition. Room size a little bit small but cozy, suitable for couple. Helpful and friendly staff. If there is a freezer in room will be better.

Rooms are small but well designed and super cozy. The hotel is super central and well decorated. The hotel has two restaurants (Ginette and 25 degrees) which are both stylish and affordable for high quality food. The hotel is accessible by MRT bencoolen or Rochor stop easily. Would recommend!

review_title: Quirky deco, smart use of space
review_text: Room feels spacious, bed is comfortable. Light switches can be located nearer the bed. Splash from the sink is somewhat annoying. Breakfast is great! Lovely hotel design and prompt staff. Fantastic location.

For this hotel I went 27-29 Oct 2017   Check in : good,friend staff but no bell boy for help you pick up luggage   Lobby : in lever 2 in so small, not grand  Room : room is the same in picture everything, i like decor but it too small !! Very small !! I am small person ( only 162 cm weight 45kg) I think so small if you have a big body it look tight !!   Coridoor : it so tight and look like you stay in hostel more like hotel   Internet and tv : is ok, good !!   Staff : good   Location : is ok only 5 mins walk from bugis, near 7-11, near gallery  1 thing is good it new hotel I thing it renovate hotel.  Suggest : if you have big body or many luggage you can find other hotel more bigger and same rate !!

I have a good memory with G Hotel with a good view from my room and friendly staffs. I have a good dream a with my friend, my family  I am planning to back Singapore and my first choice is your hotel. Thank you

My wife and I stayed for 3 days at the end of our holiday. Neat and compact room with the hotel in a good location. The mobile device provided in the room was an excellent addition for free internet and navigation around the city.

Room is not bigger. but for single user is enough size, If you want bigger roon, will not be recommended. can use Gym 24 hours. take free smart phone until check out. This is good. can get taxi easily by reception. find the conbinient store around there. The fisrt foor's bar is every day exiting for drinking.

Nice modern boutique style hotel with excellent staff and buffet breakfast located in the restaurant. The room was compact but enough space for a three night stay, staff were courteous and friendly. The location was close to shops and restaurants and short walking  distance to the mtr

Hotel G was in a great location. The beds were very comfortable and the mobile phone you receive in your room is really helpful. The room could have been a bit cleaner behind the bed and more space for storage would have been helpful but overall great!

Located near to Bugis and Bencoolean MRT station, it was convenient to move to anywhere in Singapore. Room is clean and staffs are kind. Regarding its value, quite realiable hotel. But rooms are small, wall is thin, elevater is inefficient. Good choice for business trip.

Hotel is located in one of the best area, Classy, Cozy, and most comfortable stay in Singapore. Best Part is the In-house Restaurant " GINETT " has some great collection of wine and sexy ambiance with some happening crowd.     Rooms are small but give most comfortable and cozy feeling.   Best Part is the cosmopolitan staff from every continent of the world.

review_title: Dont bring your cat to swing, not enough room for that!
review_text: G hotel is well located with restaurants and shops nearby.Access is through the back for taxi and a bit complicated for anyone picking you up by car.    The rooms are very comfortable but very small.I had  a mystery room and only an airport hotel In Amsterdam I have ever stayed in was this compact, with bed taking up the width of the end of the room, so not the place to lounge around in during the day.Gym excellent, surrounding restaurants good and staff very good too.Price fairly high but Singapore is like that I guess.Just be ready for the tiny but quite pleasing room.

The counter is not very clear. The rest of the rooms are very good, beautifully decorated, the room is complete, and the room is a bit small but acceptable. The service staff cordial, I would like to choose the next time to stay.

Staff were exceptional - friendly, polite and very helpful.  Hotel in an excellent location for the tourist in the ‘hub’ of the city with plenty to do on the doorstep - definitely one to come back to on my next visit

Great location, very convenient.  Very pleasant hotel, good scent and decor.  Room is a bit too small but still adequate.  Lobby on 2/F, very very convenient.  Overall it's a very good hotel. I'd come back again next time.

Although the rooms were compact, the facilities were well organised.  The hotel was in a convenient situation and the staff were all very friendly and helpful. The restaurant had a comprehensive list of french wines and the food was excellent.  We would stay there again,

Though room is small decor is nice adequate facilities and clean.Good location 15 minutes walk to Bugis MRT station and Bugis Junction Shopping centre. With Uber no problem to get pick up to move around though the pick up is on Level 2 via rear carpark. Nice restaurant on level 1 where there is waiting area to meet friends.

Nice Hotel and will come again. Excellent location and your staff is very helpful and nice. The location is near MRT station and walk around 10 mins. It's great that the convenience store and restaurant are opened 24-hours.

review_title: Very nice hotel in good location
review_text: we had a small but clean and very nice room, the service was good and the stuff always friendly and helpful, the room was quiet and the bet comfortable, the hotel is perfectly located for a walk through the city

Love the hotel.. very near to the new mrt beecoolen station.. about 150meter.. the staff is cery friendly and helpful.. requested for iron and it was delivered fast. There is ice machine available outside my room.. love the room deco.. will definitely recommend this hotel and will definitely comeback

Had to pay almost 20% higher to get an upgrade which was also not very comfortable. Rooms are quite small. No Amirah to keep our clothes. Wash basin is too small and near to the bed. Difficult to wash face. A very small window which has hardly any outside view. With the amount we paid we could get a much better hotel. The 4-star rating is still confusing to me.

review_title: TINY ROOM BUT I LOVE IT
review_text: for asians, the space of queen bed its not a big deal but for the other who has body taller than 180cm it would be a problem cause the size of room and bed it’s not that big.  i would be very happy to recommend you guys to stay here.

Even though rooms are small, everything found its place, beds are super comfortable. Great breakfast, very good WIFI Connection, very good located. MRT Max 5min walking distance. Nice burger restaurant. Nothing to complain.

review_title: Location is good. The environment is clean
review_text: The experience in Hotel G is good, the location is close to loads of different train stations. However, it’s not that close to Bugis station. Still it’s a comfort and convenience place to stay with. I will probability staying with them on my next visit to Singapore.

review_title: Great value for money and superb location!
review_text: Have always enjoyed staying in this hotel. This is my third stay  and will keep coming back! Location is superb. Bugis is my fave place in Singapore. Just a few minutes walk to the mrt, takes about 5-10 mins., enjoying my view while passing nearby shops til I reach the mrt. Love walking around Bugis + mall and Bugis junction as well. Just a stonethrow away from the famous Bugis market where you can find affordable souvenirs and goodies, especially the chocolates made locally, from nearby countries, even those from US and Japan! Since the public transport is so efficient, staying in this hotel makes it easy to go anywhere.

Wanna find a hotel that can go anywhere conveniently ?? Choose G-Hotel. I and my friend just randomly chose this hotel on the tripadvisor as it has good score. And it litterally blew my mind when i came to the hotel. Clean and fresh feeling. The lounge in G floor is so good and nice.  Must come hotel in Singapore if u want to stay in Bugis. What is more, the Bugis junction near there have route directly to Changi airport.

review_title: If you want to live, here's the words for you
review_text: Strengths 1.Location is good and near core of city, 4 mins walk from latest opened underground station "Bencoolen" since 21 Oct, 8 mins from Bugis stn, easy to to find something to eat in this area. 2.Good room deco and industrial style design, they offer dispenser from corridor, no need to wait for hot or ice water.  Weaknesses 1. Room size was designed for single not couple, a 29-inch luggage can occupy whole room space you pass through. 2. No fridge in the room, you only can drink something iced you bought from store immediately or café in level 1.

review_title: A commercial building converted into a hotel
review_text: My impression of this hotel is not a good one. - my cab climbed up the building and rolled up onto the rather badly lit entrance way -entered into a small reception area where two receptionist looked at me...stone-faced..as I struggled to find my hotel booking documents. No "hello", no "welcome". Well, never mind. But wait..as I was registering, a Caucasian tourist arrived and was boisterously greeted with a Good Afternoon, Welcome!!  A sickening affliction of Xenophilia. - Enter the room and...gosh, it is small. Literally no luggage space had my wife joined me on the trip. - Trying to work in my room, I found out that my HDMI cable connecting my laptop to the TV port did not work; and, trying to fix myself a hot drink, I found that there was no hot water kettle in the room.

Excellent location and wonderful breakfast selection. Near shopping malls and food stalls are available nearby. Nice and very accommodating staff that would assist you all the way. The free use of handy phone is a big plus coz it comes with free local calls and internet access

We had a great stay at Hotel G Singapore. It's in a really good location and our room with the balcony was lovely. Friendly and helpful staff. Nice bar and restaurant facilities too, however I wouldn't recommend the scallops from the food menu. We previously stayed in Hotel G San Francisco and had a great experience as well. I wish they would open some branches in Europe.

Got a slight hiccup between Expedia booking price and at the hotel, but it was honored by the staff. Shower water got affected when sink is on, small issue but could be better fixed so that shower is not affected.

Overall a good experience. The Wifi speed was rather slow, but acceptable. The breakfast was average, not much variety and food quality was average. Room was good and clean, staff was friendly and helpful.

Location was good and staffs were friendly. Bella, the receptionist was very patient and helpful and did a smooth check in for me. Room is clean and i love how my room has a view. It wouldve been better if the room has a mini fridge. Thank u hotel G!

The room itself is small, but it looks cute and clean. I wouldn't use the room with 2 person, but for 1 person, it was enough. One thing I did not like was that the room cleaning was done although I put "Don't Disturb" sign on the door. It was OK to get the room cleaned, but what is the meaning of the sign then??

If could include breakfast for 2 would be awesome.  The love the design of the room, though it is small, it has everything in it!  The shower floor's design has good drainage and the basin outside the toilet, btw, my hushand and I can "share" the bathroom at the same time. ^_^ We are couple of 50+ & 60+ but we have had an awesome experience of new generation.

The rooms were very nicely decorated, not too small, bed sheets and towels clean, everything was up to the expectations. One thing I was surprised about is that the bathrobes are only provided at suite rooms, and the rooms under the suite category is not provided with bathrobes. But overall, a very nice pretty hotel indeed.

Even the most expensive rooms have no wardrobe and neither drawers. The staff is friendly and very positive in helping but the lack of intellgence of the architect and of the property led to this hospitality  oxymoron: a hotel room without a wardrobe.

Good for overall, only that staffs need some friendly smile which is hardly get from all singaporeans. A smile can really makes a good mood for your customers and makes our day!! And I believe also can make your own days better with that friendliness smile from time to time.   :)

Booked the hotel last minute for a night and it was a great choice! We checked in at 2pm and the staff who attended to us was nice. There were four staff at the counter, very helpful and attentive team!    Some things to take note: - lobby is on 2nd floor - no fridge in the room  - no water boiling in room  - tv are mounted on the wall and cannot be swiveled   Despite the shortfalls I personally love the hotel, makes me feel comfortable and welcome. Design of the room is great, space saving. Location is awesome, 7mins walk from Bugis station, and 5mins walk from Bencoolen station. Serta bedding gave us a good night sleep. Size of our room is just right. Our room didn’t come with breakfast. Also, there is a 24hr Indian stall and a Chinese stall (not 24h), just beside the hotel.

The decor of the hotel was beautiful, the bed was really clean and comfortable. Loving the packaging of the hand soap bar, and laundry bag etc too. Really chic and pretty place. Will recommend to my family and friends.

The staff were excellent and very courteous, and helpful. Would highly reccomend this property. The hotel was extremely accessible with local transport within close proximity to everything. Well done.

reasonable prices with stylish decoration  easy to access to multiple MRT stations (Bujis and Bras Basah) there's a bar and restaurants at the first floor however, the cleanness need to be enhanced (some ants on the table)

Everything was great and the design was lovely, except that the light on the ceiling on top of my bed is malfunctioned. I could not switch it off and ended up sleep with something covering my eyes due to the light.

review_title: Room is clean, hotel is near MRT.
review_text: Room is clean, hotel is near MRT. The decoration style of hotel is quite fashion. There is a bar and restaurant just in first floor. For breakfast, the Toast Box and Ya Kun are just across the street.

review_title: Very good and affordable stay at hotel g. Receptionist very friendly and the facilities are top notched. Overall i would
review_text: Very good and affordable stay at hotel G. Staff very friendly and they greet u with smile. Would return back in future.   The facilities and decor are top notch and classy. Cosy room and intimate place for couples or for business

Hotel G is a great, central place to land and feel welcomed in Singapore. The service is excellent, the rooms are stylish and clean, and the facilities are in great working order. Plus, the breakfast is delicious!

Reception staff were very helpful and pleasant, rooms bee clean  and comfortable, restaurant service was very good. Would recommend this hotel to anyone. Convenient stores and very good local restaurants near by. Good selection for breakfast. Close to city main area by taxi. Overall, pleasant stay.

Nice hotel to stay for a couple of days, everything you need is present. The price/quality is spot on.  The rooms are small, but well decorated and it has every thing you need. Nice bed as well. The breakfast is very nice.

Such a great location that you can walk to the MRT station in a few minutes. Nice decoration, the room was clean and the staffs were nice. I would love to stay here again if there's any chance, my friend and I really enjoyed staying there!

nice,tidy and clean hotel room with strong loft style which I like. smiling faces staffs, good breakfast served well in comfort dining environment. the room facility complete with handy mobile phone available. will come again if stay in Singapore in future.

review_title: Splendid choice for accommodations in Singapore
review_text: A relatively new hotel, targeted mainly at millenials. Superb location (Little India is just around the corner, Bugis MRT station and shopping malls are 5 mins away (new station - blue line is coming soon). It's a walking distance to Raffles Place. Lots of eating places around: from food courts and Thai/Chinese small reatsurants to fancy coffee shops & bars. The hotel has 2 v good reatsurants: a buger place and a european cuisine rest with THE best priced French wine in Singapore (one of the owners has a distribution company, direct supply). I was a bit confused with a lobby at first. You have to take the stairs or a lift one floor up to take an elevator to the reception. The property design is very creative. Loved it. Though the room was VERY small. Especially the bathroom (the

1. Toilet bowls need an upgrade. They easily leave stains and easily splash water back up. 2. Better separate the shower room from the toilet to keep the floor dry. A curtain is not enough. 3. Better to provide hot water in room, not outside.

Hotel G and it's staff were excellent and very helpful to a first time visitor to Singapore.  Breakfasts were great and providing a local cell phone for use during my visit was very valuable. I would highly recommend Hotel G to anyone visiting Singapore for both service and convenient location to tourist sights.

We stayed for one night only. The hotel is located at a convenient place near Rochor. Our room was small, but efficient, comfy bed, unfortunately we have seen cleaner bathrooms. The breakfast is of huge variety and great. Staff friendliness varies. Overall it was good.

everything was great, chic design, delicious breakfast and nice and friendly staff,  definitely will come back. Improvement only on your room space, I think it too small for families with children. Thank you

We had a short stopover in Singapore and was looking for a comfortable place to stay close the centre of town. Hotel G is well positioned close to the MRT station and local bus stops. the rooms are clean and modern. The size of the room is below average but still comfortable (We had the biggest room available).  The staff were very friendly and helpful. The restaurants are great and the service very good. The food is well priced and very well prepared.  Overall a very nice stay for a short stopover in Singapore!  Will certainly recommend this hotel to others.

We previously lived in Singapore and have always loved your bar and restaurant. The staff is second to none as well. Someone is doing a great job of training them. My main complaints involve the layout of the hotel. From the odd car entrance that is too narrow for cars to properly navigate the top (taxi drivers tell me they HATE driving there) to the tiny, out of the way lobby. It should be located just above the street level restaurant. As for the rooms, they are decorated for 20 year old. As a professional photographer I appreciate art of all kinds, but there still has be some taste involved. The television which comes on every time I reenter the room and plays music by Prince is annoying as well. I turned the volume down to zero but it reset itself and came back on again loud

Design intentions, reasonable layout, small and exquisite.Convenient transportation, facilities, suitable for travel and living.The receptionist is very friendly and speaks Chinese very well, which is very satisfactory. The free telephone provided by the hotel is convenient and quick. You can call through it, check the map, and be practical.

Cute little boutique hotel if you’re just popping in to Singapore for a little while.  Very chill vibes and ambiance with friendly staff. Location is quite good as well. Would stay here again if I visited again!

Value for money is very good,location was great close to transport the staff very friendly and the food was great all up a very nice hotel i hope i can one day make a return trip.So thanks for everything.

I have accidentally made duplicate booking for my staycat, front desk Ms Bella is very patient while helping me to recall. She fully understood the situation and has managed the situation very well. She assisted me patiently by contacting my booking agent and explained my situation on behalf to them, even requested if they could waive the cancellation charge. The room is clean and tastefully decorated. Location is great and you could even have supper with just 1 min walk away.

Nice service,funcy building, clean room. The mobile was prepared and all the calls and internet were free. I didn't use this time though gym facilities were also nice. I will definitely choose and book G Singapore hotel again!

Uniq interior, helpfull staff, near the bus stop. Its good for couple or business. There was a free handyphone you can carry. There are free internet and call. If you go with children the room was too small, and the wind of air conditrioner wasnt good when you sleep.

This was planned for my boyfriend's birthday celebration surprise.. they helped me to reserve the room that had multi coloured feathers because my boyfriend once said he liked it when we came across the photo online.

review_title: I came because my partner was having chemo and I thought it would be woundleful for her to stay close too hospital
review_text: We could not keep medication in refrigerator in rooms because was none, everytiime we wanted hot water had to go outside rooms. Had to climb over your partner to get out of bed and bed to small I'm 6 foot two tall. We moved out the second night and gave room to my partner son because we couldn't stay , it was worse hotel I have stayed in like beening In dark ages or some dump in India.

I never wanted to spend much on a hotel, especially in Singapore, because mostly I will be out shopping or sight seeing or dining. Usually a hotel with this price range is old, dusty and not strategically located, but this one is different.  This hotel presents a hipster/rustic design that is warm, calming, friendly and welcoming. The overall design gives a positive and good vibes.  The receptionists are youngsters that are very helpful and friendly. The Indian lady that handled my check in was very clear and thorough explaining little details of the hotels. I was able to get an early check-in about 1030 in the morning, while the usual check-in time is at 2 PM.  With your room, you will get a mobile device which you could use to make international call and mobile internet for

A chic hotel located in a convenient center and easyti travel anywhere Room price is competitive Only the lobby area and parking area is not convenient and obvious A restaurant is very crowded in the night

Excellent small boutique hotel in Bencoolen area.  Rooms are small but efficiently designed.  But cannot access far side of bed from the side - have to climb over - not great for two people. Comfortable bed, quiet.  Breakfast is excellent quality.  Nice bar downstairs.  Reception is efficient.

Steps to climb (with luggage) and an odd front desk hidden on an upper floor after asking the restaurant where the front desk is. Rooms are small but the bed is very comfortable. The rooms are no as quiet as they could be, but not a deal breaker.

Everything is good. But the reed in the wall socket always loosen so the blower can hardly be plugged in and fixed. This situation appears in 2 rooms that I stayed in for 2 trips. Hope Hotel G to improve on this.

Stayed for a couple of nights in this rather trendy looking hotel.  Location is good and staff are very friendly.  The room was a little tight on space and if you were staying longer I'd recommend a larger room as clothing storage is at a minimum.  Otherwise a nice place

Central location. Walking distance to major Malls and MRTs station.   Good breakfast and in house restaurant and bar.   Plenty of parking spaces but parking is not complimentary.   Love the overall design but room a bit too small.

review_title: Well located, practical and cool hotel
review_text: Great value for money. Hotel G is well located. The design of the room is nice yet practical. Only things I see that could be improved are having the onsite bar open until later and the bathroom door (too thin and did not close all the way). Apart from that it was great!

Highly recommend this place - although it is a simple hotel, it is clean and nice with a very good location. Staffs are very helpful. There are two very nice restaurants located downstairs - in addition to the may other options available around. Visited the gym - small but very nice! For the pricing, Hotel G is much worth the value compared to the other hotels that i stayed with similar star rating.

review_title: great stay for a short trip
review_text: overall had a blast here, my only complaint is the size of the room. but the layout was smart to allocate so much in so little space. would love to try the restaurants downstairs next time around. checkin staff were better than the one during checkout, but still very efficient

review_title: Nice boutique hotel good for short stays at a great location
review_text: I stayed in this hotel for a day when I went to Singapore, as in Agoda.com there was a great deal for this hotel and the reviews were good. From the airport, there was no problem as the taxi driver mentioned the address as Middle Road, as I mentioned Hotel G, and he dropped me in Level 2 through a narrow winding driveway. Could be a bit of a problem for all cars to drive through that as after dropped they have to take a U turn, which has a limited turning radius. The drive from airport is about 20 mins.  The reception was good as I landed up at around 6.30 pm and they upgraded me from Queen's room to King's room. Still when I entered the room, I was surprised at the smallness of the room, which has a small entrance and opens to a double bed, and below that bed you have to keep

Its is was good and i had enjoyed staying there. Its is was good and i had enjoyed staying there.  Its is was good and i had enjoyed staying there.  Its is was good and i had enjoyed staying there......

Good, Clean and sufficient space for business travellers. The facilities are good, location is very good. Easily accessible by MRT (MRT Station is 5-10 mins walk). Looks little less space when think of family/couples staying.

Really liked this hotel! Central location! Close to sevral MRT, if you looking to relax in the hotel- rooms are very small, but if you just want to trvall around its the place! Really great hotel Super helpful staff

The rooms were pretty small but I guess sufficient for a staycation as it has a very good location and there are many many things to do nearby.   The restaurants were okay but I felt that the Striploin steak at Ginett was way overpriced as it wasn't that tasty. The yellowfin tuna burger at 25 degress also tasted a little funky but I enjoyed the truffle fries very much.   I LOVE the shower amenities because I realised afterwards that my skin and hair felt so soft and I really regret not stealing some from the housekeeping cart :( I don't quite enjoy the small sink on the outside of the toilet though because I like big sinks since I tend to splash water everywhere.   Oh and the bed was SUPER comfortable! Although could use thicker blankets.   Overall an enjoyable stay and I would

Check-in was a little disappointing as staff was not friendly and keep demanding for deposit, I do understand this is to protect the interest of the hotel. Maybe the staff can ask in a friendlier manner. Hotel was clean and unique not to forget its very convenient. Will definitely come back again.

Excellent hotel. Convenience for traveler in terms of location. Comfortable room, good service by the front desk. Recommended for traveler that looking for good location, convenience, clean room and unique hotel.

It was a very pleasaant stay. Cozy, artistic and convenient. Convenience stores are located at a very near distance. It is strategically located for a hotel. There is no fridge in the room that we stayed. But an ice machine and water dispenser was right outside our room. It made our stay convenient and we managed to get a simple dinner. The restaurant was packed but we didnt try as we had packed schedule.

Decor is cool. But wouldn’t let in before 1400 hrs even when the room was available. The staff mislead me. Said he would let me in few minutes. The next moment said I will have to wait till 1400 hrs. Terrible

Hotel is in a very good location. Very short walk to MRT, malls, markets, restaurants (there's a 24 hr restaurant right next to the hotel too). Room was very cozy and clean. The bed is one of the most comfortable bed I've slept in. Makes it hard for me to get up in the morning. It's got everything you need (apart from a fridge). The only downside is that you have to walk pass a very busy bar in order to get up to the room. Overall I had a pleasant stay, and would return again.

review_title: Cute! Best quality for money for a 2 day escape
review_text: This hotel is the perfect place for a 2 day escape on a budget. Excellent the quality for money. Super cool the restaurant downstairs and perfect the logistic a taxi step away from MBS or Orchard. Breakfast above expectation. Reception wise look for Miuccia, very helpful in all our needs.  Only thing to improve which however doesn't compromise the overall impression is the curtain on the shower which always tends to stick to the body and it is not nice. Better to remove and put a plastic door. Definitely a place to visit.

review_title: suitable for young couple or solo traveller
review_text: the room size is small for two but it is great for solo traveler.  Hotel lobby at level 2 is confusing and inconvenient Thumb up for creative interior layout.  Ideal location (nearby Bugis and easy access to public transport)

The overall experience is very nice. Clean room, modern decoration, nice big bed and a free mobile phone with unlimited Internet usage as well as both local/internation calls. The staff are nice and friendly. We did not have breakfast in the hotel, but the restartant there seems to be quite good.  There are also some minor cons. There is no exhaust fan in the bathroom so it might be a little humid inside the room if you do not turn the aircon on. The socket is somehow loosen so even it's an internation socket, my laptop plug which is US-type cannot fit. So if you have a international adapter, definitely bring it with you. (but larget plugs like UK-type fit pretty well)

The room was very nice and fancy but shower and toilet are in the same room, so it is  always wet.  Also, Singapore is very hot and humid,  so it there were even a small refrigerator in the room would be really nice.

the rooms are a half the sized ala japanese like hotel rooms. It has enough space for a short stay and if one is not always in the room. Neat and tidy setup. Beds against the wall at one end which makes piling in and out for the 2nd person a pain. If one has large travel suitcases or bags, it will take up entire room path.   The bar downstairs is a really cool and nice place to hangout. Staff are brilliant. Super helpful and.friendly. Hotel is situated in a great spot, lots of food and stuff around.

We recommand this place much more attractive than standard international hotels Staff helpfull Gold location Nous recommandons cet hôtel agréable et bien placé au style très personnel. Hôtel très propre

review_title: Modern and convenient place to stay
review_text: Over all experience is quite nice. In terms of price, the room seems a bit too cozy. Location wise, it is super close to central with few MRT stations nearby to take. For food options, apart from hotel selections of bar and burger restaurant downstairs, nearby the Al Jilani, also give different varieties.  The service is as great as I expected.

Although the room was quite small, I was very satisfied here. Staffs were very friendly and they smiled all the time. The only thing I didn't like about this hotel was they don't have refrigerator in rooms. Yes, I can use ice in the hallway, but it was kinda irritating to bring over them to my room.

room not so big but useful for two girls. very near form the rocher mrt ,first floor is a very nice bar.good food well drink. i will book this hotel in the last trip too. the first floor have a 24hours restaurant near the conner.you should try.

Convenient location with useful equipment, clean room and safe management (card needed for elevator). No ventilator in the bathroom, only rely on air conditioner to dry the room, feel the humid air while step into the room after a long day trip.

I got the Good King Room, and it was a little too small for me, it was hard to move around. The bed basically went from one wall to the other wall. I literally had to jump over the bed to get to the other side of the room which was where the window was. The bad: no fridge (they had the hydration center), no electric kettle, no closet (you can hang your clothes on the wall), very small room, no bidet  눇Hotel G is right in the middle of Middle Road and Bencoolen. The hotel is unique, it's not really the usual business hotel people may have been accustomed to, which may be an issue for some. View was great from my room. They provide you with a handy phone that you can use during your stay, you can call several countries for FREE and also be able to call all over Singapore and

The location is extremely good. It is centralized in the city, near eateries and amenities. Staff are really well trained, friendly and polite! Love the fantastic service at G hotel. I would definitely love to be back again.

review_title: Very good hotel for Singapore visits
review_text: A very good business hotel with small but immaculate rooms. Overall very good value as the city in general is not a cheap one to stay in.. The rooms are very small but contain everything needed, less so for families or couples with children..

review_title: Good Location with Decent Size Room
review_text: The room might be small to some of you but it is actually quite decent size considering the average property size in Singapore.  I was lucky to have a corner room so the room size and bathroom size is pretty good to me.  I check in around 830pm, the process is smooth and the staff is really friendly especially Bella.   The lobby is at the second floor and you have to go through the restaurant on the ground floor.  There's no proper stop over for taxi if the taxi did'n't know how to drop you off on the second floor through the car park.   Nice breakfast at the restaurant.  The slight disappointment is the cleanliness in the room where I found crisps crumbs on the floor.  Overall, I am still happy to stay here.

Pros: - We were upgraded by the friendly receptionist, Bella.  - Though the room is small, but the room design, and the cleanliness made me comfortable during my stay.  - All the staff there are responsive and friendly! - The Indian stall is just next door if you would like to eat prata for your breakfast! - Just 10-15minutes (or maybe 20mins?) walk to Arab street.   - The hotel is convenient if you would like to go to Bugis St, Bugis Junction.. Just 10mins walk.  - The bus stop is just opposite.   Cons: - There's no fridge in the room so we had to go down reception to store our cold food.  -  No bathrobe. I mean, there is but you have to purchase it.  -  No iron board and iron in the room but not sure if they have it cause I did not ask for it. Hehe.  - No luggage rack in room.

I stayed at a room on the 14th floor (1403, if not mistaken). The room was very small, and I payed 300dollars for it.  When I booked it is was happy to get room as most places were full.  During the checking process noone mentioned that I couldn't use the room for another 3 hours. This was only mentioned at the end, and the deposit was not mentioned until the end of the waiting period. These could have been mentioned at the very beginning or before paying at least.  I would stay again at the rates ( apr. 155dolars) you have on various websites, but not for 300 dollars. I did sleep Ok,  just the value did not reflect the room size.

review_title: Extremely good for a short staycation
review_text: The rooms are very well decorated and of decent size. Convenient as it is near to many eating places and MRT. Though it may be slightly more challenging if you want to grab a cab along the busy roads. All in all, a good experience.

Its centrally located, close to mrt and bugis. Its bit cramped, which is to be expected at a central location, but it is a warm and welcoming place. The staff is friendly, the breakfast is excellent. I will be happy to stay here on my next trip.

review_title: Great short stay at Hotel G
review_text: We stayed in hotel G for 3 nights and really enjoyed our stay. Staff were really friendly and helpful and even helped us to order a grab instead of a taxi as we wanted to try it out.   Check in took quite a while at the start but that was fine. We stayed in the good queen room and although there was no view (window faced another building which made it a little dark) the room was quiet, cosy, and extremely clean which was fantastic. It was fairly small though so it's good to keep that in mind as even with just the two of us we had to squish past each other to reach other areas of the room, but this wasn't an issue for us.   Food at the hotel was ok. The prices of the hotel restaurant were very high but that is standard with hotel restaurants. We ate there for dinner one night but

Love Hotel G, they really payed attention to the details. Which I really appreciated and made me feel special.  Pro's: 1.Great location. Bras Bash, Bugis and Rochor MRT are very near to the hotel, so we were able to reach most places within a few minutes.  2. Details, details, details. The lovely smell walking into the room, the METIS goodies, the music playing through the tv and a personalised message displayed on the tv. All these made us really enjoy our experience.  3. Lovely Breakfast. Good variety and even better quality! Everything tasted devine and we truly enjoyed it everyday, especially the homemade cookies. (yip we had cookies for breakfast!).  4. Friendly staff. We checked in late at night and were welcomed by friendly staff, who took care of our check in as quick as

Very clean room with nice comfortable bed. Nice gym and location is within town area. Staff was very friendly. Check in was quick and smooth. A definitely good hotel to recommend to my friends from overseas.

I think I stayed in the smallest room. It was very clean and cozy to my surprise. I didnt hear outside noise during night; everything was quite after 10:00pm. The breakfast was nice too; item in the buffet was tasty as if the staff really put effort on the quality and taste of the food, unlike breakfast buffets at other hotels that I have stayed in Singapore. I love the location; short walk to MRT, small coffee joints, and small family cafes. This hotel might not be ideal for first timers who visit Singapore because it's far from the major shopping area like Orchard Road or Marina area. Also taxi drivers are still not familiar with the location of this hotel. I was dropped right in front of the restaurant at 1:00 am and had to carry heavy luggage to the tall side walk. The

Room is a little small bout location is great. Service is good. Internet service is fine. Reasonable price. Although it is no refrigerator in the room, but it's OK, there is ice service on the corner.

Nice Location with Nice Little and clean Rooms and a friendly Staff. Good wifi Connection and under the Hotel is a Bar and a Restaurant where You can have breakfast or dinner and some Drinks. Good Hotel for a Short Stay in singapore.

Everything was great in this hotel except one thing. The bed is too short that I have to lie diagonally in order not to let my feet out of the bed. It’s a bit rediculous. Otherwise, it’s a very good hotel with a great location.

Overall my staying experience for 4 days 3 nights was good, the staffs are friendly and polite, very professionally trained, thumbs up ! the overall design of the hotel is unique and you can even find a dreamcatcher in the guest room, some Bali feel right ? however i do appreciate for a bigger room, i book a Kind size bed room but to be frank, the space is quite small, the bed already occupied 3/5 of the space but the cleanliness and decor make up to it, so i am just fine. The facilities was good, you can find water dispenser on every floor (mine just outside my room), the gym equipment is moderate but still in good condition. and..yea breakfast, limited choices but doesn't mean the food quality is not there, i like their tomato rice !

review_title: WAITING TOO LONG TO CHECK IN
review_text: We arrived on sunday morning , we got there about 12 pm , there were over 20 people waiting around the reception desk, it took us 3 hours to get into our room, the other guests also had to wait for their rooms like we did

review_title: Nice Hotel, with some limited services
review_text: This is a nice hotel.  Hard to find at first - cab dropped me off in the back, which is not an appealing looking place.  Hard to get to the front desk.  Once I found it and the proper hotel entrance, there were no more issues.  Hotel does not provide room service.  The breakfast buffet is affordable and tasty.  The adjoining restaurant serves burgers.  The hotel is near three metro stops, but I wouldn't say it is particularly close to any.  5 blocks walk any way.

Excellent room decoration and despite it being small, it was very comfortable. A little improvement would be providing more movie channels or a smart tv that could browse the internet. Other than that, had a very comfortable and relaxing stay!

review_title: Hotel G is great value for money
review_text: My criteria for search was: best hotel for a reasonable price, near the center of the city and an MRT line, for a short stay. Hotel G gave me all that, and it also happens to be a 4 star hotel. It is 8 min from the Circle line station Bras Basah (on foot), there are plenty of bars, restaurants and cafes around, and the hotel room was clean and comfortable.  Staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The only tricky part was finding the reception. You have to go to level 2 to check in. I was very satisfied with my stay in Hotel G and would gladly return.

I stayed here during F1.  The location is excellent.  The hotel is close to MRT, shopping malls, hawker center. Breakfast has great variety of options.
