Well maintained / furnished room in a great location. Room was on the smaller size. Staff friendly and helpful, assisted with a late checkout / bag storage due to my late flight departure, will be back when traveling to Singapore.

review_title: Very Good Choice for your Studio Apartment
review_text: Friendly Environment and Professional Staff (Special Mentioned Ms Bella). Boutique Designed,Great Location.(within Walking Distance to Shopping,Dinning and Drinking Area.Convenient to Public Transportation.) Within CBD Area where Business Actives are easily conducted.

A better hotel and value can be found in Singapore. Room is way too small even for solo traveller. Due to late check in, I was dissapointed with no late check out (only extended 1 hour). A better location, size, and facilities can be found with better value.

Good location, good access to hotel but no refrigerator, no cabinet in the room. Very small room, only very small hanger on the wall. Not very good but not very bad. I don't want to recommend for the guest to stay more than one week.

Great experience, very nice and central location, will come back for sure. Enjoyed the nice decor and the efficient room lay out. Will recommend to anyone coming to Singapore for leisure or business purpose.

review_title: Quirky hotel with a comfortable room
review_text: My room was extremely small but still worked perfectly well for mom and me. It's quirky decor and warm staff more than made up for it's size. The housekeeping person was great, felt nice coming to a impeccable room everyday for a long day. Overall a pleasant stay for budget travelers.

Pleasant stay. Convenient for everything MRT, shopping, street food, branded item shopping, cheap stuff. This location is closer other popular cities like little India, china town and orchard road. The breakfast was very good with healthy food varieties.

I lived on 5th floor and found a lovely and friendly house keeper grandma. She is so polite and works hard. You are lucky gotting her. Moreover, all stuffs are really great, especially at the front desk. Water dispenser and ice machine are awesome in Singapore hotel. I love it! But there was a big problem for staying here, we didn't sleep well and woke up when other doors shut. Maybe adjusting door noise is a good idea. :) Thanks

stay for 3 nights. staff give us many advice. Nice decoration, room and bar. lobby under renovate hard to find the entrance when i first came here. found water leak in the hall way at my floor. lovely hotel anyway

Hotel G's staff are always very helpful and always smiling - from reservations to check in and out - top notch, well done ! The location of the hotel is also very convenient near mainline local subway stations. Breakfast is a very good spread of local and international delicacies.

We stayed in Hotel G Singspore from June 4th to 9th.  It's a great hotel for families. It is away from the hustle and bustle of Little India and is located conveniently between Rochor and Bugis junction.

It's nearby Bugis MRT Station, so it is easy to go everywhere. The staff are good and helpful. The room is clean. The only bad thing is you need to walk upstair from G/F to 1/F and then take the escalator to 2/F for check-in / check-out.

The bedsheet got blood stain, they will NOT change bedsheet everyday automatically! The attitude of staff at check in counter is not friendly! Room is too small, whole toilet floor get wet after shower because the shower curtain is too short! Location is far from mrt station.

The rooms are nicely decorated, giving a "boutique" feel to a fairly large scale hotel. Staff were helpful and the location is central, with proximity (~10min walk) to nearby MRT train lines. Two restaurants located right below with breakfast advertised, although I would definitely encourages a small trek to the many nearby restaurants which are terrific. Would definitely return!

Room: very small, quiet and clean. No ironing board, no fridge.  Breakfast: quite good, no complaints  Check in/out: easy, quick, ok.  Staff: 50% nice, pleasant, efficient. 50% lazy,  couldn't care less.  The bar: WATCH OUT FOR RIDICULOUS PRICES AND HOPELESS BARTENDERS!  Location: ok.  This is a budget hotel. Next time I would pay $50 more per night for something more comfortable.

I checked in with a female receptionist who didn't give me index of breakfast time and location or other facilities in room while i hear the next male receptionist did. So that I have to came down again and ask her again.

Hotel location is near amenities as stated in website, really convenient. Room is very clean but too small. The downside for my stay is unfriendly staff. Not sure if they are too tired or what, but the lady who served me seemed to be in a bad bad mood. I asked for a later time to check out at 130pm, but they forgot and i got locked out and was carrying heavy things. I swear i was smiling the whole time talking to the counter people. Nevertheless, would stay again for the convenience, cleanliness and cheap price sake.

Spick n span near the bustling Bugis area. Great choice of tv channels including HBO! Doesnt hav a pool but we dont swim so no loss there. A little hard to spot if u come by the front.. Love to stay again.

Love the interior design of the hotel and the food places nearby. The check-in procedure is smooth and the staff was friendly. He even told us the free phone available in the room so for tourists who do not want to spend on getting a new SIM card, this is a good alternative.

Great location and very helpful staff. Close to public transport and within walking distance of several attractions. Although above a bar/restaurant, hotel rooms are very quiet and private. Very appreciative of being upgraded to a larger room and staff attentiveness.

Place is convenient,  easy to mrt or central. But the room is small, if you body size big have book deluxe room better.  The Design is creative and modern. Like the room and paint design. So far overall is OK!

It's clean. Though, I am surprised that one staff said there was no shaving cream at the first time, but another one said there was shaving cream when I recalled the counter again. Location is good, and it's very good to have a free mobile phone provided during the stay in hotel.

the hotel was very great and clean, strategist place because near Bugis market place, MRT & bus station. the staff was very kind and helpfull. we were very satisfied with their service and had a good experience here.

hotel has a good location and near bugis's station, for only 10 mins. and have very convenient for buying and eating. although the room is small and the water only give one. and the hotel's front desk is hard to find.

overall is ok. there should be some shield between bathroom and outside. water can easily flow to outside because of same floor level. quiet near to bugis,Dhoby ghout and orchard such as shopping areas.

Great place to stay if you want to be centrally located.  Nice staff was very helpful, especially when I only had 1.5 hours left in Singapore and needed help deciding which neighborhood to visit.  Ended up going to Hajj St, but on the way ran into the Parkview Building and was astounded by the art deco architecture.    The restaurant in the Hotel is also excellent and the breakfast was amazing.

Made a last minute booking on this hotel. Regretted it. Room was so tiny. Basin also tiny - looks like the one on the plane. No fridge or kettle either. Lobby not on ground level. Taxi have to drive up the carpark to reach lobby. After my trip i was shocked to see a charge by the hotel on my credit card. I called the Hotel and the lady was speaking very sarcastically over the phone. Bad experience!

I enjoyed my stay at Hotel G! Will come back to stay here again next time! The room was small but cozy. The interior is unique and is very well put together. Hotel G is surrounded by so many great restaurants around too!

Everythingis good but the room is really too small. The space is not big enough for two persons' luggages and when you wash your face, water spills out of the washbasin and that makes the floor wet easily.

Difficult to find lobby, need to go inside the restaurant and take evaluator to lobby. Room is ok, place near MRT, staff is nice. Nearly have food court, 7-11, shopping mall,  average is good, overall not bad.

Our 3 night stay here was exactly what we wanted.. the rooms are cosy and comfortable and styled with a touch of boutique trendy charm that sets it apart from your average clinical city hotel. The restaurant downstairs is open till late and serves a great mix of cuisine from around the world. Hotel was located within walking distance of everything we wanted to do in Singapore.  Only 2 gripes was a total lack of storage space in the room which would have been annoying had we stayed longer. The gym also is more for show than a comprehensive workout.  That being said, my favourite place to stay in Singapore!

Room was big but missing out the transparent flask which we used to have when we were in Great King room. Overall it's a nice stay. Staff are friendly and helpful especially Wallace who came up personally to deliver the cups to us.

I loved this hotel! From the location, funky decor, lovely staff and restaurants options below. There is also a "handy" smart-phone you can take with you free of charge. It comes with internet and free calls so you don't have to worry about getting a Singaporean SIM.

GOOD But the bathroom A LITTLE BIT CLOSE  staff is so Helpfull WHEN I WAS cek in, mostly the indian girl so help  INTERNETWe have a good quality sleep AC Is good  Gym im not go ther borow THE PHONE IS GOOD, should put on the web SO pepole know

Location of the hotel is good and convenient. However, it is not easy to find the front door. The hotel should have complimentary drinks at their bar. The breakfast is charged more than expected. I will recommend the hotel to my friends.

Everything are good.But really too small.The wet of bathroom infill the room. The staff all are friendly.But the entrance was hard to find. Maybe there is a sign or index will be perfect, it spand a lot of time to find the lobby.

review_title: Reliable stay at the center of Singapore
review_text: Building, room and fitment are solid, rational and designed sharp.  I think the size of the room is required minimum, but it does not matter for business use.  5 minutes walk to MRT downtown line station.  Comfortable for business use.

about 6-8 minutes walk to Bugis MRT. proximity to restaurants and shopping complex. great!   cozy room with nice decorations.   staff is helpful and friendly. room is clean. have hot/cold, ice provided in the corridor

Always have a great stay when I'm at this hotel, attentive and informative staff, rooms always spotlessly clean with very comfortable beds,food always good quality and cooked to perfection,would thoroughly recommend to the business traveler

The hotel is located between two MRT stations, bugis and rochor. It's convenient to get to many places in downtown. The room is cozy with simple decorations and the bed is comfortable. Highly recommended to all travelers!

Good location. Clean and nice rooms. Rooms are on the smaller side but can't complain as the room was nicely set out and comfortable for the two of us. Provided a device with internet to take around which was useful.

I like the interior design of the hotel, everything was so skilfully placed. Washroom was a bit small, and I believe sliding glass door should have a locking mechanism. Overall the hotel experience was good because it was located near the Bugis Junction, which is a huge plus.

Great hotel, I would definitely stay here again.  It is hard to find a reasonable hotel in Singapore that is not too expensive but also of a good standard, and in a reasonably central location - Hotel G fits the bill.

Excellent staff, very good food for breakfast, comfortable room. A bit unclear how to get to the reception at first arrival. No minibar/refrigerator in the room, so can't keep food, but they have a hot and cold water dispenser on every floor and an ice cube machine. I highly recommend.

Hotel was very nice and stylish and good location. Very clean and modern. Nice bar/resto downstairs to enjoy. The hotel is new and easy to find. Easy check in and nice staff. Price is very reasonable and suitable for business travelers and young business clients. Not very family or children appropriate though.

There's nothing to complain regarding experience and physical standards at "G" but I find the rooms a little bit too tiny. I like it roomy but that's what no service can change be it as good as it can

Couldn't ask for a better hotel. Thumbs up! Check in and out was a breeze. The bed was really comfortable, great for rest after a long day. Staff was helpful and friendly . Rooms were small but stylish !

the location is good. service, cleanliness, location is very good and the quiet environment makes my sleep quality very good. Although the single room is is small. But on the whole, all the things in this hotel are very good. Is a happy journey

The staycation was awesome ! Highly recommended although the downside was that this hotel does not have complimentary parking which was a heavy downside as the parking fees could go up a lot! Pls issue complimentary parking soon!

The decoration is innovative, and I felt very comfortable there.  Gym room is a bit small but I didn't do much gym indeed.  10min walk to Bugis MRT station, but 5min walk to a famous Chinese temple in Bugis.

The hotel is located at a great location. Easy access to 3 different MRT station. There is plenty of food choices around. Room is clean and cozy. Would recomend Only thing to watch out for in my room the hot water can switch back and forth between hot and cold.

price perfomance recomendate, covenience 10 minutes walk to bras basah mrt station and near to bugis + and bugis mrt station.  having one of the best wine bar in town and good breakfast neighborhood...

Hotel G is a nicely designed and clean hotel. Although the room is small, the bed is really comfortable and clean. The bathroom is also very small but the overhead shower is awesome. Staff was not so friendly during check in but check out was fine and fast. Hotel reception is hard to locate as it is located on the 2nd floor of the hotel. Breakfast buffet is nice and the food quality is good. Highly recommended

Rooms should have their own electric kettle. Thin rectangular shape room feels tight. Friendly staff. The small young Chinese room attendant is very friendly and helpful. Had difficulty looking for the lobby.

Well located for Bugis Junction, Orchard Road, Fort Canning Park and many CBD attractions. Rooms are clean if quite small and there is no facility for boiling your own water - you have to go to the boiling water and cold water taps by the elevators for those. No fridge either, although on the plus side the house mobile phone which you can take with you anywhere in Singapore is a great feature. Also, the bed was extremely comfortable.  The staff are helpful and friendly. There is a ground floor bar/restaurant through which you have to go to access the stairs to the elevator to get to reception which is on the third floor which is quite unique. Taxis enter the property via the back car park which extends to the third floor so that isn't a problem. The bar itself is expensive for

I really like the environment in this hotel. So peaceful and quiet. Facilities and everything reach my satisfaction.afgsfhdgjfkgmngwerhjj,jmnbdvfdfbsrtq13134thfsdefsdgdfgdfhdfghfghfghfasdasdasdasda adscadkaksdsd

Hotel G is a great base for anyone visiting Singapore. The room is a slightly strange set up with no formal wardrobe. The bed was exceedingly comfortable. The major positive of this hotel is the provision of the Handy phone, which is free, allowing you to surf the net, make local calls, and some international calls for free also. I did not eat breakfast at the hotel, but enjoyed going to the bar for a night cap. The 25 restaurant next door served the loveliest burgers when you just wanted a quick bite.   The only complaint I would have about the hotel, is that despite me staying there for 8 nights, they were not accommodating with me having a late check out at no extra cost on the Sunday, with my flight being at 9pm.

review_title: great hotel and location and staff and great breakfast
review_text: the only thing I need to see the front desk and reception as soon as u walked in hotel not in second level . I don't like the idea of the front desk in second level . usually front desk and hotel reception always in ground floor so u can easily spot it and be greet it by front staff

If you want a weekend prison cell fantasy, stay at Hotel G. The room is smaller than my bathroom at home. There is no place to hang or place clothes. The coffee pot is just a pot. You actually have to walk to the end of the hall in your underwear to get hot water in the morning. The windows are very small and the amount of natural light in the room is depressing. I had been booked here for a nine day stay but I booked another hotel within a few hours. to be fair this a property for a quick one night stay for business or for a young couple to have a quick rendezvous.for a working professional or a tourist, this is not the place to stay.

Hotel location good, but room space just for one people, room humidity high, dress isn't easy dry. Internet speed is good even watch the movie, room is clean, hotel staff service is good, I can recommend this hotel to my friends

Location was good, short walk from the nearest mall and MRT. Room is hipster and compact (comfortable for 2) and beds were comfy, also thumbs up for the built-in USB ports and the free phone with data.

Bit tough getting up and down with luggage, there is a lift going up and down tho, but still, I would imagine the lift will directly take you to Receptionist from street level without having to switch to another lift.  it was raining during my stay, and they provide umbrella to loan, this was a plus point.  Bathroom a bit of problem, water runs between the shower and closet. especially after shower. And room amenities, sometimes it's there sometimes it's not, one day I get soap, another day I don't, one day I get shower cap, another day I don't, one day there is tea, another day I don't, hmmm strange standard.  Overall stay was really good, love the room and location, easy MRT, Bus and Taxi.

Rooms are very small but well compensated with very friendly staff, great ground floor restaurant/bar, amazing location, flawless wifi and portable hotspot, super clean room! Breakfast is average but enough!

exceptional breakfast and hotel room, as well as the beautiful deco. check in was quick and straight forward. there are 2 downside with my stay.  1. the floor is still wet when i walk into the room.  2. when i was breastfeeding my son in the room, one of the hotel staff open my door as soon as she rang the doorbell. without any hesitation. its like, doorbell and door opened at the same time. i was shocked with what i have to encounter, i was quite expose i have to say. it was very rude that she did not even apologies.

The location is good, easy to go everywhere, very near to several MRT staion. It is at the Bugis, you can walk to orchard or even marina bay if you want to singapore sightseeing by walking. The room is small, but still fine as long as it is clean.

review_title: Good location and hassle free check in
review_text: Near to MRT station Bugis. Reasonable price, convenient, newly renovated. From Chiangi airport only 45 min by mrt. Clean and comfy, air cond us cold enough, shower water is warm enough. For usd100 ++ a night nothing to complain about.  Free mobile phone upon check in to be used for calling and wifi have made the stay extra convenient.

Well decorated, nice atmosphere, friendly and helpful staff, reasonable price, convenient location, variety of breakfast. Few minuses that my room (single room) didn't have a chair or proper workdesk. But overall is very satisfied. Will stay at this hotel again for sure! :)

Fantastic location! Staff friendly but seemed short staffed both when checking in and out. Rooms had good facilities and cleaning came each morning but they're a bit cramped. Also the main light in my room didn't turn off so if I wanted aircon on then I had to sleep with light on - but maybe this was just my room. Overall good experience, would recommend!

Room is a bit too small. Deco is good and stylish. Room is clean but I found the tooth brush packs are open when I arrive. Free phone is very advanced experience. Staff service is very good, especially with taxi service.

Nice location near the famous bugis street, bugis bus stop and mrt. Comfort room, but it's just too small if you're travelling with family. Great thing is the hotel provide water dispenser, so you can refill anytime, even with ice cube machine on every floor!

Staff's response and breakfast was good. I always chose IBIS or G hotel on my business trip. I would like a refrigerator in the room. IBIS has a refrigerator in the room. If there is a refrigerator, I will choose G Hotel.

My shower doesn't have any partition or blocks to stop the water to leak out. It's really horrible experience. I've to spend tons of towel to make sure wouldn't slip over the floor and use lesser and lesser water to wash.

Last minute find and we could not have been happier! Miscommunication with booking upon arrival but loved the boutique space of the room and the hotel! Good walking distance to the Bugis station so it was convenient for us to catch a train to the airport. Had a late night snack at 25 degree restaurant below and the burgers were satisfying! Would definitely recommend the stay!

We stayed for only one night. The front door little bit confusing, hard to find the access. thankfully their cafe staffs are really welcoming and friendly. Came at 1.30 pm but the room was not ready yet (even the other guests' that checked in just before me, their rooms has ready). it's okay. OUR BATHROOM'S FLOOR EASILY FLOODED. hint : keep your bath mat outside. their "G Stop" call were also not really good, we called them asking for new bath mat, the came for it in more than 20 min. I think it just became a negative side. It's not fair if I only shared their negatives. Their room design is completely gorgeous! their amenities : A SMARTPHONE! called handy. you can bring it to company you to explore the city with UNLIMITED DATA! ps : sadly can't be used for personal hotspot.

I had a great stay. The staff were super friendly and helpful. Location wise, the hotel was near Orchard, food, shopping. Room was clean and tidy. There is nothing that I pick on to complaine about my stay and this hotel

review_title: A great stay at the Hotel G
review_text: A really cool and hip hotel. The room is quite small but very well designed and efficient and comfortable. It had everything I needed. Perfect for 1 person or a couple. Clean bathroom, internet access, in-room safe, comfortable bed. 24 hour gym access worked great. Friendly staff. The restaurants downstairs were busy - but that is good and it created a desirable atmosphere. Lots of other places to eat nearby as well.  The only small point to note from my side is that I wished that the restaurant opened at 6:00 am instead of 7:00 am, as I needed to have early breakfasts.  Overall, really a great place to stay, and I'd stay there again.

This is the first time I stayed at the hotel without free parking. Hotel room is slightly smaller for me,Breakfast is Western style,Bathing products taste particularly.The location of the hotel is very convenient and Twenty-four hour convenience store is downstairs, very convenient. I am very satisfied with the overall rating of the hotel

A great concept hotel with a touch of chic and modern... space is well utilized. One thing can be definitely improved is the functions of "Handy" mobile... it's not as user-friendly as the name suggested.

Room does not come with shower gel or shampoo etc. There's no drinking water ready in the room and you'll have to get it from the dispenser outside. Room is quite small and not exactly worth what is paid for. Master switch doesn't work and I slept with the ceiling cove lights on because there was no way to turn it off unless I remove the keycard?

Close to the Bugis shopping district. Entry is through restaurant at ground floor, check-in on second floor. When checking in, the cab need to go into the car park and travel up to second floor - tight corner. Nice boutique hotel, very small but well laid out. No fridge. The real disappointment for this poor rating is the stupid policy they have about taking guarantee. After eating in at the restaurant, the staff kept chasing us like criminal for more guarantee as if we are going to run away with paying; despite the rooms were prepaid. What a disappointment to be treated like theft and criminal when on holiday.

Pros: 1.Best location  2.Great restaurant with nice crowd, one of the most lively place 3. Brilliant customer service  Cons.  1. Rooms pretty small 2. They ask for deposit which they return while checking out. But keep 150 extra cash for this purpose.

review_title: Great value in high design style
review_text: Had a really comfortable bed to relax in my perfect and charmingly small room. Quiet, relaxing and easily restored by energy before heading to CommunicAsia for 3 solid days of conference. Nice Maitre'd in Ginett.

The size of the the room was too small. When you are aware of the fact that the size of your hotel rooms are relatively smaller than the size of the other available rooms around the city, its your moral responsibility to mention it in your website. If we had known about the size of your rooms earlier we wouldn't have stayed with you. Also, there was nobody to help us with our luggage.

I must admit I was a bit hesitant when I booked Hotel G. The hotel looked good but the  rooms looked small.  After having been here for 5 days I can really recommend this hotel. The rooms are indeed not very big but they space is well used and the Greater Rooms offer more than enough space.  The beds are comfy, the shower is great and the Wifi is very fast. The restaurant and bar are also lively and unlike a hotel bar.  All in all a great hotel for personal or business travel at a very competitive price point.  Highly recommended!

review_title: Feeling good in Hotel G SG
review_text: Everything is great ! But the room has no wardrobe and small refrigerator :(  Can't found the quiet corner for the dinner at the restaurant as it's a bar as well. For the breakfast is good, the food is fresh and delicious.

Great location, but poor efficiency in the hotel. The lifts take a very long time... Also, I did not need to know that the previous guest had oatmeal for breakfast (dirty spoons). That being said: breakfast is great, and the gym facilities are too. A (yoga) mat would make it even better!

review_title: I got almost all requirements for business trip.
review_text: # good * Breakfast is good. * Free WiFi is stable,is not so slow. * can use free smart phone.(but I didn't use.) * Gyms is so so,some aerobic machines and one strength machine.very clean. * dryer,slippers,shampoo,other service.  # no good * sometime outlet is unplugged by itself. * hard to find the reception. (Please go up stair and go to 2nd floor by lift.)

review_title: clean room great decorate but too small
review_text: hotel location is quite good not too far from MRT about 10min walk but its a bit hard to find reception. room's decoration is great, chic but too small , have a bit space to keep baggage under bed.  sink is not locate in bath room.  its suit to stay alone. it'll be so so small if your go with friends or family. in 1st floor have bar and restaurant .v

We spent five lovely days at hotel g, the position is quiet convenient , the a little far from mrt station, but near 3 bus stop, you can take bus to most spot. Hotel also provide a cellphone with internet which is very helpful for us to use google map or browse some page. However the blanket is not clean, we ask two times to change it. But still found some dirty spot on it.

Arrived late night and greeted with a smile. My allocated room was seriously cold and once the thermostat was turned up condensation started to form on the walls and windows creating extreme damp. To make matters worse when I showered the water ran out from under the door flooding the room.  Management was polite and took immediate action and moved me to another rooom with a very nice balcony. The temp problem persisted and found leaving the balcony door open a jar would counter balance the cold.  The good news the breakfast was more than reasonable, the location was excellent for meetings in the CBD all in walking distance (30mins). Note I stayed ina single room and noticed the larger rooms better laid out. Overall I would recommend this hotel and strongly believe the staff

Overall good experience with the hotel. The lobby might be a little confusing at first, as it is not on the ground floor, but the friendly bar staff will direct you to the elevator to the reception. Also very convenient that there is a water and ice dispenser in every floor if you need to refill your bottles.

Stayed here for 4D3N. Got the room with Queen bed and I think 2 persons will be comfortable enough. I was surprised that the hallways have very good design. They already have the mini elevator at Ginett restaurant for those entering the hotel (from the street) with a heavy bag. The room is clean with all the necessities in place. I love how they provided 'handy' mobile phone. I never tried making calls(it was free) but the mobile data really helped me a lot in roaming around Singapore. Can refill water or get ice for free too. I love that the place is just 500m or 6 minutes walk from Rochor station. It is easy to find places to eat nearby as well. Booked through agoda and I never encountered any problems.

Althoughthe the room is a bit small, but it's Clean and cozy. The decor is quite unique. They change dishes for breakfast so won't get bored of eating the same thing over and over again. Location is quite convenient. Overall is good

review_title: Amazing location at an amazing price
review_text: This excellent hotel was everything I needed for Singapore. Clean and friendly staff. I loved it. Even when I need to leave my baggage for storage until the night, the staff was extremely accommodating.

The hotel is fine in all aspects except for the reception lounge, I am sure many would have commented, its a bit small . Guest would usually like to meet their associates or casual friends. Probably the design of the hotel is such, can look at other re arrangements.

This is an excellent hotel. The room was priced well and very functional. They serve good breakfast buffet considering the hotel price. The in-room handy phone is helpful while navigating the city. It can also be used to call various people from different countries, including Philippines.

review_title: Good location, clean and nice room
review_text: Overall is good except the parking fee. If the parking fee can be waive off will be perfectly good. Didn't request for breakfast, so I have no comment for the foods. Not a 4 stars experienced that I ever had.

Walls were thin. Rooms small but clean and comfy.  Air con was either too cold or stuffy.  Good location.   Didn't like the entrance that had to go thru bars.   Loved the toiletries.   Loved that they noted special requests. Staff helpful.  Love the phone provided.

review_title: Good location but room is small
review_text: The location is good, it is near the SMRT station with around 5-10 minutes walk. Room is clean but small. No refrigerator and electronic hot wator pot in the room, but you can get hot water outside the room.

I didn't try the Leisure and Fitness facilities so I rated 3 for a neutral rating so it could be a 5 if I tried.  I am impressed with the hotel and the design which equates to an experience living here. Before I arrived, the location was what I thought I would not like as there's a still quite a walking distance but it doesn't matter when I came to stay here. I think it was a really good price with the kind of quality offered and this is really important because I always felt like everything is overpriced in Singapore given the land space. But for this one, it is the only hotel so far that I'm paying and not get the expected quality given the price just because I'm staying in Singapore.

I am staying just for a night in Singapore. The concept is very modern and mininalist. The reception is on the 2nd floor and taxi will drop you off thru parking building. But there's access to the street level if you elevator to the restaurant on level 1.  Room is small for that price, but given the strategic area and what seems like newly furbished furniture, i feel it is ok for solo or couples. But a bit hard if you have family with little kids. No electric kettle in room, but there's ice, hot and cold water dispenser in every level. There is a ornament hanging above my bed, kinda make me uncomfortable, i don't want to sleep breathing in the dust that might come from up there.  Overall, 3 star i like their minimalist concept, OK for short stay solo or couples traveller. But no

Stayed here on the weekend and although the room was small it was in great condition. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was adequate. Hard for the person sleeping next to the window to get out of bed without disturbing the other person though. Would suggest this for the budget conscious and for someone looking at somewhere central.

Very modern, and amazing concept - i wish they had more options for food, maybe an in-room service, but otherwise the hotel was amazing.   The staff were very friendly, and the rooms were so comfortable - would definitely stay again

review_title: Hotel is not 4 star but an interesting new boutique hotel in central Bugis
review_text: Hotel G rates itself as "4 star" but definitely only deserves 3 stars ~ the rooms are tiny: my room was only 13sqm but apparently  that is bigger than some other rooms !! The shower is separated from the toilet by a simple plastic curtain which does not reach the floor... The basin is in the main room, presumably because there is no space in the "bathroom". There is no cupboard, only a hanging rack with hangers, so inconvenient for someone who wishes to stay for more than one night. The bed was comfortable, on top of the space for a suitcase and the safe. Wifi worked, a kettle with instant coffee and tea bags were provided but no towelling bathrobe or slippers.  Entrance is on the second of floor floors of car park... There is nothing wrong with being a boutique 3 star hotel BUT

The room size is really disappointed, seriously small. There're only 2 power plug in the room and one of it doesn't work well. No refrigerator in room and no in room hot kettle is really ridiculous. Still wondering why the customer rating is quite good. During my stay, one day the cup and glass was not washed.

It is a modern and boutique style hotel. Although the rooms are a bit small, the interior design has more than compensate it by making it super comfortable and functional. Centrally located. Would recommend it for both business trip and short family trip.

review_title: It was 5-star all the way until I found a disgusting tangled hairball tucked in my clean wrapped towel..
review_text: Rooms were very cozy bedding and linen were comfy too. Didn't get to dine at the restaurant but when I walked thru it at night it was full house even at 10.30pm. Will try the food next time.  Only stayed for a night so am overall pleased cept for the towel incident.  Also thankful to the hotel staff for allowing me to check-out later than usual due to my unforeseen circumstances. Hotel Staff also reminded me that I had left something personal in the hotel which saved me a huge potential inconvenience.

Having stayed at the Hotel G at San Francisco, we had high hopes!   The hotel location was great, walking distance to malls, restaurants and hawker centres. It was well-connected to buses that takes you everywhere, also uber-ing was not a problem at all in Singapore in general.   The hotel facilities was good, easy access to water and ice, staffs was very helpful and friendly. The only would be that the room was a lot smaller than I expected. To be fair, the room size was clearly specified (11-13 sqm), and the staffs was friendly enough to offer us an upgraded (charged). The size was manageable, but I'd have to give the room's value an average rating.

Excellent Service by the staff. Great room atmosphere and decoration. the food was outstandingly  glorious! Would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends.The welcome note on the bed by the GM was really a sweet gesture!

I don't really enjoy the breakfast there but may be some of you will enjoy it. The air-conditioning system is direct to the bed and I got cold after staying there.  The room is small but it's tidy. The employees are welcoming and helpful.

I find everything is fine and meet my expectations. Although the room is small but I find it is comfortable. Besides, all the staff's are very friendly and helpful. The breakfast need to have different varieties throughout different days.

all good in this hotel except no toilet exhaust fan. the room is very humid after shower hot water. and whole toilet smell go to you bedroom. this is only bad thing for this hotell others is very good

Had a good experience during my stay here, extended my stay an extra night even. Room was clean and staff even let me check in early and were very courteous. If ever I come back to Singapore I'll be sure to stay there again.

review_title: Great service and great attitude for all the staffs in hotel G
review_text: Very good experience. Room is clean and the staff are very friendly and nice. I would like to thank again for all the good service and great attidutde for all the staff in Hotel G. I will choice Hotel G next time!

A great location in central Singapore.  Really impressed with and enjoyed the well designed very compact rooms.  Reception staff friendly and helpful.  Worked very well for single occupancy - but could be a bit of a squeeze for two if you both have large luggage.  Would definitely stay again.

Clean, modern, good internet and AC.  Not much storage space.  If you come for a longer stay, bring hangers.  Good value for money.  Very convenient to SMU.  Also convenient to airport, shopping, various restaurant options.

After previous visits to Singapore and staying on Orchard Road / Scotts Road, we decided to have a couple of nights elsewhere in Singapore to explore a new area.  The hotel is in a fantastic location and we knew we were going to be in a cool hotel which have small rooms but perfect for short stays. The wine bar and burger restaurants were very popular and we enjoyed a burger meal on our first day there. Would stay again in this funky hotel!

Had a wonderful stay at the hotel. Loved my bed and found it hard to get out of it.  The room was well-appointed and the dreamcatcher was a lovely touch. Check-in and out were efficient. Thank you for an enjoyable stay.

Small room but didn't feel claustrophobic. I thought location was extremely good for business. The interior was very nice, I understand it was newly renovated. Gym facility was lacking, but I appreciate having a gym so I can maintain some exercise. Bed was very comfy and I had very good sleep both nights I stayed.   The front desk manager, the cleaning staff, and the gentlemen at the 25 degrees restaurant all made very memorable impression. I would mention their names to appreciate them, but perhaps that would not be so nice for them.

Staff was very helpful. Room was fine. But the room 1105 I stayed is having bathroom drainage issue. Please check and fix. Waste water overflowed and took long time to drain. I had to take shower and kept watch at same time so that water would not overflowed to outside of bathroom.

review_title: Modern and clean hotel in one of the most central locations in town
review_text: Hotel G was a clean and modern place to spend 2 weeks for a business trip. Amenities were nice (gym, internet, accessibility) and free, and the A+ restaurant was great for those times one doesn't want to head back into town. Location was ideal with MRT closeby, restaurants within walking distance and easy access to touristic places such as Little India. The rooms are efficient and clean though a tad small for the average american traveller (perfectly normal for the region), no business rooms are available, and not an easy place for taxis to stop. Regardless staff was super friendly and helpful both at the hotel and the restaurant. Also highly recommend the breakfast! Even with the minor remarks I would highly recommend and stay there again.

Great location great service great interior design great restaurant downstairs but small room, will only fit one suitcase. A personal thing: the pillows were too soft.  Will stay again if I was travelling alone

I had a good time in the hotel. The best part is it's location, its just 2mins walk from the bras basah Mrt. Not suitable for vegetarians as this hotel doesnt provide vegetarian breakfast. A bar on the ground level is really classy.

Location is so centralise to everywhere. Good food and cafes around. Accessible to two MRTs and malls. Love the pub and the burger store at level 1. Best, when I don't feel like going out, there' s so many nice tv channels for selections!

I truly enjoyed my stay in Hotel G. From the service, to the ambience, to the cleanliness of the room, everything exceeded my expectations. I would like to commend the staff for being exceptionally welcoming and extremely polite. Would definitely come back!

Bed area is clean and comfortable. Shower area quite tight. Toilet area size is just right. Lavatory can be improved or cleaned better. No hot water which can be provided for drinking inside room. Please provide soap dish for lavatory and shower area.

This hotel was everything I expected and more. Really beautiful, small but super comfortable, with the nicest staff. It's really well located and the breakfast had only one problem: I wanted to eat everything!! Will come back for sure

review_title: A good value new hotel that just meet what you need
review_text: Being a new hotel, its facilities are mostly new and in good conditions. The location is rather convenient with 7min walk to mrt station with interesting residential neighbourhood, yet very near to Bugis shopping malls.  The price is very reasonable, very good value. And very friendly staff

It's a great experience staying in Hotel G. The staff are friendly and helpful when I'm seeking assistance on the tourist spot. Hotel location are near to MRT and convenient to tourist who stay in Hotel G

The hotel itself is great, clean and neat room. It is located nearby Bugis area where you can find lots of delicious foods and also souvenirs. I love the concept of the hotel and how they arramge the room so it looks spacious.

The room is okay, simple and clean. Had a very good sleep. Worth for the price and the location convenient. The hotel staffs were helpful and polite, it was a smooth checking in and checking out process.

Friendly and curteous staff, very good location and excellent service. The internet service was excellent both in the room and with the supplied handy handset with free local phone calls and some international.

Everything was excellent! The food is so good you should book with breakfast it's worth it. The room is clean and location is walking distance in food centers & malls. Definitely recommend this to everyone

When we arrived at Hotel G, we were surprised by the unusual carpark entrance - thank goodness the taxi driver had been there before, otherwise we would have really been lost. The check-in was swift and a lot of thought has clearly gone into the decor of the whole hotel. When we got to our room, though, we couldn't believe how tiny it was. I had read the reviews about the size of the room before we arrived but nothing had quite prepared me for this. There was no space for our luggage and no space to walk around the edge of the bed - as I slept by the window, I had to do some pretty fancy acrobatics to clamber over my partner when I needed to use the bathroom in the middle of the night. There's also a design fault - easily fixable - in the bathroom, in that the whole bathroom

having wonderful experiences at G hotel and will stay there again next time. big bed, nice space, great design, yummy breakfast, nice stuff, near MRT, fashion building, fast check in and out, controlled lift.

Interior was excellent, staff are friendly and helpful. Walking distance to Bugis and Rochor. Would be nice to have a refrigerator in the room. The wifi was fast. Will definitely come back to this hotel for my next trip!

The room lightings and TV are automatically switched on for 4 times during my first night stay. It is really quite scared for a traveller staying at the room alone. I believe changing the room is an option but it has not been offered. However the handy phone really helps when I go outside.

Design of room was great, but it was a bit lacking in the practicality aspect. The bathroom door was not able to fully close, and the layout of the shower area enabled water to spill out of it, thus wetting the dry area of the bathroom. Smartphone device (which was supposed to give you information) was not working, and there was no fridge, which I expected most hotels to have. There was no room service for food & beverages also. There are parking facilities but it is chargeable at $2/hour, and capped at $15 if you purchase a ticket from the reception. A decent experience overall, but not fantastic.

Overall experiences are well. The only few points what I concerned are: I don't prefer to the shower and toilet exist together without any partition, and little bit wrong in terms of cleaning of the room.

Very customer focused.  We had already paid but had to cut our stay one day short. Most hotels wouldn't make any effort to accommodate. But hotel G actually gave us an upgraded room and two days free breakfast! Thanks for showing us that Customer Service and satisfaction are still important to some in the service industry!

Location of hotel right in heart of city... Accessibility is fanastic by MRT and public bus. Food wise not bad... Service crowd was helpful and polite. Amenities was fantastic. Cleanliness was good and daily housekeeping done.

I stayed for four nights here and ended up extending my stay for another night. The hotel is tres chic! I love the decor. My premium queen room is not big but I stayed alone and it was comfy and clean and I could still do my morning yoga in the room :) So it's enough space for solo traveller. The bed is perfect for me and I love the dream catcher decor right above the bed. Maybe that's why I had really good sleep there. I didn't try the breakfast cos there are plenty of eating establishments around the hotel. Water bottles are replenished everyday and if you still need more, there's water gallon and ice machine on every floor. Check in/out was efficient and fast.

The room clean and near target to go, convenience. the food delicious. people is friendly, clean country. If I have opportunity I will go to Singapore again. I am lady, this is first time i go out abroad alone, I select Singapore because I confident Singapore safety.

It is a good hotel which provide a excellent customer services. A only weakness point is the house keeper. I stayed for 4 days and I need to call to customer services to refill the toothbrush and clean the toliet.

AMAZING breakfast, if you stay here, get the breakfast package with the room, well worth the money.   Great coffee, they change up the buffet every day and the verity of stuff is beyond anything I've seen even at super fancy hotels in the USA.  loved staying here - close to the Bras Bahar and Bugis MRT stations.  Close to National Museum and Raffles Hotel.  Good staff - just loved being here.

review_title: Great room and even better location!
review_text: Stayed here for 3 nights and had a great experience! Wonderful single room with a lovely feel and all the things i need! Staff were friendly and wifi amazing! Comfy bed and powerful shower - perfect!!! But the location (near Bugis street) was amazing - lots of food options (cheap and expensive) and walking distance to the bay (20mins)! Finally, the free smartphone was a godsend - used it alot!!!!

Dear Hotel G singapore Here's how I feel 1、The room is too small 2、The shower is broken  3、No shower cap 4、There is no sign in front of the two floor But I appreciate the decor of your hotel  ANNA LAI,10/5/2017

review_title: Good location and my room is private.
review_text: Good location and my room is private. Getting comfortable with bus and MRT Free drinking water is provided. The ground floor of the hotel is a pub. But it is suitable for those who love music. Next time do not miss to stay here.

Very nicely decorated, but a very small room. The end of the bed touched the wall, so European men don't have too much space. The bathroom is not a well asset in the room due to how it looks and the small sink inside the room itself, but it fulfills it's purpose.   The reception of sometimes 3 persons seemed always busy, so we had to wait long times. Breakfast was good, too bad some mornings there were few vegetarian warm dishes (meat eaters can always add some meat right?). The hotel cellphone had a really weak battery and was not really useful because of that, when we asked the reception they couldn't do anything. It's a shame when the cellphone is one of the reasons you chose this hotel.

The location of hotel is good, near bugis station which is a interchange station of several travel sights. the room is clean and decoration is modern. There is also 24 hours Malay style local restaurant around hotel, no worry if feel hungry in midnight, haha

I was neutral on food & beverages because I didn't dine there so can't rate their food. I was impressed a handy phone was provided in the room and for tourist, you can bring this phone out to surf the net! very convenient when you need to search things online. We love the room and everything about it! Bed was awesome too! Hot water and ice dispenser is provided outside the rooms. Only thing is there is no fridge but for us tourists, we didn't mind. Safety deposit was provided as well. Walkable distance to MRT. Closer to Rochor station but sometimes we went to Bugis station when we plan to have lunch there.

It may be a small thing, but if your room does not come with complimentary carparks, how to expect staycations or friends from across the causeway to stay at your venue? Granted that we can purchase the coupons at S$15, I feel that small issues like these should not be overlooked. Maybe people who drive are not your target guests, but still...

Like the place, the room isn't a square centimeter larger than it has to be, but that's fine, why would you want to be in your room all day? Great food (the breakfast buffet is huuuuuuge, both restaurants are amazing as well, european style). Also very nice staff in the bar!

Nice Place near to shopping center Bugis Juction and Bugis Street, , Maybe need more lift to carry bag to upside, if can the window can open. for me the room and coridor from lift to room very dark, but for clean and staff good

Its small ( like most Singaporean boutique hotel rooms), but spacious enough for one. What I loved most about it was the small attention to detail  -  the decoration, bed and sheets, the toiletries they gave and the general amenities ( drinking water was available which I thought was really superb, and there was a basic gym). Also the location is great in Bugis, but the lobby is on the 2nd floor which is a bit weird because the phone reception there is a bit bad and i could not order my ubers.   The restaurants attached to it are supposed to be good too. I can attest to Ginette -  i loved it. Very affordable for SG and the food was delicious! 25 degrees is a burger place that was i wanted to try ( supposed to be fantastic), but maybe next time.

Whether my first or second time stayed in here, I would ended up loving it. A hotel that's totally close to Bugis Junction without a worry to find food (the 24 hours Indian food next to the hotel is great too), then walked for around 5 minutes (due to traffic light), you'd be finding taxi stand too. totally recommended :D

review_title: Booking sucks, but place and room is great
review_text: I booked through Expedia though G hotel wasn't sure it was paid or not. And then they charged $300 for a deposit, because they weren't sure. Then they told them to come back next day to check whether it was paid or not. So I went there next there waiting on line. Then they prioritized customer who has suitcase. well, it was so uncomfortable me saying I was waiting on line. Anyway, they confirmed that it was paid, then they said my payment on credit card wouldn't be charged. I asked them for a proof just in case it will charge. And what they've given me is a receipt of I've paid. Also they told me that I need to contact with my card company if it is charged. It is not Professional especially it comes about money. But I have to say the place was nice and they provided a phone that

Good Location  - near two MRT station and walk 5mins or 8mins to the station - Good location for visit and walk only 15mins Nice Services - the hotel staff provided professional and nice services - Room design is awesome and comfort

Very elegantly designed. Love all the decorations .The room is small,yet cozy and efficiently settled. The gym is not big but useful enough. The location is quite well,nearest subway is rochar,bugis needs 10＋mins.

Location is very central. Friendly and helpful staff. Excellent Value for money unless you spend a lot of time in the room or look for a lot of hotel facilities. Bar/ restaurants on the ground floor are convenient for a casual drink and bites. Easy access to most central locations; I have not experienced congestion around the area. I did not get to take the mrt during my 4 days. Most Uber and taxi find their way to hotel.

1）unclear entrance signage to access hotel, and is asked to pass through Resturant customer 2) integrated bath cubic and toilet, trouble for non-single customer 3) old and damaged bath shower equipment. It was damaged while using

not bad, but humidity in room is little heavily. which make bed not confortable. the location is close to the doby ghaut. there is a new station named bencoolen. in future will be closer.  their endlish is a little strange. i asked sevice for SOAP, but they sent one body wash to me.hahaha..

Just mentioning the ONLY three disappointments and the rest are perfect!  1) No Lift from G/f to Reception, where you have to carry ur luggage from the G/f to the 1/F Lift Lobby. Unless to take cab. Uber and arrive the reception via the 2/F Car Park. Anyway the staff is kind and helped us with carrying the baggage.   2) Uber drive may confused with the pick up point go Hotel G. Either it is on the 200 Middle Road or the Car Park on 2/F  3) The Basin is compact, my girl friendly can bearly place her healthcare stuff near the basin (personal perference)

review_title: New Hotel with Small but Practical Rooms
review_text: Please consider that the review will be from the point of view of a traveler on vacation with my wife and a 3-year-old as well as a 7-month-old daughter.  The Pros: 1. Each floor has a water dispenser that provides 24/7 access to cold and hot drinking water 2. Also has access to ice cubes 3. Hotel is very new and is expectedly still very clean 4. Bed is large enough to fit the family and beddings were great 5. Very good location and is near malls and MTR  The Cons: 1. Very small rooms that's built around practicality 2. Sink is very small and is similar to an airplane's sink making hard to wash baby bottles and do stuff like shaving 3. Toilet offers little privacy and the attached shower design means that the toilet area is prone to getting wet 4. Very little space left for

review_title: Very good hotel with great location and friendly staff ( not all of them)
review_text: Very good hotel with great location, in walking distance from Bugis, Bras basha and rochor stations. Lots of dinning options around and the bugis junction is just about 4 mins walking. Room is in reasonable size and very clean. Room service staffs do wonderful job. I would rate 5 stars for this hotel except my bad experience when check-in. The staff was unprofessional and not even checked customer condition when check in. He gave me a disable room which clearly i dont need it. When i asked whether i can change my room, I was told that because of my booking via hotels.com and nothing he can do. I was so upset about his attitude, so i went down and luckily saw a different staff who was very helpful. She changed room for me and apologied what happended. I understand the staff maybe

Great hotel.Less than 10min from the bugis MRT. A lot of snacks around it. Highly recommend for the couples who is travel around Singapore. Great serivice of the staff. Great cleanliness of the room. Ps:Great ciry Great hotel.

Great location, near to mrt ,bus stop, & bugis junction. Really good food, great music...modern art hotel, small room but nice design. Good value. Great atmosphere for young people.  Surely will be back here someday.

Very good budget hotel, good location, friendly and helpful staffs, the breakfast is great, nice restaurant and bar, my wife and kid enjoyed a lot. The room is designed very compact and tidy. I will come back!

Really GOOD Hotel !!! With good bed, good design, good gym, good service, good music.... I will recommend it to all of my friends. Although the G Hotel is not near the bugis MRT, but it still very convenient.

Rooms are still small for what I paid. Thought maybe the renovation would've have been  good for some changes. Check is on 2nd floor. Initial check in went smoothly, but into the room. No towels... No toiletries tooth brush etc. Cost cutting?  Moving on Ginett wine bar next to the hotel , when your a senior manager of F & B you should know better than to raise your voice in front of customers at your staff. Take them else where for a discussion and not draw attention to your dissatisfaction of an employee. You represent your hotel and your mannerism is so poor and will have to reconsider staying in this hotel

The hotel is at a very convenient location. Room is a bit small and the cleaning part can be improved. Overall staffs are helpful and good. Love their smiles :) The decoration they hang from the ceiling on top of the bed is a bit annoying though....

Enjoyed our stay at Hotel G, where the staff were friendly and very professional.  It was a breeze for the check in and check out process. A very pleasant atmosphere to stay in. Would anytime recommend this hotel to my friends.

Form over function. Tired from late flight - first obstacle was no idea how to get in the hotel or reception as no signage and you must go through restaurant then in the lift. Had to ask bar staff who were winding down after shift as its was 130am. Room was small but clean. Cordless kettle no idea how to work it. No fridge. Hairdryer but lead didn't stretch far enough to dry hair in the mirror and when you did the plug came out. Shower curtain stuck to body when showering as open plan bathroom. A few clothes hangers but no shelves to place items. Plug socket by desk but didn't stretch far enough to charge phone and use it whilst in bed. Every time you turn in TV you get this pretentious film about the hotel launch which is ironic when you've had so many functional issues. The

Traveling solo for work, so the tiny room wasn't too bad, but there was barely enough room for one person to get dressed let alone if you were a couple.  Had to iron some shirts and ironing board would only just fit  In bed my feet hit the wall with my head on the pillow (only 6ft tall), so had to lay across the bed.  Nowhere to put clothes apart from a couple of hangers on the wall so had to live out of suitcase.  Sink was in the room as there isn't enough space in the shower area. No soap at the sink, so had to use shower gel. No space for anything practical to be done. For example the desk was big enough to make a cup of coffee, OR use a very small laptop OR write some notes OR you get the idea.  What I view as basics for a hotel room were missing.  Just get the feeling they

Love the location and friendly services, only downside is the noise from room service in the morning. In summary, this is the hotel that I will go in every trip to Singapore, especially the location is right in the center of Bugis area.

I advise you to provide a map of Singapore's popular tourist attractions when i check in.Give me some tips for traveling.The hotel room is small but well-equipped, especially the mattress super comfortable

review_title: Great Hotel at very nice location
review_text: Conveniently located at the city district, offers a great place to stay when you are in Singapore. There is a restaurant at the first floor of the hotel and a 24 hour hawker center beside it.  Customer service is great. Will be staying here again on our next vacation.

Stayed 1 night for stopover. Good location within walking distance of 2 MRT stations (Bras Basah ~7min walk, Bugis ~10min walk - which is on the line that takes you to Tanah Merah where you can change to Changi MRT line).   Tiny rooms - starts from 13m2 with king sized bed; but it was adequate for my purpose. Good shower pressure and clean. Free wifi but that's pretty much most places in Singapore. Would stay again.

review_title: Good design boutique hotel and good location
review_text: Overall I love the hotel as it all about design.but the room is too small even for couple and they can improved some cleaning at the bathroom,as you can see some of the dirt mark at the bathroom.Will definitely come back.Hope to improve soon.

Rooms were incredibly tiny with hardly and room to move about. No proper closet to hang out clothes and toilets were only partitioned by shower curtains which made the entire toilet wet when showering.

Elevator on the ground floor (from the bar) was not available and there's not itinerary to direct us to find the lobby, but thankful to the bartender who helped me to carry my luggage up to the elevator floor so I was able to check in early. Love the simple decor and design of the room and facilities. 10 min walk from Bugis MRT

The hotel is walking distance to Bugis Street and shopping mall. Around 10 mins walk to Bugis MRT station. The staffs are friendly and helpful. The internet connection is awesome. Will definitely come back to G Hotel if I visit Singapore in future.

Easy to checkin & checkout. Easy to travel around as it is near shopping malls. Cheap food around the area as well. Other than that, the staff is not very proactive when called to reception however Good Place to stay & Recommended!

Clean good location great  near rochor/ bugis/ bras basah mrt also near shopping mall, very convenient.  Room is clean & tidy & bright  washroom is clean too  environment & room design is nice  we love it so much

My stay at Hotel G was a great one. The room was very clean and bigger than I expected. It is also very accessible as it is located near the mrt stations with many restaurants and leisure & entertainment facilities near by. Everything about the hotel was great other than the fact that breakfast was not provided. Nonetheless, the hotel is value for money and I would definitely visit it again!

Hotel G is located downtown so it makes it quite easier to walk around, either if that is just a short stint in the Little India neighborhood, towards the Marina Bay Sands or just looking for a barber shop in the Kallang neighborhood.   The rooms are quite small but very practical and quite efficient-used in terms of space. I did not see that as a problem.   The cleanness is impecable, good job for that. Staff was very helpful as well.  The restaurant downstairs is quite pricy but serves great food and drinks.

review_title: Great place but bad check-in process
review_text: I reserved a GREATER room on the Hotel G website and got confirmation.  Upon arrival and check-in, I already knew there was a problem because the check-in person had to go to the backroom to discuss something with the manager. The check-in person came back asked for my credit card for safety deposit. I signed.    However; the problem started; I was asked if I wanted a GREAT room like my colleague reserved but at a cheaper fare. I thought that was a very strange question to ask...first of all, it made my colleague not feel good about her reservation because she was paying more for her room and it put me in a strange position because I was getting a cheaper rate. So, I declined the offer.  Then the check-person said the reason for the offer is that there was no GREATER room

review_title: The greater part was nice, but...
review_text: The greater part of that was nice. It is located a few minutes from bugis and close to many tourist destinations including Merlion park, Marina bay and so on. The room was tidily arranged and the price was considerably reasonable. But I felt the lack of fridge for drinks!!!

review_title: Small rooms but overall a good stay again
review_text: I booked a Premium King room expecting this would be bigger in size than the previous room I stayed in. Unfortunately, only the bed was slightly bigger. The Ginnett restaurant for both breakfast and dinner made my stay pleasant however. The bar in Ginnett is lively at night.

review_title: Modern Boutique Hotel good for Travellers
review_text: The hotel room is small but space are fully used which wont bring you disappointment. I personally like the decide and enjoy watching TV on my bed. The location is good for craving food and walking distance to MRT stations around. Only bad thing is the door is too heavy for me to open.. i have to pull it hard with my full body power and stand very firm on the ground.... and i was suffered from sore throat on the 3th night and wondering if the AC isn't clean enough....cos there are too many rooms on the same floor....

This hotel is awesome about design of the room. Although the space is not too big, it will not let customers feel crowded. In addition, its location is brilliant, which is crossed between three lines of metro!

This is a mid-range hotel but it is a good mid-range hotel. Was slightly worried rooms would be very small but we found it just right and incredibly spacious for two people only. But we're also small Asian people and didn't have a lot of luggage. And I can imagine how it would be a bit cramped for larger-sized people or if you have big luggages. Hotel decor is also really chic. In the rooms we also found a phone provided with a local 4G sim card that we could bring while exploring the city.   The hotel is a good distance away from the MRT, within a reasonable walking distance and we can easily walk there whenever we wanted. It's also surrounded by a lot of food options in Bugis so that's really not a problem. And although the hotel breakfast buffet is not included, you have to

We booked the room for a 1 night stop over in Singapore, it was good for one night, wouldn't stay for much longer.  Whilst the location is great (20min taxi ride from the airport and 1km walk to Orchard rd shopping centres), the room was tiny! We even booked a deluxe king room... can't imagine how small the smaller rooms must be.   Highlights:  Location Cleanliness Decor was cool and quirky Efficient check out   Service was average at best at check in.

Great location with short walking distance to the MRT (metro) station. However, the room was TINY, including the miniature sink and shower. Really no space for anything more than sleeping. Also, reception was hard to find as it's on the 2nd floor and you have to enter through the 1st floor restaurant to get to the elevators with NO signs whatsoever. Otherwise, it was clean and quiet with great wifi.

The room was clean. Also this hotel offers the breakfast.  But the room was very narrow, so I think more than 2 people will be feel inconvenient to sleep at this hotel. And the location of the hotel is a little bit far from MRT station.

review_title: good location and good room rate
review_text: Hotel location is good, very convenient for food and shop. But a little difficult to find the hotel for the first time. For the hotel room, the bed is big and quite comfortable. but it is quite noisy when people walk through and get into the room

Hotel G is one of the best place to stay at Singapore, the foods are good, friendly staffs and the location is near Fu Lu Shou Complex, Bugis market place and also MRT station which can be reach within minutes. At overal i'm very happy to stay here for a while.

Really nice hotel, everything you need is provided, even a smartphone with a local sim and reduced tickets, which was really handy. Rooms are rather small but the bed is really comfortable and the view simply breathtaking. Looking forward to my next stay in Singapore!

Very nice and comfortable space. Friendly staff and accomodating. Mobile phone usage for net acess and call is very useful! Place for dinner and breakfast is really ellegant! But few choices of food. More of wines and bar.

Room is clean and staff with good attitude.however, room door too thin and easily be distributed in the morning with the noises.also convienent location and gd services. Breakfast is delicious and also nearby the bugis area for shopping.

We got the 13sqm room and it's still comfortable for 3 persons. There's a phone with internet that you can carry outside. The hotel also has a water dispenser on the hallway. Location is good as it is very near food stores and shopping centers. Overall experience is great. Will definitely recommend it to others.

I love the variety of the food especialy the bakery. Location +/- 700 from shopping mall Bugis Junction. The restaurant provide many type of wine and cheese with a cozy ambiance. Room rather small but clean.

Very much enjoyed the room facilities at this hotel. Clean and complete equipment. With a strategic location, very easy to go everywhere. We will have many memories while we are here. The service was giod and friendly.

Found this new refurbished hotel which located on Middle road, around 10mins distance to Bugis mrt station. Nice location and there is lot restaurant nearby with walking distance, the hotel itself got 2 nice restaurant (Ginett Wine Bar & Restaurant and 25 Degrees) with great reviews from food lovers, I only stay 1 night and rush to expo so gotta try them next trip. I stay in Great Room type and located at the top 16 floors, the room is very nice design but bit small and pricey, you can use the handy smartphone that provided in the room for free, enough for couple stay but not for family. Hotel breakfast is simple and taste good. Will return again for a relaxing trip.

Cool boutique hotel!!! The location was good and good food at the restaurant. And if Housekeeping could recycle the toiletries bottles and water bottles that would be better. The sustainability aspect needs to be looked into at the hotel.

My husband and I spent 5 nights, just got home this morning. Our flight in Singapore arrived early morning and we were at the hotel by 6.30am just looking to leave our bags until check in  time..the staff member happily offered us an upgrade to a larger room ( an extra $35 per night ) which we could access straight away, which was brilliant after very little sleep on the overnight flight we were settled into our room by 7.30am and able to catch up on rest. Similarly, we were able to arrange a late checkout on our last day to 2pm, which was fabulous as we weren't flying out until 11pm and we were able to also leave our bags until we had to catch a cab to the airport. The room was stylish and practical except there was no fridge which we would have appreciated ( and also some milk

Woke up in the morning and couldn't find any toothbrush, luckily i brought my own. Check with the front desk during checkout about the toothbrush, got the reply: IT IS ON AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. Oh i still have to request for a toothbrush. No complimentary parking, parking is expensive more than $12, from 11pm-8am.

Well this is no Raffles or Hotel Inter Continental but then again you are not paying their prices. What this is is a funky boutique hotel that has taken the tiny living concept and made it work in their hotel.   You just know you are going be well looked after from the moment you check in. The staff are friendly and tell you about their facilities including the smart phone that you can carry around with you. This is a great idea.   If you pre book breakfast if it's not included in your package then it's S$15 instead of S$18. The breakfast is exceptionally good value and very tasty with reasonable choices.   What about the rooms. Well they are small but they tell you that before you book. They are though clean tidy and modern. Great shower and good quality toiletries.   We choose

cozy & centrally located. small rooms but you get what you pay for being that centrally located. well maintained botique hotel. lively bar & restaurant area. lobby is difficult to access as u have to go up a flight of stairs from the bar. cramped lobby too. nothing exceptional about the staff. they just do their job. Gym equipment was average. I would stay again for the location

it is convenient and many shops nearby, room is small and the design is chic. Staff are really nice, two called Patrick and Jacob are very helpful to me who first came to Singapore. However, it is difficult to find the entrance of the hotel, and the cleanliness of the room is quite disappointed cause Singapore is a very clean city.

We stayed here one night, it has a nice gym with bottles of water, towels and a toilet. The room was very big compared to others at this price range, we paid 65 or so gbp for one night up front of agoda. Superb value. Bugis station to airport took 30 minutes, the metro is fantastic to get about on. Highly recommended. 50 Singapore dollars deposit returned on check out

Staff during check in was arrogant. Looked unhappy to serve me. Other staff was kind and helpful. Room was really nice and comfy. As how was shown in photos. Toilet gets really wet after shower because water could not flow down the drain. Would have been better if there is a glass door separating both. Gym was equipped and machines were quite up to date. 10mins from Bugis Junction and mrt station

Convenient location to Bugis and  Orchard area, easy to MRT Station and Bus Station, surrounded with many Foods Stall and Convenient Store. MUST TRY their Breakfast, never regret. My best Hotel Breakfast experience so far, for their Environment, Foods and the Friendly Staffs. Just not that satisfy with the Fitness, a Gym room without window, and that's no swimming pool for this hotel.

This was a great experience.  The only negative as the very strong, strong perfume smell at check-in...it was overwhelming and even hurt my eyes!  Not sure where it was coming from of if it was intentional.
travel_type: Trip type: Travelled as a couple

review_text: Nice stay at Hotel G, not your average hotel it has a great art twist to it. The room doesn't have a mini fridge and there is constant light tapping noise from the aircon vent throughout the night which sounds like its coming from the window. If you are a light sleeper might want to bring your ear plugs. Other than that everything else was good.

No tooth brush and tooth paste provided. The shower cap spend about 10 mins before i found them.                                                                          Search the whole room but unable to find.Do not have hot water boiler in the room.Room bed was good..
travel_type: Trip type: Travelled as a couple

review_text:
The staff is so friendly and helpful but since the room, it cannot keep the noise. I heard the noise from other room almost all nights even the upper floor or even the room next to me.

The room is so clean.

The room is very clean and modern style. The location is handy and close to MRT. The price is good. The staff is nice. Wifi is strong and fast internet. TAXI to airport only cost 16 dollars. Will be back.

review_title: The bed sheet and quilt are not clean enough. I felt very itchy and somethings bite my skin.
review_text:
The bed sheet and quilt are not clean enough. I felt very itchy and somethings bite my skin.

The location is very good. It close to Bugis Junction and MRT.

The room design and funitures are quite stylish.

First and foremost I recommend this place if you're on a budget and single traveler (couples might find it a little small for the basic room size). It was clean, AMAZING shower, great customer service and facilities and one of the best breakfast spreads I've had for this price range, hands down. The rooms are a little on the smaller side but functional and good for solo travelers or perhaps couples on a budget that don't plan to spend a lot of time in the room.
However, the biggest issue I had with this place was finding the entrance. There is a big sign out front with the hotel name and a whole first floor of restaurants entering from the sidewalk but no clear sign for the reception area. There is an entrance sign around the sign but this is only for the carpark along with a staff member entrance. Needless to say after 8 hours of flying, trying to find the entrance to get to your room is the last thing you want to do (btw it's through the restaurant up one level to the elevators that take you to the second floor). Please get better signs outside indicating where to check-in.

Alws had enjoyable, pleasant stay at Hotel G
Good location; good hospitality n service.
The only problem was i had a little unfortunate thing happens once on the lift service(the one in the middle); the lift suddenly stopped, started to shake ups&down for 2-5seconds n stopped again, but thanks God e lift door opened(tho it wasnt on my room floor) i just got out n waited for the other lift.

What a lovely hotel. After moving here from the awful V lavender... I found this hotel to be a breath of fresh air.
Its a tiny bit confusing to locate the lobby as its inside a carpark and has no actual street frontage for the lobby. But dont let that put you off.

The staff are super friendly and very helpful. They will go out of their way to help in the best way they can. I asked for a room with a bigger bed and my request was promptly accepted.
The beds are wonderful. Lovely shower with such good water pressure. The rooms are standard for singapore. Small but intimate. It has this amazing little phone you can take out of your room for free called HANDY and it allows you to make free calls and texts and ever call overseas!
The breakfast was amazing! i cant believe how good it was! seriously!

Anyways I would be more than happy to stay here again and highly recommend this to anyone who wants to be in the heart of the city.

Close to all major shopping centres and other inner city attractions. $14 uber from airport.

Very close to Bugis Village
