review_title: Great Hotel in center of Singapore
review_text: Great Hotel but rooms are small and lack space for storage. The hotel is conveniently located in the city center. Bed and shower is great. The only flaw is the lack of space for toiletries, luggage, clothes, etc.

Stayed here for two consecutive nights for a business trip and the stay was pleasant. Although the room was a little small, it was still comfortable throughout the whole stay. The staff were helpful and friendly.  Four stars because I find it weird to have the sink outside of the washroom and it was 1 meter away from my bed.  But overall it's good. Recommended for short trips.

- The Handy Phone is very useful. - Walk distance to shopping mall. - Walk distance to bus stop and taxi stand. - The room decoration is nice and clean.  - The problem with the toilet floor is the water stagnant and not flow to the drainage hole.  - Prefer electric water heater in each room as the drinking water machine for hot water always in low level, as too much people are taking water from it.

Room to small, don't have closet to store clothes, breakfast not really good, taste to curry. Coffee taste not really good. What can i eat is only bread & omelet.  I do really like the handy phone. it's really good!

The bed is comfortable, staff are friendly, and toiletries is beyond expectation. The location is superb, near to 4 MRT station with various routes. The only minus point is the entrance which should passing thru the restaurant and if you are travelling with taxi the lobby hotel is in the level two of car park which is confusing the taxi driver since it a new hotel. And the room is too small if you are travelling with kids. For sure I will stay again in the hotel in the future. Thank you Hotel G Singapore for having me..................................................................................................................................................................................................................................hhhhhhhhhhhhhjjjjkkijffgjjkkkkklllllllll

Hotel facilities is good and location is fairly convenient. II stayed in King size bed room as I learnt the room size would be small for double bed room. Overall, the hotel is very recommended, my local friend came to visit me and gave positive feedback to Hotel G, too.

I'm not expert about hotel but i'd like to tell u only one thing about toilet.. Should considering about shower area.. Splash of water into outside of shower curtain.. & prepare one more towels under washhand stand.

Everything are on the good side especially the staff assistance on front desk (Check in and Check out, taxi booking and friendliness), the only downside of the experience is the wine list are sub par. Maybe is my personal thing as I am a wine lover and the list and selection are slightly on the commercial brand side.

review_title: Nice room but staff could be more friendly
review_text: During checkin the staff did show black face and he can't even mention my name properly. He said "the  wifi password is your last name. T.. something something. Room wise, very cozy and clean. Great stay

wonderful bed! love the gadget you can bring everywhere. helping me a lot to find transport around the city. the room is perfectly clean and everything is provided, including hair dryer. the amenities were great with lovely scent. downstairs beside the road is 24-hour food stall where you can find delicious food. convenience store is just across the road from the hotel. love all parts of this hotel.

(+) clean rooms, value for money, very helpful receptionist, helpful overall hotel staffs,  (-) small rooms not suitable for family. 2 restaurant staffs not friendly and did not welcome us as compared to the hospitality we get in Thailand.

I enjoyed my experience with Hotel G and would recommend it to a friend. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very clean. A local phone was provided which I found as a great item as it allowed me to navigate the city and search online without having to use roaming data.

Very helpful staff, good location, very good place to have breakfast or a drink in the evening. Easy to access by subway. I liked the interior and decoration of my room and the restaurant. Definitely will stay there, if I go again to Singapore.

review_title: Big problem with reservation on booking.com
review_text: Had big problems with booking.com's reservation that no one has been willing to take care of. Had to pay additonal fees never mentioned during booking phase. I'm working into construction field for the hospitality industry and I've never seen such as disinterest towards a customers. The GM should be the firt in putting in his face when customers complain.   WIth kindest regards,  Diego Scarpino

- good location, easy access to nearby MRT station (just 400m away)  - Breakfast is nice - Room is smaller than expected. Do not have ventilation facility in toilet and cause the room become humid and floor is wet after shower.  - Friendly staff

Rooms are a little bit small. The bed is really comfortable. Also breakfast is great! Near shopping center. Near subway stations. Also near little stores like 7-11. If you want to find food, the hotel has 2 resturants.

Check in was prompt and was upsized to a big room. Love the ambience. Staff are friendly and courteous. Gorgeous service!   Didn't try the restaurant though but i will make sure i will the next time i stay in hotel g!

I have excelent stay in G Hotel, the hotel very nice and clean, all staffs are super helpful. Near to Bugis Junction and Bugis +, not really close to MRT but still ok to walk, since there're so many shops to look around. best to recommend, and i will come back here again for sure!

We stayed a night in Hotel G before boarding our flight to USA, location of the hotel was very helpful in completing some tasks..staff was very friendly and helpful all through. It's a young hotel with very kind and pretty faces...we loved it and recommend it.

The location not near the MRT station. Entrance need to get thru bar. Brakefast improved from previous but still less menu. In the room facilities quite well, big bed, many pillow, very fell comforted.

Though small but good use of hotel room space, love the room decor! The hotel restaurant serves good cheese burger and a wide selection of wines. Recep staff can be more helpful and resourceful when I requested for a android phone charger, instead of just directing me to use the connector in room that didn't work. :(

For a very reasonable amount staying in a very fancy and clean and fun hotel. The rooms are not big but do u really need a big room? I rather to stay in a functional room which this is. Love it! Will stay here from now on provided the price doesn't go up much over the years.

The room is tidy and clean, room space enought for two person, mattress and pillows are comfortable! And the staff is nice. The hotel with walkable distance to Bugis Street and MRT station within 15 minutes. Will stay again!

Great location, very comfortable rooms for business traveller or couple, not suited for family as rooms all have king size bed but are on the small side. Overall excellent hotel and highly recommended if you want to stay in the heart of the city.

room is very small, no exhaust fan in the bathroom and cause the whole room very humid, lobby is at level 2 and if take taxi there, will pay extra for the car park entrance to reach the lobby, breakfast is very nice.

thanks g hotel tha room is moor smool problem sleep with the my waif and the bad WS  thank g hotel is veary good many  tha good rasterrant and lift the good rasibshan very good  no expinsif hotel g  the good clean

Business hotel with a boutique feel. Rebranded, refurbished and slightly renovated from previous BIG Hotel. Improved breakfast options. Room toilet wasn't well cleaned though. Good food at restaurants downstairs. worth a try.

The hotel was a surprise!!! Wonderful bar that welcomes you ... unfortunately not too thrilled having to walk up some stairs to get to the elevator with my luggage. Love the design of the reception. Room was small but since it's just me. It was quite comfortable and the bed ... the bed was very sleep-worthy!!!!

Stayed in G hotel for 2 nights, so many good things I recall about this hotel.  Comfy and big bed, clean room, nice staffs, great amenities, i love the fragrance.  But, i bad point the room window is so small.  Last time I went there, the lobby area was still under construction.

We enjoyed our stay here, it was well located to the main sites of the city, modern and stylish, plus had a tasty breakfast on offer. The rooms themselves were a tad on the compact side of things but I guess that's to be expected and I had spotted that mentioned in previous reviews and it didn't put me off. All in all was a very pleasant stay and I'd recommend.

on my booking confirmation, i have breakfast benefit included but when check in staff  did not inform me anything about breakfast. but the overall is good, the housekeeper is very good, room is cozy  convenience and good location.

Very convenient, close to shopping mall and most resorts in city center. Only the room is a little bit small, but quite nice and acceptable. Window cannot be opened. Humility, have to switch on cooler all day, not used to be.

Well priced, great location, helpful staff and a stylish and clean room. What more do you need? And it's right next door to some delicious vegetarian/vegan restaurants. The Handy phone was incredibly useful as well.

Stayed in this hotel on a business trip. The room was small but cozy. Great staff and an excellent location. Awesome breakfast. A nice restaurant on the ground floor. The room was a little bit too small but they managed all the in room stuff in a very creative way.

review_title: Excellent decor, great room for low price
review_text: Beautiful rooms and comfortable stay. Could have added fridge/more toiletries in the room. About 750m to dhoby ghaut, hotel is not easy to find at first but close to town areas and convenient once you know the way

Good location, walking distance to different MRT stations as well as various restaurants. a lot of breakfast choices from american to chinese buffet. stylish and detailed decoration. atmosphere is very good.

review_title: Comfortable, affordable, great for short trips
review_text: Praise for Hotel G staff. Very welcoming and forthcoming to help out with any request and arrangements. Gave us an extra hour for check out, were quick to provide extra water and things like ironing board. Showers were good, bed was comfortable. Room certainly "cosy". Bit small, but ideal for short stay. Staff ensured smooth check-in. You would see them around the hotel always very polite and said hello that made them more approachable. Given the price, definitely recommend. Fun place, too!

Very nice Hotel small but good! The phone with Internet and call is helpfull for tourist and a super idea!!!!! I will Tell my Friends about this Hotel. Negativ was the Check in we Must wait 2 houres for oure room.

Location is pretty nice, near MRT station bus stop and  convenient, lots of restaurants and markets here. Hotel G  provides daily bottle of water. Staff also are helpful. it's a good choice in Singapore!

This hotel has boutique style decor with plenty of place to eat and cafe nearby. Around 10 mins walk from Bugis MRT or 7 mins walk from Rochon MRT. Room and the bed kinda small which is understandable for country like Singapore.

The staff were very helpful and friendly. Although, their kingsize bedroom is not quite similar in their website photos. Room was quite small with no cabinets.  However, our stay with them was great.  Location is just a short walk to the nearest mrt train station.

Everything is fine. Good location and breakfast, and it feels like home. Just the bathroom is too small, and it's a bit disappointed that during the four day stay, the house keeping didn't help to clean the floor. Anyway if next time be in Singapore I thought I'll consider to choose Hotel G.

Very happy with the hotel. Great staff at front counter. Comfortable bed and very friendly and helpful I would definitely come again. It was close to everything and easy to access most major shops. I would ensure better signage outside as some taxi / uber couldn't find the lobby

Nice location, neat breakfast and clean room. Well devorated with good amenities. But the hotel regulation was too strict so was not able to change the schedule and also they already withdrew the money from the credit card and didn't help me change the paymen ith cash. Except for those most of thing for staying was excellent.

review_title: Perfect stay when I'm in singapore
review_text: Hotel G Singapore is one of my favourite hotel in Singapore. The location is perfect for business meeting, attending conferences. Hotel G is within walking distance to Suntec Conference centre and also Raffles city .  The only downside of the hotel is they don't provide twin bed as travel with a work colleague can be awkward to share a double bed with.

I felt like there was not much room to move in the room and felt crammed. Upon check in with the front desk, I told them I wanted to pay for the morning buffet and they never charged me for the buffet and had issues the next morning during breakfast hours.

review_title: Handy location from airport train line
review_text: We stayed in hotel for 3 nights.  It was clean, quite and close to transport links and has very effective air-con.  The room is quite small and with limited storage space.   So if one is over 6'4" the bed is the width of the room and that might be an issue for the taller person. We were at the end of a long trip when we stayed here so the lack of storage for 2 large and 2 carry on suitcases meant getting at our stuff and moving around the room was a bit problematic.  However looking around singapore from this hotel is easy as it close to 2 tube stations and various bus routes.

Good experience staying in this hotel, the room was cosy and comfortable. It is very clean and modern looking. Location was very good as it is in the middle of Bugis. There are many foods around which open 24 hours.

Very nice, modern chic hotel which was just nice for my husband and me.Room was just nice for us and the bed was comfy as well. Fabulous location with eateries all around. Definitely will come back to stay for staycation again.

This s very clean with good room designed room amenities is awesome you got all necessary thing in 9sqm rooms, bedding and pillow are wonderful, only one difficulty is how to get to hotel 's lobby. I do recommend this hotel to friends and sure i will return

The location is quite good, but the shower head was broken and it's quite obvious they didn't check the room carefully. It will be great if they pay more attention to these details. The staff are quite friendly.

God experience to stay at this hotel. Nice location and near from mrt station. Cool design, but the room little bit small for stay with family. Breakfast so good. Over all i'm happy to stay at Hotel G.

I have a nice stay in Hotel G. It is very accessible to any where you go.  The free mobile use #handy is a great help for me to go around Singapore. Their staff is also helpful and nice. Will come back.
traveller_country_origin: Emirate of Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

review_text: Room is too small. Facilities are alright. Check in and check out timing ot flexible enough. Accessibility a bit weird but still ok. Value for $ i think not really. Tv channels are gd enough for a simple hotel room.

The location is not too far from bugis mrt approx 10 min walk, surrounded by nice food restaurant. Ya kun kaya is 3 min walk from the hotel so there is an option for breakfast besides hotel bf. The room was small but enough for 2 adult or 3 person (2 adult and 1 child), the bathroom was super clean.. the hot water work well. The overall hotel interior was awesome soo cozy.. i enjoyed my 3d 2n at the hotel.

review_title: Staff service and room facilities are so good!
review_text: Staffs are so kindly and room condition was so good for solo tourist. Breakfast menu is various and 1floor is Bar. Each floor have water purifier and ice merchaine. It is so convenient. Hotel's location is good. green, blue, red, yellow, purple line subway is nearby hotel.

Enjoyed my stay here. The rooms were small but cozy and had all I required. Access to the city was easy and I enjoyed the vibe of the restaurants down stairs. Only thing I would have preferred is to have a kettle for tea and coffee instead of a flask.

The overall experience was satisfactory, room is cozy, food is delectible and location is very strategic. The only thing I wish you have is a pool. It would have been an added relaxation for us during our stay.

The hotel was nice, very clean, and close to shops, such as Bugis street, and Bugis plus. They also have a nice bar and restaurant at the level 1 to spend your evening. Overall is the hotel provides an excellent service except oy a few chanels available on the TV station.

review_title: Great LOCATION, but the room is not clean at all
review_text: PLUS :  - LOCATION - EASY ACCESS - GREAT DESIGN  MINUS : - ROOM is not CLEAN (already told to the staff but i think they don't do anything) and we stayed for 4 days.  -ROOM SERVICE did not change the towel, the soap and i think they did not change everything with the new one, except for glass and water. THAT SO SAD!!!!!! We already told to the Front Desk and the result still the same for 4 days.  SO PLEASE HOTEL G, CLEAN YOUR ROOM!!!!!!!

review_title: To the point..with a pleasant surprise!
review_text: Before reserving, we knew from previous reviews that the room were small and when we got there..the room was indeed small, no false advertising there, the exact room as per photos..but big enough to have a pleasant 3 nights stay! Good internet connection and friendly and super helpful staffs! Cherry on the cake, the free smart phone with unlimited data and calls. This was really a life saver to get taxis at any time or to roam around the city but still finding our way to the hotel..

I went for a short trip to Singapore. I booked it in the lat minute. Check-in was excellent. We had a great experience in this hotel. Great location very close to a subway station. beautiful room. The hotel is a mix of great design and art. I really recommend it.

review_title: Small but quality space and service.
review_text: The room and bathroom is extremely tiny. 1 side access without side table bed. Tiny shower room with WC. Sink dressing is outside bath. With a writing desk. But in very good design and quality. There's a bar and a burger joint downstairs!

review_title: small cosy room in a convenient location
review_text: Fix more hooks for guests to hang clothes both in bathroom and bedroom. Fix lock for bathroom door. Improve on the access to elevator rather than going through restaurant and to walk up staircase. Saw an elderly couple struggling to walk on the staircase.

Quite a challenge to find the entrance since it was within an entrance to a bar. However, overall experience was good. Room was rather small but perfect for a solo traveller. The handy phone provided in the room was a bonus. There is a  24 hour halal eatery next to hotel. 10 minutes walk to Bugis MRT. Would consider staying in this hotel again.

Newly built, clean hotel, but I feel a little narrow. Because there is no electric kettle in the room, it is regrettable to use the top of the corridor to drink coffee or tea. The breakfast breakfast was very good, especially the scramble was the best

The hotel is located within walking distance to Bugis. The restaurant and bar has great atmosphere. My room was not big but perfectly adequate for one. The only downside was that my entrance light could not be turned off.

Had a 2D1N staycay at hotel G. Good service upon check in. The room might be a little small but it is super cosy. Nice deco, really has a vintage feel, very homely too. I would go back for another stay again!

Located in the city - small but nice rooms - friendly staff. The breakfast is a fair deal if you buy upfront - only this staff has some room for improvement in friendliness. Can really recommend this hotel.

Refrigerator is important for hotel especially a place like Singapore! Shower curtain made me feel disgusting when I was doing the shower because it kept sticking on my legs! It can't prevent water going out to toilet bowl area! Housekeeper didn't clean the room nicely as I found garbage on floor after housekeeping! The bed is excellent! I had great sleep for three nights!

Nice decor. The entrance to the hotel reception is a little difficult to find. Will need more directions as guide. Friendly staff. Will prefer that the hotel allows debit card to be used for the $50 downpayment

I was excited with the outcome of the decor when i enter the room. It was beautiful! I love it! All was indeed a good one! I enjoy my time there and didnt had enough of it. Wi surely come back and recommend to my other friends!

A strange hotel.  You enter from the street via a restaurant/bar, up some stairs to the lifts on Level 1.  There is a disabled lift for these stairs, but if the place is busy you would have to get a lot of people to move to access them.  If you arrive by taxi you enter via a public car park.  The taxi driver has to take a car park ticket.  There is a pull in outside reception on Level 2 on the spiral access to the different levels of the car park.  Access is tight!  The room was narrow, about six inches longer than the bed.  If two of you in the room if the person on the far side of the bed wants to get out they have to clamber over the person on the near side.  Poor design for two, acceptable for single occupant.  The fittings are modern, the room was clean, the bed

review_title: Hip and comfy stay in town
review_text: Much appreciation to the staff on duty who helped upgraded me from a good to great room! The room was generally quite small but comfortable enough for me alone with all the basic necessities, except that it would've been perfect had there been a fridge around. Didn't get to dine at the restaurant but walked through it and I sure would want to go here again for the experience.

Very well located with lots of amenities  around the hotel. Nice quaint design hotel with cosy atmosphere. Room small but comfortable for single traveller's. Not sure of the other type of rooms. Wonderful design restaurant and wine bar. Served beautiful breakfast and coffee. Nice gym too. Glad to be there.

The hotel is well located within 10-15 minutes walking distance from Bugis MRT.  The staff are friendly and helpful. Check in/out is easy and fast.  Hotel room is very clean but rather small (do check the room size 1st if you are particular bout the room space)

Love the rustic feel. gotta love the tile work n the gym. the black & white vintage pics really caught my attention. Thou i had a traumatic/hectic day.. but the plush bed takes it all away. will return 4 another stay .

i love cleaning room and overall of this hotel. this hotel is very cute of design, it's so comfy. Location near by mrt, easy to transport. breakfast buffet is so delicious but not enough for rush hour. staff is friendly person and service mind.

Stay here after my sundown marathon :) check in smoothly and love the room's decor like in 1960 style, rustic dark wood with a touch of romantic hanging feathers on top ...clean and sleek just i wish they make some adjustment on the bathroom floor little bit higher level than the floor cause when u took shower the water kind of flowing out and soaking wet the bathroom mat. Overall i have a pleasant's stay :)

This is a fairly new and trendy hotel located in a fairly central area. Although the rooms are tiny, it is cozy and comfortable. Service was also really good. Also, like with most hotels in Singapore, each room comes with a smartphone!  I will point out that the lobby was difficult to find. We walked here from another hotel across the street and we couldn't find the entrance to the hotel! We had to enter through the bar on the main floor (the lobby is located on the second floor). The lobby area was being renovated, which made it even harder to find.

The Door of the bathroom did not close and it opens, no privacy. The water from the shower wets the floor of the whole bathroom. No closet to store your clothes. Some lights do not turn off, complicated A/C System

This is the first time of mine stay at The G hotel, and Im sure that the second or even more time will available in the future and every time I come to Singapore. Beautiful room for couple like us, near the center, all staffs are very friendly , even the security men stand at the front door. Perfect at all! If can be, i wish that the hotel will have more choices of room, more type of room that we can try one by one. After all, thanks for your service. See you later, soon!

Hotel G is in a very good location,convenient for public transport, shopping and eat outside. It is great that there are bars on the ground floor of the hotel building that I could refresh myself there after day time business activity.

the ambiance of the hotel was awesome. the decoration was very modern. the gym feels like a private gym and they also provided apples for everyone. the location was strategic, because it is near 2 mrt station, bugis and bras basah, and it is also near the bugis shopping center.

Everything was great, Clean, Artistic design. Just the room slightly small. other than that overall is very good services. Even downstairs with a restaurant and wine bar, when you get bored can visit and have some chill wine.

review_title: Nice and cozy Hotel. Highly recommended!
review_text: The Hotel is nice and cozy with very nice decorations. Easily assessable to many food delights. Hotel is very near to Bugis MRT (walking distance). The staff there are friendly and approachable. Room was spacious with a nice of the city.

review_title: Nice hotel but small rooms. Best for solo travellers or couples
review_text: Rooms are tastefully decorated but small. Suitable for solo travellers but may get uncomfortable for two. Not enough space to store large baggage. Cafe bar at the ground floor is an excellent addition to the hotel. The food and drink prices are wallet friendly and the urban chic deco and atmosphere is good. Location wise, it's a walking distance from the subway, quite close to shops and eating spots. Only point to note is when you book a car via Uber or GrabCar, you need to be specific if you want to be picked up at the road because the hotel pick up point is actually at level 2!

Overall, it was a decent stay but nothing spectacular or memorable. More could be done in terms of cleanliness of the room as we found some stains and rubbish leakage from previous stay. It is a generally small hotel, from reception to the rooms. However, the onsite/restaurant bar was really wonderfully set up and some of the rooms had a great city view. Bed was quite comfortable and shower facilities/toiletries were adequately provided.

Overall Hotel G is a great place worth staying with good location. Just minutes away from MRT and also Bugis. Room is clean and comes with nice furnishing. Wish the basin area was bigger and also stronger water pressure in the shower would be great.

stay with my daughter for 2 night, -location great near bugis market -price not too pricey -got handy smartphone for call and internet -can refill water & got apples -clean room & big bed cons :  -small room, so not enough space if bring a lot suitcase -small bathroom and no exhaust fan on it, so the smells can enter room -no breakfast due to renovation  Overall i like and hope can improve more better.

Crizel gave an exemplary service from the time she saw us alight from the taxi to showing us to our room, to our room upgrade and re orientation since it's our second visit to this property. Food was great

The location of hotel is good (between MRT Bugis, Bras Basah and Rocher station). The room is nice & clean. The space is 12 square meter, not big but sufficient. I like the room in general except the bath because the shower area isn't a separate area and the area near toilet seat will get wet after shower. The hotel bar looks pretty nice but they close at 11:30PM. They ran out of beer quick early the day when I was there.

Only stayed one night. The rooms are tiny as expected but definitely comfortable for one or two people. The bed was surprisingly comfortable! It was also convenient to have internationally compatible outlets all around the room. The area was great, lots of food options around the hotel. Good value, would stay again.

Had our staycation here, stayed for one night. The room is small but it's very cosy for both of us. The ice & water (both hot and cold) dispensers were just a few steps away from our room which is very convenient for us. There is also handy phone provided in the room. The toilet is pretty small but considering the overall size of the room, it works fine for us. Check-in was a bit slow. I love the design of the gym which is quite unique and how the hotel displays their info/Q&A on the board in the room.

review_title: Decent hotel, free smartphone is the best icing on the cake!
review_text: Decent hotel, free smartphone is the best icing on the cake! Stayed for two night in two different occasion, we're travelling with a kid. Check in was quick, room was OK a tad small but complete with amenities that you might need. The window is sporadic, first time I got a full window in my room, on the second time I only got like a half of it. The room is suitable for a short stay/ layover, I would not recommend for a long stay. Free smartphone is available for you to use, pretty 'handy' to google your destination, It is free to make a local call and international (limited country) call as well. Location wise, well its Singapore :) I love the fact that there is a 24hrs prata-tehtarik shop just like two steps away from the hotel. Orchard boulevard is easily 15minutes walk from

Nice to be back and see the changes that have been made.  F&B a huge upgrade and Linette has a great buzz to it matched by the fantastic food and decent wine prices.  Service team engaged.  Will be back.

I have been a few times in Singapore, this time I stay out of the International Hotel Chain. Hotel surprised me when I m entry to my room, it s so amazing concept and design. I m fall in love with this hotel. Room size is compact and much more comfortable than the eyes estimation. Believe me is enough space to stay and enjoy the room. Of course I have a good sleep and much more surprised when went down to have a breakfast, the quality of breakfast items is five stars hotel, all fresh and keep in the exactly temp plus modern equipment. What I saw at the night, the Ginett, opening of the design restaurant unfortunately I havent book and no seat available. Thats okay I will come back next time. Only one thing that I m not sure why we can stop in front of the hotel, the driver have

I was staying at this Hotel when it was called BIG Hotel, and I can see a lot have changed since then. When I stayed here in July last year they were still renovating the lobby so a lot was to desire and I didn't get to see the Hotels full potential. My room was including breakfast, but as this area also was under renovation, they gave me gifts cards to Starbucks instead, the problem was that it was only for 10S$, and it was impossible to get both something to eat and drink for that price, and I am not a big fan of starbucks.   It is in a really nice area not far from Little India and not far from the metro either (well it depends where you are from, but for me 10 min walk to the metro isn't that far).  The rooms was clean and the staff really helpfull and sweet. They had an

review_title: Excellent stay in Hotel G Singapore!
review_text: I recently spent the weekend in Singapore and had an excellent stay at Hotel G Singapore. I have stayed in some of the other G Hotels and this one maintains the high standards!  I love the cool design of the hotel and rooms. The rooms are well designed and thought out to maximise the space. Great bathroom with a really good shower.   The location of the hotel is close to everything and its easy to get to get anywhere from here. The breakfast was delicious and a great way to start the day.  I will definitely stay in Hotel G Singapore on my next visit

The adress is center of Singapore, from here you can go by walk to everywhere, it's very near. The design are so impresive. But we had some problems with elevator, it wasn't easy to use and didn't has intruction. Room is so small and price not match the price

I really enjoyed my short stay in Hotel G Singapore. The location was quite convenient, not too far from Orchard and with easy access to shopping and the CBD. The room, though a little small in size, were nicely decorated and felt comfortable. I didn’t have the chance to try the main restaurant, which looked quite busy but had a great quick dinner at the burger joint. Overall a nice experience.

I came to Singapore for a short trip and had the pleasure of staying in Hotel G Singapore.   The rooms are very well thought, and even though i booked the smallest one, I had well enough space to open my suitcase and unpack. Special space in the room was made to put away your suitcase once you finished unpacking so it doesn't stand in the way. The shower had a great pressure.  On top of that I liked the style of the room and especially the dream catcher and the photographs. The hotel is very well located, close to everything. Breakfast was delicious and well served.  All in all great value

review_title: Great hotel, great staff, great area
review_text: I was staying there 3 days in a row and was happily surprised by the renocation they did. I stayed in  Big hotel 1 year ago and this freshly redesigned into Hotel G is a success.  The room are very comfy and the staff helpfull and pretty trendy :) Don t foogot to try Ginett, their restaurant on the first floor for a glass of good wine and fantastic food.  Cheers !

We’ve stayed at Hotel G for 2 nights in February. The interior of the hotel is very artsy and modern.   The Good King Room was unbelievably small. I think that it is only suitable for one person and not two. We were lightly packed with 2 small carry-ons. There was no luggage rack and the room was small, we couldn’t open two luggage at the same time. When they say a kitchen is of an open concept, I’d have to say the wardrobe is open concept!! It was just a few hooks and a metal rack which was in the way when you enter the room.  The vanity is so small that there is no space for your toiletry bag. I’d have to say though that the hotel is quite far away from the Bugis Station. Hotel entrance is awkward and we were not advised by reception that we had to go through the restaurant in

The rooms are small, it is ok if you are single, lightly packed and if you are going to stay one night. There is no kettle in the room but you can get hot water from the water fountain. The hotel is far away from the subway. Hotel entrance is really strange and a little awkward , you have to walk through a restaurant. There are many places to eat around the hotel. The price is good for a budget hotel.

Great location, very cool design (amazing artwork in the lobby, just behind the reception counter)! The staff is super friendly and helpful The rooms are small but functional and well decorated, the bed is amazing! I tried Ginett, once for the breakfast - very good buffet, fresh coffee and homemade pastries - and once for the dinner. I loved the atmosphere, very good vibes! And very affordable: $6 for a glass of french wine! I will definitely come back and check in at Hotel G Singapore!

Booked G hotel as it was available on the dates i needed. The hotel reception is on the 3rd floor and vehicles needed to go into the multistory care park to gain access to it. For guest going to ground level, we will need a lift to stop in the hotel restaurant Ginnet and walk through the restaurant.  The above necessarily mean that taxis will need to be called by the front desk and all taxis are - booked - with extra charge of booking. This is different from taxis in other hotels who hail taxis into their ground lobby without booking fee.   The hotel is served by 3 lifts which are slow as the building is a refurbish old building.  Had a bad experience with a telco carrier - Starhub - which does not function in the hotel reception. I am told that this is normal as other guest

Hotel is well located at the junction of Middle Road and Bencoolen Street, there are 2 or 3 subway stations within walking distance which makes Singapore pretty accessible. My room was nice and comfortable and the breakfast downstairs at Ginett Restaurant was excellent! Good selection, delicious food, they have a nice egg station among other hot stations and fresh baked pastries and bread!!

The rooms are small.  The pictured room requires walking at foot of bed to get to curtains and windows.  The top of the wooden pedestal bed was in a bad place for my shins.  Knocked them several times.  The shower and toilet area are ample with the sink in the main room.  Limited vanity space for toiletries.  Desk is great as is the Handy mobile device.  My camera seized up in China and I was able to use the Handy mobile device to take pictures in Singapore.

Hotel G was such a nice surprise! I did not expect my room to be this practical for the size. It also comes with a Handy Phone that includes free roaming and calls, so I just carried it around in town, handy indeed! Bed is nice, bathroom amenities is a brand i haven't hear of before (Metis) but quality is very good, and i was told that the TV has a mirroring option which i had no time to try, but good to know for next time I guess.  I also fell in love with the dreamcatcher on the ceiling, it is very pretty and original. Well done Hotel G!!!

review_title: Good hotel close to downtown area
review_text: The hotel is near a couple of MRT stations, easily accessible, close to City Hall and Clarke Quay. Construction work was being done when I stayed so getting in was a bit tricky but everything else was fully operational, no bothering noise either. Room was small as usual in the region but spotlessly clean with various amenities available, including a handy phone which was something I have not seen anywhere else yet. The location is good, only a few MRT stops to the centre, if you like long walks, the distance is walkable. A great value for the price I paid, would not hesitate to book again.

Good price good breakfast from a restaurant down stairs is well worth it for $10 extra per day. No vents in the bathroom tough. Water evaporates then condense on the floor around lounge .. gets floor wet and slippery

Overall good
Hotel

review_title: Great boutique Hotel on middle road
review_text: I stayed there few days, great boutique hotel, rooms are nice and well equipped,  good breakfast served in Ginett Restaurant, interesting Gym with authentic speed bag.Very convenient location on middle road.

We definitely love the location of this hotel, few minutes walk to Bugis junction and MRT
And what I love most is the local hawker nearby, i love waking up in the morning walking around the neighborhood finding some good local food, drinking coffee like a local.
The room itself is considered small but comparing to other hotel at the same rate, this is not bad at all. We love the design of the room a mix of infustrial and vintage. And there is a mobile phone that can be used during the stay.
However, the room isnt sound proof which i can say is the only minus point of the hotel but can be very disturbing.
Restaurant has a very nice ambience.
travel_type: Trip type: Travelled as a couple

review_title: Great hotel at decent room rates
review_text: Really enjoyed my 2 night stay here. Hotel is very clean and comfortable, the compact rooms are more than sufficient. Excellent restaurant downstairs that serves a good breakfast, and great food and snacks throughout the day. Nice quirky feel to the place. Will be staying here again soon.

I stayed at Hotel G for few days, and totally enjoyed this funky hotel. Location is just perfect, so close to Bugis subway station and another one, Rochor even though you would still be able to access major locations by walking. I discovered restaurants in Chimes and it is actually just a short walk away from the hotel! Also by chance, I came across a very cool photography exhibition at a place called Objectifs just 1 block away, seems that the hotel is in the middle of the art district, loved it!
Room is rather on the small side but functional and the bed was really comfy. I did not feel like the room was missing anything, it just felt like being home with all the comfort I could ask for.
Just one thing I could complain about, I felt very cold in the room corridor...but would be happy to stay at Hotel G for my next trip!

review_title: Compact room with everything that's needed
review_text: The location of the hotel was really good. Many MRT stations, Little India, CBD and Orchard Road are in good walking distance. Bus stop is right in front of the hotel. Rooms are compact but equipped with everything needed. Handy phone was awesome, free 4G internet always on the go!

Staff was a bit rude at the front desk. Rooms are extremely small, claustrophobic and characterless even for 1 person. Location is good as you are able to walk to most places. Walls are thin and you can hear the neighbours loud an clear.  If you want to smoke you need to go dow with the lift and walk away from the hotel as the surrounding areas are non-smoking. A bit too much effort and not friendly for smoking guests. I would say pick another hotel even if you have to splurge a little more because it will be worth it.

review_title: Love the ambience and it accessories
review_text:
I checked in recently to visit a friend in Singapore. The hotel is centrally located and easy spotted. The hotel ambience is great with thoughtful design and decoration. The background of the reception is decorated with an abstract art and very welcoming.

The room size is good and I love the touch of bohemian from the dreamcatcher on the ceiling with overall lofty feeling of the room. Good for Instagram moment! The bed is comfier than I thought it would be. The working station is practical and enough space to actually do some work. The bathroom is functional and great shower amenities. I do like when the hotel is equipped with rain shower. The hotel also offer mirroring system. I can linked my iPhone to the TV and it worked! It was a relaxing moment watching Youtube on a TV screen instead of watching it from my phone while waited for a friend to pick me up.

Overall, I had a great time here and the designed of the hotel is awesome! I would definitely return.

Stayed at Hotel G for two nights while on business in Singapore. Booked a great room and even though rooms are a bit small they are very well laid down and cozy. Loved the fact that they are providing a free mobile phone for us to use while in town and that wi-fi is free and reliable. The beds and their dream catcher are a very nice touch. The highlight of our stay was they ambiance and the quality of the food at their restaurant Ginett, they have amazing wines and food and there is a very cool ambiance. Overall great experience and will definitely come back
